data.name: Sohel
data.description: According to RAB, Sohel and Babu-- alleged criminals-- tried to escape a security checkpost on a microbus. After a RAB team chased the vehicle, the'criminals' opened fire forcing the security forces to retaliate. Sohel and Babu died after 10-15 minutes of gunfight. However, local people said they were arrested before being killed. In a press conference Babu's father told that his son was killed due to previous enmity and coloured the killing as a name of'crossfire'.

data.name: Kaiser Mahmud Bappi
data.description: According to RAB, on September 9, 2009, a team of officers led by Flight Lieutenant Raihan Asgar Khan conducted a raid at the construction site of an apartment block called Aftab Tower in Dhaka. According to Major Mohammad Sakhawat Hossain, then deputy director of the Legal and Media wing at RAB headquarters, RAB-1 had received specific information that a wanted criminal called Kamrul Islam Bappi was plotting a major crime at the spot. He claimed that criminals opened fire when the RAB team entered the building and the team fired back in self-defense. After the shooting ended, RAB discovered a body, which they identified as Kamrul Islam. The deceased’s family disputed the RAB claim, saying the victim’s name was Kaiser Mahmud, and not Kamrul Islam. Kaiser, 24, also had the common nickname of "Bappi". An autopsy conducted on September 11, 2009 identified the deceased as Kamruzzaman Bappi instead of Kaiser Mahmud or even Kamrul Islam. Later, a probe committee formed by the Home Ministry found that Bappi did not die in crossfire, as reported to the media by RAB. The probe report refuted most of the other claims made by RAB. It concluded that it was evident that Kaiser Mahmud was wrongfully killed by RAB due to a mistake.

data.name: Kuddus Molla
data.description: Kuddus Molla alias Nati Kuddus was locally known as a member of a pirate group'Raju Bahini'. He was reportedly killed along with two other members of the group in a gunfight with a joint force of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and Coastguard members. A RAB official told Banglanews24.com, acting on intelligence information, a team of Rab and Coastguard raided Majherchar of Baleswar River. At the time, the Raju group was lying in wait for committing robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the pirates opened fire on them, triggering a gunfight that killed three pirates and injured two RAB officers

Agitated over the incident, locals blocked the road of Dhaka-Chittagiong Highway and led a procession along with the victim's dead body. However, RAB claimed that after hearing about a news that a group of gamblers gathered in a house of Chunnu Mia, they raided the spot. Sensing the presence of the RAB, they left the place.

data.name: Manwar Hossain Monir
data.description: Monir's family alleged that he was torture by RAB caused his death. After being critically injured, he succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment in police custody at Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital. RAB denied the allegation.

data.name: Nazrul Islam Panchayet
data.description: Nazrul's family members alleged that brutal torture by police led to his death. They said Safayera Begum wife of Nazrul's younger brother Sofrul Islam, lodged a written complaint with Rampal police station against Sofrul and police went to his house on 24.9.11. Not finding Sofrul at home, police took Nazrul to the police station and beat him severely and injured him critically. Later the police took him to Rampal Jhanjhania health complex, where he died. Denying the allegation of torture, Rampal police station OC Shahidul Islam said Nazrul Islam was injured on road accident and local people took him to Jhanjhania health complex.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Poran
data.description: Police arrested Zakir on 7.9.11 and mobile court sentenced him to seven days imprisonment. Zakir's family claimed that Zakir was tortured to death by jail police.

data.name: Lutfur Rahman Ripon
data.description: Lutfur Rahman Ripon's family claimed that he died due to torture of police in their custody. His wife said that on 14.8.11 at about 10.00 pm SI Ahsan Habib called Lutfur and that he went missing that night. The next morning on 15.8.11, Lutfur's dead body was found hanging in an electric poll.

data.name: Advocate MU Ahmed
data.description: Advocate MU Ahmed, former deputy attorney general, died on 26.8.11, sixteen days after he suffered a heart attack in police custody. His wife Selina said DB police arrested him from his residence on 11.8.11 on charges of assaulting police and obstructing them from discharging duties on Supreme Court premises on August 2 and 4, 2011. Selina claimed that DB police tortured him and tied him up with a rope and later they gave electric shock on his left hand, leaving him unconscious. Deputy commissioner of DB police Monirul Islam denied the allegations.

data.name: Akida Khatun
data.description: Police arrested Akida Khatun alias Begum on 2 May 2011. Her mother claimed that police tortured her and forcibly put some drugs into her mouth. Later police admitted her to Jessore hospital, where she died on 3rd May.

data.name: Nayeem Mia
data.description: Nayeem's brother claimed that he died due to inhuman torture by police in their custody. But police said Nayeem died due to mob beating.

data.name: Mohammad Mohsin
data.description: The victim's family alleged that Mohsin, a second year Honors student, was wounded by police firing when he was passing by a checkpoint on a motorbike on April 28, 2011. Mohsin's mother Ashiya Khatun, alleged that some of her relatives had provoked police to kill Mohsin over a land dispute. Police claimed that Moshin was wounded in a gunfight after the youth opened fire on the police after being challenged. Mohsin died on May 12, 2011.

data.name: Quddus Fakir
data.description: Quddus Fakir, a pirate, was killed in a gun battle with a joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard. Another pirate also died in the shootout

data.name: Jahangir
data.description: Jahangir, a pirate, was killed in a gun battle with a joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard. Another pirate also died in the shootout

data.name: Abdullah Al Mamun
data.description: Mamun's family claimed that he was allegedly killed in the DB police custody. They also alleged that Mamun had been tortured to death as the body had multiple marks of injuries. They said Mamun's in-laws conspired with the DB police to have him killed in custody. DB police said Mamun had been arrested for possession of drugs following information gathered by the DB branch and claimed that Mamun had committed suicide by gulping raw heroin.

data.name: Md. Hamid Ali Khorshed
data.description: Police arrsted Hamid on 18 May 2011 in drug and theft cases. The court sent him to jail on May 19. Jailer of Noakhali jail Mahabubul Alam said Hamid was rushed to the hospital as he felt sick on 26 May, where the attending doctor declared him dead. Hamid's family claimed that he died due to torture by police.

data.name: Shafiqul Islam
data.description: Shafiq’s wife Tahmina Begum claimed he was picked up by RAB on 3.4.11 afternoon after he had gone to the Dhaka High Court to seek bail in a muder case. The RAB-11 clamied that based on a tip-off they raided Gopaldi Dakshinpara area where a gang of'robbers' were taking preparations to commit a robbery. RAB said Shafiqul died in gunfight during the raid

data.name: Moniruzzaman Rubel
data.description: Rubel died in police custody allegedly due to heavy beating during intterrogation

data.name: Shafiqul Islam Raja
data.description: Raja died in jail custody while undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Raja's family members alleged that he died due to torture in police remand. His family said Raja had feud over a land with his maternal uncles and that they bribed police to detain Raja. Family members also claimed that police pick him up before filing any case and then showed him arrested in a pending muder case. Later, he was remanded for three days and tortured inhumanly.

data.description: Tikka Khan, a member of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Red Flag), was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and police.

data.description: Ziarul Rahman, a member of Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML- Janajuddha), was killed by RAB in an alleged crossfire

data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Raisuddin, a regional leader of extremist group Gono Bahini, was killed by RAB in a gunfight

data.name: Minu Parvez
data.description: Minu Parvez alias Tonu alias Dadabhai, an alleged criminal, was killed in gunfight with RAB

data.name: Russel Ahmed
data.description: According to the law enforcers, a team of RAB-10 went to Zindabahar around 3:00am when alleged criminal Russel and his cohorts opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate. Russel was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. However, Russel's family claimed that RAB had picked him up from the capital's Moghbazar on March 3, 2011.

data.name: Rekha Begum
data.description: The victim's family alleged that Rekha,a convicted prisoner, was tortured to death by the jail authorities. Jailer Nazrul Islam, however, clamied that she died due to heart attack in the jail hospital.

data.name: Faisal Ahmed
data.description: Faisal Ahmed alias Roni arrested on suspicion of being a mugger and allegedly died of torture in police custody. Refuting the allegation, police said Faisal succumbed to his injuries from a mob beating during the arrest from Dhanmondi area. Hospital morgue sources said the body bore several marks of injury.

data.name: Gopal Chandra Shil
data.description: Gopal Chandra Shil's father alleged that the law enforcers had picked his son from Dhaka court premises on 22.3.11 when he was coming out after appearing in the court in a case. Kadamtali OC Kazi Ayubur Rahman said a partrol team of RAB-10 challenged Gopal and his associates when they were holding a meeting near the WASA tank at Shyampur. The group then fired into the battalion personnel, who fired back, leading to a'gunfight'. Gopal died on the spot.

data.name: Faruk Miah
data.description: District Jail Super said police arrested Faruk in a drug case on March 22, 2011. The court sent him to jail on March 25 when he was produced before it after two days of remand in custody. Faruk's wife Selina Begum claimed that her husband died due to torture after being put under police remand. Jailer Dewan Tarikul Islam said Faruk was rushed to the hospital as he felt severe pain in his chest where the attending doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Rashedul Islam
data.description: Rashedul's family, however, said that the battalion personnel in plainclothes had picked him up from a place behind the Sharif Market on March 29, 2011 when he was chatting with some of his friends. Rashedul's wife Iti, also said that law enforcers had picked him, she along with others of family went to the nearby police station and the battalion camp to know of Rashed whereabouts.'But none could give any information on him.' The RAB-4 claimed that their patrol team had challenged Rashedul and his associates when they were holding meeting. The group then fired into the battalion personnel, who fired back, leading to a'gun-fight'. Rashed died on the spot.

data.name: Azgar Ali
data.description: Azgar Ali was killed by RAB in a gunfight. The victim's elder sister said her brother had been picked up by the plainclothesmen from the house of his sister-in-law in Narsigndi about 5:00pm on 31 January 2011. She also said the family suspects that Azgar might have been killed after a verdict on a land dispute in their favour. However, the RAB battalion, in a statement, said three RAB-4 teams challenged a group and the group fired on them which led to a gunfight. Azgar was criticallt injured in the incident and was taken to DMCH, where doctors declared him dead

data.name: Hafizul Islam Reza
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Hafizul Islam Reza, an operative of extremist group Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddho), was killed in a gunfight with RAB.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdul Hamid alias Thosha Hamid, regional leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Red Flag), was killed in a gunfight with the police.

data.name: Nurul Islam Sumon
data.description: On 4.2.11 police captured Sumon, when Sumon and others were roaming around suspiciously near Proshika Bhaban. Police said, based on Sumon's statement, they raided a place in the Botanical Garden where some of his associates were holding a meeting. When police reached the spot Sumon's associates fired into the law enforcers, who fired back, leading to a gunfight. Sumon was killed in the gunfight.

data.name: Hazrat Belal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Hazrat Belal alias Haj Belal, regional leader of extremist group Gono Bahini, was killed in a gunfight with a joint force of police and RAB.

data.name: Md. Azibor Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Md Azibor Rahman, regional commander of extremist group Purba Banglar Communist Party(ML Lal Pataka), was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and police. Police said they raided Megharpara village at about 3.30 am following a tip-off that two factions of PBCP were locked in a gunfight there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws opened fire on them starting a gunfight between the criminals and police.

data.name: Maksudul Haq Khan
data.description: Maksudul Haq was allegedly beaten to death by police

data.name: Mohammad Shahid
data.description: Shahid's wife Rabeya Khatun said RAB had picked him up from Ashulia in the evening of February 7 and he had been missing since. According to RAB, RAB-4 officials challenged Shahid and his associates as they were holding a meeting at Bhashantek. Shahid died in the gunfight.

data.name: Md.Hasan Ali
data.description: On 1. 2. 11 Hasan kidnapped a 5 year old child and demanded ransom money from child's father. He was later caught by locals and handed over to Faridpur police. Hasan was found dead on 14. 2. 11 night. SP Jahangir Hossain said they were not sure how Hasan died. The SP also said a rope was found nearby, which indicated he may have strangled himself. Hasan's father Ansar Ali claimed that the police tortured his son to death. He said his son's health was good when police took him to the station.

data.description: Azizul Islam, second-in-command of a local gang called Enamul Bahini, was killed in a gunfight with police

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An unidentifed pirate was killed by RAB in a shootout

data.name: Imtiaz Hossain Abir
data.description: Family of Imtiaz Hossain Abir, a first Year commerce student of Northern College, said he was murdered by police. However, Pallabi police claimed that a team of plainclothed men challenged'a gang of robbers' at Balurmath about 9.00 pm and the gang members opened fire forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. No case was filed over the incident. Abir's father said he will not file a case as he has no courage to file case against police. If he files a case, he feared his family could face consequence.

data.name: Humayun Kabir Biplob
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: According to RAB-3, Humayun Kabir Biplob, member of 33 AL ward Unit and joint secretary of T&T unit AL, was in a motorbike with two persons. When RAB was chasing them, he shot and compelled RAB to retaliate. After the gunfight, Biplob was found dead. But his family claimed he was picked up from his house on January 11, 2011 about 10.45 pm.

data.name: Sheikh Shah Alam Apu
data.description: Sheikh Shah Alam Apu, an alleged criminal, was killed by RAB in a gunfight

data.name: Shaymol Bepari
data.description: According to police, a group of alleged criminals fired on them during a raid, forcing them to retaliate. after the gunfight Shaymol found dead. Police said along with Shaymol, another alleged criminal Anik was injured in the incident. However, Anik said he didn't know Shaymol and saw him in the custody for the first time as police picked them up and told them to handover arms. As they said they did not have any, police shot them

data.name: Jewel
data.description: According to RAB, Jewel, an alleged criminal, was was killed in a shootout

data.name: Nabir Hossain Dabir
data.description: Abdul Khaleq, an alleged criminal, was killed by RAB in a shootout

data.name: Abdul Khaleq
data.description: Nabir Hossain Dabir, an alleged criminal, was killed by RAB in a shootout

data.name: Md. Nizam Uddin
data.description: Md. Nizam Uddin, an alleged robber, was killed by the Rapid Action Battalion in a'crossfire' at Subarnachar upazila in Noakhali on December 20, 2012, claimed RAB. Nizam was an accused in 15 cases, including murders and extortions, filed with Char Jabbar and Hatia police stations, the police said.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam was killed by the police in'crossfire' at Pallabi. The 25-year-old youth sustained bullet injuries after an alleged'gunfight' with the police near Pallabi Plaza on Post Office lane at about 8.15 pm. He died on the way to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Ershad Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On November 12, 2012 police of Joypurhat Sadar Police Station arrested Ershad, a BNP activist, without any case. Police claimed 10,000 taka from Ershad and tortured him. He was pressed to the wall as a result he felt a chest pain and was beat up in legs and waist. Later on December 10, 2012 he died at the Joypurhat Jail Hospital.

data.name: Shoilendro Nath Biswash
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Shoilendro Nath Biswash Shoilen was killed in a gunfight with RAB on November 3, 2012.

data.name: Foysal
data.description: Foysal, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another in a'gunfight' with RAB and police forces at Harintana in Sundarbans in Sarankhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, commander of Barisal RAB-8, told the media that they launched an operation at the spot on a tip-off that 12 to 14 pirates of a gang were preparing to commit robbery in the Sundarbans.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An unidentified alleged pirate was killed along with another in a'gunfight' with RAB and police forces at Harintana in Sundarbans in Sarankhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, commander of Barisal RAB-8, told the media that they launched an operation at the spot on a tip-off that 12 to 14 pirates of a gang were preparing to commit robbery in the Sundarbans.

data.name: Lal Mia
data.description: Four plainclothes policemen of Basail Police Station went to the village and chased a few villagers who were playing cards on October 2, 2012. At one stage, the law enforcers caught farmer Lal Mia of the village, who was standing on a nearby road. They beat up Lal Mia and dunked him into a pond. The villagers encircled the cops, rescued Lal Mia and sent to the upazila health complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: On September 27, 2012 police asked for money from Nurul's Shop. Nurul denied to give it. Thus ASI Towhidul Islam of Jatrabari Police outpost beat him mercilessly and took him to the Jatrabari Police Station. There he detained Nurul Islam. Nurul Islam's wife gave 4,500 taka to the officer to free her husband. Later on October 3, 2012 he died at Al Baraka Diagonistic Center.

data.name: Rony Mia
data.description: A team of DB police of Dhaka district carried out a mission for arresting miscreants in different places of Ashulia. There they found a microbus running fast in the road. They signalled it to stop the microbus but the microbus did not stop rather opened fire on them. The law enforcers retaliated. Rony Mia, a 2nd year student in commrce division of Mirpur Bangla College, sufferred a bullet injury in the incident and later died at Savar Enam Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Jamal Hossain
data.description: Jamal Hossain alias Boro Jamal, an alleged criminal, was killed in a'crossfire' between his accomplices and RAB members in Kachua upazila of Chandpur on October 24, 2012. Law enforcers said on a tip-off that Jamal and his gang were preparing to commit a robbery, a team of Rab-11 of Narayanganj, conducted a raid at Bachaiya village in the upazila around 2.00 am. Sensing presence of the elite force, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the Rab to retaliate. After around a half an hour-long gunbattle, Jamal's bullet-ridden body was found at the spot.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of outlawed, a faction of Purbo Banglar Communist Party( Lal Pataka), was killed in a "shootout" between police and his cohorts in Mirpur upazila of Kushtia on September 4, 2012.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Nurul Islam, an alleged member of a group of forest bandits called Mortuza Bahini, was killed in a'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion-8 in Sundarban in Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat on September 8, 2012. Another member of the bandit group also died in the incident.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An unidentified alleged member of a group of forest bandits called Mortuza Bahini, was killed in a'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion-8 in Sundarban in Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat on September 8, 2012. Another member of the bandit group also died in the incident.

data.name: Tofazzal Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: RAB officials claimed that Tofazzal Hossain alias Tofa Mollah, a leader of Sramajibi Gono Mukti Fauj, was killed in a'gunfight' on Padma River at about 5.15 am. RAB-12 personnel claimed that they had prior information that a group of'extremists' was holding a secret meeting in a place between Charsadipur and Kheyaghat in Shilaidah to commmit'sabotage'. On receiving information, a unit of the RAB from Pabna and Kushtia went to the place and raided a boat on Padma River. The extremists, sensing the presence of law enforcers, opened fire on them, claimed the RAB.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: Iqbal Hossain, an alleged criminal, was killed in a'shootout' with the Rapid Action battalion-1 at Khejurbagan in Ashulia of Dhaka on September 12, 2012. RAB official said that they fired into the crime suspects after they had fired into the lawmen.

data.name: Rahat Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Rahat Ali, leader of Purbo Bangla Communist Party (ML Red Flag), was shot to death by police in a gunfight at 2. 30 am on September 17, 2012 at Mirpur, Kushtia.

data.name: Mohammad Bhikhu
data.description: Mohammad Bhikhu, an accused in a drug case died at Adhunik Sadar Hospital in the town on August 25, 2012. Golam Mortuza, officer in-charge (OC) of Sadar Police Station said, a police team arrested Bhikhu from PTI area on charge of taking drug on August 24, 2012 at around 8. 00 pm. His family alleged that, Bhikhu was tortured at Chapainawabganj Sadar Police Station and he died due to torture.

data.name: Shahid
data.description: Dakat Shahid" and one of his accomplices were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Laxmibazar in Old Dhaka. RAB indentified the second victim as Kalu. RAB's Legal and Media Wing Director Commander M Sohail said that Rab personnel chased their bikes and managed to catch Shahid and Kalu from the spot. The alleged criminals opened fire as the Rab members approached them, prompting the force to fire back. It is to be noted that no information from the family was found.

data.name: Kalu
data.description: Dakat Shahid" and one of his accomplices were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Laxmibazar in old Dhaka. RAB indentified the second victim as Kalu. RAB's Legal and Media Wing Director Commander M Sohail said that Rab personnel chased their bikes and managed to catch Shahid and Kalu from the spot. The alleged criminals opened fire as the Rab members approached them, prompting the force to fire back. It is to be noted that no information from the family was found.

data.name: Mintu Hossain
data.description: Mintu Hossain, a worker at Akij Bidi Factory, died along with a colleague after Ansar personnel opened fire at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers demanding a wage hike at Daulatpur in Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

data.name: Rokibul Islam
data.description: Rokibul Islam, a worker at Akij Bidi Factory, died along with a colleague after Ansar personnel opened fire at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers demanding a wage hike at Daulatpur in Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

data.name: Kala

Another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: Sumon, an alleged mugger, was killed in a "shootout" with RAB in Dhaka. After the shoot-out, the RAB personnel found bullet-hit Sumon lying dead on the ground.

data.name: Abdul Wahab
data.description: Abdul Wahab, a farmer, was killed in police fire as villagers tried to resist the law enforcers from arresting him in Jhenidah on 10.06.2012. Wahab was known as an honest figure in the area, locals said.

data.name: Abdul Malik
data.description: Abdul Malik was tortured in the Jokiganj Police Station in the night of June 12, 2012. Next day on June 13, he was sent to the court in a case filed under section 54. Later on June 18, 2012 the court granted him bail so he came back home on that day. He was very sick due to torture. Later he died on June 23, 2012.

data.name: Nobokumar Halder
data.description: Nobokumar Halder, an alleged member of a robber gang, was killed along with two others in a gunfight with RAB in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8. He said on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them prompting the RAB members to fire back, Osmani said. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

data.name: Mihir Roy
data.description: Mihir Roy, an alleged member of a robber gang, was killed along with two others in a gunfight with RAB in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8. He said on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

data.description: RAB told media that Anwar Hossain was a member of a gang of armed muggers who snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand. Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee. The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

data.name: Md. Momin
data.description: RAB killed Momin in a gunfight. Momin's family claimed that he was picked up by RAB men in plain-clothes in front of his house in Purba Charail, Keraniganj at around 3.00 pm on 01.04.2012. He was shot dead in another incident of'crossfire' with RAB in a narrow street in Mirpur area on 2nd April.

data.name: Masud Rana Tushar
data.description: RAB killed Masud Rana Tushar in a gunfight. On 13th April a patrol team of RAB signalled a speeding microbus to stop at the check post near Bashundhara City at around 4.20 am. But, the microbus (Dhaka-Metro-Cha-14-0267) did not stop and tried to escape. RAB chased the microbus while they were fired on from the microbus. RAB retaliated and at one point Masud Rana Tushar was killed. It was claimed by the family members of the deceased that he was a fruits vendor. But, RAB claimed that he was a carjacker.

data.name: Abul Basar
data.description: According to police, they chased Basar, an alleged criminal, in the time of snatching. Later, Basar opened fire targeting SI Mohammad Asaduzzaman and Asaduzzaman opened fire back in self-defence. Basar died due to fire. But, the wife of Basar claimed that police shot him death in front of the home.

data.name: M Giasuddin
data.description: A suspected robber namely M Giasuddin was killed and four policemen were injured in a gunfight in Moheshkhali upazila of Cox's Bazar on 22nd April, the police claimed. Giasuddin was the alleged ringleader of a robbery gang, said Ranjit Kumar Barua, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station. On information, police raided the house of Giasuddin around 2am when a gang of bandits were holding a meeting there for committing a robbery on a trawler, the OC said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, the OC said. After the shootout, Giasuddin was found bullet-hit.

data.name: Shahed Miah
data.description: Shahed, a businessman, was tortured by BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh). BGB had taken him to the Transit camp and beaten him. As a result, he suffered for 4 months and then died on 30.04.2012.

data.name: Abdur Rahim Sheikh
data.description: Abdur Rahim Sheikh was arrested on charge of taking drug on 29th February. He was produced before a mobile Court on 1.3.2012 . The court sentenced him to one year imprisonment. He was sent to jail in the afternoon on the day. On 02.03.2012, he fell sick and was taken to Rangpur Medical college and hospital, where he died. His family alleged that he died due to torture when he was in the custody at the police station.

data.name: Mohammad Mintu
data.description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Mintu, an alleged criminal, was killed in a gunfight during a combing operation

data.name: Jihad
data.description: Jihad, an alleged dacoit, was killed along with four other alleged dacoits in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

data.name: Sohag Farazi
data.description: Sohag Farazi, an alleged dacoit, was killed along with four other alleged dacoits in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

data.name: Belal
data.description: Belal, an alleged dacoit, was killed along with four other alleged dacoits in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: Law enforcers (the team of Mohammadpur police, Detective Branch and the Rapid Action Battalion) in separate releases claimed that'carjackers' in a car with no number plate were headed for a bridge without heeding a signal to pull over and fired on them. The law enforcers fired back. Nazrul died at the incident. It was claimed that Nazrul was the carjacker of the DIG of police. Nazrul's family, however, alleged that he along with Mithu and Swapan had been arrested by the plainclothesmen at Karwan Bazar on 14.03.2012 and the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release.

data.name: Mostafizur Rahman
data.description: RAB said Mostafizur had been a close aide to the executed leader of Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, Siddiqul Islam alias Bangla Bhai, who had spread Islamic militancy in the country under the banned organisation. He died in a shootout.

data.name: Mokaddes Moka
data.description: Police killed Julfikar Ali Gama in a gunfight.

data.name: Masud
data.description: Police shot Masud, a bus worker, to death in front of an under-construction building. The reason is not clear. His family claimed that Masud was innocent. There was no case or complaint against him. It was alleged that the rival group of his brother's bussiness bribe police to kill him.

data.name: Bidhan Chandra Biswas
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Iqbal Bahar Chowdhury, OC of Jhenaidah Police Station said the RAB informed the police about the presence of the ectremist group Gonomukti Fauz. The forces launched a joint drive to the spot where the where the group was holding a'secret' meeting. Sensing their presence, the'outlaws' opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to return fire triggering an'encounter'. Bidhan Chandra Biswas alias Montu, a commander of Gonomukti Fauj (central) died in the incident.

data.name: Tabibur Rahman Tota
data.description: Tabibur, an alleged criminal, was killed in a crossfire with RAB.

data.name: Alamgir
data.description: Alamgir, an alleged criminal, was killed in a crossfire with police.

data.name: Joynal Abedin
data.description: Pirate Joynal Abedin and two other pirates were killed in a gunfight between with a joint team of RAB-11 and Coast Guard.

data.description: Ranga was killed in a crossfire in the RAB custody. RAB identified him as a trader of illegal firearms, whereas his family claimed that Ranga was not a arms trader and that he worked as an assistant to the driver of a school bus.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.description: Faruk's sister said some police in plainclothe led by SI Nuruzzaman arrested him from in a tea stall from in fornt of his house on 19.2.12. She claimed that Faruk died due to police torture in Kafrul Police Station

data.name: Shariful Islam Russel

data.description: Shariful Islam Russel, a member of the voluntary wing of BNP, died when members of Sitakunda Police Station opened fire to disperse blockaders who were vandalising vehicles.

data.name: Hossain Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat activist Hossain Ali and Arizul Islam were killed when police and BGB members opened fire on blockaders to clear the blockades. 20 Jamaat activists were also injured in this incident.

data.name: Arizul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat activists Arizul Islam and Hossain Ali were killed when police and BGB members opened fire on blockaders to clear the blockades. 20 Jamaat activists were also injured in this incident.

data.name: Siam Mastan
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Siam Mastan, an eighth grader, and Tajul Islam Ratan, an activist of student wing of BNP, were killed in a clash with police at Kalibari around 10:30 am on December 4, 2013. At least five more sufferred bullet injury in the incident.

data.name: Tajul Islam Ratan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Tajul Islam Ratan, an activist of student wing of BNP, and Siam Mastan, an eighth grader, were killed in a clash with police at Kalibari around 10:30 am on December 4, 2013. At least five more sufferred bullet injury in the incident.

data.name: Harunur Rashid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Youth wing of BNP activist Harunur Rashid was killed in a clash with the police. 30 other people were injured in the incident.

data.name: Mafizur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Rickshaw-puller Mafizur Rahman, who became wounded with a bullet in a clash between the police and student wing of Jamaat at Daganbhuiyan in Feni, died from his injuries at Chittagong Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Shofikul Islam
data.description: Shofikul Islam, an alleged mugger, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-3 at Mogbazaar, Dhaka. RAB-3 said on 6 December 2013 early in the morning, Shofikul along with Abdul Kadir (30), Rajib (22) and Haji Mamun (43) in a car tried to snatch valuables from a couple in front of Mogbazaar camp. At that time, RAB members approached the muggers while they opened fire on RAB. RAB fired back in self defense. Later, the car with the muggers escaped from the place and clashed with an electric poll. Thus they left the car there and took Shofikul to Square Hospital as he was bullet wounded. Later, RAB members arrested the three with the dead body of Shofikul from Square Hospital. The family alleged that Shofikul was innocent.

data.name: Alamgir Rahman Sumon
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: A 10-year-old schoolboy, Alamgir Rahman Sumon, was caught in a clash between the police and activists of the BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami. The BNP-Jamaat men threw bombs during the clash with police in Bohuli Bazar area forcing the police to fire rubber bullets and tear gas, which killed Alamgir.

data.name: Abdus Salam Mia
data.description: On 10 December 2013, Acting Company Commander Nayek Subedar Imtiajur Rahman of Modhugram BGB shot two rounds of bullet at CNG driver Abdus Salam's upper and lower part of the knee in front of a Saheed Minar near the way to Chagalnaiya from Shuvopur, Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Feni. Subedar Imtiajur Rahman suspected Abdus Salam as a smuggler and chased him. Later, BGB men caught Salam and Imtiajur shot him at a stage of altercation. The locals rescued the bullet wounded Abdus Salam and took him to the hospital while he died on the way.

data.name: Hafej Abdullah Al Salman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: After hearing the news of execution of Kader Molla's death penalty, Jamaat and student wing of Jamaat men rushed to the road and staged protest. At one stage of protest, police opened fire on protesters. Hafej Abdullah Al Salman, an student wing of Jamaat leader was shot dead in the incident.

data.name: Anwar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Anwar, an activist of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, died when police attacked a procession by the party. The clash continued for about half an hour leaving 30 activists of Jamaat's student wing of Jamaat sufferred bullet injuries. Of them, Anwar was pronounced dead after being taken to DMCH.

data.name: Shihab
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Goons, accompanying a RAB team, began firing indiscriminately after entering the house of Sahabuddin Sabu, General Secretary of the District unit BNP and burnt three cars parked in the yard. The battalion took away a bullet-hit Shahabuddin, BNP leader Azizul Karim Bachchu and two of their caretakers. As the news spread in the town, the youth wing of BNP brought out a procession from Adarsha Samad High School and as it reached Chawkbazar and exploded some crude bombs, the battalion fired into the procession leaving many people injured. Shihab, Mahbubur and Suman died on their way to hospital. The identity of the other deceased could not be found. The district BNP claimed that youth wing of BNP leader Iqbal Mahmud Jewel had died in police firing.

data.name: Mahbubur
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Goons, accompanying a RAB team, began firing indiscriminately after entering the house of Sahabuddin Sabu, General Secretary of the District unit BNP and burnt three cars parked in the yard. The battalion took away a bullet-hit Shahabuddin, BNP leader Azizul Karim Bachchu and two of their caretakers. As the news spread in the town, the youth wing of BNP brought out a procession from Adarsha Samad High School and as it reached Chawkbazar and exploded some crude bombs, the battalion fired into the procession leaving many people injured. Shihab, Mahbubur and Suman died on their way to hospital. The identity of the other deceased could not be found. The district BNP claimed that youth wing of BNP leader Iqbal Mahmud Jewel had died in police firing.

data.name: Mansur Ahmed

data.description: Mansur Ahmed, who hailed from Munshirhat, Chandpur Sadar, was shot dead by police at Malibagh, Dhaka during the'road march for democracy'.

data.name: Mohammad Jihad
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Mohammad Jihad, an activist of youth wing of BNP hailed from Nobogram, Ullapara, Sirajganj, and was shot dead by police at Malibagh, Dhaka during the ‘March for Democracy’ movement led by BNP and its 18-Party Alliance.

data.name: Anarul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Anarul Islam, an Union Parishad Chairman, who allegedly had direct links with recent violence in Satkhira at the time, was killed in a "gunfight" between joint forces and Jamaat-Shibir activists at Vadra of Satkhira Sadar upazila. On 30 December, 2013, the joint forces were patrolling the Vadra area of Kushkhali UP around 12:30 pm when some 250 Jamaat-Shibir activists attacked the law enforcers with brickbats and crude bombs. At one stage, the attackers opened fire on lawmen, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunshots. As the Jamaat-Shibir men retreated after around an hour, law enforcers found the bullet-hit body Anarul lying near a pond in the area.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

data.name: Arman Ali
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police at Akkelpur in Jaipurhat on December 31, 2013. The deceased was identified as Arman Ali (40), son of the late Akkas Ali of village Puran Gopinathpur under Akkelpur. Md Hamidul Alam, Police Super of Jaipurhat, said on information that a group of robbers, led by Arman Ali, was planning robbery at Puran Gopinathpur, a police team rushed there. But as the lawmen reached there at around 2. 30 pm, the robbers fired gunshots targeting police and they fired back.

data.name: Abdul Jobbar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A ward-level Jamaat-e-Islami leader was killed in a gunfight between law enforcers and Jamaat-Shibir men in Sadar upazila on December 31, 2013. AKM Nahidul Islam, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Meherpur, said a team of joint forces arrested Jabbar from his residence at Hijuli village on December 30, 2013 in connection with recent violence unleashed by Jamaat and its student wing Islami Chhatra Shibir in the district. During the interrogation, Jabbar disclosed the identity of the party men in the area, and a cache of arms possessed by them, the SP said. Shibir cadres led by Abdul Matin, Khulna divisional coordinator of Jamaat, were scheduled to meet him in the village on the night, the SP said quoting Jabbar. Following the confessional statement, a team of joint forces conducted a raid in the village around 2:00 am on 31 December, 2013. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Jamaat-Shibir men opened fire on the joint forces, while the law enforcers fired gunshots in response. At one stage, Jabbar who was staying with the team during the raids, jumped out of the police van to flee the scene, and caught in the line of fire.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

data.name: Kismot Ali
data.description: SI Mominur Rahman and Constable Mahabub of Digholiya Police Station, Choukidar (village watchman) Mokbul went to Kismot Kismot Ali's house at about 9.30 pm on 30 December, 2013. They detained Kismot and took him to Union Parishad. From there he was taken to a pharmacy and later moved to Upazila Health Complex, where he was declared dead. Nazma Begum, wife of Kismot, alleged that police beat up Kismot by rifle while detaining him. She alleged that police is liable for the death of her husband.

data.name: Kalu
data.description: Kalu and two other alleged pirates were killed in a gunfight with police. Police got information that Kalu was staying with his associates at a Alamin fishery project near Bhuiyarhat of Subarnachar upazila and planning a crime in Meghna River. As Kalu and his associates sensed the presence of the police, they opened fire at the police who also retaliated with firing.

data.name: Ripon
data.description: Ripon and two other alleged pirates Kalu and Rubel were killed in a gunfight with police. Police got information that the pirates were staying at a Alamin fishery project near Bhuiyarhat of Subarnachar upazila and planning a crime in Meghna River. Sensing the presence of the police, the pirates opened fire at them and the law enforcers retaliated. After the gunfight the three pirates were dead.

data.name: Rubel

data.name: Jakir Sadik
data.description: ASI Masudur Rahman, in-charge of Tekala Police Camp of Doulotpur Police Station of Kushtia, arrested Jakir Sadik, an alleged criminal, from his home and took him to the Doulotpur Police Station on 13 November 2013. On the same day, at about 11.00 pm at night, the family of the victim came to know that he was dead. The family claimed that Jakir Sadik died in the police custody due to torture.

data.name: Siraj Khan
data.description: Baby taxy driver Siraj Khan was allegedly beaten to death by SI Asad, Ramzan Ali, Aminul and ASI Azad, Harun, Jewel. On 26 November 2013, Siraj Khan and five others were playing cards, when the aformentioned police officers came to the place and alleged that they were gambling. Then the officers chased them as they tried to flee the area. The police detained Siraj and beat him up. Later, local people chased the police team from the place. On the other hand, Siraj was declared dead by the doctors after he was taken to the Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mortoza Hossain Rana
data.description: Mortoza Hossain Rana, an alleged forest robber, and one of his accomplices were killed in a'shootout' with RAB in Shelargang area of Sundarban under Mongla upazila on 30 October 2013. A team of elite force conducted a drive in Sundarban around 7. 50 am as part of their regular drive against forest robbers. When the RAB members reached Shelargang area under Changpai forest range, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. The two robbers were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Saiful Islam Mithu
data.description: Police detained Saiful Ahmed Mithu on September 4, 2013 and took him to the Shahjahanpur Police Station. The family of the victim claimed that he was tortured there which killed him. However, police claimed that he died at Dhaka medical College Hospital due to stroke.

data.name: Mohammad Boshir
data.description: Reportedly, Selim, Sub-Inspector of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station tortured Boshir and as a result he died.

data.name: Fazlur Rahman Fazu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Fazlur Rahman Fazu, regional leader of ultra-left Gano Mukti Fauz, was killed in an'encounter' with police in Khuksa upazila of Kushtia on September 22, 2013. According to police sources, Fazu and his operatives were holding a secret meeting near the Uthuli Bridge in the upazila. Hearing the news at about 4:00 am, Khuksha police went to the spot. Sensing the presence of the police, the outlaws opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to return fire that triggered an encounter.

data.name: Emran
data.description: Emran, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another in a gunfight with police in Hatiya upazila in Noakhali.

data.name: Josim Uddin
data.description: Josim Uddin, an alleged pirate, was killed along with another in a gunfight with police in Hatiya upazila in Noakhali.

data.name: Rubel Hossain
data.description: Police members of Taherpur Municipality Police Barrack allegedly harassed motorcycle riders regularly for bribe in front of Mohini Garments. When people reduced their visit to the market because of the police harassment, the shop owners of the garments went to the police barrack to talk about it. At one stage of the discussion, police opened fire at them, where Rubel, owner of Mohini Garments, got shot and died.

data.name: Azhar Uddin
data.description: Police members of Nalitabari Police Station arrested Azhar on July 24, suspecting him to be involved in a murder case. He was taken into remand and kept in Nalitabari Police Station, where he was reportedly given electric shocks. Family alleged that he was tortured to death at police custody.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Businessman Billal was killed in a shootout with police. Police said a patrol team of Darshana Police Camp challenged a group of miscreants when they were seen to have gathered in a field in the area. The miscreants fired rounds of bullet targeting the law enforcers, which triggered a gunfight. After gunfight, police found Billal's bullet hit body.

data.name: Solayman Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: During the hartal period on 13 August 2013, police opened fire in a clash at Rajnagar main road of Meherpur. As a result, an activist of Jamaat-e-Islami was shot and wounded. He was admitted to the Rajshahi Islami Bank Medical College Hospital, where doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: At least five pirates were critically injured and may have succumbed to their injuries, during a six-hour gunfight with the police in Manpura upazila of Bhola on 25 August 2013. The incident occurred at the Burir Don area near the Meghna estuary in Manpura.

data.name: Yunus
data.description: Yunus, leader of a gang of robbers, was killed in a gunfight with police at Hatiya upazila in Noakhali on 30 August 2013. Police said the deceased Yunus was shot dead around 1 am.

data.name: Yasin Bepari
data.description: Reportedly, the Detective Branch of Police carried out an operation to arrest Yasin, an alleged criminal. When he sensed the presence of the police, Yasine & his accomplices began shooting at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight, Yasin was found dead.

data.name: Riaz Dalim
data.description: RAB 8 official carried out an operation in the Sundarbans. During the operation RAB members got engaged in a gun fight with a rival criminal group. That incident left Riaz alias Dalim and another of the alleged criminals dead.

data.name: Kalam Kha
data.description: RAB 8 official carried out an operation in the Sundarbans. During the operation RAB members got engaged in a gun fight with a rival criminal group. That incident left Kalam Kha and another of the alleged criminals dead.

data.name: Mohammad Mahadi
data.description: Mohammad Mahadi, an alleged criminal, was killed in a crossfire between Pallabi Police and alleged criminals

data.name: Md. Sabuj Mia
data.description: Two miscreants- Md Sabuj Mia and Sagor Ahmed Moti- rent a microbus from Dhaka International Airport to go to Dhaka-Mawa highway. When they reached there, they dropped the driver and started driving the microbus. RAB members tried to stop the microbus at a check post of RAB-10 at Nazirabag are. According to RAB, suddenly the criminals opened fire at RAB members, which fored RAB to retaliate. After the gunfight Sabuj and Sagor found dead.

data.name: Sagor Ahmed Moti
data.description: Two miscreants- Md Sabuj Mia and Sagor Ahmed Moti- rent a microbus from Dhaka International Airport to go to Dhaka-Mawa highway. When they reached there, they dropped the driver and started driving the microbus. RAB members tried to stop the microbus at a check post of RAB-10 at Nazirabag are. According to RAB, suddenly the criminals opened fire at RAB members, which fored RAB to retaliate. After the gunfight Sabuj and Sagor found dead.

data.name: H M Jahid Siddiq Tareq
data.description: AL leader H M Jahid Siddiq Tareq and his associate Shah Alam got killed by RAB members in a crossfire.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Alleged C Shah Alam and AL leader H M Jahid Siddiq Tareq got killed by RAB members in a crossfire.

data.name: Rashed Parvez
data.description: Rashed got killed in crossfire with the RAB members, it is alleged that he along with his several associates kidnapped a 14 years old son of an army sergeant.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat activist NuruL Islam was killed and four others were injured in a clash between student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami and law enforcers

data.name: Ziaur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Latifur Rahman, Amir of city unit Jamaat, alleged that an activist named Ziaur Rahman was critically injured after being shot by BGB. He succumbed to his injuries while he was being taken to Rajshahi Medical College & Hospital. He was a 1st year student of HSC of Krishna Gobinda College.

data.name: Arifuzzaman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Arifuzzaman, an activist of Jamaat, was killed along with an activist of the party's student wing in a clash between police and Jamaat supporters in Pawkhai Hazampara area.

data.name: Ruhul Amin Gazi
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Ruhul Amin Gazi, an activist of Jamaat's student wing, was killed along with another supporter of the party in a clash between police and Jamaat supporters in Pawkhai Hazampara area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: When a petrol team of Sreepur Police Station was returning from duty, around 15 miscreants held their way for robbery. When they were attacking the police officers, police counter fired. That incident left one of the robber dead.

data.name: Shamim Sarkar
data.description: Reportedly, police officers from Savar Police Station arrested Shamim, a land broker, and took him to the Tannery Industry Police Barrack. SI Imdad and ASI Akidul demanded 5 lakh taka from him. Police tortured him at the barrack the whole night. When he died, police took his dead body to the Mitford Hospital .

data.name: Razu
data.description: Ramna Police shot Razu to death in a crossfire.

data.name: Waris Ali
data.description: Ansar members of Chhatak paper Mills caught fisherman Waris Ali red handed at the time of stealing fish from a pond of the mills. After severly beating him,. Police took Waris to Osmani Medical College & Hospital in a critical condition, where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shah Alam Sarder
data.description: Shah Alam was beaten to death by RAB-06 members, when Shah Alam along with 20/25 people brought a procession during election. said RAB officials beat those processioners and arrested 10 persons. Shah Alam ran away from the beating and was moving towards his home. After some time, he fell sick and was taken to health centre of the mill, Khalishpur Meidical Centre and then Gazi Medical College Hospital, where the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Mahbub Saijja
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Mahbub alias Saijja, alleged leader of a pirate group called Siajja Bahini, from the Sundarbans was killed along with two of his men in a gunfight with RAB-08 members.

data.name: Amjad
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: Amzad, alleged member of a pirate group called Saijja Bahini, from the Sundarbans was killed along with two other members of the same pirate group in a gunfight with RAB-08 members.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: An alleged member of a pirate group called Saijja Bahini from the Sundarbans was killed along with two other members of the same pirate group in a gunfight with RAB-08 members.

data.name: Badal
data.description: Badal was killed in a gunfight with police. Police claimed that he was a leader of a robber group.

data.name: Hasmot Ali Bhutto
data.description: Reportedly, S I Selim from Bagha Police Station, Rajshahi arrested Hasmot Ali for taking drugs and tortured him at the police station. When Ali was sent to the jail, he fell sick and died. When his body was returned to his family, they reported seeing lots of marks of injuries in his body. His family claimed that he was tortured to death. by police

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: On May 02, 2013 RAB membes arrested Iqbal from Aruapara graveyard. As he became sick, RAB menbers took him to Kushtia General Hospital, where the duty doctor declared him dead. His familty claimed that he was tortured to death while in custody. The RMO of the hospital wrote in a note that sign of beating found in the body of the deceased.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: On May 20, 2013 Delwar got killed in a crossfire with police. Police said Delwar with his associates were preparing for docoity. As police tried to arrest them, they opened fire at police and the law enforcers retaliated .

data.name: Nizamuddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On May 21, 2013 Tongi Police conducted an arrest operation. During that operation police beat up Nizamuddin, a BNP student wing leader, and threw him from the police van, which caused killed him.

data.name: Johirul Islam
data.description: On May 22, 2013 RAB-1 petrol team was running a check post at Maskat Plaza Road of Uttara. At midnight, a car broke the signal and tried to run away. RAB chased the car till the end of the road . Suddenly passengers of that car started shooting at RAB and the security forces fired back in self defence.The fight left Johirul Islam, driver of the car, and another dead.

data.name: Shaju Akando
data.description: On May 22, 2013 RAB-1 petrol team was running a check post at Maskat Plaza Road of Uttara. At midnight, a car broke the signal and tried to run away. RAB chased the car till the end of the road . Suddenly passengers of that car started shooting at RAB and the security forces fired back in self defence.The fight left Shaju Akando, driver of a satellite TV channel, and another dead.

data.name: Rana
data.description: BGB members shot and killed those Rana, a drug dealer, and another as they breached BGB check post signal.

data.name: Mohidul
data.description: BGB members shot and killed Mohidul, a durg dealer, and another as they breached BGB check post signal.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a gunfight with police on May 25, 2013. Police chased the mugger, and he started to shoot at the law enforcer, triggering the gunfight.

data.name: Shamim Reza
data.description: Shamim was arrested for his alleged involvment in a murder case. He was kept at the rooftop of police quarter. Shamim's family claimed that he was tortured to death as the family failed to pay the money demanded by the police.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Mohammad Mamun was killed after police-RAB-BGB opened fire during a clash between Hefajat men and law enforcement agencies. Two other people was shot to death during the clash.

data.description: Ebadat Ali, an egg trader, was shot dead by police during a clash with the activists of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami.

data.name: Rubel Hassan
data.description: On April 02, 2013 when Rampura police was pursuing a snatcher, they opened fire on the law enforcers. Police retaliated and Rubel Hasan died by falling in the middle of that gunfight.

data.name: Sahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: On April 05, 2013 activists of AL and Hefazat-e-Islami engaged in a clash. One of the activists of AL, Shahidul Islam, got killed as police opened fire on them.

data.name: Samiul Islam
data.description: Several alleged dacoits tried to hold some police officers on there way and tried to snatch their arms. When the police fired at them, one of the alleged dacoits, Samiul, got killed.

data.name: Monsur Gazi
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: Monsur Gazi, a van puller, got shot as police opened fire when the activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing blocked a road with tree and attacked the police camp.

data.name: Selim Hawladar
data.description: Selim Hawladar and two other allaged forest alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB-8) members.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged forest robber, along with two others of the same bandit group, was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB-8) members.

data.name: Unidentified

data.name: Nurul Islam Nuri
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On April 25, 2013, BNP leader Nurul Islam was abducted by some plainclothed men, who identified themselves as DB officials. Later on on April 26, 2013, his body was found at the nearby road of Horra. Family claimed that DB officials killed him with the involvement of local AL leaders.

data.name: Asghar Ali
data.identity: Reportedly a bystander or an accidental victim
data.description: A 12-year-old boy, Ashgar Ali Limon, was killed reportedly in a police firing during fierce clashes between law enforcers and student wing of Jamaat. A bullet hit him in the face.

data.name: Korban Ali
data.description: Korban Ali, an electrician was killed by RAB-11. 20 other people were injured in the incident.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Shahidul Islam was shot dead with two other opposition party activists in a clash between Police-BGB and Jamaat-Shibir at Satkania on March 2, 2013. The activists of Jamaat were obstructed the Chittagong-Cox's Bazar highway from February 28, 2013. On March 2 a large convoy of police force tried to evict the obstruction. The protesters threw brick bats to the police and police indiscriminately opened fire.

data.name: Shah Alam Khokon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On 7.3.13, Rizvhi Ahmed, Joint Secretary General of BNP, stated that Shah Alam Khokon, an activist of BNP was shot and wounded by police. Later, he died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. He was injured after police fired bullets to break up the protests of the city unit BNP at Naya Paltan as part of the party’s countrywide programmes in protest of attacks, arrests and filing false cases against party leaders and activists’.

data.name: Kanchan

data.name: Tofayel Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Tofayel Uddin was one of the four Jamaat and student wing of Jamaat activists who were shot dead were shot dead by police during a fierce clash between the two groups. The Jamaat and student wing of Jamaat activists started pelting stones and brickbats at the law enforcers. The police retaliated by firing rubber bullets at the Jamaat and student wing of Jamaat members. The district administration imposed section 144 in the town until further notice issued. The firing ensued around 2:00 pm when several hundred activists of Jamaat-Shibir brought out processions in Rumaliachhara and Tarabaniachhara areas of the town after Juma prayers demanding release of Sayedee. 30 people including pedestrians sustained bullet injuries in the police firing.

data.description: Islami Chhatra Shibir leader Ali Asgar Khan Rahat succumbed to his injuries on February 25, 2013 after being wounded in a clashes with police in Sylhet . The Shibir leader died at Apollo Hospital and his body was sent back to Sylhet.

data.description: Mohammad Ibrahim was shot dead and in a clash between the police and Jamaat-student wing of Jamaat activists on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway on February 18, 2013 in the countrywide dawn to dusk hartal.

data.name: Mostafa Murshed Tahsin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Mostafa Murshed Tahsin was killed and 50 people including journalists and pedestrians as Islamists clashed with the police. Islamists under the banner of'Touhidi Janata' brought out processions from different mosques after juma prayers demanding punishment of the atheist bloggers for allegedly defaming the Holy Quran and making derogatory comments on the Prophet (SM). They vandalised the Ganajagaran Mancha in front of the local press club and torched a police car. Police opened fire to disperse them.

data.name: Alal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat-student wing of Jamaat and picketers blocked the Pabna-Dhaka highway road and demonstrated a half-day hartal. Police rushed to the spot and charged batons and clash ensued between them. Police fired 150 round bullets and threw 40 round tear shells to disperse them. In this incident Alal Hossain and Sirajul Islam, activists of student wing of Jamaat were shot dead .

data.name: Sirajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Jamaat-student wing of Jamaat and picketers blockade Pabna-Dhaka highway road and demonstrated im the half day hartal. data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam, a madrasa teacher, was killed in a clash between Islamists and law enforcers. Law enforcers and ruling party men had opened fired'indiscriminately' on demonstrators demanding punishment of the bloggers whom the Islamists accused of maligning Islam and its Prophet (SM), a charge the bloggers denied. The police fired 269 gun shots and more than 150 rubber bullets in self defense after several hundred villagers attacked with firearms, other lethal weapons and bamboo sticks. Three other people and pro-hartal activists were shot dead in the incident and 20 other people sustained bullet wounds

data.description: Malek, an alleged dacoit, allegedly died in a gunfight with police on January 13, 2012.

data.name: Jiarul Islam
data.description: Reportedly, a group of 30 to 35 alleged smugglers engaged in a clash with BGB members while smuggling a consignment of medicine, cosmetics, warm clothes and drugs. A that time, members of BGB opened fire, injuring Jiarul. He later succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Haresh Ali
data.description: The victim, Haresh Ali (55) was playing cards with four or five others near Hatkoroi Bazar at around 1.00 pm when two policemen- ASI Prodip Kumar and constable Samiul Islam- went there. ASI Prodip Kumar kicked Haresh hard, causing his death on the spot, locals said.

data.name: Nasir Uddin

data.description: The handcuffed body of Rafiqul Islam Majumder was recovered at Kumarkhali upazila in Khustia a few hours after he was allegedly picked up by a group of the Rapid Action Battalion personnel from Sailkupa in Jhenaidah on January 5, 2013.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.description: An alleged pirate, Zakir Hossain was killed in'crossfire' with the Rapid Action Battalion at Bhedakhali village under Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat district.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain

data.name: Nazir Ahmed Sabuj

data.name: Akram Ali
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Bhadu's wife Eti Khatun alleged that Pangsha police in Rajbari picked her husband up from Pangsha bus stand at night on December 20, 2014. However, Abul Bashar, OC of Pangsha Police Station, denied the allegation. On December 21, 2014 his bullet hit body was found.

data.name: Ujjal Sheikh
data.description: Ujjal Sheikh was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police in Magura Sadar upazila. Deceased Uzzal Hossain 33, son of Awal Biswas of the upazila's Chandpur village.

data.name: Mohammad Roni
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Mokbul Ahmed, father of the deceased alleged that, Police detained Roni from Contractor bridge area on December 8, 2014. Later on night he was shot dead by police beside Mostafa's shop at Latifpur. On the other hand, police claimed that Roni died in gunfight.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: Abul Kashem was allegedly killed in gunfight with Rab members at Suterkhali in the district's Dakop upazila on December 26, 2014. Acting on a tip-off, a special team of RAB-6, led by Commanding Officer Lt Col Enamul Arif Sumon, raided an area near Suterkhali Forest Station around 9:45 p. m., said media officer of the battalion Harunur Rashid, who is a Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police. Kashem along with his aides was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence RAB personnel, the alleged criminals opened fire, triggering a "gun battle" between the members of the gang and the elite force, the Rab official said. After half an hour of the "gunfight", Kashem was found dead. However, his cohorts managed to escape, he added.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.description: Jahangir Hossain was allegedly killed in gunfight by police on December 24, 2014.

data.name: Azad
data.description: Azad was allegedly killed in a gunfight by the police. Police said the "gunfight" in Comilla took place around 5. 00 a. m. after a Detective Branch of police team challenged a gang, which was preparing for carjacking, near Alekhar Char area in Sadar upazila on Dhaka-Chittagong highway. Sensing danger, the gang opened fire targeting the DB personnel. prompting them to retaliate that eventually triggered the shootout, said Khorshed Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station. Azad was shot and died later.

data.name: Mohammad Iqbal Hossain Bhuiyan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Iqbal Hossain Bhuiyan was tortured to death. Police arrested him from Protapganj bazaar at around 5. 30 p. m. on December 25, 2014. On that day at around 8. 00 p. m. he died at Bancharampur Health Complex. Family alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Mohammad Roni

Roni (30), son of Mokbul Ahmed, of village Latifpur of Sadar upazila. Police and locals said three policemen were injured during an hour-long gunfight that took place on December 5, 2014 night at village Latifpur.

data.name: Abdul Hadi
data.description: Abdul Hadi, along with Shohag Hossain, were picked up by Jessore police around on October 13, 2014 night and were found dead later, father of the latter victim claimed. Police, however, refuted the claim and said the two might have been killed by rival groups due to internal feud. Shohag's father Rakibul Islam, a commander of Bangladesh Ansar, said that his son along with Hadi and few others were sitting at a tea stall near their house. A team of DB police accompanied by SI Masud Hossain of Khajura Police Outpost of Jessore Sadar Police Station reached the spot around 11.30 pm and detained them along with two others-Mohsin Ali (17) and Opu Hossain (16) said Rakibul. DB stopped at Panchbera Bahadur bus stand and freed Mohsin and Opu, he said, adding that he heard the news of his son’s detention on that night from other people sitting at the tea stall. "Police gave Mohsin and Opu Tk 200 each as bus fare before freeing them and told them that they were taking Hadi and Shohag to the police station, ’’ Rakibul claimed. Next morning, Rakibul came to know that dead bodies of his son and Hadi were found in Jhenaidah. He demanded a proper investigation into the incident to unmask the real culprits.
