data.name: Abul Hashem
data.description: On October 14, 2014 at around 1.30 am police shot the fisherman while he was fishing in the Mehgna River, alleged by his family. However, police denied the allegation.

data.name: Babul Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a so-called gunfight with police in Terokhada upazila on October 15, 2014. The dead is Babul Mollah. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers. In retaliation, police fired back and Babul Mollah, while trying to flee the scene, was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The deceased was a regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist party.

data.name: Osman Dafader
data.description: Osman was killed in a gunfight between alleged criminals and police personel. On September 13, 2014 police arrested him. Following his statement, the police went to conduct drive for recovering illegal arms. During this time, alleged criminals opened fire to police. Police retaliated fire-back, leaving Osman spot dead.

data.name: Mejbah Uddin Tarek
data.description: DB police arrested Mejbah on September 13, 2014 at around 3. 00 am. Later, police took him for recovering arms at Mugda area where there a gunfight ensued with Mejbah's associates. At one stage of gunfight, Mejbah was bullet wounded. Then he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shah Alam Khondorar
data.description: The deceased's wife Mariyum Begum alleged that 15 to 20 people stormed their house at Bijaynagar of Barudi under Sonargaon upazila in Narayanganj around 10. 00 am on September 15, 2014 and dragged Shah Alam into their boat introducing them as Detective Branch of Police. Police said, Shah Alam was killed during a gunfight with the DB police at the Wireless Gate of Mogbazar when he along with his cohorts attacked on police.

data.name: Motiar Rahman
data.description: A police petrol team, acting on a tip-off, went to Patbila area where a gang of robbers was taking preperation for looting night coaches by felling roadside trees. Sensing the presence of policemen, the gang opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight Motiar received bullet injuries while remaining gang members managed to flee. Motiar was taken to Jhenidah Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sekendar Sarder
data.description: Police arrested Sekendar on September 17, 2014 at around 3. 00 am. Later, police took him for recovering arms at Mathavanga area where there a gunfight ensued with Sekendar's associates. At one stage of gunfight, Sekendar was killed .

data.name: Babul Miah
data.description: A clash took place between supporters of chairman candidate Hamidul Haq and Shah Alam to control polling center and giving fake vote. At one stage police fired 50 rubber bullets and tear shells to bring the situation under control. This left many people wounded including Babul Miah. Babul Miah was taken to Akhaura Shastho complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yusuf Ali
data.description: On September 9, 2014 a youth named Yusuf Ali, son of Ibrahim and inhabitant of Jhapaipara village under Chapainababganj Municipality area, died in the custody of Chapainababganj Police Station. The mother of the deceased, Amena Begum informed that Yusuf died due to torture by police after he was arrested. Sub Inspector (SI) Monirul Islam of Chapainababganj Police Station led this operation. She was informed by local people of the area from where Yusuf was arrested that police beat him after his arrest. Police took him on van at one stage when Yusuf’s mouth was bleeding. He was beaten again by police even after taking into van. Due to severe beating Yusuf became seriously ill and on September 9, he died in Chapainababganj Sadar Hospital. She claimed that there were marks of injuries on Yusuf’s body. The grandfather of Yusuf, Ahad Munshi informed that police beat Yusuf soon after he was arrested. He was taken to hospital by police with bleeding. Police did not allow them to see Yusuf’s body before the body was officially handed over to the family. Eye-witness of the incident, Mirza Ronju said that on September 12, at midnight, he was picked up in police station by SI Monirul Islam for disclosing the matter in media. But he was released in the next morning as the incident of his arrest exposed. He also said that SI Monirul Islam is threatening him along with his family to put in jail by implicating in case for telling truth. They could not live at home in fear.

data.name: Monirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Monirul Islam (32), a regional leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP), was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dhopakhola under Phultala upazila .

data.name: Rajib Hossain
data.description: Rajib was killed in a gunfight with DB police at Hatirjheell of Magbazar rail crossing, Dhaka on August 7, 2014. Rajib's family, however, claimed that the DB arrested him two days ago from Rampura and that the killing was pre-planned.

data.name: Moktarul Dhali
data.description: Moktarul Dhali alias Mokter was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police .

data.name: Nasir Russell
data.description: RAB killed Nasir alias Russell (29) alleged forest robber in'crossfire' in Sunderban in Bagerhat.

data.name: Abdul Jalil alias
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A leader of the outlawed Sarbahara party was killed on August 21, 2014 at Shilundia Bazaar of Babuganj upazila in Barisal in a'shootout' with the Rapid Action Battalion. . Captain Abul Bashar, Commander of company-1 at the Barisal headquarters of Rab-8, said a Rab team led by Deputy Assistant Director Abdur Rahman was patrolling Silundia area around 4. 20 pm when they marked a suspicious gathering. When challenged, the suspects opened fire on the Rab men, he said. The Rab team fired back.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.description: Police arrested Khorshed on August 26, 2014. Later, took him for recovering arms at Panchgaon union where there a gunfight ensued on August 28, 2014. He was killed in a cross fire.

data.name: Timir Baran Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the Manabendra Narayan Larma (MN Larma) or the ‘Reform’ faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (JSS)
data.description: Timir Baran Chakma alias Duranto Chakma Babu (52) died during medical treatment while under the custody of Army in Matiranga Hospital. On August 9 in the evening, members of the Army carried out an operation in Indumoni area under Guiyamara Upazila in Khagrachhari Hill District and arrested Duranto Chakma Babu (52), Nishimoni Chakma (40), Amarkanti Chakma (18) and Romel Tripura (38) in the morning of August 10. Sudhakar Tripura, Student & Youth Affairs Secretary of the Central Committee of Parbatta Gonoshonghoti Samity (MN Larma) alleged that Duranta Chakma died due to torture. Meanwhile army stated regarding his death that Duranta Chakma was suddenly fall sick due to asthma and he was admitted to Matiranga Hospital where he died. Elena Chakma, the wife of Nishumoni Chakma, said, the Army surrounded their house at night and arrested them at around 5. 30 am, and after making the arrest all of them were severely beaten and kicked by Army with their boots. Duranta Chakma’s wife Alotara Chakma said that her husband had no disease in relation to asthma.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.description: A man was killed by the DB police allegedly in crossfire at Khilgaon in Dhaka . The deceased, Zakir Hossain (40) had been running a tea stall, the family said, while the police claimed that he was known as Kangali Zakir and was facing different criminal charges including murder of sergent Ahad.

data.name: Mahbubur Rahman Sujon
data.description: A youth died in police custody at the Mirpur police station on July 13, 2014, hours after he was detained by police. Family members of the victim alleged he was tortured to death. The deceased, Mahbubur Rahman Sujon (35) was accused in several cases, said Dhaka Metropolitan Police Deputy Commissioner (media and public relation) Masudur Rahman. Meanwhile, a sub inspector of Mirpur police, Jahidur Rahman, was closed in connection with this incident. Sujon was admitted to a local clinic and then shifted to the Suhrawardy Hospital at Sher-e-Bangla Nagar after he suffered respiratory problems, around 4. 00 am, where doctors declared him dead, said Mirpur division deputy commissioner Imtiaz Ahmed. The body was sent to the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital mortuary for postmortem. Mirpur police station officer-in-charge Salahuddin said Sujon was a listed criminal and member of criminal gang Shahadat Bahini. However, the deceased's brother Shameem said Sujon was an apparel products trader and was not involved in any criminal activities. He said that a sub-inspector, Jahid was demanding extortion from Sujon and threatened to kill him unless he paid the money.' Police stormed into Sujon's Sankar residence at night and took him. Moreover, he did not have any respiratory problems. Police tortured him to death', said Shameem. DMHC morgue officials also said Sujon had several marks of injury on his body.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdur Rashid and Hazrat Ali, two members of the Purba Bangla Communist Party (ML), were killed by the police in two alleged incidents of gunfight in Jhenaidah. The Kotchandpur police station officer-in-charge, Fazlur Rahman, said that Abdur Rashid was found dead following a'gunfight' with the police on July 12, 2014 night at Dora as the police conducted an operation to arrest crime suspects. On the other hand, Harinakunda police station officer-in-charge, Ershadul Kabir, said that Hazrat Ali was found dead in another'gunfight' with the police on July 12, 2014 as the police conducted another operation in Rishkhali Amtala to arrest robbers.'As the police reached the spot, the robbers fired at the police, who'retaliate', he said.

data.name: Siraj Akunji
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Local people alleged that Siraj Akunji, an activist of Biplabi Communist Party killed in a gunfight on July 16, 2014. However police claimed that the victim was an activist of underground Biplabi Communist Party and was killed in a factional clash of the party.

data.name: Giasuddin Apan
data.description: Prime suspect in abduction and rape of a Cambrian College girl at Uttara in Dhaka was killed by the Detective Branch of police in a reported incident of'crossfire' at Hatirjheel on July 18, 2014. The police said that the deceased, Giasuddin Apan (27) was a member of a mugging ring and prime suspect in abduction and rape of the college girl after killing a security guard at Uttara on July 3, 2014. The DMP Deputy Commissioner (media and public relations), Masudur Rahman, said that a gunfight took place between the police and miscreants at about 4. 00 am in Hatirjheel area where Giasuddin was found injured. Badda police sub-inspector Jayantu Kumar Mandal said that they recovered the bullet-hit Giasuddin and sent to DMCH where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: SM Biplab Kabir
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A local leader of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party was killed by the police in a reported incident of'shootout' at Tala upazila in Satkhira on July 18, 2014. The deceased, Tala upazila BNP joint secretary SM Biplab Kabir, was also a lecturer of mathematics of Shalika Degree College. The acting BNP secretary general, Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir, condemned the killing saying that Biplab was killed in police shooting and he was also beaten up by local Awami League activists.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.description: Anisur Rahman killed in a gunfight allegedly by police at Bosotpur, Sarsha, Jessore on July 19, 2014.

data.name: Namir Talukdar
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with police in the east Sundarbans under Sharankhola range of Bagerhat on July 20, 2014. The dead, Namir Talukdar (38) was a member of robber gang, Rezaul alias'Shirsha Bahini', according to police.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Jasim
data.description: On July 21, 2014 in the dawn unknown persons called two brothers Anwar and Gias Uddin over mobile phone to come in a place. Later Anwar was found dead with bullet hit. It was alleged by the members of RAB, as Giasuddin, younger brother of the deceased Anwar was shown arrested by RAB .

data.name: Nur Islam Ulka
data.description: In Tangail, Nur Islam Ulka (26) and Shahed Miah (27) were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police who were accused in the case filed for murdering assistant sub-inspector Nurul Islam of Tangail Model Police Station. Mohammad Akhtaruzzaman, officer-in-charge of the police station, said police raided a house in Takia Kodma village of Mirzapur upazila at around 4:00am on July 28, 2014 to arrest Ulka and his accomplices. Sensing their presence, Ulka and his accomplices opened fire, prompting the policemen to retaliate. Ulka was killed on the spot while his cohorts Sagar alias Dollar and Shahed sustained bullets wounds and were rushed to Mirzapur Kumudini Hospital. Later that day, they were shifted to Tangail General Hospital. The next day, they were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) as their conditions worsened. There, Shahed succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Shahed Miah
data.description: In Tangail, Nur Islam Ulka (26) and Shahed Miah (27) were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police who were accused in the case filed for murdering assistant sub-inspector Nurul Islam of Tangail Model Police Station. Mohammad Akhtaruzzaman, officer-in-charge of the police station, said police raided a house in Takia Kodma village of Mirzapur upazila at around 4:00am on July 28, 2014 to arrest Ulka and his accomplices. Sensing their presence, Ulka and his accomplices opened fire, prompting the policemen to retaliate. Ulka was killed on the spot while his cohorts Sagar alias Dollar and Shahed sustained bullets wounds and were rushed to Mirzapur Kumudini Hospital. Later that day, they were shifted to Tangail General Hospital. The next day, they were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) as their conditions worsened. There, Shahed succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Monirul Islam
data.description: Monirul Islam (35) was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Jhenidah's Shailkupa on July 28, 2014. Iqbal Bahar Chowdhury, OC of Shailkupa Police Station, said they got a tip-off that a gang of criminals had gathered at Kanapukurai village. When they raided the village around 3:00am, the "criminals" started firing bullets at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight was over, police recovered Monirul's body.

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: In Rangpur, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police on Dhaka-Rangpur highway at Phulbari of Mithapukur upazila on July 30, 2014. Alamgir Hossain 40, was a ringleader of Alamgir Bahini and son of Javed Ali of Khamarpara Phulchouki village in the upazila. Acting on secret information that a gang of criminals were preparing to commit robbery in Bhelur Bridge area of the village, a team of police went to the spot around 11:00pm, said Rabiul Alam, officer-in-charge of Mithapukur Police Station. Seeing the law enforcers, the "robbers" opened fire, prompting police to retaliate. Alamgir was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, according to police.

data.name: Johur Ahmed
data.description: Johur Ahmed was dead allegedly by Ansar at Bholaganj, Companyganj Upazila, Sylhet while a group of stone lifter trying to steal stone from a restricted area of Railway area. Members of Ansar claimed that they opened fire in self defence.

data.name: Bhutto
data.description: Bhuttu was shot in a gunfight with police on May 26, 2014. Later he was succumed to his injuries in hospital on June 2, 2014. His wife claimed that police killed him in a planned way.

data.name: Ismail Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Khokon was killed in a gunfight allegedly by police at Katakhali area, Digholi union, Sadar upazila, Lokkhipur. Family alleged that police picked up him in the night.

data.name: Shaheen Mollah
data.description: Shaheen Mollah was allegedly tortured by police at Dasar Police Station, Kalkini, Madaripur. On June 8, 2014 at around 8. 30 pm SI Nazmul Hasan arrested Shaheen and his friends Mukit and Shah Alam from Naiarbari Bridge at Medakul of Gournadi. Shaheen's maternal aunt Selima Begum alleged that after taking those detainees into the police station he sent Nazrul Islam, source of police to their guardians. After receiving the news from the source those guardians went police station. There SI Nazmul demanded 75, 000 Taka to release those three people. At night Mukit and Shah Alam's family gave the money to the officer. However, Shaheen's family was unable to pay the amount. So, police had shown him arrested in a narcotic case and presented him infront of the court. Later he was sent to jail. Shaheen was tortured in the police custody. Later on June 14, 2014 he died at Madaripur Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Morol Islam
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in "gunfight" with police. The deceased is Morol Islam (45). According to Inamul Haque, Officer-in-Charge of Satkhira Sadar Police Station, on information that a gang of 16-17 robbers were preparing to rob a passenger bus in Chhoyghoria on the Satkhira-Jessore road, a police team went to the area around 3. 45 a. m. on June 14, 2014. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the robbers hurled bombs and opened fire on them, prompting police to retaliate, Haque added. Morol sustained bullets during the gunfight and fell on the ground while his cohorts managed to flee. Police took Morol to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.description: Abul Bashar, an alleged criminal and the chief of Bashar Bahini, was killed in a "gunfight" with the police at Jogikhal area of Begumgonj upazila in Noakhali on June 14, 2014. Police arrested Bashar on June 13, 2014, morning, said S M Ashrafuzzaman, Acting Superintendent of police in Noakhali. According to police, based on his information, police went to Jogikhal with him to recover arms. When they reached the spot, associates of Bashar opened fire on the police in an attempt to snatch away Bashar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, he said.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Jahirul Islam was detained by the members of BGB on June 14, 2014. At that time they had beaten him. BGB members then produced him in front of mobile Court. There he was sentenced to one year and eight months simple imprisonment. Later, he was sent to Jail in the afternoon. In the midnight he fell sick. The jail authority took him into hospital where doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Ferdous Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Ferdous Islam alias Litu was killed in a gunfight allegedly by police. Police said, he was arrested at around 7. 45 pm on June 27, 2014 from Thukra village, Raghunathpur union. Then in the midnight at around 1. 45 am on June 28, 2014 police took him outside to recover arms at Thukra Bazaar area. Later, his accomplice opened fire to rescue Ferdous. Police also retaliated. In this incident, Ferdous was killed. .

data.name: Md Rokonuzzaman
data.description: Police nabbed Rokonuzzaman (45), a real estate businessman, from his residence in the city's Bakalia around 1:20 am on June 19 in connection with a rape case filed with Panchlaish Police Station. On the way to the police station, Rokon fell ill and police rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, police sources said. Rokon's family alleged that he was beaten to death in police custody.

data.name: Ramzan Ali
data.description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a gunfight with DB police in Motijheel on June 29, 2014. In the words of the detectives, the criminals started firing at police and the law enforcers retaliated. Ramzan and Aqmal were killed by the criminals' gunfire during the shootout. However, sources at Dhaka Medical College morgue said the two had been shot in the head and chest from the front at close range, not from behind. They said the duo were shot 10 times and five of the bullets fired from two guns were still lodged in the bodies. Ramzan's wife Nusrat Jahan Jharna told The Daily Star at their Rayerbagh home that she suspected that her husband had been picked up the evening before and then murdered.

data.name: Rakib Hossain Aqmal
data.description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a gunfight with DB police in Motijheel on June 29, 2014. In the words of the detectives, the criminals started firing at police and the law enforcers retaliated. Ramzan and Aqmal were killed by the criminals' gunfire during the shootout. However, sources at Dhaka Medical College morgue said the two had been shot in the head and chest from the front at close range, not from behind. They said the duo were shot 10 times and five of the bullets fired from two guns were still lodged in the bodies. Ramzan's wife Nusrat Jahan Jharna told The Daily Star at their Rayerbagh home that she suspected that her husband had been picked up the evening before and then murdered.

data.name: Mowlana Ashraful Islam Morol
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Satkhira district Jamaat publicity secretary Mawlana Azizur Rahman said police caught Ashraful from his residence on May 7, 2014 and fired at him, leaving him dead at Bhodrokhali High school premises. However, Kaliganj Thana Officer-in-Charge Golam Rahman said'Jamaat leader Mawlana Ashraful Islam had fled and was living for a long time in India. Returning from India on May 6, 2014 he took part in a secret meeting at Bhodrokhali High school premises. Being tipped-off, police carried out a drive there. Some Jamaat activists exploded bombs targeting the police. In response, the police fired five rounds of bullets, leaving the Jamaat leader dead on the spot', said Rahman.'He had been accussed in many cases at Kaliganj Thana, including an attack on the Thana,' he added.

data.name: Mohammad Shahinur Alam
data.description: Victim family members alleged that Mohammad Shahinur Alam was tortured to death by Major Sakib Siddiqui, Head of Bhoirab RAB camp, Under RAB 14 Unit. On May 20, 2014, the younger brother of the deceased, Maulana Mehedi Hassan organised a press conference at the National Press Club and stated that on April 29, 2014 at noon his brother was arrested by member of RAB-14 from Boghdohor village under Nabinagar Upazila. In the night of that day, he was beaten on different parts of his body, in particular, on his heap, feet and elbow for more than two hours. On April 30, 2014 RAB forced Abu Taher, a resident of Nabinagar Pashchimpara, to file a case against his brother Shahinur Alam. Later his brother was sent to jail when he was produced before the court. His brother was first admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital and later on shifted to Comilla Medical College Hospital when he became ill. But on May 6 in the evening, his brother died in hospital while under treatment.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: Alleged robber Anwar, along another member of his gang, was killed in a "shootout" with police in the district's Ramu upazila on May 5, 2014. Saykul Ahmed Bhuiyan, OC of Ramu Police Station, said a team of patrol police took position in Toyangakata area around 2.30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery on Ramu-Marichya road. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering a "gunfight" between the law enforcers and the robbers, said the police official. During the gunfight Anwar and Khalil were hit by bullets. The others managed to escape. Police took the duo to Ramu Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Khalil Ahmed
data.description: Alleged robber Khalil, along with another member of his gang, was killed in a "shootout" with police in the district's Ramu upazila on May 5, 2014. Saykul Ahmed Bhuiyan, OC of Ramu Police Station, said a team of patrol police took position in Toyangakata area around 2. 30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery on Ramu-Marichya road. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering a "gunfight" between the law enforcers and the robbers, said the police official. During the gunfight Anwar and Khalil were hit by bullets. The others managed to escape. Police took the duo to Ramu Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.description: The family of the deceased claimed that police of Boalia Model Police Station tortured to death Ruhul Amin (22) in Rajshahi. Sirajul Islam, elder brother of the deceased Ruhul Amin, alleged that on May 16, 2014 at night some plain clothed policemen led by Sub Inspector Bajro Gopal of Boalia Police Station arrested Ruhul Amin with 250 grams of Ganja from Namobhodra area of Rajshahi city. Later police tortured to death Ruhul Amin in connection with a top drug peddler of Namobhodra area. Police claimed that Ruhul Amin committed suicide by hanging himself with tearing part of a blanket on ventilator in the toilet.

data.name: Ripon Sikdar
data.description: The police beat up and killed a tea vendor at Nabinagar of Savar on the outskirts of the capital Dhaka on May 21, 2014, the family alleged. The family alleged that a police patrol team, led by sub Inspector Anwar, had picked up Ripon from the Nabinagar bus stand and beaten him up, causing the death. Ripon's brother Mohammad Jewel told reporters at the Dhaka Medical College morgue on May 21, 2014 that Ripon was waiting for his wife, coming from Sayedabad in a bus, at the bus-stand about 10. 30 pm. After his wife had arrived, they started for their home in the Niribili Residential area. The police at this point stopped them and frisked Ripon. They also started beating him, the wife alleged. After a few minutes, the policemen took him in their van and asked his wife to arrange money for his release. As his wife Sathi was trying to arrange money from her family, the victim made called his friend Raja and sought his help. The mobile had been switched off since then. Ripon's friend Kabir later called the family about midnight and asked them to visit the hospital. Later, Jewel found the body of his brother in the hospital.

data.name: Abdul Gaffar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: On May 27, 2014 Abdul Gaffar alias Tushar was allegedly killed in a gunfigh with policet at Tengra, Tala upazila, Satkhira.

data.name: Abu Taher
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" between police and drug peddlers in Jessore Sadar upazila on May 30, 2014. The dead, Abu Taher (40) was son of late Sona Ullah of Jhumjhumpur of the upazila, said Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-charge (investigation) of Kotwali Police Station. Taher was running drug business in Jhumjhumpur area, the police official said. Police said they conducted a drive at Moilakhana of Jhumjhumpur around 3. 30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang started firing and throwing crude bombs at police. Police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle,'' said Rafiqul. Taher recieved bullets during the "gunfight" and others managed to flee the scene. Taher was rushed to Jessore Medical College Hospital where he died later.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Abdul Hamid alias Hamej was killed in a gunfight with police at Ishwardi, Pabna. Abdul Hamid was the Second in Command of Sarbahara party.

data.name: Shahadat Hossain Jasu
data.description: According to RAB, RAB went in an operation at ward no. 6, Chorbalua village, Urirchar, Chorelahi union, Companiganj, Noakhali. Sensing the presence of RAB opened fire in retaliation. In this gunfight Shahadat Hossain Jasu was killed.

data.name: Mohammad Jabed
data.description: Mohammad Jabed and Mohammad Sumon, accomplice of Shahadat Hossain Jasu were killed by RAB in gunfight on April 5, 2014. Major Shahed Hasan, deputy director of RAB-11, said a Rab team surrounded Urirchor forest around 4. 30 am, acting on information that a gang of robbers was hiding in the forest. The robbers started firing at the Rab men who also fired back.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: Mohammad Jabed and Mohammad Sumon, accomplice of Shahadat Hossain Jasu were killed by RAB in gunfight on April 5, 2014. Major Shahed Hasan, deputy director of RAB-11, said a Rab team surrounded Urirchor forest around 4. 30 am, acting on information that a gang of robbers was hiding in the forest. The robbers started firing at the Rab men who also fired back.

data.name: Badsha Mia
data.description: Badsha Mia was shot to death by police allged by his wife Rubina. On the other hand, police claimed that Badsha was killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Abul Kalam Azad was detained by Sub Inspector Mizan in plainclothes with other police of Kotchandpur at around 11 am on April 18, 2014 from his own house at Kotchandpur, Jhinaidah. After that, police denied about the detention. As a result panic spread in the area. Later, a negotiation was going on to release Abul Kalam Azad between the family and police. Abul Kalam's wife Hasina Begum alleged that, after the detention of Abul Kalam Azad he was brought to Gurpara police camp and tortured there. Later, after hearing his screaming local people went there and police charged batons on them to disperse the crowd. Later, he was moved to another place in a white microbus numbered Dhaka-metro-ga-11-2231. Later, SI Abul Kalam negotiated the money with the family to release him. As she failed to give the amount police shot him dead . His bullet wounded dead body found in Mamunshira village, Bokultola on April 21, 2014.

data.name: Foridul Alam
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with the law enforcers at Ramu-Naikhongchhari Road in Ramu upazila of Cox's Bazaar by police on April 22, 2014. A gang of robbers fired shots at a police team around 9. 30 pm, leaving Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Milton Dey bullet-hit, said Appela Raju Naha, OC of Ramu Police Station. Police fired back and Foridul Alam was killed on the spot

data.name: Saiful Islam Shikari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Saiful Islam Shikari was detained by police from Shonkorpasha village, Abhoynagar upazila, Jessore on April 22, 2014. Police claimed that after detaining him, they went for an operation along with Saiful but there his accomplices opened fire targeting police. Later, police in retaliation opened fire. In this gunfight, Saiful Islam was killed. .

data.name: Nurul Amin Majhi
data.description: Alleged muggers Nurul Amin Majhi, Zahir Ahmed and Kalu Majhi were killed in a'gunfight' with Coast Guard members in Teknaf on April 25, 2014. Lt Shahid Al Ahsan, Coast Guard commander of St Martin's Island Station, claimed that a gunfight began when patrol team challenged a trawler carrying'smugglers' on the Naf river. At one stage, the trawler fled into Myanmar, he said, claiming that the'gang' had been trying to smuggle contraband yaba from Myanmar. On April 25, 2014 evening, police recovered three bullet-riddled bodies of the alleged gang members raiding reportedly the same trawler anchored at the Bakkhali river in Cox's Bazar.

data.description: Alleged muggers Nurul Amin Majhi, Zahir Ahmed and Kalu Majhi were killed in a'gunfight' with Coast Guard members in Teknaf on April 25, 2014. data.description: Alleged yaba traders Mohammad Jahid Hossain Jakku and Mohammad Foridul Alam were killed in a gunfight at a checkpost while they were given signal to stop the car but they opened fire instead. Later, BGB-RAB opened fire in retaliation, killing both.

data.name: Aminur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Aminur Rahman was shot dead by police on April 27, 2014. Secretary General Atikur Rahman of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami alleged that in a monthly reporting meeting police had suddenly attacked and opened fire. There Secretary of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami of Satkhira Aminur Rahman was shot dead and seven others were injured.

data.name: AL Kamal
data.description: A college student was shot dead as the police opened fire to disperse agitated people in Atapara-Chandali intersection in Sirajganj municipal area on April 27, 2014 at evening. Locals of Atapara and Chandali have been locked in series of clashes over gambling for the last one week. The fresh clash erupted on April 27, 2014. Soon the clash broke out, two teams of police led by officer-in charge Habibul Islam and sub-Inspector Ashfaqul Islam went to the area and opened fire to disperse the people where AL Kamal died.

data.name: Sirajul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Sirajul Islam was killed in a gunfight with police at Debhata upazila, Satkhira. OC Jalaluddin of Debhata Police Station stated in the newspaper that, activists and leaders of Jamaat-e-Islami was conducting a secret meeting to plan for a sabotage at Keuratola, Debhata . After recieving such news police went there. A gunfight ensuded there where Sirajul Islam died.

data.name: Dholu
data.description: The Lieutenant Colonel Foridul Alam of RAB-08 stated that, on April 29, 2014 members of RAB saw a boat in the channel of Poshur river and gave signal to stop them. But, a group present in the boat opened fire insted of stopping the boat. RAB also opened fire in retaliation. In this incident, Dholu and Bacchu were killed.

data.name: Bacchu
data.description: The Lieutenant Colonel Foridul Alam of RAB-08 stated that, on April 29, 2014 members of RAB saw a boat in the channel of Poshur river and gave signal to stop them. But, a group present in the boat opened fire insted of stopping the boat. RAB also opened fire in retaliation. In this incident, Dholu and Bacchu were killed.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged dacoit was killed in a gunfight at Daudkandi upazila, Comilla at Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Hasanpur, Daudkandi, Comilla. OC Salam stated in the media that, a group of dacoits attacked a car for dacoity. The owner of the car tried to escape from the place to go in a safe place. Dacoit opened fire. While police tried to obstruct the dacoit. Then a gunfight ensued where the dacoit was killed.

data.name: Rajib Biswas
data.description: Rajib Biswas alias Raju was accused of stealing a police weapon and arrested on March 1, 2014. He was later killed in a'shootout' of the police at Shalikha in Magura on March 2, 2014.

data.name: Shah Alam Mullah
data.description: On March 2nd staff reporter Shah Alam Mullah of Weekly Aparadh Daman was killed in the custody of West Police Station of Uttara. Shah Alam’s wife alleged that her husband was tortured to death in police custody.

data.name: Mohammad Wasim
data.description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Wasim and Sangram Chowdhury were killed in a gunfight while RAB went to a house at Kadomtoli to rescue four kidnapped persons. Where they opened fire targeting the RAB and RAB also retaliated while the two killed in the gunfight. On the other hand, Wasim's wife Sonia Akhter alleged that members of RAB entered the house and broke the door of the bathroom and shot dead him. Sangram tried to escape by rolling down from the pipe of the building while RAB shot dead him. Mohammad Wasim was a contractor of taking toll of Postogola Bridge while Sangram was an assistant of Wasim.

data.name: Sangram Chowdhury
data.description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Wasim and Sangram Chowdhury were killed in a gunfight while RAB went to a house at Kadomtoli to rescue four kidnapped persons. Where they opened fire targeting the RAB and RAB also retaliated while the two killed in the gunfight. On the other hand, Wasim's wife Sonia Akhter alleged that members of RAB entered the house and broke the door of the bathroom and shot dead him. Sangram tried to escape by rolling down from the pipe of the building while RAB shot dead him. Mohammad Wasim was a contractor of taking toll of Postogola Bridge while Sangram was an assistant of Wasim.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Sub-Inspector Rofiqul Islam with other police members went to Ramchandrapur, Dhaka-Aricha highway of Savar after getting information that a preparation is going on for dacoity on March 3, 2014. After reaching there the alleged dacoits hurled cocktail targeting the vehicle of police. Police chased the dacoits. Then police charged batons. The rest members of the dacoit group opened fire to police then police retaliated with fire. At that time, the dacoit got bullet wounded and died.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: Abul Kashem was killed in a gunfight with police at Damurhuda, Chuadanga. Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Police Station Ahsan Habib stated that Abul Kashem was an accused of an abduction case of Akbar Ali. OC also stated that there was also allegation of extortion and bombing against Abul Kashem. On T5 March police conducted a raid at Kanai Babu's Mango orchard (Ambagan) where sensing the presence of police miscreants hurled bombs targeting police. In self defense police opened five shot of bullet while the group also retaliated. Later police found a bullet wounded dead body identified as Abul Kashem. On the other hand, Robiul Islam, elder brother of the victim alleged that on March 4, 2014 police detained Abul Kashem from his in laws house Mathpara, Kuralgachi village at around 9. 30 pm and shot dead Kashem later.

data.name: Ripon Majhi
data.description: Police had fired gunshots to stop a group of miscreants snatching ballot boxes from the polling centre set up at the Bhumkhara Government Primary School. The police, however, brushed aside Ripon being killed in police shooting

data.name: Abdul Kader
data.description: Three piracy suspects were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Tambulbunia under Sharankhola range of the Sundarban in Bagerhat on March 6, 2014. Two of the deceased were identified as Abdul Kader and Kalyan while the identity of thethird person could not be established. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Major Anowarul Kabir said that the three belonged to Shirsha Bahini, a gang of pirates, of the Sundarban. Anowarul claimed that acting on a tip-off, a battalion team raided hide-out of the pirates at Tambulbunia, where they were planning criminal operation. Sensing presence of battalion personnel, the pirates opened fire at them and the battalion personnel also retaliated triggering the gunfight at about 9. 30 am.

data.name: Nur Mohammad
data.description: Nur Mohammad (45) of Paschim Leda village under Lilla union was killed in a "gunfight" with the members of Rapid Action battalion in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazaar on March 20, 2014. On information that a contingent of yaba was coming from Myanmar, a team of Rab went to Jaillayadiya shrimp enclosure area around 4. 00 pm. Sensing Rab presence, the smugglers fired on the law enforcers prompting them to fire back. After the gunfight, Rab men rescued bullet-hit Nur Mohammad and recovered a long-barrel gun, two bullets, a pistol and 3, 000 yaba tablets from the spot. Upon receiving information, police rushed there and took Nur Mohammad to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where, the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Lucky
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Lucky, wife of Abdul Mannan, a rebel chairman candidate of BNP in Gazaria upazila, suffered bullet wounds when army personnel deployed to the polling centre opened fire on Mannan's supporters Lucky was hit by bullets as she got in the line of fire, Mannan said. She was taken to Apollo Hospitals in Dhaka where she died on March 27, 2014.

data.name: Selim Patwari
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: On 23.3.14, the fourth phase of upazila election was held. During election, supporters of AL backed candidate trying to snatch ballot boxes from the poll centre. Police fired 36 round bullets to bring the situation under control. In this incident Selim Patwari, Vice-President of 9 no. ward youth wing of AL unit was bullet wounded. On 28. 3. 14 he died at hospital

data.name: Hadis Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Hadis Mia, a local leader of youth wing of BNP was killed when BGB opened fire to disperse feuding supporters of BNP and AL in Akhaura over capture of polling station. The clashes broke out when AL men tried to capture Taragan primary school centre

data.name: Mohosin Mia
data.description: Mohosin Mia tortured to death in the room of the Officer in Charge of Shibpur Model Police Station. The family alleged that police demanded Taka 50, 000 from them to free Mohosin. As they could not pay the money police tortured Mohosin to death on February 3, 2014.

data.name: Jony
data.description: Police arrested Jony following a clash in the Bihari Camp area between two groups of Non-Bengali people on February 9, 2014. The victim's relatives alleged that the police had tortured him after arrest. Jony, a driver, was among five persons who were arrested by Pallabi police after a clash between two groups of Irani Camp and Rahmat Camp.

data.name: Faruk Ahmed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: He was killed in'gunfight' with RAB at Chawak Bazar in the Barisal city on February 10, 2014. The Battalion claimed that they found dead the ruling party leader, Faruk Ahmed alias Panama Faruk, after the gunfight. However, human rights defender Shaheen Aziz stated according to the allegation of the victim family that Faruk was returned from Dhaka and at Barisal Lonch terminal in front of Ebadullah mosque police shot dead Faruk.

data.name: Mohammad Rubel
data.description: A gunfight was ensued on February 4, 2014 between police and pirates in the Mehgna River. Later, on February 12, 2014 the bullet wounded dead body of Rubel was recovered from the Mehgna River.

data.name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police claimed that Jasim was bullet wounded in a gunfight and died at Chittagong Medical College Hospital. Meanwhile, acting Amir of Chittagong South District Jamaat-e-Islami claimed that police shot him dead . . NTV news reporter Babor said that Jasim was shot dead by police while he was crossing the road beside keuchiya Union Sodakeuchi School.

data.name: Ekramullah Babu
data.description: Officer in Charge of Satkhira Sadar Police Station described that on February 11, 2014 a car of Sanjana Jerin, wife of Colonel Omor Faruk was snatched from Kochukhet, Dhaka. Police tracked the car which was driven to Satkhira. At around 2. 00 am on February 12, 2014 police gave signal to stop the car at Chaltetola area. At that moment, they opened fire targeting police while police retaliated. In this incident, However, local human rights defender said that police arrested Ekramullah after snatching the car and later shot him dead

data.name: Mezbaur Rahman Mezbah
data.description: Mezbaur Rahman Mezbah was the prime accused of the murder case of Choitonno Kumar Mondol alias Modhu (48), a leader of Awami League. He was killed in a gunfight with RAB-6 at Chapatola, Jessore on February 14, 2014.

data.name: Salahuddin
data.description: Two people were killed in a'gunfight' with the police in the capital's Jatrabari area on February 15, 2014. The deceased were identified as Salahuddin (28) and Jewel (30). The police claimed that the deceased were robbers and they wounded in gunfight with police. They were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital, but they succumbed to their injuries on the way. The police said that they had chased three accused persons including Salahuddin and Jewel at Kajla around 4. 00 pm. Salahuddin and Jewel were detained in that drive, however, their associates managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their associate managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their illegal firearms around 5. 00 pm. As the police reached the area, some other associates of Salahuddin and Jewel opened fire on them.

data.name: Mohammad Jewel
data.description: Two people were killed in a'gunfight' with the police in the capital's Jatrabari area on February 15, 2014. The deceased were identified as Salahuddin (28) and Jewel (30). The police claimed that the deceased were robbers and they wounded in gunfight with police. They were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital, but they succumbed to their injuries on the way. The police said that they had chased three accused persons including Salahuddin and Jewel at Kajla around 4. 00 pm. Salahuddin and Jewel were detained in that drive, however, their associates managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their associate managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their illegal firearms around 5. 00 pm. As the police reached the area, some other associates of Salahuddin and Jewel opened fire on them.

data.name: Siraj Shikdar
data.description: The leader of Siraj Bahini (group) Siraj Shikdar was killed in a gunfight with police at Koromjal, Mongla. On February 14, 2014 at around 4. 00 am police arrested Siraj from Tujulpur village. Later on 3. 00 pm police went to Koromjol to rescue arms according to the information gathered from Siraj. However, a gunfight was ensued there as the associates of Siraj opened fire to police and police also retaliated. Later the bullet-hit Siraj died in the gunfight.

data.name: Kala Rajab
data.description: Police arrested Rajab from a place in Jhikargacha upazila around 11. 15 pm on February 15, 2014. The OC of Jhikargacha said during preliminary interrogation, Rajab divulged details about his arms den. On information extracted from Rajab, a police team took him to his village home in Keshabpur to recover firearms around 1. 45 am. When the law enforcers arrived near a bamboo cluster of the village, Rajab's associates fired at them. A gunfight ensued when the policemen fired back. At one stage, Rajab tried to flee the clutches of the law and came in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. Police rushed him to Keshabpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Babul
data.description: Police raided a rubber garden in Kulaura upazila around 2:00 am following a tip-off that a gang led by Babul was taking preparations to commit a robbery there. The associates of Babul sprayed bullets on the law enforcers when they approached the garden. In retaliation, police fired back, triggering a "gunfight", said Alamgir Hossain, assistant superintendent of police (ASP) of Moulvibazar. Police found Babul's body lying in a pool of blood. Meanwhile, family members of Babul alleged that law enforcers had picked them up and shot them dead.

data.name: Kiran Bepari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A member of Purba Banglar Sarbahara Party was killed in a'gunfight' with police at village Bagmara under Shibchar in Madaripur on February 19, 2014. The deceased was identified as Kiran Bepari (29). Police arrested him on February 19, 2014. Later, at around 1. 15 am police along with KIran started another drive at village Baghmara to recover arms. Sensing presence of law enforcers, associates of Kiran started fire on them triggering a gunfight that critically injured Kiran. Later Kiron was taken to Shibchar upazila where doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Ashraf Hossain
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Shyamnagar upazila, Satkhira on February 23, 2014. Police carried out an operation in the area, adjacent to the Sundarbans, around 12. 30 am following information that Ashraf was holding a meeting with his associates there. When the law enforcers reached there on a speedboat around 4. 00 am, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back. After a 15-minute gunfight, police recovered Ashraf's bullet-hit body but his associates managed to escape by a trawler.

data.name: Raquibul Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Condemned militant Raquibul Hasan alias Hafiz Mahmud, who was recaptured six hours after he, along with two other convicted militants of Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, was snacthed away ambushing a prison van, was killed in an alleged'gunfight' with police in Tangail on February 24, 2014.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Saddam Hossain was killed as police opened fire to quell a fighting between the activists of Awami League and BNP-Jamaat after AL men had allegedly captured Nandia Degree College polling station.

data.name: Sarder Niamat Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: 15 people including two BGB members and chairman candidate, were injured in a clash with supporters of a chairman candidate backed by the AL on February 27, 2014. On 18. 3. 14 critically injured by BGB, AL backed chairman candidate Sarder Niamat Hossain, 56 was died at DMCH. He was beaten by BGB. Ref: Ittefaq 19. 3. 14

data.name: Faruk Patwary
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Faruk Patwary, an activist of the youth wing of BNP, was shot dead in a clash between blockaders and BGB personnel in Chandpur on January 1, 2014.

data.name: Jamshed Alam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Juba Dal leader Jamshed Alam was killed in police firing when opposition activists attacked Uttar Char Chandia primary school centre in Sonagazi of Feni around 10:30am on January 5, 2014. Chhatra Dal leader Shahidullah, who suffered injuries in the same incident, died at hospital, said Sonagazi police chief Subhash Chandra Pal.

data.description: Joynal, 30, and Harun, 40, of village Khagrabari were killed in police firing when opposition men attacked polling stations at Basudevpur Government Primary School polling centre around noon on January 5, 2014.

data.name: Harun

data.description: Masud Raihan, an activist of Jatiya Ganatantrik Party, died in local hospital after being hit by a bullet in a clash with the police when opposition activists attacked Manmathpur Cooperative High School centre around 12:30pm on January 5, 2014.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In Chittagong, Shibir activist Enamul Haque, 26, of Adur Para in Lohagara, was killed when police opened fire on Jamaat men after they tried to snatch ballot boxes from Bhabanipur polling centre at about 3:30pm on January 5, 2014.

data.name: Babul Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: BNP activist Babul Hossain died in Rajshahi Medical College Hospital after being hit by a bullet at Ramnagar under Manda in Naogaon around 11:00am. Manda police officer-in-charge Abdullahel Baqui said joint forces were forced to open fire after the opposition men attacked them with bows and arrows.

data.name: Mohammad Rubel

data.description: In Laksmipur, Shibir activist Mohammad Rubel was killed as police opened fire on opposition activists at Machhimpur High School centre in Ramganj upazila. Ramganj police officer-in-charge Rezaul Karim confirmed the death of Rubel.

data.name: Matiar Rahman

data.description: Jamaat activist Matiar Rahman was shot dead as joint forces opened fire to disperse attackers at Bajitpur centre in Monirampur of Jessore and 30 more, including three presiding officers, sustained injuries in widespread violence in Monirampur that forced the Election Commission to suspend polling at 47 centres.

data.name: Md Ismail Rajib
data.description: A day after the killing of a cop, Md Ismail Rajib and another accused in the case were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

data.name: Md Nasir Uddin
data.description: A day after the killing of a cop, Md Nasir Uddin and another accused in the case were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

data.name: Anwarul Islam

data.description: Anwarul Islam, a Jamaat activist, was killed and five cops were injured in a gunfight between Jamaat-Shibir men and the joint force at Ghonapara of Debhata upazila on January 14, 2014.

data.name: Choton
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Choton was shot dead in a operation of a joint force on January 18, 2014.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

data.name: Mossharof Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police found a bullet wounded dead body of Mossharof Hossain on January 19, 2014 from Baroiyardhala, Terial, Sitakunda. Family alleged that on January 17, 2014 he went to visit his sister's house at Mothbariya, Mithachora, Mirshorai. On January 18, a group of 10-12 plainclothes people addressed themselves as RAB picked up him from the house. The family attempted to arrange a press conference after finding no trace of him at RAB office on January 20 while they got the information that police found the bullet wounded dead body of Mossahrof at about 12 noon on the same day. The general secretary of student wing of Jamaat in Chattogram Robiul Hossain also alleged that Rab picked up Mossharof and killed him.

data.name: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam, Assistant Secretary General of Meherpur unit of Jamaat-e-Islami, who was in police custody, was killed during a "gunfight" between Jamaat-Shibir men and law enforcers on January 20, 2014.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman Shohag
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A Shibir activist, who sustained bullet wounds during January 19, 2014 clash with joint froces in Gaibandha, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital in Bogra on January 21, 2014. The activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing ambushed a police team while the law enforcers were raiding Kadamtala and Khanabari villagers, known to be Jamaat-Shibir strongholds, in Sundarganj to arrest the people wanted in the cases filed in connection with the February 2013 violence in the district. On information, members of the joint forces rushed to the areas to rescue the police team. The Jamaat men also attacked the joint forces, forcing the law enforcers to fire teargas shells and rubber bullets to disperse the unruly activists.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

data.name: Shohidar Rahman
data.description: Shohidar Rahman was beaten to death by a member of BGB. On January 17, 2014 Shohidar went to attend an invitation to a relative's house. On his way, a BGB member Lance Nayek Jalal of detective branch stopped him and altercating with Shahidar that he was carrying Gaza (drugs) with him. At one stage, Jalal started to beat him. As a result Shohidar lost consciousness and Jalal escaped from there. He was admitted Rangpur Medical College Hospital and died there. Naodanga Union Parishad Chairman Musabber Ali Musa alleged that Shohidar was beaten by the BGB member.

data.name: Didarul Alam Didar
data.description: An'ring leader of criminals' was killed allegedly in a gun battle with RAB at Kamarhat in Sadar upazila of Laxmipur district on January 23, 2014. Didar's wife Momtaz Begum said, RAB picked up her husband at night and the body was found on January 23, 2014. However RAB claimed it as a "gunfight".

data.name: Golam Rabbani
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On December 15, 2013 at least 18 people in RAB uniforms raided a house at Panchagarh where Golam Rabban was staying and picked him, according to his family. Later on January 18, 2014 he was found dead in a bush beside Nilphamari Domar road on January 18, 2014. He was accused of attacking motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

data.name: Atikur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The body of Tupamari union Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal joint secretary Atikur Rahman, 26, was recovered from Dhola Gachha Nariya Khamba area of Saidpur bypass road on January 20, 2014. On January 14 night, at least six people, who introduced them as the members of the Detective Branch of police, stormed into the house and picked up Atikur from Tangail, family alleged. Later he was found dead. He was accused of attacking motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: Sumon was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Pallabi in the capital Dhaka on January 25, 2014 night. Sumon was an accused in a number of murder and arms cases, was also an associate of the slain Dakat Shahid.

data.name: Enamul Haque Biswas
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: During "gunfights" between joint forces and Jamaat-Shibir men in Jhenidah and Satkhira on January 26, 2014 two Jamaat leaders and an Islami Chhatra Shibir activists were killed and six policemen were reportedly injured. During the 20-minute "gunfight" with the joint forces, Enamul, a teacher of Balarampur High School and also an activist of Jamaat, was hit. He died on the spot in Jhenaidah.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

When the joint forces entered Narkeli village Jamaat-Shibir men surrounded the law enforcers, the OC claimed. Then in the gunfight two of them were killed.

Touhidul was killed in a shootout between his group and police on January 28, 2014 at village Satiani under Phultala upazila of the district.

data.name: Rabiul Islam
data.description: An alleged gangster – was killed in ‘encounters’ with law enforcers in Jessore on January 28, 2014. . Rabiul Islam, a suspect in the murder of Awami League leader Chaitanya Kumar Mandal murder, had sustained bullet wounds in a shootout between the members of joint forces and his gang in a bamboo cluster at Ziadanga village early Tuesday. He was declared dead after being taken to the upazila health complex.

data.name: Javed Hossain
data.description: Javed Hossain, an alleged mugger, who received bullet wounds in police firing at Pallabi in Dhaka, died at National Institution of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation on January 29, 2014.

data.name: Bablu Molla
data.description: Bablu Miah was an accused in a murder case of Awami League leader named Saiful Islam. Rab carried out an operation after getting information that a planning for sabotage was going to be happened by a group of miscreants near Jamuna River. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement agencies the miscreants opened fire. Rab also retaliated. In this incident Bablu Miah was killed.

data.name: Towhid

data.description: RAB arrested Towhid from High Court area and handed over him to Paltan Police Station on January 28, 2014. Sonaimuri police brought him from there and took him to his village home at Vodrogaon. Police resued local arms from there. Later when police returned with Towhid, Towhid's accomplices threw brick bats and opened fire. He was killed on the spot.

data.name: Ripon Islam
data.description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a'shootout' with the police at Baldipukur in Mithapukur upazila on Dhaka-Rangpur highway on January 31, 2014. Of the three deceased, Ripon Islam alias Ripon (35) and Jahangir Hossain Anwar (35) died on the spot while the third, Ahmed Ali (35) died at Rangpur Medical College and Hospital at about 1:30 pm, the police and hospital sources said. Police said the three were member of an inter-district gang of robbers.

data.description: A joint force arrested Ranga from Haridhali area under Paikgacha and as per his confession the team took him to Kumkhali area to recover illegal arms and ammunitions and to arrest his cohorts.
