Ranga became seriously injured and taken to Paikgacha Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctor declared him dead.
data.agency: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), Police, Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB)

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Howanok Bazaar, Moheshkhali, Cox Bazar on January 13, 2015 at around 7:30pm. When the law enforcers reached there, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back. Police recovered Abdur Rashid''s bullet-hit body.

data.name: Motiur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A RAB team took Motiur to a mango orchard in Kansat for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 3:00am, on January 16, 2015. Then Motiur's accomplices started firing indiscriminately and throwing homemade bombs at the RAB team forcing the RAB men to retaliate and sparking a 20-minutes gunfight. Motiur sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died on the spot. He was arrested on January 15, 2015.

data.name: Mohan Bepari Molla
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On January 16, 2015 Sechchasebak Dal leader, Mohan Bepari Molla died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital during treatment, under the supervision of the jail authority. The brother-in-law of the deceased, Mohammad Alamin claimed that on January 12, 2015 police of Shah Ali Police Station arrested Mohan under a criminal case and beat him in the police van. Mohan was tortured the whole night in the police station. After he was produced before the court, the court sent him to jail. However, his physical condition did not improve and he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by the jail authorities on January 16, where he died.

data.name: Nuruzzaman Jhony
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Yakub Ali, father of Nuruzzaman told that on January 19, 2015 at around 1:00pm Nuruzzaman along with his friend Moin and 3/4 others went to Dhaka Central Jail to meet with his younger brother Hira. On the way back a white private car stopped in front of them. 2/3 men came out of the car and identified themselves as DB police. Then they arrested Nuruzzaman and Moin. Since then, he was missing. Later on, family found the body at Dhaka Medical College Morgue. DB deputy commissioner Krishnapada Roy said that police detained him from Nazimuddin Road on January 19, 2015 at afternoon and took him to Jorapukur field of Tilpapara to arrest the other gangsters on January 20. 1. 15. After that, he admitted his involvement in the attack on police van. A shoot out took place in the area and Nuruzzaman was caught in the line of fire. Later police recovered the bullet riddled body of Nuruzzaman.

data.name: Solaiman Uddin Jisan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Anamul Haque, Sub-Inspector of Daudkandi polce station said, on January 23, 2015 at around 1:45am, a patrol team of RAB- 11 signaled Jisan to stop at Jigatola on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway when he was returning to Laxmipur from Dhaka by motorcycle. As he did not stop, another team of the RAB tried to intercept Jisan. He then fired two shots at RAB. The RAB men were compelled to fire back. Jisan was hit by bullets and died on the spot around 4:00am.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: Lt. Colonel Khandakar Golam Sarowar, Director of RAB- 3 told that on January 25, 2015 at around 2:30am a team of RAB- 3 was patrolling in Banashri area. RAB signaled a car to stop. Then the car stopped and suddenly, a man from the car fired at the RAB and ran away. Another man of the car followed the previous one. Then RAB chased them and fired at them. The men, later identifed as Solaiman Uddin Jisan and Abul Kalam Azad, was found with bullet injury and RAB brought them to DMCH. The duty doctor declared them dead.

data.name: Md. Sultan
data.description: Lt. Colonel Khandakar Golam Sarowar, Director of RAB- 3 told that on January 25, 2015 at around 2:30am a team of RAB- 3 was patrolling in Banashri area. RAB signaled a car to stop. Then the car stopped and suddenly, a man from the car fired at the RAB and ran away. Another man of the car followed the previous one. Then RAB chased them and fired at them. The men, later identifed as Solaiman Uddin Jisan and Abul Kalam Azad, was found with bullet injury and RAB brought them to DMCH. The duty doctor declared them dead.

data.name: Mahbubur Rahman Mahbub
data.description: Police said, acting on a tip-off, a police team raided Bagaritala around 3:00am after Mahbub along with his aides had blocked Jessore-Monirampur road with logs to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. Police also fired back, triggering a gunfight, Mahbub was hit by bullets and died on the spot.

data.name: Rafikul Islam
data.description: A police team arrested Rafikul Islam on January 27, 2015 at afternoon and police took Rafikul for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 3:00am, on January 28, 2015. Then Rafikul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team forcing the police men to retaliate and sparking a 20-minutes gunfight. Rafikul sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died at Satkhira Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Nurul Islam Shahin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A police team arrested Nurul Islam on January 27, 2015 at around 9:00pm and police took Nurul for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 2:00am, on January 28, 2015. Then Nurul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team forcing the police men to retaliate. Nurul Islam sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died.

data.name: Mainuddun Bhuiyan
data.description: Family of Mainuddin alleged that Mainuddin was beaten to death by RAB. He was beaten when RAB arrested him. There was a mark of injury on the left side of Mainuddin's head. But RAB said that on January 29, 2015 at around 10:00pm, RAB arrested Mainuddin and Jakir from a tin shed house at Mogbazar while they were taking yaba. However RAB said that, after arrest, Mainuddin had a heart attack and became senseless. Then RAB took him to a private clinic and the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Ariful Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On January 29, 2015 at evening Ariful Islam was detained by a group of people identified themselves as members of DB from Kornofuli-4 steamer headed to'Chorfashion'. Later police claimed that they found a dead body on that day at around 11. 15 pm.

data.name: Emdad Ullah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An opposition activist was allegedly killed in an ‘encounter’, with a team of the Mirpur police station, in the capital’s Rupnagor area on February 2, 2015. The victim, Emdad Ullah, 18, of Jamalpur, was first year honours student of Dhaka College and a ward unit president of Islami Chattra Shibir. The Mirpur police station officer-in-charge Salauddin Khan said miscreants hurled petrol bombs and used fire arms when a police team, along with the arrested man, went to Ena Properties to arrest more miscreants. The youth was shot dead from shots fired by the miscreants, police said. The student political organisation, however, alleged policemen picked up the victim in front of his house at Section-6 in Mirpur, at about 7:00pm on January 31, 2015.

data.name: Saidur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police alleged that, on February 1, 2015 at noon miscreants attacked by bomb in a CNG run three wheeler. In this incident they arrested Mohammad Ali. According to Mohammad Ali’s statement police went to Bakua village for an operation to arrest other miscreants. After reaching the place miscreants threw petrol bomb targeting the police. Police fired back while Saidur got injured. On the other hand, Moulana Shahinur Alam, Amir of Sirajganj District Jamaat-e-Islami denied the statement of police. He claimed that, Saidur was picked up by the police from a ceremony of death ritual (Kulkhani) and shot him in his leg in the road. He was injured and later on February 2, 2015 at midnight he died at Trauma Center of Sadar Hospital.

data.name: M Yusuf
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Two activists of youth wing of BNP were knocked down and killed by a truck as they were trying to throw petrol bombs at the vehicle in Jessore on February 3, 2015, the police said. The victims were identified as M Yusuf of Taherpur and Mohammad Liton of Durgapur under Monirampur upazila. Their families and associates, however, cliamed that the two were found dead on February 3, 2015 at morning after being picked up by the police on February 2, 2015 at night. Monirampur upazila unit BNP president Shahid Iqbal alleged that the police had killed them and staged the drama of a road accident.

data.name: Mohammad Liton
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Two activists of youth wing of BNP were knocked down and killed by a truck as they were allegedly trying to throw petrol bombs at the vehicle in Jessore on February 3, 2015, the police said. The victims were identified as M Yusuf of Taherpur and Mohammad Liton of Durgapur under Monirampur upazila. Their families and associates, however, cliamed that the two were found dead on February 3, 2015 at morning after being picked up by the police on February 2, 2015 at night. Monirampur upazila unit BNP president Shahid Iqbal alleged that the police had killed them and staged the drama of a road accident.

data.name: Shakhawat Hossain
data.description: Shakhawat Hossain, along with Mujahidul Islam, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the capital's Jatrabari early on February 4, 2015. Commanding Officer Zamil Ahmad of Rapid Action Battalion-10 said a team of RAB-10 was patrolling in Matuail area of Jatrabari around 2:15am. All of a sudden, brick chunks were hurled at the RAB vehicle. Several crude bombs went off on the road and gun shots were fired at the team, forcing the law enforcers to open fire on the thugs. Failing to hold out against the RAB members, the criminals left the scene a little later. An additional force then joined the RAB team and launched a search in the area. They found the bodietwo bullet-hit people lying in a pool of blood there, mentioned Zamil Ahmad. He added: Law enforcers later sent the two injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mujahidul Islam
data.description: Mujahidul Islam was killed, along with Shakhawat Hossain, in a "gunfight" with RAB in the capital's Jatrabari early on February 4, 2015. Commanding Officer Zamil Ahmad of Rapid Action Battalion-10 said a team of RAB-10 was patrolling in Matuail area of Jatrabari around 2:15am. All of a sudden, brick chunks were hurled at the RAB vehicle. Several crude bombs went off on the road and gun shots were fired at the team, forcing the law enforcers to open fire on the thugs. Failing to hold out against the RAB members, the criminals left the scene a little later. An additional force then joined the RAB team and launched a search in the area. They found the bodietwo bullet-hit people lying in a pool of blood there, mentioned Zamil Ahmad. He added: Law enforcers later sent the two injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Monir Hossain
data.description: Police alleged that a youth on February 5, 2015 at around 3. 15 am threw two petrol bombs targeting police in front of LDCL at Senpara Porbota, Rokeya Soroni. Then police fired back and found a bullet hit dead body.

data.name: Shahbuddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police went to conduct an operation to Shomsadipur area. At that time, activists of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami hurled hand made bombs at the Police's vehicle. Police fired back and Shahbuddin bullet wounds. Later, he was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he died

data.name: Shahab Uddin Patwary
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: On February 6, 2015 police patrolling in the Dhaka-Chittagong highway while at Shamuksha area a group of miscreants hurled petrol bombs to create disruption. Police fired back while Shahab got bullet wounds. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctor declared him dead. However, victim’s brother alleged that his brother was picked up by plainclothes police from his house at Chandishkora, Chouddogram, Comilla on February 5, 2015,

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Shahidul was killed in a gunfight and Abdul Majid, another one was left injured allegedly by police February 6, 2015. Jessore Additional Superintendent of Police KM Ariful Haque said a ‘gunfight’ took place in front of Khanika Picnic Spot of sadar upazila around 1:45am. Police challenged a gang of miscreants who were heading towards Jessore in a microbus. They started firing while police also retaliated. The gunfight left one bullet injured, claimed Ariful. The injured was declared dead at Jessore Medical College and Hospital.

data.name: Bachchu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Bachchu was trying to create anarchy in the upazila by throwing petrol bombs at different points of the upazila. Police arrested him with two petrol bombs around 11:00pm on February 6, 2015 from the upazila town. As per his statement during preliminary interrogation, a police team along with Bachchu went for recovering more petrol bombs. When the team reached Nesarabad bus terminal area around 2:30am on February 7, 2015 accomplices of Bachchu opened fire on police. The law enforcers also returned fire, triggering a "gunfight" with Bachchu's men. Bachchu was hit by bullets and died on the spot, the police official said.

data.name: Swapan
data.description: Swapan was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at around 1. 30 am on February 8, 2015. He was arrested by Kotowali Model Police Station and handed over to Sadar South Model Police Station at around 1. 00 am. Then a police team of Sadar South Model Police Station conducted a drive to recover arms with him to his village Rampur. However, on the way to Vatpara Swapan's accomplice attacked the police. Police also fired back. Swapan was bullet hit. Later, he was taken to the Comilla Medical College Hospital, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: On February 7, 2015, RAB arrested Mehedi from his house at around 9 pm. Then RAB took him to a brick field for recovering arms at Kazipur late night on February 8, 2015. Then a group of miscreants fired to RAB and RAB also fired back. However, Mehedi got bullet wounds. He was taken to Jessore General Hospital where doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Madrasa student Jasim Uddin, 26, was killed in a "shootout" with police in the capital's Taltola around 4:00am. A statement, signed by Officer-in-Charge Ganesh Gopal Biswas of Sher-e-Bangla Nagar Police Station, said police picked up six alleged Shibir men including Jasim on February 8, 2015 following an attack on traffic sergeant Golam Mawla at Shishu Mela crossing near Shyamoli. After obtaining information from Jasim, a police team took him to Taltola to arrest Shibir leader Delwar and his accomplices. As the team reached the area around 3:45am, Delwar and his accomplices hurled crude bombs at and opened fire on police. At one point, they snatched Jasim away from the police custody. Police too opened fire on the criminals. Although the Shibir men managed to flee, Jasim's bullet-hit body was found later. However, the victim's brother Anisur Rahman claimed his brother was innocent and had been killed in a pre-planned way.'Police picked him up from Agargaon on 7th February afternoon. He had been missing since then, " said Anisur at Dhaka Medical College morgue, where the body was sent for an autopsy. Jasim was badly wounded in the chest, said the brother.

data.name: Mohammad Nahid
data.description: On February 2, 2015 a civil team of Pallabi police station which led by SI Touhidul Islam picked up Nahid in front of Proshika Bhaban, Mirpur, Dhaka. Family members got information about Nahid from a source of Pallabi police station. Meanwhile, family members also talked with Nahid over phone. At a time, they also talked with SI Touhidul Islam Arefin and SI Subroto while the police officers asked for money (5 lacs tk) from them. As they didn't provide the said money, on February 5, 2015 they found the bullet wounds dead body of Nahid at Dhaka Medical College Morgue.

data.name: Rasel Sarder
data.description: Police said a patrol team of Detectives Branch of Police came under attack in the area at 3:30am on February 9, 2015 when some pickets hurled bombs and fired at them. Police retaliated by firing back and at one point Rasel was hit by bullets. ‘He was rushed to DMCH where doctors declared him dead at around 5:00am, ’ said DMP Deputy Commissioner (media and public relation) Masudur Rahman. However, Rasel’s brother Akash Sarder claimed his brother was innocent and had no link to any political party. He went missing on February 5 after getting out of the shop around 12:00pm. He said they had been searching for him at different police stations in Dhaka and Narayanganj, but no one could tell them about his whereabouts. ‘We came to know through television news that a body was kept at DMCH morgue after gunfight at Jatrabari. We went to DMCH and found the body, ’ said Akash.

data.name: Arif
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Arif (22) was killed in a police "encounter" with alleged blockaders in Sitakunda of Chittagong on February 14, 2015. Arif was declared dead on arrival at CMCH at around 11:30pm. Saiful Islam, Assistant Superintendent of Police of Chittagong, claimed that a group of criminals hurled a crude bomb at a police petrol team in Nonachhara area around 9:30pm. The group then opened fire on the team, forcing the police to retaliate, the ASP claimed.

data.name: Md. Mozammel
data.description: Md. Mozammel, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Amtali upazila of Barguna early on February 14, 2015. On information, a police team conducted a drive at a deserted house when the robbers were taking preparation there, for committing a robbery, said Sukumar Roy, officer-in-charge of Amtali Police Station. The gang first fired bullets targeting the law enforcers who then retaliated by firing shots, informs the OC. Later, Mozammel’s body was found lying on the spot which was then sent to Barguna General Hospital morgue for autopsy. .

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On February 17, 2015 Moshiur's son Kazi Nayon Hossain said that locals had seen police chase his father and six other people who were chatting at a tea stall in Chhoigharia Bazar. "At one point, they [locals] heard gunshots and after some time we learned my father was shot, " he said. Another bullet-hit, Rafiqul Patwari, was picked up by police, locals claimed. Law enforcers, however, refuted the claim. Police said a patrol team led by Biplob Kumar Nath, officer-in-charge of Shalikha Police Station, came under attack at Chhoighoria village around 6:45pm. As the law enforcers were crossing the Hazambari intersection by a van, they saw four to five men sitting there. "When we asked them about their whereabouts, the group opened fire and threw a bomb on the police van, prompting us to return fire, " Moshiur was taken to Magura Sadar hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, said police.

data.name: Motiar Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: He was shot during a raid by a team of police and BGB personnel at Ranirbandar of Dinajpur on February 17, 2015 at night. Police and locals said that during the raid around 8:30pm police arrested BNP activist Khoda Bakhs, an accused in several arson cases. As the team was taking him out of the area, Jamaat-Shibir and BNP men exploded several crude bombs and surrounded the team in a bid to snatch the arrestee. Police fired rubber bullets and then the BGB men fired seven shots. Motiar, Bakhs' elder brother, who led the attack, was hit by three bullets, said Anisur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Chirirbandar Police Station. Law enforcers took Motiar, son of Abdur Rahman of Dakkhin Nashratpur, to Dinajpur Medical College Hospital. Later, he was moved to the capital, said Dinajpur Superintendent of Police Ruhul Amin. Police took Motiar's body to Dhaka Medical College morgue from NICD around 4:00pm, but none came for his body as of 12:15 am today, said morgue sources.

data.name: Liton Miah
data.description: Liton Miah, an alleged mugger was killed in police firing while a gang was fleeing after snatching valuables from a man in Mymensingh town on February 15, 2015. Police said some four to five muggers took away a mobile phone set and TK 2, 800 in cash from one Abdul Wahab at Balashpur around 3. 00 am. He was returning home from his workshop in the town’s Mashkanda area. Hearing his screams, a police team patrolling the area chased the muggers, said Abu Mohammad Fazlul Karim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang tried to attack the police team with sharp weapons. Police opened fire to retaliate. Liton was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others fled, the police official said.

data.name: Abu Sayeed
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Sayeed and Bajlu were detained by the police of Monirampur Police Station at evening on February 17, 2015. Then at around 3. 00 am they were taken to Begaritola for rescuing arms while accomplices attcked on police. Police retaliated and opened fire. In this incident, Sayeed and Bajlu were killed

data.name: Bajlur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Sayeed and Bajlu were detained by the police of Monirampur Police Station at evening on February 17, 2015. Then at around 3. 00 am they were taken to Begaritola for rescuing arms while accomplices attcked on police. Police retaliated and opened fire. In this incident, Sayeed and Bajlu were killed

data.name: Mostafa Manjil
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Mostafa Manjil (32), a Jamaat activist and former president of Gaibandha Sadar unit Islami Chhatra Shibir, the student wing of the party the prime accused of the February 6, Gaibandha bus arson, was killed in a "shootout" with the RAB in the district on February 17, 2015.

data.name: Rafique Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Rafique Uddin alias Chhoto Tareque, 40, was a resident of a cluster village in Bishoykhali Bazar under Jhenaidah Sadar Upazila. According to the RAB, he was the regional leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddah). But his family claimed that he was an activist of Jubo League, a pro-ruling Awami League youth organisation, and RABb men picked him up the day before. Two villagers said they saw a Rab team detain him on February 16, 2015.

data.name: Tipu Hawlader
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Tipu Hawlader, along with Kabir Molla, was killed in a'shootout' with police in Agailjhara of Barisal on February 21, 2015. They stood accused in a case for firebombing a fruit-laden pick-up on February 9, in Agailjhara and had been absconding since then, said Monirul Islam, officer-in-charge of Agailjhara Police Station. OC Monirul said a team of Agailjhara police with the help of DB police in Dhaka caught Kabir from his relative's house in Ashulia around 4. 00 am on February 21, 2015. Around an hour later, the same team arrested TIpu from Keraniganj, on the outskirts of the capital. Around midnight the two were taken to Agailjhara to hunt down other accused in the arson case. As the law enforcers reached Jobarpar, they came under a firebomb attack around 2. 10 am on February 22, 2015, he claimed. They also opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate with gunfire, said the OC. After the gunfight, police found the bullet-riddled bodies of Tipu and Kabir on the ground.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations

data.name: Asadul Hawlader
data.description: A group of police officials led by SI Mukul and Russel of Bhanga Police Station came to Miapara village on February 21, 2015 and detained Asadul and Johor Ali while they were working in the field. Johor escaped and jump to the pond. On the other hand police dragged Asadul with a chain from his throat. As a result he died.

data.name: Hossen Ahmad
data.description: Hossen Ahmad was allegedly killed by BGB in a gunfight at Teknaf, Cox'sbazar on February 18, 2015. On that day a group of yaba traders from Myanmer were waiting by the side of River. After receiving information BGB went to the place and a gunfight ensued. As a result, Hossen Ahmad killed in the gunfight.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: On February 19, 2015 Rafiqul Islam was killed in a gunfight. However, eye-witnesses Abdul Kadir, Jalal Uddin, Shamim and Babul Mia informed that he was arrested by the police before the gunfight.

data.name: Abdul Odud
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Abdul Odud was arrested in the morning then at night he was taken to Kalayanpur Housing for rescuing arms. At that time, his accomplices opened fire while police also retaliated. In this incident he was killed.

data.name: Shaheen
data.description: Shaheen was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Sreenagar upazila on February 25, 2015. Sheikh Mahbubur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said a police team launched a drive at Rudrapara village around 1:30pm acting on intelligence that a group of armed thugs gathered there to commit criminal activities. Sensing the presence of cops, criminals opened fire on law enforcers, leaving one Al Amin injured. On information, an additional police force went to the spot and cordoned off the area. Criminals at that time again opened fire on cops, prompting retaliatory police fire that left Shaheen dead on the spot. The other criminals managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Daud Ali
data.description: The head of the outlaws' gang'Daud Bahini' Daud was killed in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts at Chhoto-Khalimpur village in Magura sadar upazila early hours on February 25, 2015.

data.name: Rezawanul
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Rezawanul was shot dead by police while there was a clash ensued between police and local people regarding the arrest of Habibur Rahman, a leader of BNP and father of Rezawanul.

data.name: Saddam Mollah
data.description: Lt Col Faridul Alam, Commanding Officer of RAB-8, said they had information that some members of Sagar-Saikat Bahini had set up a den at Katleswar Khal, locally known as Katlar Khal, under the Sharankhola range and had been holed up there. A RAB-8 team led by Maj Adnan Kabir reached the area, around 45 kilometres south of Sharankhola, around 7:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire prompting the RAB men to retaliate, said the RAB-8 CO. After around a half-an-hour-long "gunfight", the robbers retreated and the RAB men found three bullet-riddled bodies of Saddam Mollah, Sohel and another unidentified men lying on the ground, he said.

data.name: Sohel
data.description: Lt Col Faridul Alam, Commanding Officer of RAB-8, said they had information that some members of Sagar-Saikat Bahini had set up a den at Katleswar Khal, locally known as Katlar Khal, under the Sharankhola range and had been holed up there. A RAB-8 team led by Maj Adnan Kabir reached the area, around 45 kilometres south of Sharankhola, around 7:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire prompting the RAB men to retaliate, said the RAB-8 CO. After around a half-an-hour-long "gunfight", the robbers retreated and the RAB men found three bullet-riddled bodies of Saddam Mollah, Sohel and another unidentified men lying on the ground, he said.

A RAB-8 team led by Maj Adnan Kabir reached the area, around 45 kilometres south of Sharankhola, around 7:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire prompting the RAB men to retaliate, said the RAB-8 CO. After around a half-an-hour-long "gunfight", the robbers retreated and the RAB men found three bullet-riddled bodies of Saddam Mollah, Sohel and another unidentified men lying on the ground, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Monsur Ali
data.description: On February 28, 2015 Mohammad Monsur Ali was shot dead by a group of police. The agitated fishermen went to catch fish in river while the powerful lessee called the police to obstruct the general fishermen. Those lessees filed a case before one week against the general fishermen thus they were in a panic of arrest. As a result they started to agitate and went there to catch fish.

data.name: Arif Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On March 1, 2015 Arif and Mainuddin were received bullet injury in a gunfight with police. Later Arif succumbed to his injuries on March 11, 2015.

data.name: Nazmul Huda Lablu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Nazmul Huda Lablu, President of Shramik Kalyan Federation and ex-president of Islami Chhatra Shibir was killed in a clash between police at Mithapukur in Rangpur. Police informed that on March 9, 2015 at around 3:30 am, a group of criminals were cutting trees at Baldipukur area in Rangpur-Dhaka Highway. At that time criminals threw cocktails and petrol bombs at police when police put barrier. Criminals fled when police opened fire in self defense. Later Nazmul Huda Lablu was rescued with bullet wounds and taken to Rangpur Medical College Hospital where the doctors on duty declared him dead. Brother-in-law of the deceased ialleged that on March 8 at around 7:00 pm, Lablu was picked up by some men in plain clothes identifying them as members of law enforcement agency at gun point from Shanerhat Kalanur Shahpur village under Pirganj Upazila. On March 9 at noon, police informed them to bring the body. Deceased’s father Nurunnabi Shah said that "police staged a drama of ‘gunfight’ after killing my son".

data.name: Mohammad Apu
data.description: Family alleged that, Mohammad Apu was picked up by DB police on March 10, 2015. Later, his dead body was found on March 11, 2015. Police claimed that they found the dead body at 11 am and sent to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital for post mortem. They claimed that he was an alleged mugger.

data.name: Hasan Ali Sana
data.description: An alleged leader of a robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Hongshu Rajerchar area of the Sundarbans on March 12, 2015. Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers conducted a drive in Dabura area of Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on March 11, 2015 and arrested Sana. He was handed over to Koyra police around 11. 00 pm. After gleaning information from Sana, a police team taking him along with them launched a drive in Hongshu Rajerchar area around 2. 00 am to recover arms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sana's cohorts opened fire in a bid to snatch him, forcing the police members to retaliate by firing. As a result Sana died in the gunfight.

data.name: Md. Israfil
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: The family alleged that plainclothes police had killed him after picking him up.

data.name: Yunus Ali
data.description: A robber was allegedly killed in a'gunfight' with police in Panchbaria area on the Jessore-Magura Highway in the district on March 17, 2015. Receiving information that a gang of robbers was taking preparations for looting night coaches and good-laden trucks on the highway by felling a tree, a police team went to the spot at around 4. 00 am, said Akkas Ali, OC of Jessore Kotwali Police Station. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers exploded crude bombs and opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Yunus Ali sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot while his accomplices managed to flee, the OC said.

data.name: Mukter Hossain
data.description: A suspected robber was killed and four of his aides were injured in a'gunfight' with police at Joydevpur area under Alfadanga upazilla in Faridpur on March 16, 2015.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: Iqbal was killed in a'gunfight' between his cohorts and police in Kaliganj Kanchatala Bazar area undre Kaliganj upazila of the district on March 21, 2015. The deceased was Iqbal Hossain (28), son of Abul Kashem of Arpara village.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.description: On March 19, 2015 Jahangir was arrested by police from Chakbazaar of Old Dhaka as a suspect of a dacoity case. Police produced him in the court and appealed for remand. In the remand period on March 20, 2015 police claimed that Jahangir hanged himself to death. However, family alleged that he died due to torture by police. There were marks of torture in his body.

data.name: Mobarok Ullah Monti
data.description: Mobarok was killed in a ‘shootout’ with Rapid Action Battalion in the capital’s TT Para slum area on March 22, 2015. He was identified as Mobarok Ullah Monti, 45, an accused in the recent murder of one Sumi Akter in Motijheel area, said the battalion officials.

data.name: Al Amin Hossain
data.description: T M Rokunuzzaman, OC of Khulna district Detective Branch (DB) of police, said acting on a tip off, a joint team of DB and Koyra police arrested Al Amin from Chandkhali in Koyra around 10:15 pm on March 29, 2015. After gleaning information from Al Amin, police raided Jhapjhopiarchar area, which is adjacent to the Sundarbans, in search of his den and arms. The law enforcers took him along with them at that time. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, other gang members in the area opened fire on police, triggering a gunfight that lasted for almost an hour. Al Amin was found dead when the shooting ended. However, his cohorts managed to escape.

data.name: Lokman Hossain
data.description: Lokman Hossain was shot to death by police during a clash occurred regarding the UP election for counting votes in Rangpur. At Chowdhurypara Madrassa vote centre while presiding officer announced Sohel Rana won then the other contestant Abdul Matin protested it. A clash ensued there. As a result, police opened fire while Lokman recived bullet injuries and died after sometimes.

data.name: Bellal Hossain

data.name: Milon Ahmed
data.description: The chief of an inter-district robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mirpur upazila on April 21, 2015. The dead, Milon was the son of Abdus Sattar of Laxmidhardia village in the upazila. Milon's family alleged that two officials of the police station- Sub-Inspector Abdul Halim and Assistant Sub-Inspector Atiqur Rahman- picked up Milon on April 18, 2015 night and cooked up the "gunfight" story.

data.name: Al Mamun
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police in Khulna city on May 5, 2015 . A special team, led by Officer-in-Charge Sukumer Biswas, went to Bagmara Burir Bagan area in the city along with the two robbers to arrest their cohorts and recover firearms at around 8. 30 pm, said Assistant Commissioner of Khulna Metropolitan Police, Ziauddin Ahmed. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the cohorts of the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one stage, the robbers retreated. Police found Al Mamun dead .

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police. Acting on a tip-off, around 3:00am, a joint-team of Joypurhat DB and Panchbibi police raided Bhutgari village where some seven to eight "robbers" were preparing for committing a robbery, according to police. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals started firing on them. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the "gunfight", police found two bodies of Abdus Salam and Babu Mia on the spot and those were sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Babu Mia

The law enforcers retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the "gunfight", police found two bodies of Abdus Salam and Babu Mia on the spot and those were sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Dholu Hossain
data.description: Three alleged human traffickers- Dholu Hossain, Jahangir Alam and Zafar Alam - were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015. "Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at Hatchery Beach area in Teknaf around 3:30am, " said Ataur Rahman Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the human traffickers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute "gunfight", he said. The gunfight left the three traffickers dead on the spot.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: A human trafficking suspect was killed by the police in a reported ‘gunfight’ in Cox’s Bazar while an anti-human trafficking team of the Coast Guard and the Navy detained 116 Malaysia-bound job seekers from Bay of Bengal near St Martin’s Island. Human trafficking suspect Belal Hossain, 38, of Kawarpara village under Khoroskhool union of Cox’s Bazar was in a ‘gunfight’ at Meherghona village under Cox’s Bazar sadar upazila at about 5:00am, the police claimed.

data.name: Sultan Khokon
data.description: Sultan alias Khokonl was allegedly killed in a "shootout" with police in Meherpur Sadar upazila. Ahsan Habib, officer-in-charge of Meherpur Sadar Police Station, said acting on a tip-off, police raided Sultan's "hideout" at College intersection of Meherpur district town and arrested Sultan. As per Sultan's statement, a police team took him to Rajnagar village in Meherpur Sadar upazila around 5:00am to recover arms and arrest his accomplices. As soon as the law enforcers reached near a bridge in the village, the aides of Sultan opened fire on them. Police returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". At one stage, Sultan tried to flee but was caught in the line of fire. He died on the spot.

data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: He was arrested by police on May 6, 2015 from Purba Shakpura village, Boyalkhali. On May 7, 2015 he fall sick before producing court. Then he was taken to Upazila Govt Hospital and later he was refered to Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On May 11, 2015 he died in the hospital. Family alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Ishaq Miah
data.description: The police claimed that the suspect, Ishaq Miah, 45, had committed suicide in a toilet at the police station while the family alleged that the police were bribed to kill him. He was died in the custody of Kotwali Police Station in Chittagong.

data.name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
data.description: Mohammad Jasim Uddin was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight.

data.name: Selim Sheikh
data.description: Selim Sheikh was allegedly killed in a'gunfight' with police at Kanaipur in Sadar upazila on June 13, 2015. Receiving information that a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive in the area around 3. 30 am. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, Selim recieved bullets and died on the spot while others managed to flee.

data.name: Mohammad Jamal
data.description: Shah Jamal was allegedly killed in a'gunfight' with RAB-08 at Sarankhola.

data.name: Nazmul Islam Sagar
data.description: Nazmul Islam Sagar was allegedly killed in a'gunfight' between police and his cohorts at Katlamari under Mirpur upazila on June 19, 2015. Mirpur police officer-in-charge Jalal Uddin said they had information that 10-12 robbers were preparing to commit robbery on the Kushtia-Meherpur road. A police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:15 am, he said. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on police prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and his cohorts in Hidarabad area of Gazipur on June 23, 2015. Muhith Kabir, operation officer of RAB-1, said a gang of robbers intercepted a patrol microbus of the elite force at Haidarabad on Tongi-Kaliganj road around 3. 30 am. When another microbus of RAB reached the spot, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, reports our Gazipur correspondent. "The RAB members fired back in retaliation, which triggered a gunfight, "he said, adding that they recovered the bullet-hit body of Mamun from the spot his cohorts managed to flee.

data.name: Shahin
data.description: Shahin was killed, along with and Sultan, by BGB men at Birampur in Dinajpur on June 30, 2015 afternoon. OC Md Amiruzzaman said that a BGB team seized Indian smuggled clothes from Birampur Railway Station around 4.00 pm and left the station. Immediately after the seizure, the smugglers gathered in the area and tortured a BGB source, he said. On hearing it, the BGB members came to the area again when the'smugglers' swooped on them. He, quoting the BGB members, said the BGB team opened fire in their self-defence, leaving Shahin and Sultan dead on the spot. Locals, however, claimed that Shahin and Sultan were'common people' and used to run shops in the area. As the news spread in the area, locals blocked the Birampur-Dinajpur highway by felling tree logs and keeping the bodies on the road, police and locals said.

data.name: Md. Yusuf
data.description: Md. Yusuf was shot dead by police in the capital's Hatirjheel area on June 30, 2015, although the deceased's family members said that he was picked up by police on June 28, 2015. The deceased's wife Ruksana Begum said that Tejgaon Industrial police picked Yusuf on June 28, 2015 night and they saw him in police station on June 29 at afternoon. Yusuf told his family members that police demanded Tk 50000 for his release. The police station officer-in-Charge Mizanur Rahman, however, brushed aside allegation and said that Yusuf was shot during a gunfight.

data.name: Shamim Ahmed
data.description: Shamim Ahmed was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Purano Paltan area of the capital.

data.name: Mohammad Jony
data.description: An undertrial prisoner named Mohammad Jony died in Rajshahi Central jail as a result of torture by police in custody. However police claimed that Jony committed suicide by hanging himself with a local towel ( gamcha). The victim's family alleged that Jony was arrested by police being a suspect of thief, tortured to death in Rajshahi police line custody.

data.name: Najim Uddin
data.description: Najim Uddin was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on July 7, 2015.

data.name: Yasin Sarkar Rajon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A sanitary worker and also Juba League activist was shot dead by RAB at Taltola in Agargaon after he was abducted allegedly by the force on July 12, said the victim's family members. The deceased was identified as Yasin Sarker Rajon, 32. However, RAB claimed, deceased was a mugger and accused in several cases, including murder, claimed RAB. RAB-2 Commanding Officer SM Masud Rana claimed that their petrol team challenged a gang of muggers in the area around 2. 30 am when they were trying to flee. RAB team chased the gang, at that time, the gang opened fire. RAB men retaliated and Rajon sustained bullet injuries. Later, Rajon was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. The victim's brother Nazmul Haque Panna, however, said that Rajon was going to his relative's house on that night when four to five motorbikes intercepted him and he was picked up into a microbus.

data.name: Suman
data.description: In Rangpur, two brothers were killed in a'gunfight' with the RAB personnel in the city's Dhap area. Two RAB men-Sub-Inspector Saiful Islam and Constable Imran were also injured during the'gunfight' and admitted to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. . According to the RAB, a team of RAB-13 challenged the duo around 3.00 am. They tried to escape the scene opening fire to the RAB men that prompting them to retaliate that triggered the'gunfight' leaving the duo dead on the spot, claimed the RAB officials. The victims were identified as Suman, 26 and Manik, 25, sons of Abdul Malek, residents of Khaliphatari in the city.

When the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire on police, prompting them to return fire that triggered a "gunfight".

data.name: Md Abu Zafar
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in an encounter with Rapid Action Battalion at Patenga Sea beach in Chittagong city on July 26, 2015. RAB lLegal and Media Wing Assistant Director Major Maksudul Alam said Zafar, ayaba lord of South Chittagong zone, was killed in a'gunfight' with RAB 7 officials.

data.name: Tarikul Islam Taru
data.description: Taru was reportedly killed in a'gunfight' with the members of Rapid Action battalion-8 in Majhgram area of the district town on July 27, 2015. Taru went missing on July 17, according to a general diary filed with Sadar police station by his wife Rekha Begum.

data.name: Miarul Islam
data.description: An alleged ringleader was killed in a gunfight with police. A team arrested Miarul, accused in 10 cases including two for murder, from Nurpur village on August 1, 2015, said Ahsan Habib, OC of Meherpur Police Station. Then while he was taken to recover fire arms in the mean time his cohorts came and a gunfight ensued. which caused him dead.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Salam's mother Rawshanara Begum alleged that police killed her son after taking bribe from his rivals. She admitted her son was accussed in several cases and was detained in prison several years ago. The house owner said Salam rented the room a month ago and had been living there with his wife, Ruby, and their two-and-a-half-years old child. According to them, police first entered the building and asked residents not to move and then stormed Salam's room. A few minutes later, the tenants heard three to four gun-shots. About one and a half hours later police took away an unconscious Salam, who was bleeding, neighbours said.

data.name: Farhad
data.description: An alleged forest robber was killed in a'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Alki of the Sunderbans in Koyra of Khulna on August 4, 2015 night. Khulna RAB-6 Commanding Officer Khalikuzzaman said on a tip-off that the forest robber gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area, a team of the elite force launched a drive there at about 7. 30 pm. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Farhad was caught in the line of fire and seriously injured while other members of the gang managed to flee the spot. Farhad was rushed to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead at about 9. 30 pm.

data.name: Abdus Sobhan
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Burumaria in Pangsha of Rajbari on August 7, 2015. Abu Samad Md Hayat, officer-in-charge of Pangsha Police Station, said police arrested the robber from Charkalimohar at around 10. 00 pm on August 6, 2015 . Later a team of police along with Sobhan conducted a drive at a mango orchard of Akter Master in Burumaria around 1. 30 am to recover firearms. Sensing the presence of the lawenforcers, associates of Sobhan opened fire to the police, prompting the police force to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Sobhan was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Siddiq Sana
data.description: Six alleged tiger poachers- Siddiq Sana, Ansar Ali Sana, Rafiqul Islam, Mamun Gazi, Bappi Dhali and Majid Gazi- were killed in a'gunfight' with police in the Sundarbans on August 9, 2015. Police claimed that all the six are'tiger poachers' and members of a Sundarbans-based robber gang. Acting on a tip-off that some'tiger poachers' were in Alki Mandarbaria area of the West Sundarbans in Koyra upazila, a police team raided the area at around 3. 45 pm, said Harendranath Sarkar, OC of Koyra Police Station. The victim's family and locals alleged that they were detained by the police day before gunfight.

data.description: Six alleged tiger poachers- Siddiq Sana, Ansar Ali Sana, Rafiqul Islam, Mamun Gazi, Bappi Dhali and Majid Gazi- were killed in a'gunfight' with police in the Sundarbans on August 9, 2015. Police claimed that all the six are'tiger poachers' and members of a Sundarbans-based robber gang. Acting on a tip-off that some'tiger poachers' were in Alki Mandarbaria area of the West Sundarbans in Koyra upazila, a police team raided the area at around 3. 45 pm, said Harendranath Sarkar, OC of Koyra Police Station. The victim's family and locals alleged that they were detained by the police day before gunfight.

data.name: Sardar Abdur Rob
data.description: On August 10, 2015 a gunfight was ensued when Sardar Abdur Rob was allegedly killed by police.

data.name: Zahidul Islam Alo
data.description: An alleged yaba trader was killed on August 17, 2015 in what RAB claimed was a gunfight, but the victim's family claimed he was murdered. Major Shahid Sarwar of RAB-7 said the incident occurred when a RAB team was patrolling the Dhaka-Chittagong highway and came across a pick-up van on Port-Bhatiary link road at 2. 45 am. They saw two people in the van and asked them to stop as they were trying to drive away. At that time the two men opened fire at the RAB team, and a gunfight followed. The pick up managed to flee after a while. Later, RAB members found Zahidul's bullet-riddled body. He was rushed to Chittagong Medical College Hospital only to be declared dead on arrival. Family members refuted the Rab statement, calling it a cooked-up story. Yasmin Akhter, wife of the deceased, said her husband was abducted by 7-8 people in plainclothes from a friend's house in Dhaka at around 8. 00 am on August 15, 2015.

data.name: Arzu Miah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Arzu Miah killed in a gunfight between his associates and RAB members in the capital's Hazaribagh area on August 18, 2015 around 12 hours after he and his friends allegedly beat a teenage boy to death. Police and locals said Hazaribagh BCL President Arzu Miah, 28, and a couple of his friends beat a boy, Raja Miah, in Hazaribagh on August 17, 2015 allegedly for stealing mobile phones and a laptop. Several hours after Raja's death, Arzu was picked up by RAB-2 personnel from Hazaribagh park area, said Arzu's brother Masud Mia . Ferdawsi Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-2, said members of the elite force took Arzu, the main suspect in the Raja murder case, to Baroikhali area of Hazaribagh to arrest the others involved in the murder. His cohorts opened fire on the Rab members at 2. 35 am on August 18, 2015. Wounded, Arzu was found lying there after the gunfight. He was later taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctorspronounced him dead around .

data.name: Mehedi Hasan Ajibor
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A joint team of Detective and police gunned down Ajibor . Ajibor, the third accused in the case over shooting a man dead and injuring a pregnant woman in Magura, was a former executive member of Magura municipality BCL.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A ruling party activist who was allegedly involved in the August infighting that left one dead in Kushtia was killed in a'gunfight' with police in the district town on August 19, 2015. Sabbir Ul Alam, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Police, said the "gunfight" took place at Jagati area of Kushtia Sadar upazila at around 1. 30 am. Police conducted a drive in the area after being tipped off that a gang of criminals was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the gang opened fire on them, forcing police to fire back triggering a gun battle. . Zakir was found lying on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene. He was taken to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh
data.description: Mozibur Rahman was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Shamarghat under Sadar upazila in Tangail in the early hours on August 21, 2015. The victim was identified as Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh, son of late Sona Mondol of Kashinagar village under Sadar upazila in the district. Company Commander of RAB-12, Additional Police Super Muhammed Mohiuddin Faruki said they raided the Shamarghat area on a tip off that two gangs of ultra left extremists had gathered there. Suspecting the presence of the law enforcers, the'extremist' groups opened fire, triggering a gun battle with RAB. Faruki said the criminals had fled away at one stage while Mozibur was found bullet-hit in a Mehegini tree garden with a 7. 65 foreign pistol and two rounds of bullets after the exchange of fire between them and the law enforcers. Mozibur was immediately taken to Tangail Medical College Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Police said Jubo League ward leader Saidul Islam was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of Detective Branch of Police at Salna in Gazipur on August 21, 2015. Inspector of Gazipur DB Amir Hossain said police arrested Saidul, an alleged criminal, on August 21, 2015 and took him to Salna area to arrest his associates and recover firearms around 12. 00 am on August 22, 2015. Sensing the presence of police, the associates of Saidul opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. . At one stage, Saidul was caught in the line of fire, added the officer. Saidul was taken to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yusuf Akhter
data.description: Yusuf Akhter was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight. Family allged that, he was arrested before the gunfight and later a drama staged to sort out arms while Yusuf died in gunfight.

data.name: Khalilur Rahman
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion on August 31, 2015 at Darjarkhal in the Sundarban under Sharankhola of Bagerhat district. The Commanding Officer of RAB-8, Faridul Alam, said the gunfight took place when his forces went to Darajarkhal on a tip-off that a group of thugs were planning for robbery there. Cohorts of slain robber opened fires on the forces of RAB-8, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. The body was sent to Bagerhat General Hospital for post mortem examination.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: On September 1, 2015 Sumon was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at Sadar upazila, Comilla.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: Two leaders of an outlawed party were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rajbari's Pangsha upazila on September 4, 2015. The deceased Kamal Hossain and Omar Kha were from Shantikhola and Borochoubaria villages of the upazila. Kamal was the prime accused in a case filed in connectionwith the murder of Mizanur Rahman, a former OC of Pangsha Police Station. Omar, one of Kamal's accomplices, was also the ringleader of an inter-district robber gang, claimed police. They were arrested before the gunfight and police brought them to recover arms then a gunfight ensued.

data.name: Akash Ferdous
data.description: On September 6, 2015 Akhash alias Ferdouse (30) was allegedly killed in police firing at Wari in old Dhaka . Wari police Sub-Inspector Shariful Islam took Akash to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where he succubbed to his injuries at about 5. 15 pm, said sub-inspector Sentu Chandra Das posted at the hospital.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.description: Three people--Faruk Hossain, Shameem and Shyamal Chnadra Pal-- were killed as police opened fire at local people who clashed with the police during their protests against an alleged sexual harassment at Kalihati upazila in Tangail on September 18, 2015. Witnesses said that the locals of Kalihati and Ghatail were staging protests at about 4:30pm on September 18, 2015 on Tangail-Mymensingh Highway against the alleged sexual harassment of a local woman in front of her son on September 15. Police charged baton on the protesters to disperse them from the highway triggering clashes between the cops and the protesters

data.name: Akkas Rahim

data.name: Omar Siraj
data.description: He was arrested by RAB on September 18, 2015 from UGC office, Agargaon, Dhaka for leaking questions of medical college and university admission exams. Then he was taken to RAB custody for interrogation. On October 1, 2015 he fell sick and he was taken to National heart disease Institute. On that day, he died in the hospital. Family alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Toufiqul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: He was arrested by police on October 4, 2015 as an alleged member of a militant group. Then he was taken to custody for interrogation. Police said that on October 6, 2015 he was taken to Ananna residential area of the city to recover grenades. Once police reached there, Jabed's associates hurled grenade at police. Then Jabed died. Therefore he was under the custody of police and found dead and no information found from the family.

data.name: Asadul Islam
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in Sirajganj Sadar upazila on October 9, 2015. The dead is Asadul Islam, 35, of Guttara village in Tangail's Bhuapur upazila. According to RAB acting on information that some robbers, including Asadul, were preparing to commit a robbery in Chinabandh area, a team of RAB-12 went there to conduct a drive around 4. 00 am, said Hasibul Hasan, Commander of Sirajganj RAB camp. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire on the elite froce members, said Hasibul, also assistant superintendent of police. The Rab members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, Asadul was found dead on the spot.

data.name: Mohklesur Rahman
data.description: Two police members allegedly beat a man to death in Bogra's Gabtoli upazila on October 15, 2015. The victim was Mokhlesur Rahman (45) of Daripara village in the upazila. Two cops were suspended in this connection. They are ASI Abdus Sabur and Constable Abdur Rahman of Gabtoli Model Police Station. Following his death, locals and family members confined Sabur and Rahman, who allegedly beat Moklesur to death. The two had to be rescued by additional police force. Police sources said victim's younger brother filed an allegation against him over some family feud on October 14, 2015. Following this, the two cops in question went to investigate the allegation and they beat and kicked Mokhlesur after they caught him. He died instantly, family alleged.

data.name: Rezaul

Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the party men opened fire on RAB forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Johirul Islam Bijoy
data.description: On October 22, 2015 Johirul was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-1 at Adorshonagar, Badda, Dhaka.

data.name: Habibur Rahman Habib
data.description: Habibur Rahman Habib was allegedly killed in a'gunfight' with DB police in Faridpur town on October 23, 2015 night. Acting on a tip off that Habib was making a deal with his buyers to sell firearms, a team of DB police raided East Khaspur Launch ghat area around 11. 30 pm, said Mohammad Kamruzzaman, Additional Superintendent of Faridpur police. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, Habib and his aides attacked police with sharp weapons. Police then opened fire on them, triggering a gunfight between police and criminals. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene, and police found the bullet-hit body of Habib on the spot.

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Laxmipur Sadar upazila on October 22, 2015.

data.name: Arshad Ali Bepari
data.description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a'gunfight' with police in Rajbari's Goalando on October 26, 2015. Police said the dead, Arshad Ali Bepari. was an accused in seven cases, including murder and robbery.

data.name: Shipon
data.description: An alleged robber was reportedly killed in a'gunfight'with Rapid Action Battalion members at Mrigamari canal of Chadpai in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat on October 28, 2015.

data.name: Rajib Hasan
data.description: Rajib Hasan was killed in an alleged'gunfight' with police in the capital's Uttarkhan on November 2, 2015. Police said Rajib was a wanted criminal and died in a'gunfight' between the police and some robbers who were his cohorts. The OC of Uttarkhan police station, Yunus Ali said that Kotwali and Uttarkhan police jointly conducted a drive at Shahid Nagar Balur Math area on a tip-off that some robbers were preparing for committing robbery in the wee hours there. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting the lawmen to retaliate, he said. As the robbers fled, bullet-hit Rajib was found dead there, the OC said. His body was taken to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital morgue for a post mortem examination.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: The deceased was identified as Kamal Hossain, 28, of Lebutala under Jessore Sadar district. Jhenaidah RAB camp commander Major Mohammad Suruj Mia said that RAB had signalled a motor-biker to stop at Koroitala area on Jhenaidah-Jessore highway around 2. 30 am on November 2, 2015. The bike had two more pillions. The biker did not comply and, instead, the pillions targeting the RAB men opened fire, prompting RAB to retaliate. Two of the pillions managed to flee. Bullet-wound Kamal was caught by the RAB men who took him to Kaliganj Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Rafiq
data.description: RAB-1 Operation Officer Akramul Hasan said they acting on a tip-off that a group of miscreants gathered at Bangoan Kumarkhada and raided the area around 1. 30 am on November 2, 2015. Sensing presence of RAB members, the miscreants opened fire at them. prompting RAB members to strike back, that led to a'gunfight'. Rafiq caught in the line of fire while his associates were able to run away, Akramul said.

data.name: Razib
data.description: He was accused in a dacoity case where he looted 25 lacs taka from a jewelary shop. Police arrested him on November 1, 2015 and brought him to Shahidnagar area near Turag River for searching his cohorts. At that time, a gunfight ensued and he was found bullet wounded. Later he died.

data.name: Picchi Sentu
data.description: Sentu alias Picchi Sentu was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015. He was arrested and took to Kathadiya for recovering arms. At that time, a gunfight ensued where he was killed by police

data.name: Shohag Mridha
data.description: Shohag was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015.

data.name: Towhidul Islam
data.description: Towhidul was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015. He was arrested before the gunfight. When police took him to rescover arms, his cohorts came to rescue him and a gunfight ensued. In this gunfight he was killed.

data.name: Rashid Ahmmad
data.description: An accused in an abduction case was killed in a'gunfight' with police on Eidgaon-Eidgarh road at Panerphara Dhala in Sadar upazila on November 16, 2015. The deceased was identified as Rashid Ahammad. Tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in Ramu upazila and arrested Rashid at about 3. 30 am, said sub-inspector Minhaz, in-charge of Eidgaon Police Camp. When the law enforcers along with Rashid reached Panerphara Dhala on Eid-gaon- Eidgarh road in Sadar upazila, Rashid's cohorts opened fire at police, forcing them to fire back which triggered a gunfight. Rashid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his other associates managed to flee.

data.name: Sakib Mia

data.description: Ramjan was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 29, 2015. He was arrested before the gunfight. When police took him to rescue arms, his cohorts came to rescue him and a gunfight ensued. In this gunfight, he was killed.

data.name: Md. Monir Khalifa
data.description: Md. Monir Khalifa, an alleged robber, was killed along with an associate in a gunfight with RAB-8 at Urubariar Khal, Chandpai range, Purba Sundarban.

data.name: Nur Islam Sardar
data.description: Nur Islam Sardar alias Bhola, an alleged robber, was killed along with an associate in a gunfight with RAB-8 at Urubariar Khal, Chandpai range, Purba Sundarban.

data.name: Covered van driver
data.description: Armed Police Battalion members got information that some people were smuggling arms and illegal goods by a covered van. Then APBn men chased the covered van. At one stage they barricated the road by a micro bus and motorcycle and signaled the car to stop but the van did not stop . The APBn men shot at the covered van for their defence. That time the covered van driver was shot dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The man was allegedly killed in a gunfight by police while he and his cohorts were preparing for a dacoity.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged gunfight between police and robbers at East Gunagori under Banshkhali in Chittagong on December 7, 2015. The body was sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy. OC of Banshkhali police station said that a gang of armed robbers entered the house of Belal Master around 1:30 am. As the family members tried to resist, the robbers opened fire on them and hacked with sharp weapons, leaving four of them injured. On information, police rushed to the spot and encircled the house of one Belal around 1:45 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate triggering a gunfight, that left one of the robbers bullet-hit.

data.name: Mohammad Osman Goni
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Mohammad Osman Goni was allegedly shot dead by police. At around 2. 30 pm on December 15, 2015 he was having his lunch at his house. In the mean time, a police team in plainclothes came there in a black microbus. After getting the news about police Osman tried to escape from the back door of the house. Police chased him and shot him in his waist. He died there.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: Rashid, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Dharanti village in Sarail upazila on December 6, 2015. Receiving information that a gang of 10-12 robbers was taking preparation to commit a robbery at the village, a police team conducted a drive there around 3. 00 am, said Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police team, robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rashid was shot and died on the spot while the rest of t Police recovered Bashir's body and sent it to Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Sagir Bhandari
data.identity: Allegedly tied with a local criminal gang
data.description: On December 23, 2015 the ringleader of a robber gang of Sundarbans East Zone was killed in a'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Panighat area under Sarankhola upazila of the district on December 23, 2015. Recieving information that members of'Nayan Bahini' gathered at Panighat, the RAB in association with DB police took position in the area around 7. 30 am, said Harun-or-Rashid, Assistant Director of RAB-6. Sensing the presence of the RAB men, the gang opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After 15 minutes of gunfight, members of the gang retreated, said Harun, also a senior assistant police superintend. Later, RAB members found bullet-hit Sagir in the area. He was rushed to Sarankhola Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

Sensing their presence, the PBCP men opened fire on RAB personnel prompting them to retaliate that triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the extremists retreated from the spot leaving three of their associates-Omar, Kashem and Saddam-bullet wounded. data.name: Al Amin Jony
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Al Amin Jony was picked up from his house on December 29, 2015 and killed during a'gunfight' with RAB in the capital's Mirpur area on January 3, 2016. The RupnagarJCD unit aspirant secretary candidate, Al Amin Jony, 30, was wanted in atleast 13 cases, including those for murder and extortion, filed mostly with Pallabi police station while family said most of the cases were politically motivated. The family also alleged AlAmin was picked up from their house in early hours on December 29, 2015 by breaking their door and keeping locked the doors of their neighbours in the six-story building in Rupnagor area. They also alleged nearly a dozen people intorducing them as'men from administration' broke the door open and tied up his mother and wife and took him away blindfolded.

data.name: Mohammad Mintu
data.description: On January 3, 2016 police arrested Mintu in front of the Khulna Shopping Complex. At that time, police rescued a motorcycle that was stolen from the Khulna Sonali Bank Corporate. Family alleged that he was tortured to death in the police compound.

data.name: Mohammad Mostafa
data.description: On January 4, 2016 Mostofa was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Magurata under Tangail Sadar upazila.

data.name: Monir Khan
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Gazipur Sadar upazila on January 5, 2016.

data.name: Abdullah Noman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Two alleged operatives of banned militant outfit JMB - Abdullah alias Noman and Kamal alias Hiran - were killed in an "encounter" with law enforcers in the capital's Hazaribagh. Hiran was an accused in a case filed over the killing of a police constable in an attack on a checkpoint in Ashulia in November last year, said Sanwar Hossain, Additional Deputy commissioner (DB) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, He said a team of DB police raided a house at Kamrangirchar and arrested three militants around 10. 30 pm. Acting on the information of the arrestees, DB police conducted a drive near ZH Sikder Women's Medical College around at around 11:30 pm. As they were carrying out a search, militants on two motorbikes threw handmade grenades at the DB team, prompting the DB to open fire. Two of the militants were wounded, and two more fled the scene on a bike. . The injured were taken to Dhaka Medical Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead around 12. 45 am.

data.name: Rofiqul Islam
data.description: Members of Border Guard Bangladesh opened fire on a group of cattle traders along Jaluli border in Maheshpur upazila during a clash on January 30, 2016. Local people informed that members of BGB searched for a cattle trader. However they started to beat up the villagers who were sitting at the crossing of the road at Matila village by not finding the cattle trader. On the other hand, in protest, the villagers went to the BGB camp. At that time, BGB members opened fire from inside the camp. As a result Rofiqul Islam died on the spot. Another man Feroz Hossain, 28, succumbed to his wounds at Jhenidah Upazila Health Complex later.

data.name: Feroz Hossain
data.description: Members of Border Guard Bangladesh opened fire on a group of cattle traders along Jaluli border in Maheshpur upazila during a clash on January 30, 2016. Local people informed that members of BGB searched for a cattle trader. However they started to beat up the villagers who were sitting at the crossing of the road at Matila village by not finding the cattle trader. On the other hand, in protest the villagers went to the BGB camp. At that time, BGB members opened fire from inside the camp. As a result Rofiqul Islam died on the spot and Feroz Hossain, 28, succumbed to his wounds at Jhenidah Upazila Health Complex later.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.description: Moshiur Rahman was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight at Sundarban.

data.name: Shahabul Islam
data.description: Mohammad Ali, brother of Shahabul Islam told that on January 16, 2016 at around 1:30 am SI Abul Kalam arrested Shahabul from his house and beat him up there. He was then again beaten up at the bus Station at Choykuro intersection. At one stage, SI Abul Kalam took 9, 000 tk from Mohammad Ali for not torturing his brother. Shahabul was taken to Satkhira Police Station. Later he was taken to court and court granted one day remand. He was sent to jail then. On February 24, 2016 he was died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Motahar Hossain
data.description: The prime accused in Keraniganj school boy Mohammad Abdullah murder case killed in a gunfight with RAB in Chitakhola area of South Keraniganj. RAB said, a patrol team of the battalion challenged some motor bikers in Chitakhola at around 4:00am. Being challanged, the bikers opened fire on the batallion men that triggered a gunfight. One of the offenders was caught in the line of fire and became bullet-hurt. RAB members held the injured man and sent him to Mitford Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Arif
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight between DB Police and his cohorts in Madhabdi. The deceased was identified as Arif, son of Md Haklim of Birampur area in the upazila. Delwar Hossain, Officer in Charge of the DB, said law enforcers, being informed about a mugging, went to Saikadi area and saw three youths with a motorbike. Sensing the presence of the DBs, the youths started shooting at them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, the OC said. Arif was shot during the shootout while two others managed to flee. Arif was taken to Narsingdi General Hospital and died while being shifted to DMCH.

data.name: Akam Uddin Hia
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two alleged outlaws were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kushtia. The dead Akam Uddin Hia and Liakat Ali were top cadres of banned Gana Mukti Fouz, according to RAB. our cases, including two for murder, while Liakat in eight cases including three for murder. RAB-12 commanding officer Major Mosaddek Ibne Mujib said acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force raided Swastipur area around 3:00am when a secret meeting of the party was going on there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight the RAB official said. At one stage, Akam and Liakat were hit by bullets. The two were taken to kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.
