data.name: Ratan Miah
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police in Baddapara. Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station said, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers were taking preparation to commit a robbery in the area, a police team conducted drive there at around 4:10am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire and hurled brick chips at them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, triggering the gunfight the police official said. At one stage, Ratan was caught in the line of fire, while his other associates managed to flee. Ratan was admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where he died later.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: Kamal Hossain alias Jewel was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight.

data.name: Mohammad Masuk
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion as the special force claimed to have foiled a robbery attempt at a Sonali Bank branch in Dhamrai of Dhaka on February 19, 2016. Mohammad Masuk was a motor-cycle mechanic in the capital's Dholaikhal area and lived with his family in Bangshal, said his family members.

data.name: Chantu Mia
data.description: Chantu Mia, a murder accused was killed in a gunfight with police at Moheshpur in Jhenaidah on February 23, 2016. He was accused in a case of killing one Akimul of village Samanta, the police said. Moheshpur police officer-in-charge Aminul Islam Biplab said they had arrested Chantu from Kushtia on February 23, 2016. According to his statement, the police launched a drive to recover arms and ammunition on February 23, 2016. Around 3:30 am when they approached Balidapara area, the associates of Chantu opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. At one stage of the gunfight, his cohorts retreated from the spot and bullet-hit Chantu was found dead .

data.name: Bachchu Miah
data.description: An accused in the Habiganj four-kid murder case was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the district's Chunarughat upazila on February 25, 2016 eight days after law enforcers allegedly picked him up. The dead, Bachchu Mia, was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been traceless since being "detained by plainclothes officials" on February 17, according to his family members. The family has been making this allegation since the day after his "detention". Bachchu was one of the accused in the case filed with Bahubal Police Station in connection with the killing of the four schoolboys. Kazi Moniruzzaman, Company Commander of RAB-9, claimed that they had detained Shaheed, one of the accomplices of Bacchu. A team of the elite force conducted a drive in Dawargachh area to arrest Bacchu as Shaheed informed them that he was preparing to flee to India. Sensing the presence of RAB members, Bachchu along with his accomplices "opened fire on them". The RAB team fired back, triggering the "gunfight", the official said. Later, the bullet-hit body of Bachchu was found and sent to Chunarughat Upazila Health Complex for autopsy. But the family members turned down the Rab version. "My husband never touched a gun, let alone operate it. How come he engaged in gunfight?" said Bachchu's wife Rina Akther in a tearful voice. She alleged that two men in plainclothes on the afternoon of February 17 came to their house at Sundrateki village of the district looking for her husband. "After talking to them outside the house, my husband came back and told me that police asked him to meet them for some reasons. He did not tell me the reasons and went away, " After a while, she called her husband on his mobile phone, but he was not picking it up. At one stage, she found the phone switched off, Rina said. Contacted repeatedly, police could not provide any information on him, she added. Bachchu's mother Elai Bibi alleged that it was the RAB that picked up her son and killed him. "My son was not involved in the killings. Even if he had been involved in the murders, court was there to try him. Why did he have to die without trial?" she said.

data.name: Babul Matubbar
data.description: On February 3, 2016 at around 9:30 pm, a patrol team of Shahali Police Station of Dhaka, along with their informer Delwar went to Gudaraghat area and demanded extortion form a tea staler Babul Matubbar. As Babul Matubbar did not give money, police hit on the kerosene stove with stick and police informer Delwar pushed Babul onto the stove, which caught fire to Babul. Police left the scene leaving Babul in serious condition. Soon after the incident, Babul’s relatives took him to the burn unit of the Dhaka Medical College Hospital. On February 4, Babul Matubbar died in the hospital. Sub-Inspectors Mominur Rahman Khan, Sreedham Chandra Hawlader, Niazuddin Molla, Assistant Sub-Inspector Debendra Nath and Constable Jasimuddin were temporarily suspended due to this incident. An inquiry committee was set up to investigate into this incident. On February 7, 2016 the inquiry committee submitted its report to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police Commissioner. In the inquiry report, four police personnel of Shah Ali Police Station were recommended to be given departmental punishment. But the committee did not mention about extortion in the report. However, Babul Matubbar was accused as a drug peddler and the police informer Delwar and his five associates had been accused for his death.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Mahbub
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: On February 16, 2016 Anwar Hossain Mahbub ( Joint Secretary of Dhaka South City Corporation’s 23 numbered ward unit BNP, who was detained in jail, died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital. His relatives claimed that Anwar was severely tortured by police during remand after being arrested under a politically motivated case on January 15, 2016. His younger brother Maksud said that that Anwar Hossain Mahbub had not any physical problems or illness. His brother was severely beaten by police on the street while police were taking him to the police station after arrested Anwar. Hundreds people witnessed this incident. Later he was tortured in custody after taking him into remand.

data.name: Golam Mawla Mridha
data.description: An alleged Yaba trader was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Patuakhali town on February 29, 2016 . The deceased was identified as Golam Mawla Mridha\son of Nurul Haque Mridha of Kalikapur area in the town. He was an accused in a number of cases including an arms case, kM Tariqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station said. The'shootout' took place in Hatalia area of Kaliakpur village at 4. 00 am, . After the'gunfight' police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mawla and send it to Patuakhali General Hospital morgue for autopsy, the police official said. .

data.name: Zahirul Islam
data.description: Two accused in a double murder case were killed and another was injured in a'gunfight' with police at Nagoriakandi in Narsingdi municipality area on March 3, 2016. The deceased were Zahirul Islam 25, of Nagoriakandi area and Md Rakib, 24, of Tongi in Gazipur. The Officer-in-Charge of Narsingdi sadar police Mostafa Hossain said that the'gunfight' took place in the area at around 4. 00 am when the police conducted a raid to detain the murder accused. During the'gunfight', Zahirul, Rakib and Hossain Ali were injured, he OC said. They were taken to Narsindi General Hospital where the on-duty doctors pronounced Zahirul dead and referred Rakib and Hossain to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital, the police said. Rakib died on the way to DMCH while Rakib was admitted to DMCH.

data.name: Pias
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected military wing commander of banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Police in the capital's Khilgaon on March 8, 2016. Pias was the JMB's military wing chief in Dhaka region, DB claimed. DB Deputy Commissioner of Dhaka Metropolitan police Mashrukur Rahman Khaled said that Pias opened fire at the DB personnel when they conducted a drive at the rail tracks near Khidmah Hospital in Khilgaon at around 3. 30 am on March 8, 2016. In retaliation, police fired back that left Pias injured. He was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.description: Aminul Islam was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Kasundi area, Magura.

data.name: Obaidur Rahman
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Shalikha upazila of Magura on March 17, 2016. The dead is Obaidur Rahman of Hatbaria village in the upazila. According to police, Obaidur stood accussed in four robbery cases filed with different police stations in Magura and Jessore. He was the chief of an inter-district robber gang. Abu Jihad Fakhrul Alam Khan, OC of Shalikha Police Station, said that around eight to 10 robbers blocked Jessore-Magura highway near Ramkantopur bridge by placing logs for committing a robbery. As soon as police reached the spot, the criminal opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, police found Obaidur lying on the spot, while others fled. He was rushed to Shalikha Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Molla
data.description: On March 8, 2016 Police arrested Jasim Molla in a gunfight. During the gunfight, he got bullet wounded. Later on March 10, 2016 he died at the Pongu Hospital during operation.

data.name: Fazlu
data.description: Two alleged members of an outlawed were killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jugni Haat in Tangail on April 7, 2016. The dead are identified as Fazlu and his associate Uzzal. An incident of robbery took place in the area, a few days ago, locals said. On information that a gang of criminals was making preparation for committing another robbery in the area, a RAB team raided the village around 1:00 am, said Mohiuddin Faruqe, Rab-12 Company Commander in Tangail. Sensing the presence of theRAB members, criminals opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate.

The dead are Kamrul Hasan of West Shewrapara in the capital, and Yakub Ali of Mothbaria upazila in Pirojpur. The deceased were involved in the robbery of Shamim Jwellery shop in Baroiarhat Bazar of the upazila on February 26, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of Rab-7 .

data.name: Anowarul Islam
data.description: Bangladesh police killed four protestors on 4 April 2016. They were among hundreds of farmers protesting against acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation, for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District. The murdered victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam alias Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), and Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), as well as Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, have suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also gone and arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in the hospitals, as well as relatives of deceased victims.
data.source: The Asian Human Rights Commission on Apr 5, 2016

data.name: Kausar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Family members of Kausar alleged that DB police arrested Kausar from Laxmipur regional passport office on April 6. When the family went to DB office, the DB officisls they denied that they detained Kausar. Later, on April 7 they found Kausar's dead body in a hospital. Police said that police arrested Kausar on April 6 and went to conduct an operation to recover arms. There Kausar's cohorts tried to snatch him. As a result a gunfight ensued where Kausar was killed.

data.name: Amirul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A regional leader of the outlawed party Ganobahini was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Housing Mondal Filing Station area in Kushtia town on April 27, 2016. The deceased was identified as Amirul Islam, son of Jaber, a resident of village Sonaidanga under the Islamic University police station. Four policemen were injured during the gunfight.

data.name: Abdul Kadir
data.description: An alleged robber was killed and four policemen were injured in a'gunfight' in Suhilpur area of the Brahmanbaria sadar upazila on April 26, 2016. The deceased was identified as Abdul Kadir, 35 son of Nowab Mia of village Kalikacho of Sarail Upazila. Brahmanbaria sadar model Police Station OC Mainur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of the police went to the area while the robbers were being prepared for committing a robbery. Sensing presence of the police, the miscreants started firing at them and in retaliation the police also opened fire on the miscreants. . Abdul Kadir, an accused in six robbery cases, died on the spot during the gunfight.

data.name: Alam Khan
data.description: An alleged robber gang leader was killed in a'gunfight' between his cohorts and RAB in Chandpai range of the Sundarbans at East Zone on May 6, 2016.

data.name: Asadul Fakir
data.description: On May 9, 2016 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Mohobbat Kha
data.description: Mohobbat Kha was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Shoshoi village, Bijaynagar upazila, Brahmanbaria on May 25, 2016.

data.name: Din Islam
data.description: Family alleged that, DB police went to Din Islam's house. From there, they arrested him and later he was allegedly tortured to death, Earlier police asked for 5 lacs taka and told the family members to go to DB office. Family members went to DB police but they could not enter into the office. Later they got information that Din Islam died at Narsingdhi Sadar Hospital on May 19, 2016.

data.name: Abul Hashem
data.description: Abul Hashem was accused of a murder case. He allegedly killed his wife in demand of dowry. On May 29, 2016 police arrested him from Gulshan area of Dhaka and then took him to Sorishabari Police Station. The next day at around 4. 30 am he died. Police claimed that he committed suicide whereas family members alleged that he died due to torture.

data.name: Tariqul Islam
data.description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the joint force of police and Border Guard Bangladesh at Panchbibi in Jaipurhat on June 2, 2016. Meanwhile, Guljan Begum mother of the deceased, Tariqul Islam of village Ratanpur, claimed BGB personnel picked up her son on June 1, 2016 night before the death news reached her . She said that four BGB men picked up Tariqul around 10:00pm while he was playing carrom in front of the house. He was released from jail after getting bail in a case and came home on June 1, 2016. Police said Tariqul was accused of more than 11 cases related to narcotics filed with different police stations including Panchbib. Panchbibi police officer-in-charge Ashraful Islam said the joint force conducted drive at Ratanpur responding to a tip-off that drug peddlers were smuggling narcotics through the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers carried out attack on them with local weapons and opened fire. The law enforcers also retaliated that left Tariqul injured critically. His accomplices managed to flee.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a'gunfight' between his associates and police near the office of multinational pesticide company Syngenta at Panchbaria on Jessore-Magura Road on June 8, 2016. Police could not confirm his identity . Ilias Hossain, the Officer in Charge of Kotwli Police station said that the unidentified'robber', aged between 45 and 50, died on the spot in a'gunfight' between his cohorts and a police team while the gang was committing robbery on Jessore-Magura Road under Kotwali police station.'At around 2:40 am, when a patrol team of police reached the spot and a gunfight ensued, leaving the robber dead on the spot'. . The police recovered the body and took it to Jessore Medical College Hospital for post-mortem .

data.name: Kawsar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected member of the banned militant outfit, Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, who was allegedly involved in the attack on a Shia mosque in Bogra, was killed in a gunfight with police at Haripur of Shibganj in Bogra on June 8, 2016, police said. The deceased was identified as Kawsar, son of Amir Ali of Kamargram in Jaipurhat.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: An alleged leader of a doping gang, Nazrul Islam, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at a checkpoint in Prottasha bridge area under Turag Police Station at around 1:45am, said Lt Commander Md Shoaib, Deputy Director of RAB-1.

data.name: Kamal Parvez
data.description: A suspected mugger was killed in a gunfight with RAB in capital's Rampura. Abdul Karim, operation officer of RAB-3. said that Parvez was held with a gold bangle about 3. 00 pm on June 8, 2016 after he along with his three accomplices had mugged a woman at Taltola in Khilgaon. A team of RAB-03 then took him to Balurmath area to arrest his accomplices in the middle of the night. Sensing RAB's presence, criminals opened fire. Law enforcers fired shots in retaliation, leaving Parvez injured. He was declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Tuhin Arif
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A man was shot dead in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts at Malancha village in Gobindaganj upazila of Gaibandha at around 2:00 am. The incident happened as a team of police went to raid one Jahangir Hossain's house, being informed that JMB men had gathered there, said Mozammel Huq, OC of Gobindaganj Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, JMB men opened fire at them. Police retaliated with gunshots. . Within half an hour, members of the outlawed group fled the scene. Police later recovered a body, one detonator and explosives from the spot, he added. Law enforcers claimed that the dead was a JMB man but could not give his identity. The OC said the house owner, Jahangir, was an active member of the JMB man but could not give his identity. The OC said the house owner, Jahangir, was an active member of the JMB, who is on the run now.

data.name: Rakib
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged "gunfight" between his cohorts and police at Dighalia Dokkhinpara village in Lohagora upazila on June 11, 2016. The victim was identified as Rakib, son of Mokles Hossain, a resident of Chanchai village under the upazila. The OC of Lohagora police station, Biplop Kumar Saha, said that they responded to a tip that a gang of robbers were taking preparation to commit robbery in the vicinities. It was when a team of police launched a drive there at around 2:30 am. As the robbers sensed police presence, they opened gunshots prompting, police to strike back. A gunfight then broke out which left Rakib injured with bullets. He was rushed to Lohagora upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead. Other associates of the band managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In an incident at Kamalpur, a robbery suspect was killed in'gunfight' between the robbers and police around 2. 30 am. The incident took place while the gang was committing robbery on Rajarhat-Chuknagar Road at Kamalpur under Kotwali Police Station, said Ilias Hossain, OC, Kotwali Police Station. Yusuf Ali, Medical Officer, Jessore Medical College Hospital, said the bullet-hit youth was brought to the hospital dead around 3:00 am on June 16, 2016.

data.name: Rubel Hossain
data.description: A youth, accused of killing a police officer, was killed in a'gunfight' after his arrest on June 15, 2016 at Pakshey Natunpara under Ishwardi upazila. The deceased, identified as Rubel Hossain, son of Idris Ali of village Diar Baghoil, was the prime suspect in the killing of Assistant town Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sujaul Islam. . Assistant town sub-inspector Md Sujaul Islam of Pakshey police camp was killed at a turmeric field near the Pakshey Rail Station area on October 4, 2015 when he was on duty in the area. The body was recovered from the spot on October 5 and a case was filed with the incident.

data.name: Jibon Mia
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a'shootout' between his cohorts and police on Dhaka-Sylhet highway near Bariura Bridge at Sarail in Brahmanbaria on June 15, 2016. A police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:00 am, said Rupak Kumar Saha, OC of Sarail Police Station. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. Jibon Mia, 32, son of Mahram Ali of Shahbazpur village, was caught in the line of fire while others managed to flee. Police took injured Jibon to Sarail Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: Two people allegedly involved in the killing of AK Azad, a newly elected Union Parishad chairman, were killed in a "shootout" with police in Joypurhat on June 14, 2016. The deceased are: Sohel Rana, son Nurul Islam of Sawalpara, and Munir Hossain, son of Lutfur Rahman of Kuchkuri village under Joypurhat Sadar upazila. The "gunfight", which took place at around 4:00 am, also left three law enforcers injured, police claimed. Mollah Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Police of Joypurhat, said on information that criminals had gathered in Gopalpur to attack the house of slain AK Azad, law enforcers raided the village. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them and also swooped on them with sticks and sharp weapons. The law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, leaving the two dead on the spot, claimed the district police. The bodies were sent to Joypurhat General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Munir Hossain
data.description: Two people allegedly involved in the killing of AK Azad, a newly elected Union Parishad chairman, were killed in a "shootout" with police in Joypurhat on June 14, 2016. The deceased are: Sohel Rana, son Nurul Islam of Sawalpara, and Munir Hossain, son of Lutfur Rahman of Kuchkuri village under Joypurhat Sadar upazila. The "gunfight", which took place at around 4:00 am, also left three law enforcers injured, police claimed. Mollah Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Police of Joypurhat, said on information that criminals had gathered in Gopalpur to attack the house of slain AK Azad, law enforcers raided the village. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them and also swooped on them with sticks and sharp weapons. The law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, leaving the two dead on the spot, claimed the district police. The bodies were sent to Joypurhat General Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Mozaffar Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mozaffar Sana, believed to have connection with ultra-left party, was killed in'gunfight' with police at Chara Battala of Tala upazila in Satkhira on June 10, 2016. The police said Mozaffar Sana was a regional leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party and accused in at least 18 cases. He was son of Gaffar Sana of village Dohar in the upazila. Satkhira police said during a special drive, a team of police, led by OC of Tala police station Sagir Mia, signaled a Jethuya Bazaar-bound motorcycle carrying Sana to stop in the area around 2. 30 am. In response, three motorcycle riders blasted two crude bombs and opened fire at police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Two of the three managed to flee leaving behind injured Sana, who was declared dead at upazila health complex.

data.name: Aidul Sagor
data.description: A "criminal" was killed in an alleged shootout between his cohorts and the Rapid Action Battalion at Agargaon in the capital on June 17, 2016. The dead, Aidul alias Mama Sagor, 25, was an "extortionists" in Karwan Bazar area and accused in several arms cases, claimed the elite force. The "gunfight" took place around 1:45 am after a RAB patrol team approached a group of criminals near the Sher-e-Bangla Agricultural University, said Lt Col Mohiuddin Ahmed, commanding officer of the RAB-2. Instantly, the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots. At one point, all the attackers except Aidul, who was shot in the incident, fled. The RAB members rescued and took him to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Salim Howlader
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Amanatganj Bazaar of village Baliatali of Muladi upazila in Barisal on June 1, 2016. The deceased was resident of Safipur union of Muladi; he was the leader of ‘so called’ Salim Bahini, a robber gang. Muladi police station officer-in-charge Matiur Rahman said that they arrested Salim on May 31, 2016 afternoon as he was accused in 11 cases including 4 murder cases. The gunfight took place as Salim’s associates attacked the police and tried to snatch Salim from them while they were going to recover arms along with the miscreant, the OC said. Salim was shot dead during the gunfight, he said, adding that the body was sent to Barisal Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital for post-mortem examinations.

data.name: Tarek Hossain Milu
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Dhaka Metropolitan Police’s Detective Branch Deputy Commissioner Mashrukur Rahman Khaled said two JMB members were killed in a gunfight at Pallabi in Dhaka early on June 7, 2016. Tarek was involved in the killing of Rajshahi University English professor AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee and Sultan was involved in the Bogra Shia mosque attack, he claimed. DMP Additional Commissioner and Counter-Terrorism unit head Monirul Islam at a press conference at its office said that the two were northern-district-based JMB leaders. He said police had information that some JMB men were heading for Dhaka. They encountered a police team near Lohar Bridge at Kalshi in Pallabi with firing gunshots. Police retaliate with firing which triggered a gunfight, leaving the two injured, he said. Pallabi Police Station Sub-Inspector Anwar Hossain said that the ‘gunfight’ took place at some time between 2:30am and 3:00am where the duo received bullet wounds. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where duty physicians declared them dead around 6:00am.

data.name: Jamal Uddin
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: In Rajshahi, a JMB operative, who allegedly supplied bomb in the ‘suicidal’ attack on an Ahmadiyya mosque at Baghmara in Rajshahi, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Godagari in the district early June 7, 2016. The deceased was a resident of Shibganj in Chapainawabganj. Godagari police officer-in-charge SM Abu Forhad said Jamal was the accomplice of Tarek Rahman, who caused explosions at a mosque of Ahmadiyya Muslims on December 25 last year and he himself died on the spot. Police arrested Jamal in Babu Dying area of Chapainawabganj around 11:00pm on June 6, 2016. Upon his information, police conducted a drive to arrest another accomplice at Farajpur in Godagari in the early hours of June 7, 2016. Accomplices of Jamal opened fire on police at that time, the OC claimed, when the law enforcers also retaliated triggering a gunfight. Jamal died on the spot during the gunfight. The body was sent to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy, No information found from the family of jamal Uddin

data.name: Rubel
data.description: Abdul Kader, Officer-in-Charge of Nasirnagar Police Station, claimed that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in Tullahpara village. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. Police fired back triggering a gunfight. Seriously injured Rubel was taken to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead

data.name: Golam Faizullah Fahim
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Hizb-ut Tahrir, an Islamist fundamentalist organization
data.description: Golam Faizullah Fahim was killed in a "shootout" with police on June 18, 2016. Police claimed miscreants sensing their presence opened fire. Police fired back, triggering a gunfight. After a while, police found Faizullah lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Taken to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, he was pronounced dead. However, Locals captured the youth while he along with two others was trying to flee after hacking Ripon Chakraborty, a lecturer at Government Nazimuddin University College, on June 14, 2016. He was placed on a 10-day remand in an attempted murder case filed by police on June 17, 2016. Earlier on June 16, the Madaripur police chief said that during interrogation Faizullah claimed to be a member of Hizb-ut Tahrir, an outfit banned in October 2009 for public security.

data.name: Kamal Hossain Sarder
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Magura Sadar upazila on June 19, 2016. After the "gunfight", police recovered the body of Kamal Hossain Sarder, 40, a leader of the district-based inter-district robber gang, from Moghirdhal area on Kushtia-Khulna highway. Locals later helped the law enforcers to identify the deceased. Kamal, son of Afsar Hossain of Shawladanga in Magura Sadar upazila was accused in five robbery cases filed with different police stations of the district, reports quoting police. Azmol Huda, officer-in-charge (OC) of Magura Sadar Police station said that they had information that a group of robbers was taking preparation for a robbery by blocking the highway with logs. The robbers opened fire on the law enforcers when a patrol team of the Sadar Police Station raided the area around 3:30am. The "gunfight" took place between police and the robbers when the law enforcers retaliated. . At one stage Kamal Hossain Sarder found dead

data.name: Shariful Sakib
data.identity: Allegedly affiliated with the Ansarullah Bangla Team, an Islamist militant organization
data.description: The prime suspect in bloggers -- Avijit Roy and Niladri Chattopadhyay Niloy -- murders was killed in a "gunfight" at Meradiya Banshpotti around 2:00am with DB police in Khilgaon of Dhaka on June 19, 2016. Hailing from Khulna, deceased Shariful was a top organiser of banned militant group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), said Masudur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of DMP. Police announced Tk 5 lakh bounty on him earlier when they found evidence of his presence at the crime scene at TSC in Dhaka University where Avijit was hacked to death on February 26 last year 2015, according to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police website. His direct involvement was found in a number of killings including blogger Avijit and Niladri Niloy.

data.name: Abdus Sattar
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts in Sarail upazila of Brahmanbaria on June 21, 2016. The dead is Abdus Sattar of College Para village in the upazila. Rupok Kumar Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said acting on a tip-off that some robbers, including Sattar, were preparing to commit robbery in Gonara village, police raided the village around 1:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight", the police official added. Sattar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Others managed to flee.

data.name: Mohammad Dulal Mridha
data.description: On June 23, 2016 Mohammad Dulal Mridha was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Banaripara upazila, Barisal.

data.name: Masud
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Char Chandia union of Sonagazi upazila on June 25, 2016. Shafayet Ahmed Fahim, camp commander of RAB-7 said, on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing for committing robbery, a team of the elite force conducted a drive in the union around 2:00 am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Masud was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Pranto Chandra Dey
data.description: Kamrul Islam, Officer in Chrage of Mymensingh Police Station claimed that Pranto Chandra Dey of Mymensingh town's Golpukurpar area, died after suffering a heart attack. Pranto's family members and neighbours, however, said he was "innocent" and might have been "tortured to death".

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.description: A man, who was allegedly abducted on July 1, 2016, was killed in a'gunfight' with police in Jessore on July 2, 2016. The deceased is farmer Faruk Hossain, 42, son of Abu Bakar of Daulatdihi village under Kotwali Police Station, said family sources. Ilias Hossain, Officer-in-Charge, said an unidentified'robber' died at Khulna Medical College Hospital after he was shot in a'gunfight' between his cohorts and the law enforcers. The incident took place when a gang was committing robbery at Kanaitala on Rajarhat-Chuknagar road around 2:30 am, the OC said, adding that Faruk was killed in firing by the robbers.

data.name: Ibnul Islam Parvej
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An Islami Chhatra Shibir activist was killed in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts in Uttar-Kastasagra village of Jhenidah Sadar upazila on July 2, 2016. The dead, Ibnul Islam Parvej, 27, was the son of Jahangir Hossain of Bananipara in the district town. Parvej was the former president of Jhenidah Sadar unit Shibir, pro-Jamaat-e-Islami student body. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Jhenidah Sadar Police Station, said a police team was patrolling Porahati village. When their van reached near the Madhupur graveyard, some criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Parvej was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Parvej's father Jahangir Hossain said some plainclothes men picked up his son from a house of Mohammadia Housing Society in the capital's Mohammadpur area on June 16. Jahangir claimed that a week ago, he gave Tk 5 lakh to police as bribe for his son's release. But they did not free his son. Instead, they killed him. Jahangir, however, declined to say who took the bribe. Contacted, OC Hasan said they would look into the matter if Jahangir told them the name. Lutfar Rahman, grandfather of the victim, claimed that Parvej was not involved in any subversive activity. He was not facing any case.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Two suspects in the Mitu murder case have been killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rangunia upazila of Chittagong. The dead are Nurul Islam alias Rashed, 27, of Islampur and Mohammad Nurunnabi alias Nabi, 28, of the upazila's Rajanagar area. However, Rashed's family alleged that police had picked up both of them on 23 June, 2016 and "cooked up the shootout story after murdering them". Recently on June 29, 2016 the law enforcement agency had issued a ban on the two leaving the country. Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir of Rangunia Police Station said acting on a tip off, the Detective Branch (DB) of Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) raided Ranirhat around 3:10am on July 5, 2016 to arrest the "killers" of Mitu, wife of SP Babul Akter. When the police reached Thandachhari area, criminals, who were hiding, opened fire and swooped on the law enforcers with sharp weapons. Police retaliated with gunfire, triggering the "gunfight", said the OC. The incident left Rashed and Nabi injured. They were declared dead on arrival at a local health complex, said DB Assistant Commissioner Md Kamruzzaman, who is also the investigation officer of the Mitu murder case.

data.name: Abdul Bari
data.description: A freedom fighter was allegedly beaten to death by some railway police personnel after he had locked into an altercation with them over detaining his nephew in a block raid at Jamalpur railway station, on July 11, 2016. The victim, Abdul Bari, 68, was a resident of Hatchandra vicinity of Jamalpur municipality. He was a veteran freedom fighter and a retired member of Bangladesh Army, said Md Safiqul Islam, commander of Jamalpur Zila Muktijoddha Sangsad. Victim’s family and witnesses said Bari went to General Railway Police station in Jamalpur after being informed that the police had detained his nephew, Majaharul Islam Babu, an MBA student of Rajshahi University, for travelling without a ticket. The officer-in-charge of Jamalpur railway police station, Goura Chandra Majumdar, said that Babu was detained by railway authority as he boarded a Bangabandhu Bridge-bound train from Chittagong, without a ticket. Bari was trying to get his nephew freed from the police custody. At one stage of hot altercation, Bari punched one Tapon Barua, a constable of the police station, witnesses said. The constable then indiscriminately punched on the face of the FF, causing him to bleed severely from his nose and mouth, said FF Haider Ali, the commander of Jamalpur sadar upazila muktijodha command, quoting some witnesses. Bari fell on the floor, according to the witnesses. He was rushed to Jamalpur General Hospital and then was moved to the Combined Military Hospital in Mymensingh, as his condition deteriorated, around 12. 00pm. ‘There were injury marks on his face and considering his critical condition, he was referred to CMH of Mymensingh, ’ said Mushair-ul Islam, Civil Surgeon of Jamalpur. The FF succumbed to his injuries around 2:45pm, said FF Haider Ali.

data.name: Jasim Uddin Khokon
data.description: Jasim Uddin Khokon was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Ramu upazila, Cox's Bazar.

data.name: Lokman Miah
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and police at Mirpukurpar in Brahmanbaria’s Kasba upazila on July 16, 2016. The deceased was Lokman Miah, 32, of the upazila.

data.name: Tareq Hossain
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a'gunfight' between police and his cohorts at Makardhos village in Sadar upazila of Laxmipur on July 17, 2016. The deceased was identified as Tareq Hssain, 32, a member of criminal gang'Bashar Bahini' and son of Abdur Shukur alias Siraj Miah, a resident of the same village.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged ‘gunfight’ with police at Akhaura in Brahmanbaria, early on July 18, 2016. The deceased was identified as Saiful Islam, son of Idris Mia, of Jangal. He was wanted in six cases, including, five for robbery, police said. The officer-in-charge of Akhaura police, Md Mosharraf Hussain, said that police responded to a tip as a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit robbery near Tanmandal bridge. A team of Akhaura police conducted a drive there, he said. As police approached the spot around 2:15am, the robbers, sensing police presence, opened gunshots on them prompting police to retaliate, triggering a gunfight, Mosharraf added. At one stage, a number of robbers jumped into the adjacent canal and fled, Mosharraf said. Police then found the body of Saiful on the scene.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: An under trial prisoner of Munshiganj jail has died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on July 22, 2016. The family of the deceased Abdul Karim alleged that he was tortured by the complainant before being handed over to the police, who also beat him in jail afterwards. Karim, 35, of Adhariatola village under Munshiganj Sadra upazila, was sent to DMCH for treatment from Munshiganj jail on July 21, 2016 due to a severe chest pain, said Farid Uddin Rubel, jailer of Munshiganj jail. He claimed that when Karim was sent to the jail from the police station on July 11, he was already physically sick. Karim was first admitted to Munshiganj General Hospital for treatment and later sent to DMCH, the jailer added. Karim's wife Moyna Begum said a house was being built by their neighbour Md Shamim; Karim along with others wanted some money from him for arranging a picnic earlier this month. Later, Shamim and his relative Khorshed Alam took Karim to Shamim's office at Adhariatola and beat him mercilessly and handed him to the cops on July 10, she alleged. She also alleged that a sub-inspector of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station tortured Karim at the station and damaged a part of his ear. Shamim also filed an extortion case against Karim the same day and police sent him to Munshiganj jail on July 11, she said. Moyna alleged that Karim's younger brother Abdus Salam Khan, who was also detained in Munshiganj jail in another case, told her Karim was groaning due to stomach pain on July 22, but when they called a doctor from the local hospital he said that Karim had no problem. Sonjoy Kumar Poddar, a doctor of Munshiganj General Hospital, said as Karim was seriously sick, he was sent to DMCH for better treatment. When asked about the reason behind his sickness, the doctor said that they did not perform any test on Karim before sending him to DMCH. Yunus Ali, officer-in-charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Statiion, refuted the allegation, saying that police did not torture him.

data.name: Mizan Ali
data.description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Kalia upazila of Narail on July 24, 2016. The dead is Mizan Ali alias Mizan Kazi, 38, of Bagudanga village in the upazila. According to police, Mizan was leading the robber gang. He stood accused in at least a dozen cases, including murder, rape and robbery, with different police stations in Narail and Bagerhat. Mahabubur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Naragati Police Station in Kalia, said a team of Naragati police, led by Sub-inspector Mohiuddin, with the help of Gopalganj police arrested Mizan from his hideout in Gopalganj on July 23, 2016 evening. As per Mizan's statement, the team with him was going to his village home in Bagudanga to recover firearms at night. Around 2:30am, accomplices of Mizan attacked the police van to snatch Mizan when it reached near Balurmath in Pohordanga, the OC added. The criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Mizan was caught in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody. Others managed to escape, the police official told this correspondent over the phone.

data.name: Oliullah Mollah
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP man was killed in a so-called gunfight with police in Satkhira July 10, 2016. The dead, Oliullah Mollah, 40, was the general secretary of Kashimari Union BNP in Shyamnagar upazila, said his brother Habibullah Mollah. The alleged shootout took place in Ganghati area of the upazila around 3:30am. Sub-inspector (SI) Kamal Hossain of Satkhira SP office said a police team, led by SI Sudhangshu Kumar Mondal, was patrolling Ganghati Chorakhali Culvert area. During the time, a number of people were speeding through the area on bikes. Police asked them to pull over but they did not stop. Rather, they started to hurl bombs and open fire on the law enforcers. When policemen retaliated with gunshots, one of the attackers was shot and fell on the ground. Others fled, said the police official. The bullet-hit man was taken to Shyamnagar hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead. However, Oliullah's elder brother Habibullah said the man was innocent. Oliullah had been working as a supervisor at a garments factory in Dhaka for long. He left home for Dhaka at 6:00pm on July 9, 2016. He was travelling by a bus bound for Dhaka from Kaliganj. Habibullah claimed that police picked up Oliullah from the bus in Devhata Parulia area. Later, he came to know that his brother had been killed in police firing, he added. Police denied the allegation.

data.name: Bagha Jewel
data.description: Tongi police claimed that an accused of several cases including murder, robbery and extortion succumbed to gunshot wounds getting caught in a crossfire right after his arrest on July 21, 2016. Bagha Jewel, 25, son of late Sentu Ahmed of Brahmanbaria's Bancharampur upazila, was arrested at Duttapara-Bonomala road in Tongi of Gazipur during a raid around 3:45am following a tip-off, claimed Tongi Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Firoz Talukder. His accomplices right afterwards shot at police, who retaliated, leading to a gunfight, he alleged, adding that the accomplices fled and Jewel was sent to Tongi Sadar Hospital and shifted to the National Institute Of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Johurul Islam
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Salimpur village in Ishwardi upazila on July 29, 2016. The deceased was identified as Johurul Islam, 30, son of Borat Ali Mondol of Punkharua village in Ullapara upazila of Sirajganj. He was allegedly the ringleader of a gang of robbers in Sirajganj and also the regional chief of "Johurul Gang", RAB said.

data.name: Ramzan Ali
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the law enforcers in Moheshpur upazila of the district on July 30, 2016. The deceased, Ramzan Ali, 45, was son of Kuran Mondal of Krishnapur village in the upazila. However, Ramzan's sister Sumita Khatun told that her brother used to live in a rented house at Khoiyertola area of Jessore Sadar. On July 28, 2016 a group of people in plainclothes introduced themselves as police blindfolded and handcuffed him and took him away with them.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be known immediately, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing. Moazzem said acting on a tip-off that some criminals gathered in a mango orchard of one Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30am, a joint team of Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. Other criminals managed to flee.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Nazrul Islam alias Hasan alias was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rajshahi city. He was an alleged member of banned militant outfit of Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) .

data.name: Shafiul Islam
data.description: Two "militants, " including Shafiul Islam who was among the Sholakia attackers, were killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and Shafiul's associates in Mymensingh, RAB and police claimed. Identity of the second victim could not be known immediately. But Commanding Officer of RAB-14 Lt Col Shariful Islam claimed he was an associate of Shafiul and was among those who attacked the RAB convoy. The RAB official said Shafiul, also known as Saiful, had been undergoing treatment at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) under Rab custody since he was caught from the attack scene in Kishoreganj on the Eid day. After doctors released him August 4, 2016 he was being taken to Kishoreganj to be handed over to the police, he said. They came under attack at a place in Nandail when the attackers tried to snatch away Shafiul by hurling bombs and opening fires, he claimed. A gun battle ensued when RAB fired back, leaving the two hit by bullets, he added. Nandail police said the "gunfight" happened around 11:00pm near a brickfield at Dangrigoshpala area under Chandipasha union, some three to four kilometres east of Nandail upazila headquarters. Arif Mohammad Ziauddin, emergency medical officer at Nandail Upazila Health Complex, told that the two were taken dead around midnight. Shafiul is originally from Dinajpur.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Liton
data.description: In Dhaka, the "gunfight" took place between a group of seven to eight alleged drug peddlers and Rapid Action Battalion members at Postogola in Kadamtoli area around 4:15am on August 12, 2016. Delwar Hossain Liton was found lying on the spot after the incident, said Jahangir Hossain Matubbar, commanding officer of RAB-10. He was taken to Mitford Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, the RAB official added. Delwar's wife Rozina told that her husband's name is Liton Miah, 26, and he was a local drug peddler. But he never had any arms in his possession, she claimed. Someone called her husband and took him away from Chittagong Road area on August 11, 2016 evening and since then, he was missing, she added. Delwar's body was sent to Sir Salimullah Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Shahidul Islam Pancha
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members at Falsi Battala in Jhenidah's Harinakundo upazila on August 12, 2016. The deceased is Shahidul Islam Pancha, 42, of Pardakhalpur village in the upazila. Jhenidah RAB-6 Commander Monir Ahmed said a RAB patrol team had gone to Falsi Battala area after being informed that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery there. As the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire, prompting the elite force members to retaliate. Shahidul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The other robbers, however, managed to flee.

data.name: Anarul Sana
data.description: Anarul Sana, an alleged robber, was killed in Koyra upazila in a "gunfight" with police on August 12, 2016. He stood accused in 10 cases, including robbery, said police. Anarul was arrested from Koyra Bazar area around 2:35pm on August 11, 2016 said Sheikh Shamsher Ali, officer-in-charge of Koyra Police Station. Later, based on information he provided during questioning, police took him along with them on a raid in Kharkharia river area inside the Sundarbans to recover firearms, the OC said. As soon as law enforcers reached there, Anarul's cohorts opened fire, triggering a gunfight that left Anarul and three policemen injured, he said. Anarul was taken to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, Shamsher added. The injured police members were undergoing treatment at the hospital.

data.name: Sadir Miah
data.description: A sub-inspector was closed over allegation of police beating up an old man to death in Moulvibazar on August 11, 2016. The victim is Sadir Miah, 60, of Kalenga village in Kamalganj upazila of the district. His son Shipon Miah is an accused in a case filed with Kamalganj Police Station, said Mullah Md Sahin, assistant superintendent of police of Moulvibazar. Police went to raid Sadir Miah's house to nab Shipon, he said. Sadir's wife Safina Begum said a police team carried out the raid around 4:00am on August 11, 2016. Not seeing Shipon at home at the time, the law enforcers dragged his father out and beat him up. Having been beaten severely, her husband died on the spot, Safina added. Local people brought out a procession and held a rally in the area to protest the incident. Holding police responsible for the killing, they issued a 24-hour ultimatum for suspension of Sub-inspector Nazrul Islam.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be known immediately, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing on August 7, 2016 noon. Moazzem said acting on a tip-off that some criminals gathered in a mango orchard of one Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30am, a joint team of Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. Other criminals managed to flee. Six policemen were injured in the "gunfight" and they took first aid at the RMCH, claimed the SP. Police also claimed to have recovered a pistol, three bullets, 13 crude bombs, several sharp weapons and some jihadi books from the spot.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Biswas
data.description: On August 13, 2016 Abdur Rashid Biswas was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police. However, family members of Abdur Rashid claimed that he was picked up by plain clothes men claiming to be members of police at around 9. 30 pm on August 12, 2016.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.description: On August 15, 2016 Mohammad Shamim alias Fokir was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Rahis Miah
data.description: An alleged drug smuggler was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Konabari in Kosba on August 24, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rahis Miah, 48, son of late Sawdagor Ali Fakir, of Pathariatek village in Akhaura upazila. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kosba police station Mohiuddin Ahammed said tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in the area when a gang of drug smugglers, including Rahis, was staying there at about 1. 30 am.

data.name: Mukul Munshi
data.description: On August 27, 2016 Mukul Munshi aged 40 was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-12.

data.name: Abu Bakar
data.description: A suspected ringleader of a Sunderban-based robbery gang was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between robbers and Rapid Action Battalion members in the forest in Khulna on August 26, 2016 morning. The deceased was identified as Abu Bakar, 40, suspected chief of ‘Saijya Bahini’ in the Sunderban, RAB said. Tipped off that a gang of robbers gathered in Phultala area to commit robbery, a RAB team raided the area around 7:30am, Khulna RAB-6 operation officer Zahid Hossain said. Sensing RAB members’ presence, the criminals opened fire on the battalion personnel, who retaliated. At one stage, the robbers fled the scene and searching the spot, RAB men found a bullet-hit body,

data.name: Sanwar Hossain Sanu
data.description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Kamarkhand upazila of Sirajganj on August 25, 2016. They are Sanwar Hossain Sanu, 32, of Bharanga village of the upazila, and Lutful Ali, 55, of Ankutia village in Pabna's Chatmohar. The two stood accused in eight criminal cases with different police stations, RAB said. Shahabuddin Khan, commander of RAB-12 in Sirajganj, said RAB members arrested Farhad Ali, one of the prime accused in Awami League leader Mahbub Alam Milton murder case, on August 9. On June 19 this year, Milton, also an UP member in Kamarkhand, was hacked to death by criminals. A case was filed with Kamarkhand Police Station in this connection. The elite force later took over the charge of the case, sources said. During interrogation, Farhad mentioned some names, including Sanwar and Lutful, saying that they were involved in the murder, RAB commander said in a press release. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB from Sirajganj camp went to Jamtoil station around 3:00am on August 25, 2016 where Milon murder suspects were hiding to nab them, he said. When the team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB men then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". During the gun battle, Sanwar and Lutful were hit by bullets. They were taken to Sirajganj General Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Khaled Hasan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected top leader of "Neo JMB" and another key operative of the organisation were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bogra's Sherpur upazila on August 29, 2016. The deceased militants were identified as Khaled Hasan, 30, alias Badar Mama, and Ripon, 29, alias Golam Tareque alias Abu Ibrahim. They were allegedly involved in several militant attacks in the country's northern region last year. Khaled, a military commander of the northern region, masterminded the attack on Italian physician Piero Parolari, the bomb attack at Kantaji Mandir, the attack on Iskcon temple and looting of a petrol pump in Dinajpur in November and December last year, said Gaziur Rahman, senior assistant superintendent of police in Bogra.

data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)

data.name: Nurunnabi
data.description: On August 19, 2016 at midnight, a group of police led by the two Sub-Inspectors of Kotwali Police Station, Tareq and Tofazzal raided Golzar’s house at Birbhodra Balahati village of Mahiganj in Rangpur town and arrested him under a motorbike stealing case. Later two police officers demanded one hundred twenty thousand taka bribe to Golzars’ family. At one stage, his family gave the police eighty thousand taka and they informed the police that rest of the money would be given the next day. But this was not acceptable to Golzar’s elder brother Nurunnabi and he entangled in an altercation with police in this regard. This enraged the police and apprehended Nurunnabi in allegation of stealing. Police also demanded money for him. He was severely beaten by police as he was unable to pay. At once, Nurunnabi fell on the ground and died on the spot.

data.name: Sagar
data.description: An alleged snatcher was killed and another sustained bullet wounds in police firing in the capital's Dhanmondi on September 6, 2016. Law enforcers also nabbed their accomplice Bashar when he was trying to flee the spot. Police said the dead is Sagar, 26, a listed snatcher. The injured is Hazrat Ali, 28. The trio in a private car attempted snatch valuables from a rickshaw passenger near Matsya Bhaban intersectionn around 6. 00 am, said Maruf Hossain Sorder, Deputy Commissioner (Ramna division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said on information, a patrol team of Shahbagh police chased them to Road-3 in Dhanmondi. At one stage, the criminals stopped the car there as police put a barricade on the road. Abu Bakar Siddique, OC of Shahbagh Police Station, said when the criminals were trying to flee the scene, police opened fire, injuring Sagar, Hazrat and Bashar caught from the spot. Sagar and Hazrat were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Sagar dead.

data.description: An alleged snatcher was killed and another sustained bullet wounds in police firing in the capital's Dhanmondi on September 6, 2016. data.name: Lal Mia
data.description: On September 2, 2016 Lal Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police. However, family members claimed that he was picked up by police before the gunfight on September 01, 2016.

data.name: Fadur Ali
data.description: A man, accused in several murders cases, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and police in Bajitpur upazila on September 15, 2016. The deceased, Fadur Ali alias RIpon, 35, was son of late Morshed Mia of Dari Ghaghatia village in the upazila. Police arrested Fadur from Narsingdi's Belabo upazila on September 14, 2016. Later, police along with Fadur raided Satirchar village to recover firearms around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Fadur's associates opened fire on the policemen prompting them to retaliate, triggering a "gunfight". Fadur was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, police added.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: An alleged leader of a gang of robbers group was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" in Hatirjheel area on September 12, 2016. The deceased was identified Al Amin, 28, who had several cases.

data.name: Anwar
data.description: The "gunfight" took place when the robbers were planning to commit a robbery in Shreekhondia village, said Mohoshinul Quadir, OC of Ashulia police. when a police patrol team reached the spot around 4:30 am, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back and thus triggering a gunfight between them, the OC said. Anward died instantly, he mentioned, adding that Anwar was accused in at least five cases including of murder and robbery.

data.name: Humayun Kabir
data.description: An alleged abductor was killed in a gunfight with policemen in Pirganj upazila of Rangpur on September 20, 2016. The deceased was identified as Humayun Kabir, 27, son of Abdus Sattar of Dhefulia village under Barisal Sadar upazila. A police team arrested five people including Humayun Kabir from Chandipur village on charge of abducting a trader on September 19, 2016 evening, said Rezaul Karim, officer in charge (OC) of Pirganj Police Station in Rangpur. "Later police went to Chandipur village taking Humayun with them to recover arms as per his statement. "As police arrived there, Humayun's cohorts snatched him away, firing several gunshots. Police also fired back, leaving Humayun dead on the spot.

data.name: Rakibul Islam
data.description: A union parishad member, who is also the prime accused in the abduction and killing of schoolboy Mahfuz Alam Sajib, was killed in a'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion members in a mango orchard at Gobindapur under Damurhuda in Chuadanga on September 18, 2016. The killed was identified as Rakibul Islam aged 28, son of Iman Ali of village Alukdia under Chuadanga Sadar. He was a member of Alukdia union parishad and went in hiding after the abduction and killing of Sajib.

data.name: Farid Khokon
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Mohammad Ali
data.description: On September 7, 2016 Sub Inspector of the Detective Branch (DB) of Police at Norshingdi, Khokon Chandra Sarkar conducted a raid at Mohammad Ali’s grocery shop on suspicion over the selling of drugs in the shop, in Matialpara area under Belabo Upazila in Norshingdi District. During the raid, Mohammad Ali was beaten with an iron rod and also hit with bricks when he denied the allegation of selling drugs. Later he was taken to Belabo Police Station and a case was filed against him after police confiscated 100 Yaba. Witnesses and the family members of Mohammad Ali said that at around 3:00 pm Mohammad Ali was brought to Norshingdi District Hospital with severe injuries and he died there in the evening. The Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of Police (DB) in Norshingdi, Saidur Rahman said that Mohammad Ali was in good health when he was arrested. Later he was taken to the hospital when he became sick and as a result he died while was under treatment.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A JAMAAT-E-ISLAMI activist was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Satkania upazila in Chittagong on October 16, 2016 morning. The deceased, identified as Abul Bashar, 40, son of the late Dudu Mia of Kanchana area of the upazila, was involved with Jamaat-e-Islami, police said. According to them, eight police personnel were also injured in the gunfight and they had been given primary treatment at the local health complex. Farid Uddin Khandakar, Officer-in-Charge of Satkania Police Station, said a police team arrested Bashar at Banshkhali upazila October 15, 2016 evening. After primary interrogation, police conducted a drive along with the arrestee in Chhonkhola area of Eochia union around 6. 30 am on October 16, 2016, when sensing their presence, his cohorts opened fire at the police force, he said. Police also fired back triggering a gunfight and at one point Bashar was injured with bullet, he added. Police sent him to Satkania Upazila Health Complex where duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An armed member of United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) was killed in a gunfight with a team of joint forces in Khagrachhari Sadar upazila on October 14, 2016 evening. However, the identity of the victim could not be known immediately. Lt. Col Mohammad Rashidul Hasan, director of ISPR, told that the forces came to know that some 15-20 armed members of UPDF were in a secret meeting with their party chief at Kutukchhari. They were planning to commit subversive activities in different areas. After the meeting, they returned to their den, the ISPR said in a statement. A team of the forces went to Datkupia and Bhuachhari areas around 6:00 pm, found the den and surrounded it, the statement added. Sensing the presence of the forces members, the criminals opened fire. The joint forces then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. During the gunfight, a member of the UPDF was killed. The others managed to flee, the statement said.

data.name: Manik Mia
data.description: On October 13, 2016 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police after 26 hours of his arrest.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Family alleged that, a group of plainclothes men picked up Delwar Hossain on Octobr 9 at around 11. 00 pm from a road near to his house. The next day, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at early in the morning. Police said that he was killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Shah Alam Nayan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Shah Alam Nayan aged 42, organising secretary of Savar municipality unit Jubo Dal was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police. SM Kamruzzaman, OC of Savar Police Station, said a team picked him up from Mohammadpur in the capital and took him to a nursery of Krishibid Foundation in Birulia area around 2:30 am to recover firearms. Sensing presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the police, who also retaliated. At one stage, Nayan was shot, police said. He was whisked off to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. Police claimed he used to run a drug racket in Savar, Ashulia and Amin Bazar on the outskirts of the capital. His family members, however, alleged that police "shot him dead" for his political affiliation with the BNP and also for money and then cooked up a story.

data.name: Nizam
data.description: A robber was killed and three policemen were injured in a "gunfight" with police at Bibirhat of Ramgati upazila of Lakshmipur on October 1, 2016. The dead was identified as Nizam, 28, son of Abdus Salam of Char Jabbar in Noakhali district. Iqbal Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Ramgati Police Station, said Nizam was arrested in Boyar Char area in Ramgati on September 30, 2016 night. Based on his information, police took him to Bibirhat area to arrest his accomplices, who opened fire on the law enforcers. The police retaliated with gunshots and Nizam was killed in "crossfire".

data.name: Sabuj Hossain
data.description: Two accused in a schoolboy murder case were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga on October 20, 2016. The dead are Sabuj Hossain, 23, of C&B area in Chuadanga town and Shakil Hossain, 21, of Darshana town in the district. The two were accused in the murder case of Mahfuz Alam Sajib. Major Monir Ahmmed, Deputy Director of RAB-6 in Jhenaidah, said a RAB team launched a drive in Shantipara area of the upazila around 2:45 am on information that a group of criminals were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, criminals opened fire on RAB men, forcing them to fire retaliatory shots. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. The RAB team later searched the area and found the bodies of Sabuj and Shakil.

The RAB team later searched the area and found the bodies of Sabuj and Shakil.

data.name: Rasel Dewan
data.description: A suspected miscreant was killed in a'gunfight' with police in Kurgaon area under Ashulia police station in Dhaka on October 23, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rasel Dewan aged 32, son of Piyar Ali of Niribili area of Ashulia. Ashulia police officer-in-charge Mohsinul Quadir said that acting on a tip-off, a team of the Ashulia police arrested Rasel on October 22, 2016 night. Later, the police team, along with Rasel, went to Kurgaon area to recover illegal firearms and arrest his accomplices. The OC claimed that miscreants opened fire at them after they reached in the area at about 3. 30 am and the gunfight took place as the police retaliated. Rasel recieved bullet injuries in the clash while his accomplices managed to escape. The OC said that they took him at first to Ganosasthya Kendra and later, to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: On October 29, 2016 three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB-7. The dead, though not identified yet, have been branded as robbers by law enforcers. According to the RAB, a microbus carrying members of RAB-7 came under attack by robbers around 2:30am at Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. The law enforcers were patrolling the area in plain clothes at the time. The robbers put up barricades and fired at the vehicle, said Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-7. The Rab personnel retaliated. Minutes later when the gunfight stopped, three of the attackers were found bullet-hit, Chandan said. The injured were taken to Mirsarai Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Biplob Kumar Bepary allias Bipul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Two alleged members of the outlawed Nakshal Bahini were killed in a shootout with Rapid Action Battalion on October 28, 2016 claimed Rab. The incident took place at Goyeshbari area under Ataikula in Santhia upazila. One of the killed was identified as Biplob Kumar Bepary allias Bipul 28, son of Abdul Pramanik from Bil Shalangi village and the other was Moyen Uddin, 27, son of Motaleb Hossain from Paiksha village under Ataikula of Santhia upazila in the district, RAB said. On a tipoff that members of the outlawed party were holding a secret meeting near Goyeshbari Government Primary School, a RAB team was sent there, Bina Rani Das, commander of RAB12 in Pabna said. The RAB team was shot at when they raided the place around 4:00am. The RAB team fired back.

data.name: Nurun Nabi

data.name: Kulu Mollah
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected member of banned extremist outfit Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a'gunfight' with police at Kaburhat in Kushtia on October 31, 2016, police said. The deceased was Kulu Mollah aged 30, a resident of Khajanagar under sadar upazila and a regional commander of JMB, said Detective Branch of Kushtia police.

data.name: Alal Miah
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police in Habiganj on November 9, 2016. The deceased was identified as Alal Miah, 25, son of Rahmat Ali of village Sultansi of Habiganj sadar upazila. Habiganj sadar police officer-in-charge Yasinul Haque said that a gang of suspected robbers made a sudden attack on a patrol team of the police at about 3:00 am while the lawmen patrolling in Machhulia area near the River Khoai, leaving for policemen injured. The gunfight took place as the police retaliated by firing, the OC said. Later, the body of Alal, which received bullet injuries, was recovered from the spot, he said, adding that it was sent to Habiganj Sadar Hospital morgue for post mortem examinations.

data.name: Mahbub Alam
data.description: On November 10, 2016 Mahbub Alam was allegedly killed in a gunfight by police at Dhaka- Mymensingh highway.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: A suspected leader of outlawed Biplobi Communist Party was killed in a'gunfight' between police and the party operatives at a bamboo grove at Garakhula under Phultala in Khulna on November 8, 2016. The deceased was identified as Billal Hossain, 35, of Jugnipasha village of Phultala. ASI Md Asmot Ali, said that a team of Phultala police, on secret information, conducted a raid at Garakhola area. As soon as the police team reached near a bamboo grove in the area, the out-laws opened fired on police at about 1:30 am, he said. He said that police also retaliated by firing. The police officer said that after the gunfight, police searched the area and found bullet-hit Billal left abandoned. Police took him to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shawkat
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police on Magura-Jhenaidah highway in Pashchim Ramnagar area of sadar upazila on November 7, 2016. The deceased was identified as Shawkat, 38, son of Moyen Uddin, a resident of Komorpur village in Mashukhali upazila of Faridpur district. On information that a robber gang was preparing to commit robbery by placing logs on the highway, a team of the law enforcers conducted a drive in the area around 2:00 am, said Azmal Huda, OC of sadar police station. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire at them, prompting them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. The gunfight left Shawkat dead on the spot, added the OC.

data.name: Anisur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Anisur, a Sramik Dal leader was killed on November 2, 2016. His brother Azizur Rahman claimed that police picked up Anisur on October 30 and took him to DB office. Police demanded Tk 10 lakh bribe for his release but Anisur was killed as they couldn't pay the money . Police claimed that he was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of criminals at Begaritala in Manirampur upazila

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Lalpole area. Identities of the two could not be known. Squadron leader Safaat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 said that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in the area on Dhaka-Chittagong Highway a team of the battalion conducted a drive there around 2:45 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the battalion personnel prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight. Two robbers recieved bullet injuries during the gun-fight. They were taken to Feni General Hospital where on duty physician declared them dead.

data.name: Md Abdul Jabbar
data.description: A suspected ringleader of a robber gang was killed in a said gunfight between his cohorts and police at village Kalagachhia under Amtoli upazila in Barguna on November 24, 2016. The deceased was identified as Md Abdul Jabbar, 45, son of Amjed Hawlader, a resident of the village. . Amtoli Police Station sub-inspector Shah Alam said on a tip-off a team of Amtoli police raided the village while the gang of robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected robbers opened fire on them around 3. 00 am prompting the police to retaliate that triggered a gun battle. At one stage, Jabbar sustained gunshot wounds while his cohorts fled the scene, Alam said. Jabbar was taken to Amtoli Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Dalim
data.description: On November 12, 2016 a group of robbers near Srimoddi area of Homna preparing for robbery in the Mehgna river. At that time, a group of police conducted an operation in the River. At that time, police arrested two of the robbers and going back. In the meantime, robbers chased them and opened fire. As a result police retaliated. A robber recieved bullet injury later died in the hospital.

data.name: Unidentified
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: An alleged member of outlawed militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bagerhat Sadar upazila on November 27, 2016. Acting on a tip off, a joint team of DB police and Bagerhat Model Thana police raided Rasulpur Bridge area around 1:00am, said Pankaj Chandra Roy, Superintendent of Police in Bagerhat. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, miscreants opened fire and hurled crude bombs at the police vehicle, triggering a "gunfight, " he added. At one stage, the attackers fled the scene leaving one of their cohorts with bullet wounds, he informed. The unidentified injured JMB suspect was whisked off to Khulna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rustom Ali
data.description: Four suspected robbers were "killed in gunfight" with RAB in Pabna November 25, 2016. According to Rapid Action Battalion, the four "robbers" died of bullet injuries they sustained during exchange of fires as the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while the criminals were robbing the rice mill at Joynagar of Ishwardi around 3:00am. Three other suspected robbers, injured during the said gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased "robbers", aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, RAB said. The other three deceased -- Badsha Miah, 32, Shafikul Islam, 35 and Monjurul Islam, 36, from Mymensingh and Chandpur -- were identified by their wounded associates apprehended by the RAB.
