data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: Police claimed that a youth named Jahangir Alam (30), was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between two groups of criminals. The victim’s family alleged that police picked up two brothers, Jahangir Alam (30) and Abid Hasan (27), from their house and shot Jahangir dead. There was no information of the whereabouts of Abid. Abdur Rahman, an uncle of Jahangir Alam, said that on November 18, 2016 at around 1:30 am, some policemen came to their house with three vans and picked up Jahangir and Abid. Later, Jahangir’s family searched for them but no trace was found. The next day, Abdur Rahman phoned one of his relatives who works at the Jessore General Hospital and found that police had left Jahangir’s body in the hospital at around 3:00 am. Jahangir was involved in politics with one group of the Jessore Awami League unit.

data.name: Probitra Samaddar
data.description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Rampura in the capital on November 30, 2016. The Rab identified the dead as Probitra Samaddar, 28, son of Notobor Samaddar from Jhalakathi and Mohammad Ali Swapan, 30, son of Siraj Mia from Shariatpur. The firefight took place around 2:00am when a team of RAB raided Balur Math area of Rampura with information that a gang of criminals would commit robbery at the spot, Lt Col Khandakar Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB-3, told. The criminals, sensing RAB's presence, started firing shots at the law enforcers in their attempt to flee the scene. The RAB also returned fire, leaving two of the gang members injured. Other members of the gang managed to escape by the time the shootout was over, the RAB CO added. The RAB with the help of local police transported the injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Tajmul Hossain
data.description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a'gunfight' with the police at Gangni of Meherpur on December 6, 2016. The deceased were identified as Tajmul Hossain, 25, and Mahidul Islam, 22, of village Manikdia and Tuhin Hossain, 28, of village Bholadanga, all under Gangni upazila. According to the police officer, unidentified miscreants opened fire at a police patrol as they reached near a brick kiln. The police retaliated by firing. Following the gunfight, the police with the help of locals searched the area and found three bullet-hit bodies, he added. The police sent the bodies to Gangni Upazila Health Complex for post-mortem examination.

data.name: Shahadat Sheikh
data.description: Family members alleged that Shahadat Sheikh aged 33 along with his nephew Shariful Islam aged 24 were picked up by members of police from their house at Lakkhipur village, Kanaipur union, Faridpur on December 21, 2016. Later, on December 22, 2016 dead body of Shahadat Sheikh was found at brick field at Lakkhipur village, Kanaipur union, Faridpur.

data.name: Sharif Mia
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Ashuganj, Brahmanbaria on December 25, 2016.

data.name: Sohel Rana
data.description: A 30 year old man died in custody of Melandah police in Jamalpur a few hours after his arrest at his house of Paharipatol under Melandah upazila on December 18, 2016. Around 7:30 pm, the Sohel fell sick after complaining of severe chest pain while in the custody. He was rushed to Melandah Upazila Health Complex. As the on duty physicians could not read his pulse, they referred him to Jamalpur General Hospital, said police and upazila health complex officials. But, he was brought dead to Jamalpur General Hospital around 8. 45 pm, said Ferdous Hassan, Resident Medical Officer. On December 19, 2016 noon, police sent the body to the hospital's morgue for post-mortem examination after preparing an inquest report in presence of executive magistrate Mohammad Imranul Haque, said Mazharul Karim, OC of the police station. The executive magistrate said no injury mark was found on the body of the deceased. Meanwhile, the victim's family members alleged that Sohel was tortured to death by police while he was under their custody, said local union parishad chairman, Mominul Haque Babu, quoting a member of his family.'They (family members) claimed that Sohel was quite well when he was arrested,' he said. Melandah police denied the allegation.

data.name: Kashem Khalifa
data.description: On December 25, 2016 around 4. 00 pm a group of police went to Kashem Khalifa's house at Madrassa para, Kushtia. They dragged Kashem from the house to the vehicle. At that time, they beat up him. The women family members tried to stop the police but police also assaulted them. Those police members tortured Kashem after taking him at the vehicle. In the afternoon they received news that he died. Family alleged that, police killed him in exchange of money from neighbor Angel.

data.name: Ripon Hossain Gazi
data.description: Ripon’s maternal Uncle Habibur Rahman Gazi allged that on November 30, 2016 plainclothes men introducing themselves as members of police picked up Ripon from Choto Achra intersection. He alleged that police shot Ripon to death. However, OC of Kotowali Police Station told that at around 1. 00 am on December 1, 2016 two groups of miscreants were exchanging of fire at Panchbariya in Jessore-Magura High way. While police went there miscreants left the place. Police found the bullet wounded body of Ripon Hossain Gazi aged 28.

data.name: Dulal Hossain

data.name: Montajul Islam
data.description: On December 7, 2016 both of them were killed in a gunfight with police at Keraniganj, Dhaka. The deceased in the Keraniganj incident were identified as Montajul Islam, 35, and Sabuj, 34. Shah Mizan Shafiur Rahman, superintendent of police in Dhaka, said they apprehended Montajul and Sabuj from Mawa Road on December 7, 2016 . Based on the information gleaned from the two, police took them along to Porahati area of Ruhitpur in search of illegal arms. Associates of Montaj and Sabuj at one stage opened fire on the police and police also returned fire, the SP said, adding that the two detainees sustained bullet injuries during the shootout. After they were shifted to Mitford Hospital, the doctors on duty declared them dead at around 3. 00 pm.

data.name: Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas
data.description: A man was killed in a'gunfight' with the police on the Rajbari-Kushtia highway at Kalibari point in Rajbari on December 29, 2016, claimed the police. The deceased was Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas, 55, of Dhekipara under Pangsha in the district. Rajbari police Officer-in-Charge Abul Bashar Mia said that they had been tipped-off about a planned robbery on the highway by felling trees. According to the police, as they reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them. and they fired back about 3:30 am. The police later found Biswas critically wounded and took him to Rajbari Sadar hospital where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Abul Bashar
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a'gunfight' with the police on December 31, 2016 morning. The victim was Abdul Bashar, a resident of the village Sonapur under the district's Sadar upazila. According to the police, the'gunfight' broke out as the police reached Kajjalipur area under Sadar upazila to prevent a robbery attempt. The robbers opened fire as they sensed the presence of the police.

data.name: Badu Monir
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch (DB) of police at Noljani in Gazipur on January 1, 2017. Badu Monir, 30, a resident of Tin-Shed colony area in BARC and an accused in 17 cases, was declared dead at Shahid Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital, said detectives. Police claimed that sensing presence of DB police, Badu and his men opened fire forcing the law enforcers to fire back in T&T colony area of Segun Bagan.

data.name: Ruhel Ahmed
data.description: An alleged yaba trader was killed in ‘police firing’ during a clash between police and drug traders in Berirpar area in Moulvibazar town on January 4, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ruhel Ahmed, son of Shayesta Miah of village Ghorghor of Sadar upazila. Mohammad Shah Jalal, superintendent of police, at a press briefing at 1. 00 pm on January 5, 2017, said tipped off a team of police conducted a drive in the area around 11:30 pm. At one stage, police opened fire on Ruhel that left him bullet injured. He was later taken to Sadar Hospital where attending doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: A suspected cattle thief was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with Rapid Action Battalion at Majlishpur in Gazipur city on January 5, 2017, RAB claimed. Additional Superintendent of police Mohiul Islam of RAB-1, Gazipur, said on a tip-off that the cattle thieves were running away with cattle riding a truck, the battalion personnel set up a check post at Dakkhin Salna in the city. At about 3:30 am, the RAB personnel signaled a truck loaded with cows to stop but the driver, violating the signal, tried to flee prompting the RAB personnel to chase the vehicle. As they entered into the village road and reached near Majlishpur High School, about two kilometers away from the check post, they got stuck. The suspected thieves then opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB personnel also retaliated by firing. At one stage, the suspects managed to flee from the truck. The battalion members detained bullet-hit Rafiqul from the spot.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: A suspected robber died at Rangpur Medical College Hospital on January 26, 2017, three days after he got injured in a police firing at village Magurmari under Panchagarah Sadar. He was undergoing treatment in the hospital in police custody. The dead was Delwar Hossain, 41, of village Magurmari. Delwar died at RMCH around 7:30 am on January 26, 2017, said Bhajanpur high way police officer-in-charge Enamul Huq. On January 23, the police officer claimed, the highway police had signaled a motorcycle without a number plate to stop while checking documents of vehicles at Magurmari. The rider, instead of stopping, crossed the police check post . Enamul added that Delwar later returned with his associates and as they tried to attack the police with sharp weapons, the police personnel opened fire and one of the bullets hit his waist. Then he was rescued and taken to RMCH and died there.

data.name: Amirul Islam
data.description: An alleged cadre of outlawed Gono Bahini (GB) was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police in Alampur under Sadar upazila of the district on January 19, 2017. The victim was Amirul Islam, 45, of Ambaria village in Mirpur upzila. Police said the deceased was a listed robber and second-in-command of notorious GB leader Serajul Islam’s ‘Seraj Bahini. ’

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.description: On January 20, 2017 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB.

data.name: Sharif Hossain
data.description: A man, who stood accused in shooting two policemen, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Atghoria upazila of Pabna on January 29, 2017. The dead, Sharif Hossain, 30, of Gaspara village in Pabna Sadar upazila, was one of the key accused of shooting two on-duty policemen in Dangergram area in Atghoria upazila.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Anar
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in Kaundia area of Savar on January 11, 2017. The dead is Anwar Hossain Anar, 40, of Kaundia. He was the ringleader of the robber gang named "Gangchil Bahini", said RAB sources. Members of RAB-3 raided the house of late Liakot Mia in Kaundia Melartek area around 4:45 am, acting on a tip-off that some robbers were staying there, said Lt Col Khandker Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB 3. Sensing presence of the elite force, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", the RAB official said. After the gun battle, the RAB members found Anar injured. But others managed to flee the scene, said Sarwar, adding that Anwar was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Russel
data.description: According to his family, at midnight on January 10, 2017, Mohammad Rashel was shot dead by police, in Jessore. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Jessore Kotwali Police Station, Ilias Hossain claimed that a gunfight had taken place between two groups of robbers at night in Joghati area; and Rashel was shot dead due to that. Meanwhile Rashel’s aunt Saniya Khatun said that police picked Rashel up and shot him in his neck. There were a few cases filed against Rashel. The deceased mother isaid that some police came to their house to search for Rashel, about 10-12 days before he was killed. She believes that police took her son from somewhere and shot him dead.

data.name: Abdur Razzak
data.description: A "top outlawed" was killed in an alleged shootout with Rapid Action Battalion in Santhia upazila of Pabna on January 16, 2017. Abdur Razzak, 42, of Bilshalangi village in the upazila, was a regional leader of a faction of outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party, according to RAB . Bina Rani Das, Commander of RAB -12 (Pabna camp), said acting on a tip off that Razzak and his accomplices were preparing for a robbery, a RAB team raided Haludgar Bazar area around 4:00 am on January 16, 2017. Sensing RAB presence, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate by firing back, leading to a gunfight, Bina said. Razzak died after being shot but the accomplices escaped. His body was sent to Pabna Medical College morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Nurul Islam Marzan
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Both of them were alleged member of Neo-JMB and they were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: Both of them were alleged member of Neo-JMB and they were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Rahat Hossain
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mithapukur upazila of Rangpur on January 2, 2017. The dead is Rahat Hossain, 32, of Bujruk-Shontoshpur village in the upazila. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Mithapukur Police Station, said on information, police arrested Rahat at his home around 10:30 pm on January 1, 2017. Based on information gleaned from Rahat, police went to recover firearms. They took Rahat with them. When the police van reached near a bridge of Bheluarmor around 5:00 am, some robbers opened fire to snatch him. Police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Rahat was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Mojid
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dugbi village under Matlab Uttar Upazila of Chandpur district. The deceased are Mojid, of Matlab Uttar Upazila and Habu of Laksmipur district.

data.name: Habu
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dugbi village under Matlab Uttar Upazila of Chandpur district. The deceased are Mojid, of Matlab Uttar Upazila and Habu of Laksmipur district.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: On January 15, 2017, Jalal Uddin was allegedly shot to death by police in Narsigdi.

data.name: Moshiur Rahman
data.description: In Rangpur, two "robbers" identified as Moshiur Rahman, 37, from Alampur under Taraganj upazila and Bijoy Chandra, 32, from Kursha-Boloram under Rangpur Sadar upazila-died during a "gun battle" that took place near Lengtisera Bridge on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila. According to police, they dispatched a team to the spot on information that a 10-member gang of highway robbers, including Moshiur and Bijoy, were getting ready to rob passengers in vehicles on the highway. As soon as they arrived at the scene around 3:00 am, the gang started to retreat while firing gunshots at the law enforcers. The two "robbers" died on the spot as police also returned fire, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station.

data.name: Bijoy Chandra
data.description: In Rangpur, two "robbers" identified as Moshiur Rahman, 37, from Alampur under Taraganj upazila and Bijoy Chandra, 32, from Kursha-Boloram under Rangpur Sadar upazila-died during a "gun battle" that took place near Lengtisera Bridge on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila. As soon as they arrived at the scene around 3:00 am, the gang started to retreat while firing gunshots at the law enforcers. The two "robbers" died on the spot as police also returned fire, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station.

data.name: Juban Ali
data.description: In Magura, a "drug dealer" died on the spot during a "gunfight' between their gang and the police, reports our Jhenidah correspondent. The deceased was identified as Juban Ali, 50, son of Sohrab Hossain from Thalahara village under Magura Sadar upazila. Ajmal Huda, Officer-in-Charge of Magura Sadar Police Station, said, a police patrol unit was fired upon when it raided a "drug dealers" meeting being held in Thalahara village under Magura Sadar upazila at around 3:00 am. Juban sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot as the police returned fire in self defence, the OC said.

data.name: Shamsu Sheikh
data.description: Shamsu Sheikh, an alleged pirate killed in a gunfight with RAB on February 7, 2017.

data.name: Kamal Sheikh
data.description: On February 7, 2017 both of them allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Fakirpara area .

data.name: Ibrahim Ali
data.description: On February 7, 2017 both of them allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Fakirpara area .

data.name: Shahjalal Miji
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and law enforcers in Munshiganj town on February 13, 2017. The dead is Shahjalal Miji, 33, of Dakkhin Courtgaon area in the town. Jayedul Alam, superintendent of Munshiganj police, said Shahjalal was arrested in Dakkhin Courtgaon area at around 5:00pm on February 12, 2017. Based on information gleaned from Shahjalal, a team of the Detective Branch of police and local police was going to Baikhar area in the town to recover firearms, said police. Shahjalal was with the law enforcers. When they reached Parulpara area around 2:30am, some 10 to 12 accomplices of Shahjalal suddenly opened fire and tried to snatch Shahjalal from them, said police. Police then returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the bullet-hit body of Shahjalal. They took him to Munshiganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the mainstream faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (PCJSS) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A "criminal "was killed in a gunfight between criminals and an army patrol in Naikkhong Mukh Para in the district's Lama upazila February 13, 2017. The identity of the dead could not be known as of filing of this report. . Major Mustafizur Rahman, acting commander of Alikadom zone, said the dead, a member of Parbatya Chattagram Jana Sanghati Samiti (PCJSS), was in army uniform. The army patrol cordoned off Naikkhong Mukh Para area around 4:00pm on information that an armed gang was there. "Shortly afterwards criminals opened fire on the troops. The army men retaliated, firing shots. The two sides fired at least 50 shots during the gunfight that lasted for around 10-15 minutes, " added the acting zone commander.

data.name: Sagar
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Abu Musa Samiul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: The dead, Abu Musa alias Abujar alias Abu Talha alias Samiul, 32, was the chief of Pabna, Kushtia, Natore and Sirajganj region of "Neo JMB". Musa also stood accused in cases filed in connection with killing homeopath Mir Sanaullah in Kushtia Sadar upazila and shopkeeper Shunil Gomez at Bonpara Bazaar in Natore, police said. Nur-e-Alam Siddiki, officer-in-charge of Kahaloo Police Station, said some criminals suddenly opened fire targeting their van when they reached Patonja village around 2:45am February 14, 2017. He along with his team was returning to the police station after a patrol. Police then returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". After the "gun battle", they found the body of Musa lying on the spot. The others fled.

data.name: Abdus Sattar
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, an alleged criminal was killed in a "shootout" with police in Kerontoli area of Moheshkhali upazila. Deceased Abdus Sattar alias Sabbir, 52, was from Majher Para village of the upazila. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station, said police as part of their regular patrol went to the spot around 4:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, some criminals opened fire. Police then fired back, triggering the "gunfight". Sattar was hit by bullets during the "gun battle". Doctors of Moheshkhali Upazila Health Complex declared him dead when he was taken there, the police official said.

data.name: Nizam Uddin
data.description: An outlawed party operative was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bera upazila of Pabna on February 15, 2017, said police. The dead, Nizam Uddin alias Nistar, 40, of Kathulia village in Sadar upazila, was a leader of outlawed Sarbahara Party, said Tazul Huda, officer-in-charge of Aminpur Police Station. Nizam used to run "Nistar Bahini" which was involved in various criminal activities, including robbery. Nizam was the Secretary of recently dissolved committee of Jatiya Samajtantrik Dal (JSD-Inu) of Sadar upazila unit, said Kanu Shannal, vice-president of the district unit JSD. Amirul Islam Ranga, president of the JSD unit, said Nizam was not involved with their organisation now. OC Tazul said police went to Dobirchar area around 3:00am, acting on information that two gangs -- "Nistar Bahini" and "Julhas Bahini" -- were locked in a gun battle. At one stage, police opened fire to disperse the criminals and nab them. Nizam was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said.

data.name: Moazzem Fakir
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged outlaw was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rajbari's Pangsha. The man killed in Pangsha upazila was Moazzem Fakir, 32, a "member outlawed Sarbahara Party", sid police. Moazzem, of Modyapatta village in the upazila, was also the second-in-command of "Bipul Bahini" which is involved in different criminal activities like extortion, said police. Mofazzel Hossain, officer-in-charge of Pangsha Police Station, said they had arrested Moazzem in Ashulia in Dhaka. Later, he was taken to Rajbari. As per Moazzem's statement, police along with him went to Noura Bongram village to recover firearms and bullets. When the law enforcers reached the village around 2:30am, cohorts of Moazzem opened fire. Police then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Moazzem was hit by bullets as he tried to flee from police custody, the police official said. He was rushed to Pangsha Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mukhter Hossain
data.description: Two people were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with Detective Branch of police at Fatulla in Narayanganj on February 22, 2017. The dead were Mukhter Hossain and his cohort Md Manik, both aged between 25 and 30, said Narayanganj DB police officer-in-charge Ahmedul Islam. The OC said that a team of Narayanganj DB launched a drive at Amtali area to arrest the duo around 5:50pm. Sensing their presence, the two and their cohorts opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing. Police later found seriously injured Mukhter and Manik and took them to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared the duo dead.

data.name: Md Manik
data.description: Two people were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with Detective Branch of police at Fatulla in Narayanganj on February 22, 2017. The dead were Mukhter Hossain and his cohort Md Manik, both aged between 25 and 30, said Narayanganj DB police officer-in-charge Ahmedul Islam. The OC said that a team of Narayanganj DB launched a drive at Amtali area to arrest the duo around 5:50pm. Sensing their presence, the two and their cohorts opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing. Police later found seriously injured Mukhter and Manik and took them to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared the duo dead.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: The police recovered the bullet-hit body of a young man, who was allegedly picked-up by plainclothes police, from a field near Medda Sishu Paribar in Brahmanbaria municipality area early February 7, 2017. The deceased was named Al Amin, 28, son of Zilu Mia of Kandipara area. On information that a gunfight took place in the area, a team of police went to the spot and found Al Amin lying in a pool of blood, said Narayan Chandra Das, sub-inspector of Sadar Model police station. Later he was sent to local hospital where the doctors declared him dead. Tanjina Begum, wife of the deceased, alleged that a team of plainclothes police picked up Al Amin from his residence around 4pm on February 6, 2017 and shot him to death. She demanded punishment of'responsible policemen' for the death. However, additional superintendent of police Iqbal Hossain denied the allegation of picking up Al Amin by law enforcers.

data.name: Zia Sana
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Zia Sana was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between police and ‘miscreants’ in Khulna about 12 hours after his family claimed that police picked him up from a court premises. The OC claimed that he was second-in-command of New Biplobi Communist Party (Mrinal Bahini) and was a drug trader. A press release issued by Khulna Metropolitan Police claimed that they had information about Zia, Jony Biswas, 34, Sagar Kazi, 30, Pabitra, 36, and an unidentified man, 30, and other five or six people preparing for robbery at South Bangla Residential Project under the metropolitan police. A team of Harintana police raided the area around 2:15am on February 24, 2017. The suspects, sensing presence of police, opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing, the release read. Zia received bullets in the head and belly during the exchange of shots, it said, adding that police with the help of locals took him to Khulna Medical College Hospital, where he was declared dead around 4:30am. Zia’s elder brother Abdur Rahim Sana at a press conference at Khulna Press Club alleged that a uniformed and two or three plainclothes police personnel picked his brother from the corridor of Khulna chief metropolitan magistrate court around 10:50am and took him to an unknown place by a car.

data.name: Amijul Al Amin Rony
data.identity: Allegedly tied with the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
data.description: A suspected neo-JMB member was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Jamnagar in Sherpur upazila on March 2, 2017. The deceased was identified as Amijul alias Al Amin Rony, chief of neo-JMB of northern region and son of Nurul Islam, a resident of Bujrum Radharampur village in Godagari upazila of Rajshahi. Tipped off, a police team conducted a drive in the area when Amijul along with his associates had been there around 3:00am, said Sonatan Chakrabarty, Additional Superintendent of police. Sensing the law enforcers’ presence, they opened fire on them, forcing the police to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Amijul was caught in the line of fire and injured while his associates managed to flee the scene. Amijul was taken to Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. Police sent the body to the hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Billal Mir
data.description: A member of a "robber gang" was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Sundarbans. The dead, Billal Mir alias Kana Billal, was the second-in-command of "Shamsu Bahini", according to RAB. Deputy Commander of RAB-8 Maj Adnan Kabir said a RAB team was on a regular patrol in the Sundarbans on March 2, 2017 morning when some robbers opened fire on the team in Sukhparar Char area under the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans East Zone. The RAB men retaliated which led to the "gunfight". After the "gunbattle", the body of Billal was found on the spot. The others fled, the RAB official claimed.

data.name: Bulbul Islam
data.description: A "gunfight" between "robbers" and Detective Branch of Police (DB ) police took place at Khetabari in the upazila around 3:30am. Robber Bulbul Islam alias "Builla" of Kalisima village in the upazila was found dead after the "shootout", said Ali Arshad, officer-in-charge of Bijoynagar Police Station. Police said Bulbul stood accused in five cases.

data.name: Prakash Nuru
data.description: An alleged drug dealer, Nurul Islam alias "Prakash Nuru" of Nalgaria village was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mirasani area around 4:30am, the police official said. Police claimed to have recovered a firearm and several sharp weapons from the spot.

data.name: Syedur Rahman Prakash
data.description: Syedur Rahman Prakash, a fugitive convicted gunsmith was found dead with a bullet wound to the chest following a gunfight during a police raid on an uninhabited hill in Cox's Bazar's Maheshkhali upazila on March 3, 2017. The body of Syedur Rahman, son of Azam Ullah of Boro Maheshkhali union, was sent to the district hospital for an autopsy. A team of 50 policemen on a tip-off surrounded Keruntol hill was fired upon around 11:00am and retaliated with some 40 shots before reaching the camp said a police official.

data.name: Afzal Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Sabuj Malitha
data.description: Four people were killed in what the police called a gunfight in Meherpur on March 14, 2017 after being allegedly arrested earlier. The police arrested two of them from Dhaka on March 13, 2017 for their alleged involvement in the killing of two people of Meherpur’s Sonapur village. The double murder took place a week back. The two, who were arrested and killed, are identified as Sabuj Malitha, 25, son of Mashiur Malitha and Rashomoy Karmaker’s son Ramesh Karmaker, 22. Both of them were residents of Sonapur village of Meherpur sadar upazila. Barely 24 hours after their arrest, the duo along with two others - Shohag Islam, 27, son of Monirul Islam and Kamruzzaman Kanon, 25, son of Abul Kalam - of nearby Pirojpur village were killed in police'gunfight' in the wee hours of March 14, 2017. The police said all of them used to carry out terrorist activities and extortion. But their family members outright denied the allegation and claimed that they were just construction workers in Dhaka. Family members also said the duo was used to live in Dhaka from much before the double murder.

data.name: Kamruzzaman Kanon
data.description: Four people were killed in what the police called a gunfight in Meherpur on March 14, 2017 after being allegedly arrested earlier. The police arrested two of them from Dhaka on March 13, 2017 for their alleged involvement in the killing of two people of Meherpur’s Sonapur village. The double murder took place a week back. The two, who were arrested and killed, are identified as Sabuj Malitha, 25, son of Mashiur Malitha and Rashomoy Karmaker’s son Ramesh Karmaker, 22. Both of them were residents of Sonapur village of Meherpur sadar upazila. Barely 24 hours after their arrest, the duo along with two others - Shohag Islam, 27, son of Monirul Islam and Kamruzzaman Kanon, 25, son of Abul Kalam - of nearby Pirojpur village were killed in police'gunfight' in the wee hours of March 14, 2017. The police said all of them used to carry out terrorist activities and extortion. But their family members outright denied the allegation and claimed that they were just construction workers in Dhaka. Family members also said the duo was used to live in Dhaka from much before the double murder.

data.name: Tajul Islam Mahmud
data.identity: Allegedly affiliated with the Harakat ul-Jihad-I-Islami/Bangladesh (HUJI-B)
data.description: An alleged member of Harkat-ul-Jihad-al-Islami (Huji) was killed in police firing during a raid in Brahmanbaria's Kasba upazila on March 16, 2017. Deceased Tajul Islam Mahmud 45, is a resident of Sadullapur village in Habiganj's Nabiganj upazila.

data.name: Abdus Selim
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Adabaria village in Kushtia's Daulatpur upazila on March 17, 2017. The deceased, Abdus Selim, 40, was from Modhugari in the upazila. Police claimed. Sabbirul Alam, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch (DB) of Kushtia police, said a joint team of DB and Daulatpur police conducted a raid around 3:00am at Shialia field after being tipped off that Selim and his seven to eight accomplices were holding a secret meeting there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The "gunfight" ensued when police retaliated with fire, the OC said. With bullet injuries, Selim was taken to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he said. The body was sent to Kushtia General Hospital for an autopsy.

data.name: Zahirul Islam
data.description: An alleged robber killed in a gunfight with police in Brahmanbaria. The deceased robber was identified as Zahirul Islam, 35, of Kayempur village under Kashba Upazila in Brahmanbaria. A team of police launched a drive at Kayempur village in Kasba Upazila around 4:00am on March 18, 2017 after they came to know that robbers were preparing for a robbery there, Mahiuddin Ahammed, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kasba Police Station said. Sensing police's presence, the gang members opened fire on them prompting the police personnel to retaliate which triggered a gunfight, the OC said. At one stage, Zahirul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, Ahammed said adding that police later recovered his body and sent it to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Fakir Ahmad
data.description: In Feni, a suspected drug peddler Fakir Ahmad was killed during a police raid on their den in Sonagazi upazila of Feni on March 18, 2017 police said. The gang members opened fire on the police forcing them to shoot in retaliation. Six police personnel were injured during the incident, Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of Sonagazi Model Police Station, said. The deceased Fakir Ahmad, 35, hailed from Chharait Kandi village under Sonagazi upazila in Feni

data.name: Kawsar Bhuiyan
data.description: An alleged drug dealer was killed in an alleged gunfight with the Detective Branch of police in Bhatshala area of the district, amid an anti-narcotics crackdown that began two months ago. The dead is Kawsar Bhuiyan, 45, son of Abdul Razzak of the town's Kandipara area. "He was carrying drugs in a pick-up van and started firing on us after we asked to stop him, forcing us retaliate as well, " DB Officer-in-Charge Md Mafiz Uddin said in the evening. Two of his cohorts managed to escape.

data.name: Nurul Amin
data.description: A 55 year old person died allegedly after being tortured and given electric shocks in police custody in Feni. Police refuted the allegation raised by the victim's family, claiming that Nurul Amin had suffered a stroke. Feni model police Officer-in-Charge Rashed Khan Chowdhury claimed that they had arrested Amin as a warranted criminal from the town’s Pagla Mia Road on March 23, 2017. Later at night he suffered a stroke and was taken to a local hospital, the OC said, adding: "Amin finally was shifted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for better treatment where he died on March 24, 2017 morning. " Amin’s son Nurul Afsar Manik alleged that his father had been beaten up and then electrocuted at the police station. He said that the case in which the police had shown him arrested was filed by a local over previous enmity. "The complainant bribed the police to arrest and torture him, " he claimed. Manik said that they would file a case against the police.

data.name: Abdul Halim
data.description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) claimed to have found the body of Abdul Halim following a gunfight with robbers in Sirajganj's Kamarkhand upazila on April 12, 2017. Rab-12 Commander Maj Safayet Ahmed said that a RAB team raided a spot near Jhaoil Bridge at Shahbazpur Uttarpara area around 2:00am on a tip-off that criminals were preparing to commit robbery. The criminals shot at the RAB team, leading to the gunfight for a few minutes and Halim died on the spot . The body was sent to the Sirajganj General Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Shipan Hossain
data.description: Two suspected miscreants were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Gangni in Meherpur on April 14, 2017 police officials said. The deceased were identified as Shipan Hossain, 25, son of Madar Ali, of village Dulalnagar, and Alamgir Hossain, 29, son of Abed Ali, of village Chandpur under Gangni upazila. Tipped-off that a group of miscreants had gathered at Haridaho field to commit crimes, a team of Gangni police conducted a drive there around 3:00am, claimed Anwar Hossain, officer-in-charge of the police station. Sensing the presence of police, the ‘miscreants’ opened fire on police personnel, prompting them to retaliate by firing, Anwar claimed. The duo received bullet-wounds during the gunfight and died on the spot while their associates managed to flee.

data.name: Sohel Sheikh
data.description: Sohel Sheikh was killed in a "gunfight" with DB police in the city's Bhashantek area on April 17, 2017 four days after he was called out from his Ashulia house allegedly by a criminal gang. . Sohel's family members alleged that suspected criminal "DSP Babu" called him out from his home on April 13, 2017 to talk about the gun attack on Chiku. Sohel phoned his sister Minara Akter on April 14, 2017 to inform her that he was in the custody of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. "My brother called from his mobile phone and asked us not to worry about him. The conversation lasted for only a few seconds, " Minara told. Talking to this correspondent at his house at Bhashantek slum, Sohel's father Manju Sheikh alleged that DB officials "cooked up the story of shootout after killing his son in custody".

data.name: Yunus Hossain
data.description: On April 20, 2017 Yunus Hossain, 40, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Keshobpur in Jessore. Ashashuni, Satkhira. The deceased was a son of Mokbul Hossain and was a resident of Ashahuni in Satkhira.

data.name: Forhad Hossain
data.description: On April 23, 2017 Forhad Hossain allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Noyapara, Khutakhali, Chokoriya, Chittagong- Cox's Bazaar highway.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: On April 10, 2017 Jalal Uddin was allegedly beaten to death by police when police went to an operation to arrest a criminal at Parkasunda village, Atrai, Naogaon. Police went to one Askan's house to arrest Mostafa aged 25, an alleged criminal. There, they did not find Mostafa. At one stage, Askan's nephew Jalal Uddin involved in the altercation with Police. As a result, police beat him up and he eventually died in the place of incident.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.description: In Jessore district, a youth was allegedly killed in a' gunfight' by police after picking up. Mohammad Rajib (35), the deceased’s family alleged that police arrested him from his house in the afternoon of April 5, 2017 . Later, police told that Rajib escaped from police by unlocking the handcuff. After that police searched for him but did not find. Later, the family got information that Rajib's body was in the morgue of the hospital. Officer-in-charge (OC) of Jessore Kotowali Police Station, A K M Ajmal Huda told that on April 5, 2017 Sub Inspector (SI) Jamil and Mokhles conducted an operation in plain cloth and arrested Rajib. But on the way to Police Station, Rajib escaped from police by unlocking the handcuff. At around 3:00 am, police got information that firing between the two miscreants’ groups was going on at Kholadanga area of the town. The miscreants started firing at patrol police when they reached the incident place. Then, police also reply them with firing. Later, the miscreants left the place and police found injured Rajib who was shot in his head. On the way to hospital, Rajib died. OC A K M Ajmal Huda also told that ‘gunfight’ incidents are going on all over the country. It was also that kind of incident. He did not want to bring your own danger by saying more about the incident.

data.name: Mohammad Rahim
data.description: He was allegedly killed in gunfight with Khualna Sadar Police on April 28, 2017.

data.name: Romel Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly tied with the mainstream faction of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Samhati Samiti (PCJSS) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: There was an allegation that a college student had died due to torture by the military in Rangamati Hill District. The victim-family alleged that on April 5, 2017 members of the Army took Romel Chakma to their camp. Romel Chakma was a Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSC) examinee of Naniyarchar Degree College and was also General Secretary of Naniarchar unit Pahari Chhatra Parishad in Rangamati. Later, Romel was handed over to police. On April 19, 2017 Romel died in Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On April 21, the Army allegedly cremated his body without following any religious custom.

data.name: Lalon Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Gangni on May 18, 2017.

data.name: Raju Ahmed
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Paschim Tutpara area of Khulna city on May 20, 2017. The deceased was identified as Raju Ahmed, 27, son of Siddiqur Rahman. Tipped-off that a gang of robbers numbering 10 to 12 were taking preparation to commit robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive there around 3:00am, said Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Raju bullet-wounds. Later, he was rushed to Khulna Medical College and Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries around 4:00am.

data.name: Russell
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dattopara in Lakshmipur Sadar upazila on May 19, 2017. The deceased was identified as Russell, 30, son of Abdul Karim of Chhayani Togba village of Chatkhil upazila in Noakhali. Russell along with his associate Babul was arrested with a gun at an abandoned house at Kabirajbari of North Joypur village, said Officer-in-Charge of Chandraganj police Mokhtar Hossain. Based on information given by him, the police took him to Dattapara in Binodpur on a drive to recover more firearms. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, Russell's associates opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight", the OC claimed. Russell was wounded during the "gunfight" and was rushed to Lakshmipur Sadar Hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ashrafuddin Dhol
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claims was a gunfight in Trishal upazila of Mymensingh on May 24, 2017. The deceased, Ashrafuddin Dhol, 28, of Ragaichati village in Mymensingh's Gafargoan upazila was detained from Kishoreganj around 9:00pm on May 23, 2017 night, said Additional Superintendent of Mymensingh police (South) Mohammad Noor-e-Alam. A team led by Imarat Hossain Gazi, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Mymensingh police took along Ashraful Dhol when they raided a den of robbers at Bhaga village in adjacent Trishal upazila around 3:00am the same night. The robbers started firing at the police prompting them to retaliate, Noor-e-Alam said. Ashraful suffered bullet injuries in the gunfight and was declared dead after being rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, the police official said.

data.name: Muktar Hossain Mukti
data.description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a reported gun-fight between his cohorts and police at Birulia area in Savar, on the outskirts of the capital on May 26, 2017. Police said they arrested Muktar Hossain Mukti, 45, a presumed drug trader on May 25, 2017. Later, police along with Muktar conducted a drive in the area to arrest his associates, said SM Kamruzzaman, Officer-in-Charge, of Savar Model Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire towards police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight between them around 3. 30 am. At one stage, Muktar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his cohorts managed to flee, he said.

data.name: Sobuj Uddin Sobuj

data.name: Bappi

data.description: Two regional leaders of the Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila on May 13, 2017. The deceased were identified as Bappi, chief of Lal Potaka Bahini and his associate Lalon. Rois Uddin, Additional Superintendent of Police, and also company commander of RAB Faridpur camp, said that on secret information a team of RAB conducted a drive in the area around 3:00am. Sensing the presence of elite force, the outlaw leaders opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate that triggered a ‘gunfight’. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

data.name: Nazrul Islam Babu
data.description: Nazrul Islam Babu, 32, a Class IV employee of Jaintapur Upazila Administration office and son of the late freedom fighter Abdul Zalil of village Kohaigar under the upazila, found dead in a detention cell hours after he was arrested, the police said. His Family alleged that he was tortured to dead by police. on May 20, 2017.

data.name: Firatul Islam
data.description: A man was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Nurpur village in Meherpur Sadar upazila on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Firatul Islam, 48, son of Ayub Ali, a resident of Pirojpur village in the upazila. Acting on tip-off, a team of police conducted a drive at a jackfruit orchard in the area around 2:00am while Firatul along with his associates was preparing to commit robbery, said Ahsan Habib, Assistant Superintendent of police of Meherpur. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on police, prompting police to retaliate that triggered a gunfight, he said. After the gunfight, Firatul was found dead on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, the ASP added.

data.name: Ibrahim Miah
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at village Chandidwar of Kosba upazila in Brahmanbaria on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ibrahim Miah, 34, son of late Samraj Miah, a resident of village Latuamora of the upazila. Kosba police Officer-in-charge Mohammad Mohiuddin said that a police team, led by Sub Inspector Rafiqul Islam, conducted a drive at village Latuamora and arrested Ibrahim’s wife Renua with six kilograms of hemp at about 10:00pm. While the law enforcers reached village Chandiwar on their way to police station with Renua, Ibrahim along with his associates carried out an attack on the policemen. Ibrahim and his cohorts opened fire to police personnel, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering the gunfight.

data.name: Ismail Hossain
data.description: Police shot dead Ismail Hossain, 32, son of Shahidul Islam of Shyampur village in Birulia as he and others attacked the law enforcers to snatch a listed criminal named Al-Amin Hossain at Birulia in Savar on the outskirts of the capital on June 8, 2017. Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahbubur Rahman said four policemen led by Sub-Inspector Toriqul Islam raided Shyampur area to arrest Al-Amin Hossain, at around 11:00pm. The police arrested him at his rest house but came under attack as Al-Amin, who sensed the presence of law enforcers, had already announced in a loudspeaker that robbers entered his house, added Mahbubur. At one stage, family members of Al-Amin including his sister, brother and others managed to snatch Al-Amin from the police. The law enforcers in self-defence opened fire on the attackers, the official said. On information, additional force from Savar rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control. Ismail who was the main aide of Al-Amin received a bullet and died on way to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Rabiul
data.description: An alleged robber was killed during a'gunfight' with Rapid Action Battalion in Hadda khal area of Sundarbans on June 10, 2017. The dead man, Rabiul, 30, was the gang leader of Rabiul bahani according to RAB-6. He hailed from Burigoalini village under Munshiganj upazila of Satkhira district. Khondokar Rafiqul Islam, commanding officer of RAB-6, said that after receiving information a RAB team went to patrol the Sundarbans with the help of local police at around 1:00 pm. Sensing the presence of law enforcers Rabiul opened fire on them and law enforcers fired back in retaliation. At one stage of the fire exchange, law enforcers found Rabiul's dead body.

The deceased, Selim Mia, 32, was son of Tajul Islam of Malihata village. OC of Sarail Police Station Rupok Kumar Saha said Selim was arrested while he along with his cohorts was preparing to commit robbery at Bertola village. Later, Selim's cohorts opened fire targeting the policemen to free him, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, Selim was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the OC said.

data.name: Rabiul Badsha
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police and members of his gang on July 1, 2017 at Madrasa road of Chuknagar under Dumuria upazila of Khulna. The dead man was identified as 35-year-old Rabiul alias Badsha, son of Jaffar Sheikh from village Malotia under Dumuria upazila of the district. According to police, he was the leader of a band of robbers. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Dumuria Police Station said that Rabiul was arrested on June 30, 2017. He confessed to possessing illegal firearms and based on information extracted from him police raided the area in the early hours of July 1, 2017. Sensing the presence of law enforcers Rabuil's cohorts opened fire on the police and they retaliated and Rabiul was shot dead.

data.name: Sohel
data.description: Sohel, 35, an alleged criminal and an accused for the murder of Fulgazi upazila chairman Ekramul was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB on July 3, 2017. RAB members raided Birinchi area in Feni town around 4:30am, acting on information that some criminals were taking preparation for committing a robbery, said Squadron Leader Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire. In retaliation, RAB returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". During the gun battle, Sohel was hit by bullets and died on the spot, Fahim added.

data.name: Idris Ali
data.description: An alleged robber, Idris Ali, 32, was killed in an alleged gunfight with police in Rangpur's Mithapukur upazila on July 3, 2017. Mozammel Haq, officer-in-charge of the police station said that police arrested Idris on July 2, 2017 while he was preparing for committing a robbery. Gleaning information from Idris, police along with him went to recover firearms. When their vehicle reached near Joyrampur village around 3:00am, cohorts of Idris opened fire and snatched Idris, the OC said. Police then fired back, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the body of Idris lying on the ground, while his aides managed to flee.

The deceased was identified as Alamgir Hossain, 35, Major AH Mohiuddin, Second-in-Command of RAB-10, said two members of a motorcycle patrol team of the elite force chased a private car after witnessing a snatching in front of Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education around 4:30pm. At one stage, Alamgir was killed.

data.name: Abul Kalam
data.description: Abdul Kalam, an alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Pologround area of Chittagong city on July 19, 2017. A team of Rab-7 raided Pologround area around 3:00am, acting on a tip-off that some arms dealers were trading firearms there, said Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7. He said when the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the RAB team found a bullet-hit man and took him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead on arrival. Victim's family, however, said Kalam went outside his rented house in Baizid area on July 18 morning, saying he was going to work. But he did not return home at night. Md Ripon, the elder brother of Kalam's wife, said, "In the morning, we came to know about his [Kalam] death from TV news. Family members of Kalam asked me to see whether Kalam was alright. I came to the hospital and identified his body. " "My sister's husband [Kalam] used to catch fish and look after their cattle in his village in Feni. He came here [Chittagong city] around six months ago. He used to work as a daily labourer. On July 18 morning, he told my sister that he was going to work in a vehicle as a helper, " Ripon said. But the claim of exchanging fire between Kalam and RAB was not true as he had no firearm, he added.

data.name: Mosharraf
data.description: Two suspected muggers, who allegedly used to pose as DB police and rob people, were shot in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Azimpur on July 25, 2017 afternoon. Mosharraf, 39, and Monir Hossein, 35, suffered bullet wounds in their right and left thighs. They were undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, RAB said. The alleged gunfight took place between a group of muggers and a team of Rab-10 after the law enforcers, acting on a tip-off, went there to nab them. The duo was injured during their fire exchange, Shahabuddin Khan, commanding officer of Rab-10, told.
