data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Mirerbagh, Dakkhin Keraniganj, Dhaka.

data.name: Saiful Islam Jhilki
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Baniyachong upazila, Habiganj.

data.name: Imran
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Kadamati area of Dhaka

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: A suspected drug paddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Akhaura in Brahmanbaria on August 5, 2017. The deceased was identified as Jalal Uddin alias Budo, 45, son of Dharo Miah of village Bawtala under Akhaura upazila in the district. Jalal’s family members, however, claimed that ‘the police killed him in custody in a staged crossfire incident’. Md Mosharaf Hossain, office-in-charge of Akhaura police, said that Jalal Miah was a listed drug paddler and locals detained him and handed him over to the police on August 4, 2017 . The police officer added that Jalal had confessed to the police of possessing illegal firearms and drugs. Later, the police along with Jalal conducted a raid based on his information at Nurpur area around 2:00am on August 5, 2017. ‘Sensing the presence of law enforcers, his associates opened fire on the police and the police retaliated by firing. Jalal Mia received bullets and died on the spot during the gunfight, ’ Mosharaf said. Jalal’s wife Halima Begum claimed that the police arrested her husband and she met him in police custody on Friday morning and afternoon. She claimed that police murdered her husband in custody in a staged gunfight.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.description: Mamun Mia was arrested on August 9, 2017 at Nabinagar upazila of Brahmanbaria. Later police took him to Deura village for rescuing arms. There he was allegedly killied in a gunfight with police.

data.name: Enamul Haq
data.description: A key accused in a college student abduction case was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Shibpur village of Kushtia Sadar on August 22, 2017. Enamul Haq, 33, was accused of abducting and killing college student Sagar Saha. Sagar, 19, son of Pradeep Saha, was abducted on August 16, 2017. Police recovered Sagar’s body in an abandoned toilet at Harinarayanpur village on August 19, 2017. Ratan Seikh, officer-in-charge of Islamic University Police Station, said they arrested Enamul on August 20, 2017. In primary interrogation, Enamul told police that his partner in the crime was a villager named Shipon Ali. According to the OC, police teams taking Enamul with them, went to Shibpur village to hunt for Shipon. "On the way, the police teams were attacked near a banana orchard. They shot at police to snatch Enamul. A gunfight ensued. Enamul, handcuffed, was shot dead when he tried to escape from the police van, " Ratan claimed.

data.name: Mamun
data.description: A man, allegedly involved in a shooting incident on August 12 which left a DB police injured, was killed during a "gunfight" in capital's Jurain on August 22, 2017 with police. The deceased was identified as Mamun, 30.

data.name: Arman Ali
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: A suspected member of Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was reportedly killed in a gunfight between his associates and police at village Boalia of Daulatpur in Kushtia on August 25, 2017 police claimed. Deceased Arman Ali, 42, was the son of Ahsan Ali, a resident of village Thakur Soulatpur in Bheramara upazila. Officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police station Shah Dara Khan said on secret information a police team conducted a drive in the area while Arman and his associates were holding a secret meeting at about 3:30am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the JMB members opened fire on policemen forcing the police to fire back that triggered a gunfight, the police officer said. After the reported gunfight, police found Arman dead with bullet wounds while his associates managed to flee. Later, police took Arman to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors confirmed his death.

data.name: Masudul Haque Pintu
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A BNP leader was allegedly tortured to death by police in Bogra on August 22, 2017 following a family feud over who had the right to fish in a local pond, the deceased’s family has claimed. Family members alleged that Kaigari police outpost in-charge, Inspector Anisur Rahman, and three other officers picked up Pintu from his home without any arrest of warrant on August 22 . "The police pulled out my father from the bathroom and hit him with their rifle butt on his head, chest, neck and other places before taking him away on a CNG-run auto rickshaw, " Pintu’s daughter, Meherunnesa said. . She also said that family members rushed to the police station, but her father was not there. Police informed us that he had died at the hospital. According to the family, Pintu was severely tortured with rifle butts while in custody and later succumbed to his injuries at Shahid Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Robbani
data.description: Syed Nurul Islam, Superintendent of Mymensingh police said a patrol team of Mymensingh DB police, led by its officer-in-charge Ashiqur Rahman, went to Boilor area around 3:30am, acting on information that eight-10 robbers were there to commit a robbery. The team found a gathering of some 200 people at Boilor where the gang attempted to commit the robbery. But chased by locals, the gang members fled in two pickups. Locals caught one of them while fleeing and beat him up, killing him on the spot, the SP said. Hearing the news, the police team went after the gang and came to know that the criminals were staying in Jhitka area. When the law enforcers reached near the spot, the gang members opened fire. In retaliation, police returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". During the "gun battle", Robbani was hit by bullets and died on the spot, said police. However, other members of the gang managed to flee.

data.name: Mojaharul Islam
data.description: Mojaharul Islam, died in the custody of RAB on 9/9/2017 hours after members of the RAB arrested him at Naogaon. He was declared dead at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital at 4:37am, said the hospital and police officials. Executive Magistrate Rohima Sultana Bushra prepared an inquest report at RMCH morgue mentioning marks of injuries in parts of his body. Swollen marks of hits were seen on the back of his head, forehead, throat, both hands, legs, left waist, and on his back. The family member of Mojaharul Islam told reporters there that Mojahar was tortured to death.

data.name: Maulana Saidur Rahman
data.description: Maulana Saidur was tortured to death by the members of Satkhira Sadar Police on 16. 9. 17. SI Asaduzzaman and his team of Satkhira Sadar Police Station, had arrested Saidur from his house. Police claimed that he was arrested in two sabotage cases. Later, police brought him to Kathonda Bazar. During the time, police beat him mercilessly. At this time, his nephew Muttasim Billah asked for release of 5000 taka and left the uncle. But the police demanded one lakh taka. Saidur was brought to Satkhira Police Station due to not being able to pay this money. Police also tortured him brutally there. After taking him to the Court, the authorities refused to accept Saidur after seeing his illness. Later, the police took him back to Satkhira hospital. After recovering his illness, police brought Saidur to the Court again at around 5pm. In the afternoon, Saidur sent the Court to Satkhira jail. Superintendent of Satkhira Prison said that when he fell sick that night he was taken in the prison hospital. Then he was transferred to Satkhira Sadar Hospital in midnight and his treatment was going on'. Dr. Farhad Jamil, residential medical officer of Satkhira Hospital said,'after being brought to the hospital, he was being treated. He died in early morning. The post mortem will be investigated' He also said that the marks of torture in the body of the madrassa teacher Moulana Saidur were found.

data.name: Miraz Hasan Teny
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight with police in Pipulbaria-Baliadanga field at Daulatpur in Kushtia . The deceased was identified as Teny, 27, son of Alam Mandal, a resident of village Chatardara in Aria union of the upazila . Shah Dara Than, Officer-in-Charge of Daulatpur Police Station, said that on a tip-off, a team of police led by sub-inspector Rahim conducted a drive in the area around 03:45am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, members of the opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Later, police rescued bullet-hit Teny from the spot. He was rushed to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Sohagh
data.description: A suspected robber was killed during a shootout with police at Bhairab Bridge area in Bhairab upazila of Kishoreganj. The victim was identified as Md Sohagh, 23, son of Mohammad Ali of village Bhairab Dakhhinpara. On information that a gang of robbers in Bhairab Bridge area were preparing to commit a robbery, a police team led by officer-in-charge of Bhairab Police Station Muklesur Rahman raided the area around 3. 30am, said Mohammad Ali Zinnah, officer-in-charge (Investigation) of Bhairab Police Station. Sensing police presence the alleged robbers fired some 30 round of bullets on the police team, the OC said, and the police retaliated with 20 rounds of gunshots. After the gunfight police found a wounded Sohagh and rushed him to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saidur Rahman
data.description: Nuruzzaman Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Kalai Police Station, said a team of law enforcers raided Harunza village to arrest Md Shapla Hossain, an accused in a case filed under Women and Children Repression Prevention Act by one Shyamoli Akhter of the same village. Witness Ruma Khatun alleged that the police were in an angry mood during the raid and were assaulting villagers irrespective of their gender. At one stage, Saidur Rahman stepped forward and protested their actions. The policemen locked in an altercation with Saidur and later started beating him up in front of the villagers. As he collapsed on the ground unconscious, the policemen took him away, alleged Nadira Begum, Saidur's wife. The police took him to Kalai Upazila Health Complex where he died of his injuries around 8:30am. Police refused to record a case over the death of a man in police torture at Kalai in Jaipurhat, alleged the father of the victim.

data.name: Didarul Alam Chowdhury Sohel
data.description: Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of the media wing at RAB 7, said a Rab team went to Durgapur beside Dhaka-Chittagong highway around 3:30am, acting on information that some criminals were carrying a consignment of phensidyl to Chittagong in microbuses from Dhaka. Five to six criminals came out of two microbuses and opened fire on the RAB men after they were intercepted at a checkpoint, forcing them to return fire. Didar was hit by bullets, said Squadron Leader Safayat Jamil Fahim, Company Commander of RAB -7, who led the drive. Didar was declared dead when he was taken to Mirsarai Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Modon Mia
data.description: Mazharul Islam, officer-in-charge of Bahubal Police Station, said Modon stood accused in seven cases, including the ones related to arms, robbery and murder. Police arrested him and took him to the tea garden area to arrest his associates around 3:30am as per his statement, the police official said. Sensing the presence of police, Modon's associates opened fire. In retaliation, police fired back, triggering the "gunfight". Modon was "caught in the line of fire when he was trying to flee from police custody". He was pronounced dead after being taken to Habiganj Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Moniruzzaman Shahin
data.description: Moniruzzaman was killed during a "gunfight" with DB police around 4:30am. The "gunfight" took place when a team of the Detective Branch of police raided a drug den at Galachipa in Narayanganj city, said Md Sharifuddin, Additional Superintendent of police in the district.

data.name: Shahinur Rahman
data.description: Kushtia Detective Branch of police Officer-in-Charge Sabbirul Islam said that they arrested Shahin and went to Silaidah Kasba Ghat under Kumarkhali in Kushtia along with the accused to arrest another accused wanted in the case of murdering an expatriate. Sensing the law enforcers’ presence, a group of criminals opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight, he said. When the gunfight was over, bullet-hit Shahin was rescued and taken to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, Sabbirul said.

data.name: Mohammad Mokhter Molla
data.description: Abdul Jalil, the OC of Sarankhola police station said a team of RAB-8 on secret information conducted a raid in the area in the morning while the members of Liton Bahini took position in Shaila canal area of the Sunderbans. He said that the robbers, sensing presence of RAB members, opened fire on them and RAB also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight. As the gunfight was over, the OC said, the RAB members searched the area and found a bullet-hit body.

data.name: Mohammad Selim
data.description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of Cox's Bazar RAB-7, said that they arrested Selim from New Fishery Ghat area . Getting information from him, a RAB team conducted a drive in Kurushkul area around 2:00am to arrest his associates and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of RAB officials, his associates opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate, the officer said, claiming, Selim died on the spot receiving a bullet fired by his associates. Selim's associates, however, managed to escape, said Major Ruhul.

data.name: Mohammad Faruk
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the members of RAB at Barisal Colony in Chittagong city. The deceased was Mohammad Faruk. Mimtanur Rahman, senior Assistant Director (media) of RAB-7, said that that a team of RAB members conducted a drive at Barisal Colony to recover drugs around 2:00am. Sensing their presence, Mimtanur claimed, drug peddlers opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate, triggering the gunfight. During the gunfight,

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A youth was killed in a gunfight with the police personnel at Tighria village of Binauti union of Kosba upazila. The identity of the deceased could not be ascertained immediately. Police claimed that he was a robber. Mohammad Mohiuddin, officer-in-charge of Kosba Police Station said that they conducted a drive after received an information from the local people. A group of 15 to 20 robbers with arms attacked at Tighria village for robbery. Sensing their presence, robbers opened fire on the police members. During the time, police counter fire to them for their self defence. Later, they were escaped from the place. Police rescued bullet wounded an unknown person's body from the place.

data.name: Bishwa Chandra Dey
data.description: On October 1, S I Suman of Nalitabari Police Station, detained Bishwa with 60gram Ganja and took him to the police station. During the time, they beat him mercilessly, leaving him critically injured. However, police released him. Later, he succumbed to his injuries at around 2:00am. Bishwa's sister Sheuly Dey alleged that he was killed by police torture.

data.name: Majom Ali
data.description: Majom Ali's family alleged that members of BGB picked up him and tortured, leaving him dead. Robiul Islam, UP member of 6 no. ward of Boroshoshi union, told BGB members tortured Majom infront of him

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: An accused in the case filed over the murder of Malaysia expatriate Rafiqul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police in Kushtia's Kumarkhali. Abdul Khalek, OC of Kumarkhali police station, said a joint team of Kumarkhali police and Detective Branch of Police in Kushtia raided Joynabad village around 2:30am, acting on information that some criminals were holding a meeting there. Cordoning off the spot, police asked the criminals to surrender. Instead of listening to the law enforcers, they opened fire, the OC said. In retaliation, police returned fire, triggering the gunfight that lasted for half an hour, the police official said, adding that they found the body of Anwar on the spot after the gunfight.

data.name: Rashel
data.description: A businessman named Rashel (25) was allegedly tortured to death by the Detective Branch (DB) of Police for one hundred thousand taka at Kaunia’s Haldibari area under Rangpur District. Reshel’s younger sister Sohana alleged that on October 28, 2017 at around 10:00 pm, a group of DB police led by Sub Inspector Shafi arrested her brother from Haldibari Bazaar. Later at around 1:00 am, SI Shafi went to their home and demanded one hundred thousand taka bribe for releasing Rashel. When they said that they did not have the capacity to pay this amount SI Shafi threatened her father and brother to be accused in criminal case. Later DB police inflicted torture on his brother. Due to torture in custody, DB police admitted Rashel to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. On October 29, her brother died in hospital while he was under treatment.

data.name: Afajuddin
data.description: A robber was killed in a gunfight with police while his gang preparing to commit a robbery in Gazipur city. The dead is Afajuddin of Pachahar village at Pagla of Mymensingh. Acting on a tip off, police raided the area and sensing their presence the robbers opened fire on them, triggering the gunfight, said Sakhawat Hossain, Additional SP (Gazipur Sadar-Tongi Circle).

data.name: Nannu Molla
data.description: A leader of a ‘forest robber gang’ was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Chunkuri canal in Satkhira range of Sundarban west division. Local fishermen identified the deceased as Nannu Molla, 47, the second-in-command of a robber gang who went by the name of ‘Zonab Bahini’ in the area, said ANM Zahidul Kabir, the Crime Prevention Company-1 Commander of RAB-6. Being tipped off, a RAB team raided a canal located about five kilometers away from the mainland around 9:30am, he said. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them and prompted the RAB team to retaliate. Nannu was shot in the ensuing gunfight which lasted for half an hour while the other members of the gang fled the scene, claimed the commander.

data.name: Yusuf Fakir
data.description: Two suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans. The deceased were identified as Yusuf Fakir, Second-in-Command of the robber gang and Ruhul Amin, a gang member who was assigned to kill people. Based on information that members of a robber gang, Abbas Bahini, were staying in the area, a team of the elite force carried out a drive in the Baleshwar River, said Hasan Emon Al Rajib, wing commander of RAB-8. Several gunshots were traded between the gang and the RAB members during the gun battle. Yusuf and Ruhul were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the RAB officials said

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.description: Two suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans. The deceased were identified as Yusuf Fakir, Second-in-Command of the robber gang and Ruhul Amin, a gang member who was assigned to kill people. Based on information that members of a robber gang, Abbas Bahini, were staying in the area, a team of the elite force carried out a drive in the Baleshwar River, said Hasan Emon Al Rajib, wing commander of RAB-8. Several gunshots were traded between the gang and the RAB members during the gun battle. Yusuf and Ruhul were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the RAB officials said

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: Al Amin alias Akash, 32, was killed in what police claimed was a crossfire between DB police and his armed cohorts in South Keraniganj. He was killed hours after police picked him up in Munshiganj. Dipok Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Dhaka District Police's Detective Branch (South), said a team of police, taking Al Amin along, went in a drive in Khejurbagan area to recover arms and drugs around 2:30am. But when armed gang men started shooting at police in an attempt to free him, he got shot and died.

data.name: Mokarram Hossain
data.description: A "top robber" enlisted by the Home Ministry was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and RAB in Cox's Bazar. Deceased Mokarram Hossain, 38, led local gang "Jambu Bahini", said RAB. Maj Ruhul Amin, Commander of RAB-7 in Cox's Bazar camp claimed that they were tipped off that a gang was preparing to conduct a robbery in the sea. For this they took position with firearms in Kutubjom. Sensing their presence, the gang opened fire on them, and the force retaliated in self-defence, he claimed. After a 30-minute encounter, the gang fled and the criminal was found bullet-hit. He was declared dead in a local hospital, he said.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Two suspected robbers — Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah — were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murders, robbery and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang ‘Saiful Bahini’ while Safiq was one of his cohorts, RAB claimed. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of police Jasim Uddin said that they, on information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat, conducted a drive in the area around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB members also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

data.name: Safiq Mollah
data.description: Two suspected robbers — Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah — were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murders, robbery and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang ‘Saiful Bahini’ while Safiq was one of his cohorts, RAB claimed. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of police Jasim Uddin said that they, on information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat, conducted a drive in the area around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB members also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

data.name: Palash Mandol
data.description: Palash Mandol, Second in Command of Munna robber gang, was killed in ‘gunfight’ with police at Bhayenar Khal of Sunderban, said Koira police officer-in-charge Enamul Haq. Sensing the presence of police, robber started firing triggering a fight which left Palash dead, said Enamul.

data.name: Billal Hossain Selim
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in police claimed was a shootout between police and his armed cohorts in the capital's Khilgaon area. Billal Hossain Selim, 45, son of Syed Ali of Tangail, was killed hours after police had picked him up from Demra in Dhaka. He was suspected to be a leader of an inter-district robbery gang and was accused in at least 10 cases, police said. Anwar Hossain, deputy commissioner (Motijheel) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said a team of Khilgaon police took Billal on a drive in Mostafa Majhir area to arrest his cohorts and recover firearms around 2:00am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them in an attempt to free Billal. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire and Billal was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arriving at DMCH, the DC said at a press conference at his office.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam died in police custody after he was picked up with his two sons and two nephews from their house at Hazaribagh over a robbery case filed by one of their neighbours. He fell sick during a court hearing. He was first taken to nearby National Medical College Hospital, but doctors referred him to DMCH as his condition deteriorated. DMCH doctors declared him dead. Victim’s daughter Umme Kulsum said that the police arrested her father, two brother—Osman Gani and Murad Hossain, and two of their cousins from their house at Hazaribagh without any warrant. "They were kept in the police custody, tortured, and we were not told the reason for what they were arrested, ’ said Umme Kulsum.

data.name: Abbas Sarder
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged member of Purba Bangla Communist Party was killed in a gunfight with police at Kalitola Kheyaghat area of Beninagar village under Rajbari Sadar. The deceased was Abbas Sarder alias Khokon (46). Tarik Kamal, Officer-in-Charge of Rajbari Sadar Police Station said a team of Sadar Police Station and DB Police drive in Kalitola area at around 3:30am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire and Khokon was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arriving at Sadar Hospital. Police recovered a Kata Rifel, thee cartridge and one shooter gun from that place.

data.name: Mohimuddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami or its sister organization(s)
data.description: An alleged cadre of student wing of Jamaat was killed in a shootout between RAB and his cohorts in Chittagong. According to RAB, Mohin was known to be an operative of notorious student wing of Jamaat cadre Sazzad. The shootout took place in Rajganj area of Panchlaish around 4:00am, said Ashequr Rahman, Lt Commander, deputy director of RAB7. Acting on information that a group of armed criminals, led by Mohin, gathered at Rajganj, a RAB team from Chandgaon camp went to the spot to arrest them. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire on law enforcers. As the RAB team fired retaliatory shots, the thugs fled the area, leaving bullet-hit Mohin behind. Law enforcers later recovered Mohin's body from the spot.

data.name: Abdullah
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with police in the capital's Tejgaon area. Abdullah, 30, from Kishoreganj, was a wanted criminal, said Mohammad Rasheduzzaman, an inspector of Tejgaon Industrial Area Police Station. He said police raided the BG Press field around 3:30am on information that some criminals gathered there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". When the criminals fled, police found the bullet-hit body of Abdullah lying on the spot, the police official said. Abdullah was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he added.

data.name: Mohammad Russel
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russel and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Super Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot

data.name: Mohammad Omar Faruk
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russel and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Super Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot

data.name: Anu Ahmed
data.description: Kushtia Detective Branch of police Acting Officer-in-Charge Sabbirul Islam, reported that a team of DB and Sadar police launched a drive at about 4:00pm on information that a group of robbers were taking preparation to rob on the Rajbari-Kushtia Highway. When the law enforcers turned up, the suspected robbers started shooting at them, who in response had to return shots. After the gunfight, a man with bullet wounds was found, however his associates managed to flee, police said. Later, police sent the body to Kushtia General Hospital where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police (Kanaighat circle) Aminul Islam Sarker said a team of the police led by sub-inspector Bashir raided Habibur’s house at village Charipara as he was wanted in many robbery cases to arrest him. Sensing the presence of police, Habibur opened fire to police while his family members attacked the police with knives. Police fired back that injured at least 8 persons including Habibur and four cops, Aminul said. ‘Habibur was sent to the SOMCH in a critical condition after his recovery from the spot, but he died on his way to the hospital, ’ the police officer said.

data.name: Kohinur Rahman
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A top cadre of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML Janajuddho) faction was killed in a shootout with police in Sadar upazila of Chuadanga. Police arrested Ketu from a hideout of Keraniganj in Dhaka and he was later brought to Chuadanga Sadar Police Station in the evening. During interrogation, Ketu admitted about his firearms at Bhalipur village in the district, " said Amir Abbas, Officer-in-Charge (OC-operation) of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station. "Police started with Ketu to recover the hidden firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot on Chuadanga-Jhenidah highway, Ketu's aides opened fire, triggering a gunfight between them and police, " he said. "Ketu was killed in a line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody with handcuff.

data.name: Riad Sharif
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with the DB Police in Rupganj. Riad, was accused in several robbery cases, said police. On information that a gang was planning to commit robbery in Kanchan bridge area, detectives conducted a raid there. But, sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to return fire, said Narayanganj district DB. They also recovered a foreign pistol, four bullets, a machete and a large knife from the spot.

data.name: Shamim
data.description: The Detective Branch of police in Comilla said that a suspected robber was killed in a gunfight between the DB police and a group of robbers at Chandina. DB sub-inspector Shah Kamal Akand said that the gunfight occurred while a DB police team was patrolling different areas of Chandina. ‘When we reached Chhaygharia on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway around 2:40am, the robbers intercepted our microbus with local weapons and rod bars in an attempt to rob the vehicle, not realising that we were law enforcers, ’ he said. The DB members chased the robbers who in return opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight which left Shamim critically injured. The other robbers managed to escape but the detectives recovered one locally made gun and sharp weapons from the spot. Later, Shamim was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, the SI added. Shamim’s family members, however, alleged that Shahim was picked up by some men in plainclothes from his village home on Saturday.

data.name: Yunus Mia
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Yunus Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police while police went to conduct an operation to catch miscreants at Dimagurunda village, Chunarughat, Hobiganj at around 11. 30 pm on December 31, 2017. Police claimed that Yunus attacked them and in retaliation they opened fire. As a result, Yunus Mia had died. On the other hand, Yunus’s wife Kazi Shahana Akhter informed that police picked up Yunus Mia in the evening.

data.name: Anowar Hossain
data.description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB at Dharmapur, Sadar upazila, Feni on December 31, 2017.

data.name: Sirazul Islam
data.description: Police arrested Sirazul, an accused of Sadia killing, who was killed after being raped, on 4th December 2017. On next day, he was produced before the Court and admits about the incident. On 8 December, suddenly he felt sick at Barisal Central Jail. Later, he rushed to the Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries. On the basis of prescription and information of the doctors, he felt sick for torture and then died

data.name: Anwar Hossain Raju
data.description: A person was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB in Feni. The deceased was Anwar Hossain Raju, son of Jahangir Alam of Dharmapur in Feni Sadar. Anwar’s father Jahangir Alam alleged that his son, who was released on bail only 10 days earlier, was picked up by RAB personnel from the house around 4:00 am and then they heard that his son was killed in a ‘gunfight’. Feni Camp Commander of RAB-7, Squadron Leader Shafayat Jamil Fahim claimed that on a tip-off that a gang of drug traders gathered at Dharmapur, a team of the battalion raided the area. The drug traders opened fire on RAB personnel, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. Anwar received bullet-wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to Feni General Hospital where on-duty physicians declared him dead.

data.name: Lutfar Rahman
data.description: Mohanganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ansari Jinnat Ali said that Lutfar was arrested and the police launched a drive at night with Lutfar at Noapara to recover illegal arms. During the drive, Lutfar’s accomplices fired gunshots on the police and the police retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Lutfar sustained bullet wound during the exchange of fire and was taken to Mohanganj Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Farid
data.description: A suspected forest robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between a team of river police and suspected robbers at Katiarkhal in Sunderbans east division under Sarankhola in Bagerhat. Sarankhola Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Kabirul Islam said a team of river police’s Dhansagar outpost, on tip-off that the members of forest robber gang ‘Chhoto Bahini’ had abducted six fishermen for ransom, conducted a drive at Katiarkhal in the Sunderbans at about 2:30am. He said the team, on suspicion, signaled a boat to stop but the boat violated the signal and the suspected robbers from the boat opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate by firing. The OC claimed that Farid was shot and died on the spot and his associates managed to get away by jumping into the river and swimming ashore.

data.name: Babu
data.description: Babu, the main accused in Awami League activist Abbas Mollah murder case, was killed during a "gunfight" with a Rapid Action Battalion. Major Zia, Commander, Jessore camp, RAB-6 said acting on a tip-off that a group of criminals had gathered for a meeting in Mirzapur village, a RAB team went to the area around 4:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the gang fired at them triggering a "gunfight".

data.name: Solaiman
data.description: An alleged kidnapper of a child was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Ashuganj. Police arrested Solaiman, on charge of kidnapping Rifat (7), son of Bahar Mia of Khariala village of the upazila. Following his statement given during primary interrogation, a team of police raided abandoned Ankhi Trading and Boiler House in Bahadurpur area to arrest prime suspect Mizan of the case, said Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj Police Station Badrul Alam Talukder. Sensing the presence of police, Solaiman's accomplices opened fire on them. As the police returned fire, a gunfight ensued and a bullet fired by his cohorts hit Solaiman. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Abu Taher
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with Comilla DB Police in Amtoli area near the Gumti river of Comilla Sadar around 1:30am. Officer-in-Charge Monjur Alam of Comilla DB police said that the DB police was conducting a special drive near the Gumti in Amtoli. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fired on the policemen resulting in a gunfight. Taher was shot dead on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Zakaria Sardar
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion claimed a gunfight between a team of RAB and a gang of suspected robbers at Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Sohel Rana Prince said a team of RAB, on a tip-off that the members of forest robber gang ‘Sumon Bahini’ had been staying at Sukhparar Char area in the Sunderbans, conducted a drive there. Sensing presence of RAB, suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the gunfight ended after about 40 minutes and the suspected robbers fled away, the RAB official claimed, the RAB men searched the area and found bullet-hit bodies of three people whom the fishermen later identified as members of ‘Sumon Bahini’.

data.name: Bashar Mia
data.description: In Brahmanbaria, two suspected robbers, who were arrested, were killed in a "gunfight" in Sarail upazila. Mofijul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said, "Police went to recover firearms as per the information of the two. When the police team reached Shahbazpur-Deora regional road of Sarail upazila around 2:45am, their accomplices attacked police to snatch the two. " The "criminals" opened fire and police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Wahab, along with, Bashar died on the spot.

data.name: Abdul Wahab
data.description: In Brahmanbaria, two suspected robbers, who were arrested, were killed in a "gunfight" in Sarail upazila. Mofijul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said, "Police went to recover firearms as per the information of the two. When the police team reached Shahbazpur-Deora regional road of Sarail upazila around 2:45am, their accomplices attacked police to snatch the two. " The "criminals" opened fire and police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Bashar, along with Wahab, died on the spot.

data.name: Razaz Ali
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rangpur city. Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent of Police in Rangpur, said on being tipped off that a gang of robbers was preparing for a robbery in Dharmadash area near the Rice Research Institute, a police team was sent there. When the law enforcers reached the area around 4:00am, the gang opened fire at them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. A member of the gang was killed in the "gunfight" that ensued. Others managed to flee the spot. They recovered the dead body and sent it to Rangpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: A man was killed and two others were injured in a clash between police and a group of villagers in Sitakunda upazila of Chittagong. The dead was Saiful Islam, 22, son of Shamsul Alam of Telipara village under Bhatiari union. A team of plainclothes policemen went to the village to detain some criminals around 9:00pm. The clash broke out as the villagers tried to stop the law enforcers from making the arrests, said locals. "Suddenly, the criminals tried to escape. At one point, police opened fire, leaving one dead and two injured, " said Nazim Uddin, chairman of Bhatiari Union Parishad. Later, the villagers blocked the Dhaka-Chittagong highway near the village for an hour in protest. They left after the chairman assured them of justice.

data.name: Swapan Pyada
data.description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. Officials of RAB-8 said the gang, locally known as Munna Bahini, was involved in abducting fishermen and honey collectors from the Bay of Bengal and the Sundarbans for ransom. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB men raided Majherchar area around 5:30am. When the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", said Hasan Al Rajib, Company Commander of RAB-8 in Patuakhali. Three bodies were found on the spot after the "gun battle".

data.name: Liton Khondokar
data.description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. data.name: Iman Ali
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "shootout" with police in Chuadanga. Ahsan Habib, Assistant superintendent of police in Chuadanga, said a police team, led by him, raided the village around 1:30am on information that some robbers were preparing to commit robbery on the highway. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". During the "gun battle", Iman was hit and he died on the spot, while others fled, the police official said.

data.name: Mohammad Naim
data.description: A suspected snatcher was killed in an alleged incident that police claimed was a ‘gunfight’ between police and suspected snatchers at Balashpur Balurchar area. The deceased, Md Naim, 22, of Krishtapur area of the town, was the prime suspect for the murder of Ananda Mohan College HSC student Ibrahim Khalil who was stabbed to death by suspected snatchers in the town’s Patgudam area on January 15, police said. Mymensingh Kotwali Police Station officer-in-charge Khandaker Saker Ahmed said a team of Detective Branch of Police, upon receiving information that a group of snatchers including Naim were staying at Balshpur, conducted a drive in the area to arrest the suspects of Ibrahim Khalil killing. Sensing the presence of police, the snatchers opened fire forcing the cops to shoot back. Naim sustained bullet injuries while his accomplices managed to flee. Police took him to the Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Julhash Mondol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An alleged top leader of an outlawed party was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Dhalarchar area of Pabna's Bera upazila during a drive for recovering illegal firearms. Pabna Police Superintendent Jihadul Kabir said Julhas was a listed criminal and had been in hiding for some time. A team from Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) had arrested Julhas in the capital's New Market area and then handed him over to Pabna police. Acting on information obtained from him, Aminpur police took Julhash along with them during a raid to recover a cache of arms in Dourir Char of Bera upazila. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his cohorts fired shots at the police near Balaz Member intersection in Dhalar Char area around 1:00am, prompting police to retaliate and thus triggering a "gunfight". At one point of the "gunfight", Julhash's cohorts fled leaving Julhash's body behind, Sukumar Mohonto, Officer in Charge of Aminpur police station, said.

data.name: Nazim Uddin Shikder
data.description: Police said cardiac arrest. But the deceased family members alleged that he was tortured to death by DB Police. He subseqiently died in Jamalpur General Hospital.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: In Narayanganj, a suspected robber was killed in what police said in a "shootout" in Fuldee village of Sonargaon upazila. The deceased was Nazrul Islam, 36, of Dudkhatha village in the Upazila. A police team was patrolling Fuldee area where a local had announced through a mosque loudspeaker that 10-12 robbers inside a bush were preparing for committing a robbery, said Morshed Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station. When the team went there around 4:00am, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", police found the bullet-riddled body of Nazrul on the scene, while others fled.

data.name: Rinku Dewan
data.description: Officer-in-Charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station Alamgir Hossain said acting on a tip-off, police went to Charbeherpara area to arrest Rinku around 12:00noon. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Rinku opened fire at them. Sub-Inspector Sanjay was shot in the leg. Police opened fire in retaliation and at one stage, Rinku was shot and killed. Police recovered his body and a firearm from the spot. Superintendent of Police Mohammad Jayedul Alam claimed that Rinku was a "notorious criminal" and involved in various offences.

data.name: Mohammad Sujan
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: An activist of AL was shot dead and 50 others, including five cops, were injuries in a clash between its two factions at Kanchan Bridge area of Rupganj. Police and locals said two AL factions — one loyal to Kayetpara union council chairman Rafiqul Islam and another loyal to local MP Gazi Golam Dastagir — took positions on a bridge at about 11:00am to inhibit BNP leaders and activists from taking to the streets and tackle any possible unrest over the verdict on a corruption case against BNP chairperson and five others. But at one stage, members of the factions locked into an altercation and start fighting. To bring the situation under control, police opened fire and shot tear gas canisters. At least six persons, including Sujon, got shot at that time. Later, the injured were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared Sujon dead at about 1:30pm, Said sub-Inspector Bacchu Miah, in-charge of DMCH police outpost.

data.name: Sohorab Hossain Sourav
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between police and suspected robbers at Pathannagar under Chhagalnaia in Feni. Family members of the deceased, Sohorab Hossain Sourav, 30, son of Mohammad Amin of village Pathannagar under Chhagalnaia upazila, alleged that police shot Sohorab to death after picking him from their residence. Chhagalnaia Police Station Officer-in-Charge MM Morshed said they arrested Sohorab for his alleged involvement in a recent incident of robbery, which saw a Saudi expatriate was killed at Pathannagar. On the basis of his information, police said, they had conducted a raid at Pathannagar when suspected robbers, also associates of the deceased, opened fire on police personnel sensing their presence. Police claimed it prompted the law enforcers to retaliate triggering a gunfight. He said that Sohorab received a bullet during the gunfight and police rushed him to Feni Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Islam Nura
data.description: Nurul Islam Nura, a suspected of committing Merul Badda murder was killed in a reported gunfight with the police’s Detective Branch (DB) near Badda’s Satarkul area in Dhaka. The OC said Nura was sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) for treatment after he was detained. A DB team took him on a drive late at night. Upon reaching Satarkul, the DB team was allegedly fired upon by Nura’s alleged associates. An allegedly stray bullet hit Nura who was taken back to DMCH, where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Anu
data.description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of RAB-7, said that RAB conducted an operation, acting on a tip-off, around 4:00am to arrest Anwar. "After the presence of law enforcers was sensed by some criminals, a "gunfight" ensued between them and the RAB officials. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. RAB recovered Anwar's bullet-hit body and took it to Chakaria Upazila Heath Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Selim
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Boro Kumira area in Chittagong. Around 3:30am, a group of six armed robbers waylaid a Laksham-bound pickup in Boro Kumira area on Dhaka-Chittagong highway, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmad, Commanding Officer of RAB-7. The vehicle, coming from Hathazari upazila, was carrying 21 people, including children and women, and wedding gifts for a bridegroom. The criminals beat up the people and looted valuables, including gold ornaments, and cash from them. The victims informed a RAB patrol team of the matter. After a short search, the RAB personnel found the robbers under a bridge where they were distributing the looted valuables among themselves. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB men to retaliate. After the "gun battle", the RAB team found a bullet-hit man on the spot and the looted valuables. The others managed to flee. He was declared dead after being taken to Sitakunda Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Jabed Mia
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between his cohorts and police in Kaitala village under Nabinagar Upazila. Chittaranjan Paul, Additional Police Superintendent of Nabinagar circle said that he was arrested for involvement in a theft case. Acting on information that a cache of arms was hidden near Bhanga Bridge, a team of police took him to the spot. "When we took him to Bhanga bridge of local Moheshpur road around 3:15am, his associates opened fire and tried to snatch him away from us, " the police official said. As the law enforcers retaliated, a gunfight ensued and Jabed got shot by his associates. Jabed was rushed to Nabinagar Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. The deceased were the members of notorious gang'Hasan Bahini', Hasan Al Rajib, Wing Commander of RAB-8 was quoted as saying. The identities of the deceased could not be ascertained. When a patrol team of RAB-8 chased a trawler in the Bhaleshwar river around 6:00am the gang members took shelter in Majherchar. When the RAB members reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

data.name: Abdur Rab Hawladar
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Patka in Sreepur upazila around 3:30am. The deceased was Abdur Rab Hawladar, 35, hailing from Goshairhat upazila in Shariatpur. Around 3:00am, a team of police was patrolling the area when the robbers shot at their vehicle. The team fired back, resulting in the "gunfight", said Joynal Abedin, Assistant Sub-Inspector of Sreepur Police Station. At one stage, Abdur Rab sustained injuries after being hit by a bullet, fired by one of his cohorts, claimed police. He was declared dead at Sreepur Upazila Health Complex. The body was sent to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Mohammad Prince
data.description: A suspected robber was killed and another hurt in a "shootout" with police. The deceased was Md Prince, 28, and the injured, Golap Hossain Bappi, 27, of Amubari village of Madaripur. Bappi was being treated at Rangpur Medical College Hospital. On information that a gang of robbers was preparing for a heist near Keramatia Government School in Munsipara area under Rangpur city, police raided the area, said Abdul Aziz, Inspector (Investigation) of Rangpur Sadar Police Station. Sensing their presence, the gang attacked the law enforcers and they retaliated. The other gang members fled the scene. The body was sent to Rangpur Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Rubel
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" between police and a gang in Savar. The deceased was identified as Rubel, 26, from Tangail. Abul Kalam Azad, Sub-Inspector of Ashulia Police Station, said police were on the lookout for the gang since a highway robbery on the night of February 12. DB police arrested Rubel, prime accused in the robbery case, from Kobirpur area around 9:30pm. Based on Rubel's confessional statement, a team of Ashulia Police Station and Detective Branch of Police (Dhaka north) jointly launched a drive in Ashulia's Tongabari area around 3:00am to arrest the other gang members. They took Rubel along with them. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rubel was caught in the line of fire. The other gang members managed to flee. He was taken to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zillur Rahman
data.description: In Narayanganj, alleged robbers -- Zillur Rahman, 35, and an unidentified man -- were shot dead in a gunfight with RAB on Dhaleshwari River in Alirtek area. Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said the gunfight ensued when a RAB team raided the area where around eight to ten robbers were preparing to loot ships.
