Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said the gunfight ensued when a RAB team raided the area where around eight to ten robbers were preparing to loot ships.

data.name: Jahangir
data.description: Jahangir, 38, was shot dead in a gunfight with police in Jampur Mirerbag area of Sonargaon upazila. Narayanganj police said a gang of around eight robbers was preparing for robbery on a road. When police rushed to the spot, the robbers started firing bullets, ensuing the "gunfight".

data.name: Sabedul Haque
data.description: A team of RAB, on secret information, conducted a raid at remote hilly Jungle Salimpur, Sitakunda, to recover illegal firearms and suspected robbers at about 12 noon, quotted RAB-7 Deputy Commander Ashiqur Rahman. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on RAB men, prompting them to retaliate. The RAB official said Kalu died on the spot hit by bullets during the ``gunfight’’ and that his body had been sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for post mortem.

data.name: Ibrahim Majhi
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in what RAB claimed, a gunfight between suspected robbers and RAB at Char Elahi under Companiganj Upazila in Noakhali. The deceased was Ibrahim Majhi, from Sandwip upazila in Chittagong. His name was on the list of robbers prepared by the Home Ministry. Additional Superintendent of Noakhali police AKM Zahirul Haq said that a team of RAB-7 from Chittagong conducted a drive in the area and sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while others managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Quazi Md Emran Hossain Saiful
data.description: Saiful was killed in police custody in what police claimed as gunfight between police and suspected robbers at GM Hat area at Phulgazi in Feni. The victim‟s family, however, claimed that the man was picked up by police and was shot in his head and killed for enmity with some local influential people over his soil business. Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Humayun Kabir said they conducted a raid at GM Hat area to arrest Saiful, but he managed to flee by attacking police when Constable Abul Khayer, 45, received serious injuries. Later at night, police lodged a case with the Phulgazi police station and arrested Saiful at his residence at night. He said police later conducted a raid at GM Hat area with Saiful and when the team reached near GM Hat Brickfield, Saiful‟s cohorts opened fire on police. Police also retaliated by firing when three suspected robbers, including Saiful were shot during the gunfight. All the injured people were rushed to Feni Sadar Hospital where doctors declared Saiful dead.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: Abdur Rashid was shot dead in a gunfight with police at Kadamtoli in Dhaka. Police demanded that he was a robber. Police conducted a raid after receiving an information and when the team reached near at Wasapur area the robbers opened fire on police. Police also retaliated by firing when Rashid was shot. Critical injured Rashid succumbed to his injuries at DMCH

data.name: Badsha
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The "gunfight" took place when a RAB team signalled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added the elite force had put up checkpoints at several spots including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10 and Airport Road on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signalled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them received bullets and were left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30pm.

data.name: Hanif Hamid
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The "gunfight" took place when a RAB team signalled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added the elite force had put up checkpoints at several spots including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10 and Airport Road on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signalled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them received bullets and were left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30pm.

data.name: Hasan Ali
data.description: A man suspected to be the key accused in the murder of Dhaka Metropolitan Police’s Detective Branch Inspector Jalaluddin was killed in what police called a gunfight between DB men and suspected miscreants at Pirerbagh. The photograph of Hasan Ali, key suspect in Jalaluddin murder, matches with the man who was killed in gunfight. Metropolitan Police Detective Branch (West Division) Deputy Commissioner Mohammed Mokhlesur Rahman said, acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a drive at Bhanga Bridge area of Pirerbagh around 2:30am to arrest the suspects of Jalal murder and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, miscreants opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate by firing. An unidentified young man, aged about 25 years, was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries while the others managed to flee the scene. Later, the policemen rescued the critically injured man, took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jahirul Islam
data.description: Dakkhinkhan Police said that a robber was killed in'gunfight' with police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during robbery at a house in Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in Diabari area around 3:00am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul bullet shot, Tapan Kumar Saha Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge claimed. The OC further demand that, after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead at around 5am.

data.name: Jakir Hossain Milon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: A Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal leader died in custody just six days after his arrest while he was returning from a demonstration organised by Bangladesh Nationalist Party in the capital. A prison official said that the inmate complained of "health problem" at the jail hospital in Keraniganj about 7:40am and was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he died about 8:40am. Family said Ramna police picked Zakir Hossain, from somewhere between Press Club and Naya Paltan, and handed him over to Shahbagh Police Station. His uncle BM Waliullah said they came to know from different sources that Zakir fell ill and was taken to hospital. Dakkhinkhan police said that a robber was killed in'gunfight' with police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during robbery at a house in Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in Diabari area around 3:00am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul bullet shot, Tapan Kumar Saha Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge claimed. The OC further claimed that, after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead. The family alleged that he was tortured in custody that caused his death.

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.description: Abdur Rahim, 20, accused of raping the girl at Chakaria upazila on March 26 was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. The incident occurred in Ulubania area adjacent to Katakhali Bridge under Dulahazara union around 12:30am. Company Commander Maj Md Ruhul Amin of RAB's Cox's Bazar camp said criminals opened fire on a patrol team of the elite force. The crime busters returned the fire and drove away the criminals. The RAB team recovered bullet-hit body of Rahim from the spot.

data.name: Haider Ali
data.description: Mimtanur Rahman, Media Officer of RAB-7, said that acting on a tip-off, RAB conducted a raid around 12:30am to arrest miscreants. ‘After some criminals sensed the presence of law enforcers, a "gunfight" ensued between them and the RAB members. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene, ’ he said adding that they recovered Haider’s bullet-hit body from the spot.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between a gang of robbers and police at Thakurgaon-Dinajpur Highway Road at Dawan night. The deceased person's identity could not found. Officer-in-Charge of Thakurgaon Police said that police conducted a raid after received information about robbery. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving one bullet shot. After being rushed to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Nazrul Islam
data.description: In 2 April 2018, a group of 10-12 smuggler entering Bangladesh from India with Indian Sharee. During the time, BGB members of Kakdanga camp of BGB, challenged them. Then the smuggler opened fire to them, prompting them to retaliate in self-defence, leaving one bullet shot and wounded. Local people rushed to Khulna's Gazi Clinic where he died.

data.name: Uzzal Mia
data.description: The main suspect in stabbing a police officer was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between Detective Branch of Police and suspected drug traders at Saheb Kachhari area. The deceased was Uzzal Mia, 26, son of Samor Ali of Jailkhana Road area in Gouripur municipality in Mymensingh. Mymensingh district Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman claimed that a team of district DB, on secret information, conducted a drive at Saheb Kachhari area at about 2:00am to arrest Uzzal. He said Uzzwal and his cohorts, sensing the police presence, opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to retaliate by firing. The police officer said when the gunfight was over, they found seriously injured Uzzal and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Kuddus
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: An outlawed party leader was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Kushtia's Kumarkhali upazila. The dead, Abdul Kuddus alias Sagar, 47, of Urakandi village in Rajbari Sadar upazila, was the regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party's Lal Pataka faction. A RAB team cordoned off the spot around 3:30am and asked the criminals to surrender. Instead of complying, the criminals opened fire, the RAB official said. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After an hour- long battle, the criminals fled and the RAB team found a body on the spot.

data.name: Rakib Howlader
data.description: A 15-year-old film actor was killed in an alleged ‘gunfight’ between mugging suspects and police on Toyenbee Circular Road at Wari in Dhaka. The family, however, alleged that the boy, Rakib Howlader, a school dropout who played the role of a child character in a movie was picked up on April 4 and killed in custody. Wari Police Station Officer-in-Charge Rafiqul Islam, however, claimed that Rakib was 22-year-old and was the prime suspect in killing of Daffodil University student Khandaker Abu Talha in October 2017. Police officials said that he was earlier arrested on October 10, 2017 just two days after the killing of Talha. Wari police station sub-inspector Shah Alam claimed that a group of eight or nine suspected muggers opened fire on a police patrol team behind Bangladesh Homeopathic Medical College Hospital at about 3:20am. Police also retaliated by firing triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight the police found bullet-hit Rakib. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: The main accused in a case filed for raping an eight-year-old girl was killed in a gunfight‖ with RAB in Jessore town. Major Ziaur Rahman, Commander of RAB-6 in Jessore, said around 3:45am, a RAB team raided Kholadanga Mandalgati area on information that some criminals were holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the RAB members' presence, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the ―gun battle‖, RAB members found bullet-hit Al Amin lying on the spot. He was rushed to Jessore Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zamshed Ali
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police. The deceased was identified as Zamshed Ali, 43, son of Osman Ali of Kosba village in the upazila. Harendranath Sarker, Officer-in-Charge of Gangni Police Station, said they raided a banana orchard at Hemayetpur village on information that "robbers" were holding a secret meeting there to rob vehicles on Hemayetpur-Amtola road. The police team cordoned off the orchard around 3:30am, asked the alleged criminals to surrender and came under fire. The team retaliated, forcing the criminals to flee the scene after an hour-long gunfight. The law enforcers claimed to have found bullet-hit Zamshed on the spot. They took him to Gangni Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctor Ali Reza declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an ‘exchange of bullets’ with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based ‘on information’ they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an ‘exchange of bullets’ with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based ‘on information’ they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an ‘exchange of bullets’ with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based ‘on information’ they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

data.name: Saidul
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: A suspected member of an underground party was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between his cohorts and police at Jakura Balurghat at Sadar upazila in the district. Rajbari Police Superintendent Asma Siddiqa Mili in a press briefing said that the law enforcers conducted a drive when the underground operatives were holding a meeting at Jakura Balurghat around 2:30am. Sensing presence of police, they fired gunshot on them forcing police to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, Saidul sustained bullet wounds while his cohorts fled the scene. Later, police took Saidul to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Khokan Sutradhar
data.description: A man was killed in ‘gunfight’ with police at Akhaura hours after his arrest. Khokon Sutrdhar was the son of Ramesh Sutradhar, resident of Singarbil of Bijoynagar upazila in the district. Local people caught him when he was trying to snatch money from one Makib Deb, a Manager of a tobacco company distributor at Lalbazar road. Locals caught him and handed him over to police. His brother Makhon Sutradhar alleged ‘it was murder’. Akhaura Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mosharaf Hossain said the police conducted a raid taking Khokan with them to arrest his associates. Around 2:45am, when police reached near Akhaura Titas Bridge, Khokan’s associates opened fire, forcing police to ‘retaliate’ in self-defence. ‘Khokan was injured from a bullet from his friends, ’ the police officer claimed. Later, police claimed, they took him to Akhaura Health Complex where the doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Krishnapod Das
data.description: A farmer allegedly been killed at police custody in Bhola. The deceased name was Krishnapod Das. Police said he was died due to cardiac arrest. The deceased wife Chatur Rani and son Sujan Das told Jony (Roni), son of UP member Monzu Matobbar, handed Krishnapod to police. Police tortured him in the custoday. After deteriorating his condition, police took him to the hospital, where duty doctor declared him died.

data.name: Babul Hossain
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in police custody in a reported ‘gunfight’ between police and suspected robbers in Raipur area. The deceased, Babul Hossain, 35, son of Iman Ali of Purcherchar area under Madhabdi upazila in Narsingdi district. Daudkandi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mizanur Rahman said police arrested two — Babul and Maruf Hossain Lablu of Shibchar in Madaripur — from Uttara area in Dhaka in a case of hijacking a covered van lodged with his police station on April 11 and recovered the booty from Dhaka as per their information. They were brought to Daudkandi Police Station and a team of police went to Raipur area on Dhaka-Chittagong highway to catch the cohorts of Babul and Maruf. As the team reached Raipur at about 3:00am, the detainees’ cohorts, sensing police presence, opened fire on police and tried to snatch the detainees. Police retaliated by firing on the suspects. The OC claimed that as the ‘gunfight’ was over, they found critically injured Babul and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Halim
data.description: Abdul Halim, a suspected robber, was killed in DB Police at Kongshonagar area. Police said based ‘on information’ they launched a drive in the area as some robbers were planning to commit robbery in Comilla-Sylhet Highway Road. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers fired gunshots and threw brick bats on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and one body was found found lying in the area and two robbers were detained. They took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Abdur Razzaq
data.description: A man accused of murdering an autorickshaw driver was killed in a gunfight‖ with police in Gudaria area. According to AKM Mahbub Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Phulpur Police Station, Razzaq is an accused in the auto-rickshaw driver Alim Uddin murder case filed with the police station. A team of DB police led by its Officer-in-Charge Md Ashiqur Rahman raided Gudaria area on Mymensingh- Sherpur road to arrest Razzaq around 4:30am. Sensing police presence, the accused and his cohorts fired several gun shots at the police team prompting the police to shoot back. Razzaq was hit in the chest during the exchange. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Amberia area. The identity of the deceased could not be known but locals confirmed that he was a member of Sattar Bahini, said RAB-8 Patuakhali Company Commander Additional Superintendent of Police Surat Ali. Seeing a patrol team of RAB-8, a gang of robbers opened fire, triggering a gunfight. Later, a bullet-hit body was found in the area.

data.name: Abdul Hakim Mintu
data.description: Abdul Hakim Mintu, an accused in a child rape case was killed in a gunfight with RAB-7 at Banshkhali. The gunfight took place at a border line area between Banshkhali and Pekuya thana area when a team of RAB went there to arrest the alleged rapist, said Deputy Director of RAB-7 Lt Com Ashequr Rahman. On receiving a tip off, a team of RAB carried out a raid to arrest Mintu. Mintu and his associates opened fire at the RAB personnel and RAB also shot back in retaliation. The bullet-riddled body of Mintu was recovered from Toitong area under Pekuya union after the gunfight ended. Mintu was rushed to the Pekuya Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Atikul Islam Atik
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kuicchagara area. Sources said a gang of highway robbers put up a barricade on Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated, after some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two bullet hit members. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kuicchagara area. Sources said a gang of highway robbers put up a barricade on Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated, after some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two bullet hit members. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police in Muradnagar. Manzur Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Muradnagar Police Station, said that on information that robbers had taken position along the road, a team led by Additional Superintendents of Police Shakhawat Hossain (North) and Mohammad Jahangir Alam (Muradnagar circle) raided Shushunda area on Eliotganj-Muradnagar road around 1:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on them. The police also returned fire, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers left the spot, leaving wounded Al Amin behind. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Sohag Hossain
data.description: An alleged rapist has been killed in a gunfight with police at Kolaroa. Officer-In-Charge of Kolaroa Police Station Biplob Kumar Nath said Sohag raped a nine year old student of a primary school in Keragacchi union. The victim's maternal grandmother filed a case against Sohag with the police station. On the basis of the information, a police team, led by Sub-Inspector Solaiman, went to the area to arrest Sohag. When police were passing by Hizoldi field, some miscreants shot at police and also hurled brickbats at them. Police fired back in retaliation. After exchange of gun shots for about 20 minutes, the criminals fled. One person was found bullet hit and lying on the spot. Police rushed him to Kolaroa Health Complex, where the on-duty emergency doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam Arif
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in gunfight with police at Char Haydrabad. Munshiganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Alamgir Hossain said they arrested Saiful in possession with 110 pieces of contraband yaba tablets. He said that they extracted information from Saiful about illegal drugs and at about 1:30am, a team of police along with Saiful went to recover the drugs. The OC said that when the team reached the Char Haydrabad area, Saiful’s accomplices opened fire on police. As Saiful tried to run away he got shot. The police rushed bullet-hit Saiful to Munshiganj General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Alam
data.description: The Chandraganj Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Md Zafar Ahmed, reported that Nuru was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Chandraganj Ganipur. He claimed that a team of police, on secret information that a group of robbers gathered at Ganipur area for committing robbery, conducted a drive in the area at about 3:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. At one stage of the gunfight, Nuru received bullets and died on the spot.

data.name: Raihan Sardar
data.description: Raihan was killed in a gunfight between a team of RAB-5 and suspected robbers by the side of Bagha-Charghat road at Hajirdhalan area. RAB-5 Deputy Commander AM Ashraful Islam claimed that a patrol team of RAB-5, while patrolling at Charghat came to know that a group of robbers had gathered at Hajirdhalan area at about 12:30am and conducted a raid there. He claimed that when the RAB-5 patrol team reached near Hajirdhalan area, the suspected robbers opened fire on them and RAB also retaliated by firing. As the gunfight was over and the suspected robbers fled the scene, they searched the area and found bullet-hit Raihan and rushed him to Charghat Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead. Victim’s wife Beauty Begum said that her husband left the house and did not return home while the people of Hazir Dhalan Beel area said that they did not hear any fighting in the area at night.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: A suspected criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with DB police in Mymensingh town, barely half an hour after his arrest. A team of Detective Branch (DB) of police arrested Salam with 50 yaba pills in Rally Mour area of the town around 1:45am, said Md Ashikur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of DB, Mymensingh, who led the drive. The shooting incident took place around 2:15am when the DB team took Salam along and went to Mymensingh town's Alia Madrasa Road area to arrest Siraj Uddin, an alleged "drug trader". Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Siraj and his cohorts opened fire at the DB police, forcing police to retaliate, triggering the "gunfight". Salam was hit by a bullet on his chest. The critically injured Salam was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nabab Ali Mollah
data.description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Abaderhat area. The deceased was identified as Nabab Ali Mollah. Satkhira Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Maruf Ahmed, said Patkelghata police arrested fugitive Nabab Ali from Patkelghata. He was handed over to Satkhira Police Station as he was accused in several cases with them. During interrogation Nabab Ali confessed the possession of arms. A police team took Ali along to Abaderhat area around 4:00am. About 200 yards from the spot, members of Ali's gang started shooting at the police team from an abandoned house trigerring a gunfight. The injured were taken to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where doctors at emergency department declared Nabab Ali dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ashraful Mia
data.description: Aslam picked up by the DB (west) of the DMP for interrogation died at DMCH. Aslam, of Gazipur was a suspect in the abduction of a youth of Shah Ali area of Dhaka, police officials said. DB Inspector Md Mahbub, who brought Aslam to the hospital, said that he brought Aslam to Rajarbagh Police Lines Hospital from where he was sent to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital at about 10:30am and the doctors advised some laboratory tests. He said that he heard that doctors declared Aslam dead at about 5:45pm, when he returned after getting the tests done. Metropolitan police Additional Commissioner (Detective Branch) Devdas Bhattacharya said that a team of DB police picked up Aslam in an abduction case and he complained pain in the abdomen and he fell sick on the way to Detective Branch office.

data.name: Altab Hossain
data.description: An alleged mugger was killed in a gunfight with police in Daulatpur upazila. The deceased was Altab Hossain, son of Golam Mostofa of Boalia in the upazila, said Sabbirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch (DB) of police in Kushtia.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between a gang of forest robbers and RAB in Dakatir Khal area. The identity of the deceased could not be known. RAB-8 Deputy Commending Officer said a RAB patrol team was patrolling in the area at about 6:30am when a suspected forest robber gang opened fire targeting RAB men and RAB also retaliated by firing. The gunfight continued for about half an hour and the suspected robbers fled away. Later, the RAB team searched the area and found the body of a 25-year old suspected forest robber whom fishermen identified as a member of the "Gariber Bandhu robber gang".

data.name: Lelin
data.description: In Dhaka, an alleged criminal identified as Lelin, 35, of Shreenagar upazila in Munshiganj, was killed in a "gunfight" with detectives in Khilgaon Nandipara area, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police Masudur Rahman said. Rahman said police conducted a drive in the area around 3:15am after receiving information that a gang of criminals had gathered there to commit a crime. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate. Lelin got injured during the "gunfight", while his accomplices managed to escape. He was declared dead after police took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Raju Prodhan
data.description: Maj Manjur Mahede, a Company Commander of RAB-1, said a RAB team went to 300 feet road area in Rupganj area after receiving information that a gang of muggers had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the RAB team, the muggers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated for self defence. After the fire exchange stopped, RAB informed local police who took Raju to Rupnagar Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shafayat Tamrin
data.description: One of the three persons detained following the murder of a Jubo League activist in Badda was killed in a "shootout" between DB police and "criminals" in the capital's Aftabnagar area. At around 9:30pm, Shafayat along with two aides allegedly entered Badda Jagoroni Club premises and shot dead Abdur Razzak alias Babu, 30, the owner of cable TV service provider Max Cable, and an activist of Badda Jubo League. The two accomplices—Ovi and Helal—escaped arrest after mingling with the general public on that night, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North Division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. Mashiur said the gunfight that left Shafayat dead took place around 4:00am in Aftabnagar when a team of the Detective Branch took him along on a drive to arrest the other killers including Ovi and Helal. He said the criminals opened fire on DB officials, and they retaliated. As Shafayat tried to flee, he got injured with a bullet during the gunfight. Doctors declared him dead after police took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Mirajul Islam
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Mirajul Islam, a leader of outlawed PBCP Red Flag faction, was killed in a'gunfight' with police at Gobindohuda village in Damurhuda upazila. Akram Hossain, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Damurhuda Police Station said that a team from the police station arrested Mirajul with a firearm at his village home. Following information obtained from him, police took him with them in a raid to recover a cache of arms at a hideout of Gobindohuda of the upazila. His cohorts fired at the police near Gobindohuda Eidgah ground around 2:00am, prompting police to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, Mirajul's cohorts fled, leaving his body behind.

data.name: Mohammad Alamgir Hossain
data.description: An officer of Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police said that they arrested Alamgir, the prime accused in the case of February 2 murder of Abul Kashem at Jaybanglabazar under Sadar upazila, from Gopalganj area of Mymensingh town. Later, he claimed, they conducted a raid at Jaybanglabazar at about 3:00 am when Alamgir’s cohorts threw brickbats and opened fire on police, prompting police to retaliate by firing. Alamgir received bullets when he had been trying to flee the scene. DB police took Alamgir to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sirejul Islam
data.description: Kotwali Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Khondor Shaker Ahmed said they arrested Sirajul, accused in the case of mugging and hacking a school teacher. Later police raided SA Sarkar Road to nab his cohorts. But sensing the presence of police, Sirajul’s cohorts opened fire on police and police also fired back. Sirajul was caught in the line of fire and was rushed to MMCH where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zakair Sana
data.description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a ‘gunfight’ between suspected robbers and Coast Guard west zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team of Coast Guard’s West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, robbers of Asaful Bahini opened fire on the raiding team and the Coast Guard men also retaliated by firing. Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee the area.

data.name: Tajel Gazi
data.description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a ‘gunfight’ between suspected robbers and Coast Guard west zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team of Coast Guard’s West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, robbers of Asaful Bahini opened fire on the raiding team and the Coast Guard men also retaliated by firing. Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee the area.

data.name: Hamidul Islam
data.description: In Kushtia, alleged criminal Hamidul Islam, 47, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Milpara area of town, Mohaiminur Rashid, Commander of RAB-12 said that he was the top leader of Hamidul-Rashul Bahini and wanted by Kushtia police. Mohaiminur said a RAB team raided the Milpara area around 4:00am on information that a group of drug dealers were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire forcing them to retaliate, which resulted in a "gun battle". At one stage, the suspects fled the scene. RAB found a body. It was later identified as Hamidul.

data.name: Rikhon Hossain
data.description: Rikhon Hossain, 36, of Meherpur was killed in a "gunfight" in Narayanganj. Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said around 4:30am following a tip-off, RAB set up two checkpoints at Siddhirganj on Dhaka-Chittagong highway to seize a consignment of yaba pills arriving from Chittagong on a truck. As RAB intercepted the truck, three people got out of the truck and one started firing at RAB. RAB "retaliated, resulting in a gunfight that lasted for seven minutes. Rikhon was found injured. He was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital where he was declared dead.

data.name: Musa Alam Masud
data.description: Daganbhuiyan Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abul Kalam Azad said that they arrested Musa and interrogated him. Later, based on information extracted from him, police raided Khushipur area under Daganbhuiyan in Feni along with Musa at about 2:00am to arrest Musa’s accomplices and to seize illegal firearms. As they turned up in the spot, Musa’s accomplices opened fire on the law-enforcers and Musa was shot. As the gunfight ended and his accomplices fled away, Musa was rushed to Daganbhuiyan Upazila Health complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Azizul Islam
data.description: The district Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that a 29-year-old suspected robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between DB police and robbers on a road in front of Baroihati Battala Araj Ali High School under Gaforgaon in the district at about 3:00am. The OC said the DB police raided the area on information that the robbers were robbing vehicles and passers-by by felling tree logs on the road.

data.name: Parvez
data.description: Md Shahjalal, Inspector (Investigation) of Fatullah Police Station, said that hearing the news that two gangs of muggers were exchanging bullets in Dapa Al-Amin Nagar area around 2:30am, a team rushed there to intervene. Both the gangs opened fire on the police, who also retaliated. When the gangs retreated, Parvez was found with bullet injuries and was later declared dead at Narayanganj General Hospital.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barisal Colony around 11:40pm. Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman of RAB-7 said that when RAB started a drive in the colony under Sadarghat Police Station following a tip-off, the "gunfight" ensued. After the "gunfight", RAB found two bullet-riddled bodies on the spot, said RAB-7's Media Wing Senior Assistant Director Mimtanur Rahman.

data.description: Two people were killed in a "gunfight" between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barisal Colony around 11:40pm. data.name: Abul Hasan
data.description: Abul Hasan was killed in a gunfight between alleged drug dealers and RAB in Purba Noboganga area. Deputy Captain of RAB-5 SM Ashraful Islam said that RAB drove at Purba Noboganga area after received a secret information that a consignment of phensedyl arriving from India. Sensing their presence the criminals opened fire and RAB also retaliated by firing. After the "gunfight", RAB found one bullet-riddled body on the spot. Abul Hasan was rushed to the Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Alim
data.description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Tantipara ghat in Shibganj. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp went to Tantipara ghat area for an anti-drug drive around 1:50am, said Abul Khayer, an official of the RAB camp. Sensing presence of RAB personnel, the criminals opened fire. RAB members returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", the RAB men found Alim bullet-wounded. He was taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, Alim's wife Motiara Khatun said that RAB members picked up her husband from a tea stall at Ghora Stand of Sadar upazila. Motiara said she came to know it from locals and found her husband's body at the hospital morgue. Contacted, the RAB official denied the allegation of picking up Alim.

data.name: Habibur Rahman Sheikh
data.description: Habibur, Abdul Kalam and Milon were killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-6 at Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar upazila on Nawapara-Paira Road at about 2:45am. RAB-6 Company Commander Lieutenant Commander Jahid said that a battalion patrol team stopped a motorcycle-rider at the place at about 2:30am and after sometimes another Nawapara-bound motorcycle started firing to the battalion personnel as they saw the searching of the biker from 20-30 metres back. In response, the battalion personnel fired back and found the three wounded as the ‘gunfight’ was over. They rushed the wounded to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared them dead. Ibrahim Sheikh, elder brother of Habibur, said that his brother and two other victims were picked up by plainclothes men from their respective houses.

data.name: Mohammad Emon
data.description: The district Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that Emon arrested for killing of auto-rickshaw driver Md Rana, 15, at Nandail, was killed in a gunfight between DB police and crime suspects at about 2:30am. Ashiqur said that they went to the area with Emon to arrest his cohorts and the gunfight occurred when Emon’s cohorts opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing. Emon received bullet injury as he tried to flee the scene, he said, adding that they rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dalim Hossain

Mirzapur Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Mizanul Haq said that the gunfight occurred when they, being tipped off that a group of muggers was mugging halting buses on the road, raided the area at about 2:00am.

data.name: Babu

data.name: Momtazur Rahman Munna
data.description: Three ‘former drug peddlers’ were killed in ‘gunfights’ at a place between Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jessore. The police claimed that the three were killed in ‘gunfights’ between gang members of drug peddlers although the families alleged that they were once involved in drug peddling and turned into innocents. Momtazur’s brother Sohrab Hossain said that his brother was picked up and the body was found later. Sirajul’s son Ripon Hossain said that his father was an innocent farmer and law enforcers picked him up. The families and local people said that the three had given up drug peddling and were leading normal life.

data.name: Sabdul Mondol
data.description: Sabdul Mondol, 42, son of Mohammad Ali Mondol of Narendrapur village was killed in a'gunfihgt' with RAB. Golam Morshed, Company Commander of RAB-6, said that the gunfight that left Sabdul dead ensued when RAB team was signalled to stop a motorcycle on information that a consignment of drug would pass through the area around 1:30am. Abdul Mannan, a neighbour, however, said some plainclothes men picked up Sabdul around 5:00pm when he and Sabdul were working in their crop fields.

data.name: Liakat Ali Mondol
data.description: The man who was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Puthia of Rajshahi was identified as Liakat Ali Mondol, 45, son of freedom fighter Zakkar Ali Mondol, of Namajgram village in the upazila. The incident took place after a RAB team went to a mango orchard at Jamira village for an anti-drug drive. Liakat's daughter Sharmin Akhter Hashi said that her father had been missing since Sunday afternoon when two persons, Feroz and Momin, who identified themselves as RAB members, took him away from home. Liakat's wife Neher Banu said he was earlier engaged in drug trade but quit it early this year and started raising cattle. She filed a general diary with Puthia Police Station stating that he went missing.

data.name: Abul Kalam Azad
data.description: In the Deulabari area of Tangail, when a suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with members of the RAB at around 12:30am. Tangail RAB-12, CPC-3 Company Commander Rabiul Islam said that "acting on a tip-off, we went to the area to arrest the drug traders (but) sensing our presence, they opened fire at us". In retaliation, the elite force members fired back, fatally injuring Abul Kalam Azad, 45, of east Pakutia area. The other suspects managed to flee the scene, but Azad was taken to Tangail General Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Rezaul Islam

Kamal Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Tongi Model Police Station, said a team of police were conducting a drive in the area following a tip-off. "Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug traders opened fire on us, forcing us to retaliate, triggering the gunfight". Rony was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. He was picked up by DB police around 2:00am on Saturday.

The deceased’s wife Shilpi Begum alleged that police killed her husband by staging a so-called gunfight. ‘Three police officials including sub-inspector Mehedi Hasan had visited my house on three occasions since Monday afternoon to early Tuesday and the officials took out my husband from the house saying that they would need his help to perform a job, ’ Shilpi said, adding that the police officials used to visit her house often.

data.description: Feni's Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir said that suspected ‘drug peddlers’ Sahmit Hossain Shamim, 25, of Maij village and Majnu Mia alias Manir of Mantala village under Phulgazi upazila were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Jammura at the upazila at about 3:30am. Shahmit’s mother Anwara Begum alleged that Phulgazi police station sub-inspector Shafique picked up her son from a land adjacent to her house where he had been collecting grass for their cows. She alleged that police demanded Tk 2 lakh from them and his son was shot dead by police as she failed to pay the money. Rejina alleged that her brother was killed as her family could not pay money.

data.description: In Cox's Bazar, cops recovered the bullet-hit body of alleged yaba trader Md Hasan from Uttaran residential area around 3:30am yesterday. Farid Uddin Ahmed, Officer-in-Charge of Cox's Bazar Police Station, said 35-year-old Hasan was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of yaba traders. But Hasan's brother Shohor Mulluk said a group of plainclothes men picked up his brother from his house early on Tuesday.

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.description: Satkhira police claimed to have recovered the bullet-hit body of Abdul Aziz from Choubaria village in Kaliganj upazila around 6:00am yesterday. Aziz's wife Ayesha Khatun said a group unidentified men picked up her husband after iftar on Wednesday. She heard about his death yesterday morning.

data.name: Selim
data.description: In Narayanganj, alleged drug peddler Selim was killed in a "shootout" with police in Maghmara area of Siddhirganj upazila early yesterday, said Abdus Sattar, Officer-in-Charge of Siddhirganj Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Mostak
data.description: Mohammad Mostak Ahmed, an alleged drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with police at Munsir Dail Pahartoli area. said Pradeep Kumar Dash, Officer-in-Charge of Moheshkhali Police Station.

data.name: Kamrul Islam
data.description: In the capital, Kamrul Islam was killed in a "shootout" with RAB in Tejgaon industrial area early yesterday. His wife Taslima Begum said her husband used to peddle drugs around 10 years back. He quit the trade after their first daughter was born. Kamrul was accused in two cases, Taslima added. Sathi Begum, sister-in-law of the deceased, said Kamrul went to her house in Dakshinpara area on Tuesday and took iftar there. He left the house for his hotel around 7:30pm. "Around 8:00pm, a few people picked him up from in front of the hotel, " Sathi said, adding that Kamrul's phone had been found switched off since then.

data.name: Osman Goni
data.description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in the town's Monag area. One of the dead is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, said Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other man could not be confirmed.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in the town's Monag area. One of the dead is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, said Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other man could not be confirmed.

data.name: Rajon Mia
data.description: In Mymensingh, alleged drug peddler Rajon Mia, aged about 32, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in the city's Purohitpara area yesterday, said Kandaker Shaker Ahmed, Inspector (Investigation) of Mymensingh Sadar Police Station. Rajon's father Harun said his son used to take drugs previously, but he was not involved in drug trade. He was accused in two cases. Harun, security officer of a private organisation, also said his son had been traceless since police picked him up from his house early on Tuesday.

data.name: Azad
data.description: Azad, 28, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Satpakia area of the district’s Sadar upazila early on Friday. Sherpur Sadar Circle’s Additional Superintendent of Police Md Aminul Islam said the incident took place around 3:00am when a team of police conducted a drive in the area. However, Azad’s family members claimed that police had picked up Azad from home Thursday morning and since then they could not find him.

data.name: Jewel Mia
data.description: In Gaibandha, alleged drug trafficker Jewel Mia, 35, was shot dead in a "shootout" with police in Falia bridge area, about seven kilometres away from the district town, said Khan Mohammed Shaharier, OC of Gaibandha Sadar Police Station. Jewel's wife Rozi Begum said her husband remained traceless after police arrested him from Bridge Road area. Next day in the morning, she heard the news.

data.name: Younus Ali
data.description: In Satkhira, alleged drug peddler Younus Ali was killed in a "gunfight" between two groups of drug traders in Sonabaria village of Kolaroa upazila, said Biplob Kumar Nath, OC of Kolaroa Police Station. Younus's wife Rabeya Khatun said police picked up her husband around 9:30pm on Thursday after he had returned home attending Taraweeh prayers.

data.name: Mohammad Kamal
data.description: Burichang Police Station Officer-in-Charge Manoj Kumar Dey saifd that suspected drug peddler Md Kamal, 51, of Rajmangalpur area of Sadar upazila in the district, was killed in a gunfight with police at Mahismara under Burichang upazila at about 2. 00am. Kamal’s relative Abu Taher alleged that cops chased and caught him from his house Thursday night and then demanded Tk 1. 5 lakh from the family. ‘The family failed to pay the money and we heard the news of his death Friday morning. ’ Monoj denied the allegations.

data.name: Akter Kamal
data.description: The body of Akter Kamal, a member of Sabrang Union Parishad in Teknaf, was found lying beside Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road in Darianagar area, said Monirul Islam, in-charge of Himchhari Police Outpost. The police official said Kamal, a listed yaba dealer, died from bullets wounds he sustained during a "gunfight". His relatives said some plainclothes men had picked him up from Sabrang area on Thursday evening.

data.name: Russel Mia
data.description: The victim's mother Amena Begum and brother Rubel Mia said Russel was working as a night guard at City Centre branch of Shahjalal Islami Bank. In the early hours of Monday, a theft was committed in a shop at the 3rd floor of the market, where the bank is also located. Police took away Russel for questioning on Monday afternoon. Claiming that Russel was tortured in police custody, his relatives alleged that the youth was thrown off the 3rd floor of a building. Russel, who suffered critical injuries after the reported torture, breathed his last while undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Ref: Daily Star 25. 5. 18.

data.name: Babul
data.description: In Comilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, said Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station. Almas's wife Taslima Begum said her husband worked as a day labourer and was the only earning member of her family. He was picked up by police from his village home on Friday.

data.description: In Comilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, said Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station. The "gun battle" broke out after police had taken him to the area to arrest his "associates", said Goutam Kumar Bishwas, Additional Superintendent of Police in Pabna.

data.name: Rentu Mia

data.name: Saddarul
data.description: In Dinajpur, suspected drug traders Saddarul, of Nandail village, and Abdus Salam, of Mohorarpur of sadar upazila were killed in gunfights with police and the battalion. RAB-13 Crimes Prevention company commander Talukder Najmus Sakib said that Saddarul was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the battalion at Basudebpur of the upazila. Mohammad Raju, son of Sabdarul, said his father had been traceless since Friday evening and his phone was found switched off. Besides, suspected drug peddler Abdus Salam was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Paschimpara under sadar upazila, said Redwanur Rahim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

data.name: Sagir Khan

data.name: Ekramul Haque
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Ekramul Haque, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Noakhalipara under Teknaf upazila early Sunday. Major Ruhul Amin, Rapid Action Battalion-7 Company Commander in Cox's Bazar, said, "Ekramul was at the top of the list prepared by the Department of Narcotics Control [DNC] and the home ministry. Ekramul's brother Ehsanul Haque Bahadur said that some plainclothes men from "an intelligence agency" picked up his brother from their house around 9:30pm on Saturday, saying they would talk to him over the purchase of a plot of land. "My brother was never involved in yaba trade. He had no links to it whatsoever. " Ekramul's wife Ayesha Begum Ashu said the RAB claim that her husband was a drug dealer is totally false.

data.name: Emdadul Huq
data.description: Satkhira Sadar Police Station Sub-Inspector Prabir Kumar Das said that two ‘drug peddlers’ – Emdadul Huq of Modhumollardangi of the district town and Khalilur Rahman of Lakshmidari village under sadar upazila – were killed in a ‘gunfight’ between two groups of ‘drug peddlers’ at Bankal-Agunpur under sadar upazila. data.name: Shan Ahmed
data.description: On 15 May, Chuadanga police recovered a bullet-hit body of a youth named Shan Ahmed, son of Helal Hossain, from Belgachhi Gongachara field under Chuadanga Municipality. There were two gunshots in the left hand and rights rib of the deceased. His mouth was wrapped with scotch tape and blindfoled. Shan's aunt Kausari Begum said that Shan was at her home in the evening of 14 May. Five plainclothed police of Chuadanga Outpost came to her house in the afternoon to look for Shan. Shan fled sencing the presence of police. At that time police threatened her that if Shan was caught, he will be killed in crossfire.

According to the police statement's, a gang of robbers starting threw brickbats to the running cars at Abdullahpur-Baipail highway. Police seen the incident. However, the robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing, leaving a robber dead.

data.name: Ashraf Uddin Hridoy
data.description: An alleged rorobber named Ashraf Uddin Hridoy was killed in reported'gunfight' with police in Ashulia, Savar. The incident took place at around 3:00am in Moragung area of Tongi-Ashulia-EPZ road. Deceased Ashrah, son of Hazrat Ali, was a resident of Dour Sumoner area under Turag Police Station in Dhaka.

data.name: Asir Ali
data.description: Jessore Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda said that suspected drug peddlers Asir Ali, 56, of Mondolgati village and Malik, 26, of Raipara of the district town were killed in a ‘gunfight’ in Chanchra Raipara area at about 3:00am.

data.name: Malik
data.description: Jessore Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda said that suspected drug peddlers Asir Ali, 56, of Mondolgati village and Malik, 26, of Raipara of the district town were killed in a ‘gunfight’ in Chanchra Raipara area at about 3:00am.

data.name: Sarfan Islam Babu
data.description: Sarfan Islam Babu, an accused in a case filed for the murder of electrician Peu Babu, was killed in a so-called gunfight between law enforcers and criminals in Mymensingh city on 14 May. According to DB police Babu was arrested in Dhaka on Sunday. Later he was taken to Mymensingh city's Teenkona Pukurpar area to arrest other accused in the murder case, said Ashikur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of Police. Sensing presence of police, accomplices of Sarfan opened fire on the law enforcers around 2:30am, triggering a "gunfight". Sarfan, who was in handcuffs, was shot in the chest and back when he tried to flee. He was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Muktar Ali
data.description: Alleged robber Moktar Ali, son of Habibur Rahman Habib, a resident of Ratandia Village under Monirampur Upazila in Jessore was killed despite of being detained in jail. Police recovered his body from a field in his area. Muktar's parents said that thoir son was in jail for seven months. His wife met him in jail the day before he was killed. Meanwhile Jailer Abu Taleb of Jessore Central Jail said that Muktar was released from jail on 8 May in the evening after being bailed by the court.

data.name: Islam Uddin
data.description: An alleged robber was killed during a "gunfight" with police in Kulaura upazila of Moulvibazar early today. The deceased was identified as Islam Uddin alias Islam Ali, 45, son of Motsin Ali from Kamalganj upazila. Shamim Musa, Officer-in-Charge of Kulaura Police Station said that a team of police raided Paboi area of the upazila around 4:00am based on information that a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit a robbery there. But the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate which triggered the "gun battle". Islam was hit by a bullet during the "gunfight" and died on the spot.

data.name: Raju Ahmed
data.description: In Jessore, Sub-Inspector Nasirul Haque Khan of Bagharpara Police Station, said that Raju Ahmed, 28, Dighalsingha under Chaugachha upazila in Jessore was killed in a reported'gunfight' at Bhatar Amtala under Bagharpara upazila at about 2:00am. Raju’s mother Kohinoor Begum at Jessore General Hospital, however, alleged that her son was called out from a local mosque after Tarabih prayers on 30 May over mobile phone identifying the caller as a police officer. ‘My son was a garment worker in Chittagong and he came home two months ago. He was innocent, ’ the mother claimed.

data.name: Bacchu Khalifa
data.description: In Madaripur, suspected drug peddler Bachchu Khalifa, son of Safar Khalifa, a resident of Khalifapotti area under Shibchar upazila in the district, was killed in a ‘gunfight at Shambhuk area under the upazila at about 4:00am, claimed Shibchar police. According to police, acting on tip off several teams of police were patroling in the area to recover drugs. At one stage, police heard gunshots between two groups druge peddlers. When police reached the spot, at that time drug peddlers opened fire at police and police also fired back in retaliation, triggering a gunfight. During gunfight, Bachchu Khalifa was shot and wounded. When he was sent to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: In Rajshahi, Rapid Action Battalion-5 Company Commander Major Ashraf Hossain said that two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Karamja under Karanhat Police Station at about 11:30pm. Belal's wife Amena Begum said her husband was a day labourer over a decade ago and was involved in fish farming. Amena said two plainclothes members of a law enforcement agency went to their house in Poba Upazila around 1:30pm on 30 May and asked her husband if he was involved in drug peddling. Within around half an hour after leaving the house, one of the two law enforcers phoned Belal and asked him to go to Nawhata area. He was confident that he would face no problem as he was no more involved in drug trade.

data.name: Kamrul Khan Kamu
data.description: Alleged drug dealer Kamrul Khan Kamu, 40, who was killed in a "shootout" with DB police in Gazipur on Friday, was picked up a day before from his home by plainclothes policemen, claimed Kamrul's wife Asma Begum. Asma said, "five to six plainclothes policemen came to our house around 5:00am on Thursday and took Kamrul with them". "During the time, the policemen in name of searching the house took away some valuables, including a TV set, mobile phone, some cash, ornaments and documents, " she claimed. Asma said she got married eight years ago and during these years, she never heard of any case filed against Kamrul. She said her husband used to work at a garment factory.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.description: In Comilla, Saddam Hossain, 36, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Chauddagram upazila around 2:40am. . Abul Faisal, Officer-in-Charge of Chauddagram Police Station, said a police team went to Koroibon on information that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered there. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots triggering the "gunfight". Police then found the bullet-riddled body of Saddam on the spot. Saddam’s brother-in-law Saiful Islam claimed that the victim was picked up by people identifying themselves as police from in front of their residence sometimes after 8:00pm. He claimed that Saddam was a drug-addict but was not a peddler.

data.name: Shahjahan
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, Shahjahan, who police said was the chief of a criminal gang "Shahjahan Bahini", was killed in a "gunfight" in Chakaria upazila . Bakhtiar Uddin Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Chakaria Police Station said recovered Shahjahan's body from the spot and sent it to the Sadar hospital morgue.

data.name: Ruhul
data.description: In Tangail, an alleged drug peddler, Ruhul was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Kalihati upazila. The 30-year-old man from Paschim Golora village of the upazila. According to a text sent by Maj Rabiul Islam, a Company Commander of RAB-12 in Tangail, a team of RAB-12 started an anti-drug drive in Golora area around 2:30am. Sensing presence of Rab personnel, the criminals opened fire, prompting them to retaliate. After the "gunfight", the RAB team found Ruhul hit and took him to Tangail General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, Ruhul's wife Rashida Akter said, "One Sumon Bhai of adjacent Taratia area called my husband out of the house around 11:00am on 31 May. " "Sumon Bhai took Tk 6 lakh from my husband about one and a half months ago for dropping his name from the list of drug traders, " said Rashida, mother of a six-month-old boy. "Ruhul was involved in drug trading previously but left the trade about six to seven months ago and started running a shop near Chhatihati Bazar, " said his elder brother Bahadur.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam Opi
data.description: In Rangpur, police claimed to have recovered the bullet-hit body of alleged criminal Rafiqul Islam Opi who was killed in a' gunfight' in Kaunia upazila, said Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent (circle A) of Rangpur police.

data.name: Shahjahan Hossain
data.description: Rangpur Assistant Superintendent of Police Saiful Islam said that suspected drug peddler Shahjahan Hossain, also named in at 10 drugs related cases, was killed in a gunfight with police at Chotopur Banupara of Kawnia.

data.name: Manik Mia

The police officer said that they, being informed by the locals, recovered the body. He claimed that the drug peddler might have been killed in gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers. The victim's brother Rajab Ali, however, said that the police pickedup Manik from the local bazaar June 4 and since then he was missing.

data.name: Munna
data.description: In Mymensingh, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of suspected drug peddlers Munna and Idris Ali of Charkalibari area under Sadar Dakhshin upazila from Brahmapurtra rail bridge area said Kotwali Police Station Office-in-Charge Mahmudul Islam. Mymensingh district superintendent of police Syed Nurul Islam said that the two were killed in a gunfight over enmity among the drug peddlers. Families of two victims in Mymensingh alleged that they were picked up by some people in plainclothes identifying them as members of DB from Mashkanda Sheba Drug Rehabilitation Centre on June 1.

data.name: Azad Kha
data.description: Police claimed to have found the bullet-riddled body of a suspected drug dealer in Alalpur area of Faridpur, two days after he was allegedly picked up by several plainclothes DB police. AFM Nasim, Officer-in-Charge of Faridpur Sadar Police Station, said that a police team recovered Azad's body after receiving information from local people and recovered the body around 12:15pm and sent it to Faridpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy. Azad's sister Sahera Begum, said, several plainclothes men, identifying themselves as detectives, picked my brother up from his friend's house in Gazaria area around 2:00am on 2 June. My brother was missing since then.

data.name: Abu Sayed
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers, including the gang leader of Kalu gang were killed in a gunfight between police and suspected forest robbers at Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderbans, police claimed. Koyra Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Enamul Haque said members of Kalu gang abducted four fishermen demanding ransom on June 5 and they, on secret information, raided a den of forest robbers at Maidapesha canal to rescue the abducted fishermen. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers fired on police, forcing them to fire back, said Enamul After the gunfight, police found the three forest robbers who sustained bullet injuries and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared the trio dead.

data.name: Nusrat Jamil Nitul
data.description: In Mymensingh, suspected woman drug trader Nitul, was killed in a gunfight with DB Police.

data.name: Shamim Hossain
data.description: In Thakurgaon, alleged drug peddler Shamim Hossain, 42, son of late Abdus Sattar of Bhabanandapur village, was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Ranishankoil upazila of the district. Abdul Mannan, Officer-in-Charge of Ranishankoil Police Station said that on information that a group of traders were taking preparation to deal drugs on Bhradreswari-Jagdal road in Bhradreswari village of the upazila, police conducted a drive there around 1:30am. Sensing presence of police, the drug peddlers opened fire. The law enforcers then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Shamim was hit by bullets while others fled the scene. Police took Shamim to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

data.name: Abu Musa
data.description: In Rangpur, a suspected drug peddler, Abu Musa, 26, son of Abdul Kuddus, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rangpur city around 2. 00am. The gunfight took place when a police team of Rangpur Sadar Police Station, on information, conducted a raid in Kukrulful area of the city to recover drugs and a group of drug peddlers attacked the law enforcers, said Saiful Islam, Additional Superintendent of police (ASP) in Rangpur.

data.name: Abdur Razzak
data.description: In Dinajpur, police recovered the bullet-hit body of an alleged criminal Abdur Razzak of village Danihari-Kanakpuri under Sadar upazila from Kharipara under the upazila who was killed in a' gunfight', said Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-charge Redwanur Rahim.

data.name: Md. Sumon
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police on Chandina- Debidwar road in Debidwar upazilla. Mizanur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Debidwar Police Station said that the deceased was Md Sumon, 35, son of Habibur Rahman of Kuroin in the upazila, also an accused in 15 cases. Informed that a gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area a police team raided there. The robbers opened fire, prompting police to retaliate. Sumon sustained bullet injuries and later died at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Sohagh
data.description: In Comilla, Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abu Salam Mia said that suspected drug peddler Sohagh, 32, of South Chartha Thirura Pukurpar area under Sadar upazila in the district town succumbed to his injuries at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on June 8. The OC said that Sohagh was injured in a gunfight between members of Chawakbazar police outpost and suspected drug peddlers at Mellarkhil area under Sadar upazila on June 1 and he was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital. He said that he was later sent to DMCH where he died on June 8.

data.name: Shahin Sheikh
data.description: In Sirajganj Additional Superintendent of Police Yusuf Ali said that suspected drug peddler Shahin Sheikh, 35, of Mahmudpur of the district town was killed in a gunfight with DB police at about 2:15am.

data.name: Shariful Islam
data.description: A murder suspect was killed in what DB police claimed was a gunfight in Bhatara cattle market area. According to Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North) of Detective Branch of Police on information that a gang of hired killers gathered on 100-Foot Road in Bhatara to commit a target killing, a team of DB police launched a drive there. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliatel. Following the "gunfight", bullet-hit Shariful was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rony Mia
data.description: Suspected peddlers, Rony Mia, 30, of Krishtapur and Anwar Hossain alias Anar, 38, of Banshbari Colony, were killed in a gunfight with the Detective branch of Police at Kalibari Road, Mymensingh City at about 1. 45AM said district DB Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. According to him, DB seized 1, 750 yaba tablets, a pistol and three empty cartridges from the spot. Family members however claimed Anwar was picked up by plainclothes police around a week ago and Rony had been traceless since June 11.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: New Age correspondent in Jessore reported that two drug peddlers, who were picked up earlier, were killed in two separate ‘gunfights’ at Chengutia under Abhaynagar upazila early Monday and near Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan – Sathkhira Road under Sharsha upazila in Jessore early Friday. The deceased were Shahidul Islam, 34, of Nawapara industrial town and Montaz Ali, 40, son of Jabed Ali of Khedapara village under Monirampur police station. Montaz’s relatives said that Montaz was missing since June 12 since the Khedapara camp police picked him from Gangulia. Admitting the arrest of the victim, sub inspector Md Ainuddin, in-charge, Khedapara police camp told new Age that he was picked up from Monirampur Municipality area, not from Gangulia at around 8:30 pm on the day. He was produced in the court on the next day.

data.name: Ruhul Amin Bagha
data.description: In Shariatpur, Ruhul Amin Bahga, 50, son of Moslem Bagha of Char Jushirgaon in Gosairhat upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and DB police at Bhadrachand in the upazila around 1:30am on June 15, said the district Superintendent of Police Abdul Momen.

data.name: Rehena Akhtar
data.description: Police recovered the bullet-hit body of a listed woman ‘drug peddler’ Rehena Akhtar, 35, wife of late Azizul Islam of Sankipara area in Mymensingh town from Gandhropa of the town on June 17. Kotwali Model Police Station Office-in-Charge Mahmudul Islam said Rehena, might have been killed in a clash between two groups of drug peddlers over sharing of drug money. However, Rehena’s daughter Ajeda Begum alleged that her mother was picked up by police from in front of their residence around 4:00pm on June 16.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: In Sherpur, Al Amin alias Fakir, 28, son of Sahibor Rahman of Balaichar village under Sadar upazila, was killed in the reported gunfight at Chunierchar at night. Being informed by locals on June 20 in the morning, the police recovered the body from the spot. Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sherpur police said that the incident took place at night. The battalion-14 Company Commander Razib Kumar Dey said that their team conducted an anti-drug drive in the area on June 19, at night and also exchanged gunshots with drug-traders. and he was killed.

data.name: Hridoy
data.description: Police said that they recovered bullet hit body ofa suspected drug peddler near the railway crossing on the Chuadanga-Darshana Road at Damurhuda in Chuadanga on June 21. Hridoy, son of Bacchu Mia of Hatathpara, Darshana, Chuadanga district was a listed drug peddler, Damurhuda police station officer-in-charge Sukumar Biswash said. The OC said that being informed by local that a bullet hit body was lying near the railway crossing, the police recovered it at about 11 AM. The OC said that it was his suspicion that Hridoy was killed by rival drug peddlers. Hridoy’s family, however, said that the police had picked up Hridoy from a shop on June 19 and since then he was missing.

data.name: Ali Hossain
data.description: Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that Ali Hossain was killed in gunfihgt with DB Police near an auto-rice mill on Tarakanda-Phulpur road at about 2:45am. Mujibur Rahman, memberWard no-2 of Kakni Union Parishad, quoting neighbours said Ali was picked up from his house on June 18 at night and remain traceless since then.

data.name: Swapan Mia
data.description: Mymensingh Trishal police Station Officer-in-Charge Zakiur Rahman said that suspected drug peddler Swapan was killed in a gunfight with police near Jatiya Kabi Kazi Nazrul Islam University under Trishal upazila around 4:00pm. He was picked by police from Trishal Bus Stand area on June 21 around 6:00pm when he was going to Trishal Bazar to buy meat and taken to the police station-said Rubel Mia, Swapan's younger brother who works in a local newspaper. Rubel claimed they had met Swapan at the police station, given him food and left around 2:00am, but in the morning they received the news that he was killed in a gunfight.

data.name: Jakir Farazi
data.description: Jakir, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Syadpur village under Hajiganj upazila. Police said that after being informed that a gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area a police team raided there. The robbers opened fire, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Jakir died.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain
data.description: In Sirajganj, a suspected drug peddler Jahangir Hossain, 32, son of late Hatem Ali of Railway Colony Purbapara area, was killed in a'gunfight' with drug dealers at Mahmudpur field area, police said. Acting on a tip-off, a police team raided the area around 3:00am, Mahmud Daud, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station, said. The criminals opened fire on the police forcing them retaliate. Afterwards police recovered Jahangir's body.

data.name: Abdul Mannan
data.description: Police recovered the bullet hit body of drug trader Abdul Mannan, 45, son of late Ali Hossain at Kandapara in Tangail municipal area. Police said they suspect Mannan may have been killed in a gunfight following a dispute between two groups of drug traders. However dceased's brothers Golam Rasul, Golam Maula and his son Nazmul Hasan Sumon said police picked up Mannan from his house at 2:00am on June 22. Sanjit Kumar Roy, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Tangail, at a press briefing said police discovered Mannan's body when they raided Charabari are at 7:00am after receiving information from locals.

data.name: Mohammad Nizam Uddin Mondol
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Pabna, Sabahara Party leader Md Nizam Uddin Mondol was killed allegedly in a ‘gunfight’ with police. According to police, Nizam of Mirpur in Aminpur thana, Bera upazila in Pabna, was the regional leader of a faction of the Sarbahara Party. The police described Nizam as the key suspect of murdering three police officers at Dhalarchar police camp in 2010. Nizam was watching a World Cup soccer match on the TV at a neighbour’s house at 10. 15 PM on June 23, when he was picked up by uniformed police, neighbours said. Pabna Additional Superintendent of Police Goutam Kumar Bishwas said that a team of Amirpur thana police raided Dhaarchar Daspara following tip off that a group of dacoits were taking preparations to commit dacoity. He said the dacoits opened fire forcing the police to retaliate when Nizam was hit by a bullet and the police took him to Bera Upazila Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Monirul Islam
data.description: New Age Correspondent in Jessore, quoting Monirampur police station officer in-charge Mokarram Hossain, reported that police recovered bullet-hit bodies of two suspected miscreants from crop field at Chhatiantala under Monirampur upazila early June 24. The OC claimed that the duo was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with a rival group. After the bodies were taken to Jessore General Hospital for post mortem examination, relatives identified 30-year old Monirul Islam of Ranagati, Abhaynagar, Jessore. His brother Mehedi Hasan told reporters that plainclothes police picked up Monirul Islam from the Jessore Central Jail’s main gate in the afternoon of June 21 after he was released on bail in a murder case. The police, could not, however, identify the other victim.
