The OC claimed that the duo was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with a rival group. After the bodies were taken to Jessore General Hospital for post mortem examination, relatives identified 30-year old Monirul Islam of Ranagati, Abhaynagar, Jessore. His brother Mehedi Hasan told reporters that plainclothes police picked up Monirul Islam from the Jessore Central Jail’s main gate in the afternoon of June 21 after he was released on bail in a murder case. The police, could not, however, identify the other victim.

data.name: Mohammad Kaiyum
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, suspected drug peddler Md Kaiyum, 28, son of Abdul Kuddus of Chokha Monaksha village under Shibganj upazila was killed in a gunfight with police at about 2:30am, said District Superintendent of Police TM Mozahidul Islam.

data.name: Nayem Islam
data.description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25, in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, 9, son of Pabitra Dutta, and a class III student of Chitlia Primary School. Based on information provided by the duo, police recovered Deb’s body from under the ground beside a toilet of Nayem’s house around 2pm on June 25. Later at night, police conducted a drive in the village along with the duo to arrest other criminals. When the team reached the village, their cohorts opened on law enforcers. Law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight between them, police said. The murder accused sustained bullet wounds when they tried to flee the scene during the ‘gunfight’. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Joyar Ali
data.description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25, in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, 9, son of Pabitra Dutta, and a class III student of Chitlia Primary School. Law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight between them, police said. The murder accused sustained bullet wounds when they tried to flee the scene during the ‘gunfight’. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Jakir
data.description: Jakir, an alleged drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with DB police at Berirhart Bazar of Digholdi union under Bhola. DB police team raided Bagmara area after informed that some drug traders altercating in that area over drugs. The drug traders opened fire, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Jakir died.

data.name: Manik Sheikh
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in what police claimed was a gunfight in Bagmara area in the city on June 27, hours after their arrest amid the ongoing anti-narcotics drive. Raju's family, however, claimed the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release and killed him as they failed to pay the sum. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Khulna Sadar police, said a team of law enforcers from Khulna arrested Raju and Manik in Dhaka on June 26 and brought them to the city as they were listed drug peddlers. After interrogation, the police took them to recover drugs in Bankers Lane area around 3:30am. Sensing the presence of police, their cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, the police recovered the bodies of Raju and Manik, while their cohorts fled. Titli Begum, Raju's wife, said that police picked up her husband from New Market area in Khulna on June 26. "I met the police and requested them to free him, but they demanded Tk 10 lakh for that. We wanted to arrange a press conference at Khulna Press Club, but civil police did not allow us, " she alleged.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: Abdur Rahman alias Lalu alias Sayed alias Akkas alias Kawsar, 34, was the military wing commander of Dhaka division of the Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, police claimed. Police said Rahman was the one who shot and killed progressive writer Bachchu on June 11. Police arrested Abdur Rahman at a JMB hideout in Gazipur on June 24. Jayedul Alam, Superintendent of Police in Munshiganj, at a press briefing yesterday said his team recovered the firearms and one of the motorcycles used in Bachchu killing. He added that Rahman and several other suspected JMB members rented a house in Bachchu's neighbourhood in Sirajdikhan upazila of Munshiganj three months before executing of their plan to kill him. Although four suspects took part in the murder, two others were involved. A team of police raided the house around 1:00am yesterday taking Rahman along. Sensing police presence, the suspects fled. When the team was returning, Rahman's associates opened fire on police in a bid to snatch him from custody, the SP said. A gunfight ensued when police retaliated, he said, adding Rahman was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Rahman was taken to Sirajdikhan Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zahid Hasan Tokon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: A Jubo League leader was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Kaemkola Bagmara Beel in Jhikorgachha upazila of Jessore on June 29. The deceased, Zahid Hasan Tokon, 32, son of Ali Aslam of Krishnanagar village under the upazila, was joint convener of Jhikorgachha upazila Jubo League. Victim's father has alleged that police picked up his son Tokon from their rented house at Chachra area in Jessore town at around 9. 30 pm Friday. Jhikorgachha Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Masud Karim said after his arrest Tokon confessed to possessing arms and bullets. At around 3:00am police took him to Kaemkola Bagmara Beel to confront his accomplices. Sensing police presence Tokon's accomplices fired at the law enforcers and police retaliated by firing seven rounds of bullets. The gang members all fled the scene and police recovered the injured Tokhon who had been shot in his head during the gunfire exchange. Police took the critically injured Tokon to Jessore General Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead on arrival, the OC said.

data.name: Idris
data.description: Narsingdi district Additional Superintendent of police Zakir Hasan, reported that police arrested Idris June 29 evening from Ghorashal under Polash upazila in the district. He was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between police and his cohorts when police conducted a raid as per his ‘confession’ to nab suspected carjackers at Shilmandi under Sadar to arrest his associates around 1:00am.

data.name: Bachchu Mia
data.description: The DB official claimed that a team of DB police, on a tip off that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered at Shambuganj to share their drug money, raided the spot at around 2:45am. Sensing presence of police, the drug peddlers hurled brick bats on them and later opened fire, forcing the DB police to retaliate. After the gunfight ended, police found bullet-hit Bachchu and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jalal Uddin
data.description: An alleged drug dealer Jalal Uddin killed during a skirmish in Bhaluka Upazila's Habirbari area aound 2:15am on July 4, said the district Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. He said a team of DB and police raided the area to arrest a gang of drug dealers.

data.name: Shahid Hossain Mallik
data.description: Police said they recovered the body of an accused of drug case from Jessore's Chougachha area. The family alleged that Shahid was picked up by men claiming to be members of law enforcement agency from Sharsha. The Officer-in-Charge of Benapole Police Station claimed Shahid Mallik was a drug dealer and was killed in a gunfight between two gangs around 2:30am. Meanwhile Shahid's brother Monir Hossain Mallik said that Shahid was a farmer and he was picked up by some men identified themselves as police picked him up from infront of Sharsha Sub-Registry office. He had been missing since on July 3.

data.name: Akash
data.description: Jiban, accused of Jubo League leader murder, was reportedly killed in what police had claimed to be a gunfight between two groups of criminals at Bablatala of Shankarpukur under Kotwali Police Station in Jessore. Kotwali Police Sub-Inspector Tareq Nahian said the gunfight took place at about 3:30pm on July 5. Police on information rushed to the spot and took the man to Jessore General Hospital where the attending doctor declared him dead. However, relatives of the deceased alleged that Kotwali police arrested Akash from Notun Upashahr area of the district three days before. But police denied the arrest of Akash. They believe that police had shot dead Akash and staged a drama of'gunfight'.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Two suspects in June 15 murder of Awami League leader Farhad Hossain were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with DB Police at Santarkul area. Dhaka Metropolitan Police’s Detective Branch (north) Deputy Commissioner Mashiur Rahman said a team of DB, on secret information that a group of miscreants have gathered at some under construction buildings near Santarkul Projapoti Garden area, conducted a raid at the area around 3:00am. He claimed that sensing the presence of police, the suspects opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the ‘gunfight’ was over, police found two bullet-hit persons on the ground floor of the under-construction building and sent them to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Amit
data.description: Two suspects in June 15 murder of Awami League leader Farhad Hossain were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with DB Police at Santarkul area. Dhaka Metropolitan Police’s Detective Branch (north) Deputy Commissioner Mashiur Rahman said a team of DB, on secret information that a group of miscreants have gathered at some under construction buildings near Santarkul Projapoti Garden area, conducted a raid at the area around 3:00am. He claimed that sensing the presence of police, the suspects opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the ‘gunfight’ was over, police found two bullet-hit persons on the ground floor of the under-construction building and sent them to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Golam Mustafa
data.description: In Narail, the police said the suspected drug trader, Golam Mustafa, was killed in ‘gunfight’ with the police at Chandmari. Police said they were on operation and the drug paddlers suddenly attacked the cops, who returned fire in self-defence. After the gunfight, police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mustafa from the spot.

data.name: Sazzadur Rahman
data.description: According to the Rapid Action Battalion, two of the suspected drug peddlers were killed in ‘gunfight’ with RAB, at Pabahati, Jhenaidah. Of the killed suspected peddlers, Sazzadur Rahman, 42, was from the Baghajotin area while Abdul Razzaq, 35, was from the Udaypur areas in the district town, said RAB. RAB 6 Company Commander Golam Mourshed said that on a tip-off a plainclothes RAB team raided the Khajura area at around 1:00am. Sensing RAB’s presence, the suspected drug peddlers fled from the spot on motorcycle and took the road on which RAB had a check post. ‘The drug peddlers opened fire on RAB members in their bid to stop the checking when RAB retaliated and two suspects sustained bullet injuries and died, RAB said. Two RAB men Touhidul and Saidul were also injured in the incident, RAB said.

Two RAB men Touhidul and Saidul were also injured in the incident, RAB said.

data.name: Faruk Mia
data.description: In Mymensingh reported a suspected drug peddler was killed allegedly in ‘gunfight’ with the police Station at Atharbari, Ishwarganj, Mymensingh. Officer-in-charge of Ishwarganj police station Ahmed Kabir said that on tip-off that drug money splitting was taking place, police raided the Atharbari area. Sensing presence of the police, the drug peddlers hurled brick chips and opened fire on them. The police retaliated in self-defence, and at one stage of the ensuing gunfight the peddler allegedly fled, he said. Later, the police recovered bullet-injured Faruk Mia and sent him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shamsul Huq
data.description: In Gaibandha, alleged robber Shamsul Huq, 38, of Bedkapa village in Palashbari upazila, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Khan Md Shahriar, OC of Gaibandha Sadar Police Station, said based on information, a combined force of Gaibandha Sadar police and Sadullapur police raided Dholbhanga bazar area in Palashbari and arrested Shamsul from there on July 7. Based on Shamsul's statement, police, along with him, conducted a drive in his house to recover firearms and nab his cohorts at around 4:00am. Afterwards, when they reached Shakoya bridge area, his gang members opened fire at the police officials to try and take him away. In retaliation, police fired back. Shamsul sustained bullet injuries in "shootout" and his associates managed to flee. Critically injured, Shamsul was taken to Gaibandha Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kalu Sikder
data.description: Shariatpur Police Superintendent Abdul Momen said that drug peddler Kalu might have been killed in a gunfight between two drug peddler groups. According to Kalu’s paternal uncle Selim Sikder said plainclothes men identifying themselves as Detective Branch of police along with a man from Palang Bazaar had picked up Kalu from Khokon Shah’s residence at Khelsi in the district town on July 6 evening. Selim said that when family members went to the district DB office and Palang police station they denied having detained anyone with the name of Kalu. On July 7, they went to Palang police station to lodge a general diary regarding Kalu’s missing but they refused to record the GD. Kalu’s mother Shanti Begum said that Rashed Sardar, a villager of Chandsar under Palang police station, demanded Tk 50, 000 for his release but they failed to pay the money. But Rashed denied the allegation. SP Momen also denied that the DB had picked up or detained Kalu.

data.name: Ibrahim Hossain Babu
data.description: In the capital, Ibrahim Hossain Babu 35, was killed in the alleged gunfight with RAB at the Beribundh area in Mirpur. According to RAB-4 Commanding Officer Chowdhury Manjurul Karim at 4 AM on July 10, two riders on a motorcycle opened fire on RAB men at a checkpost at Mirpur Beribandh area ignoring their signal to stop when the RAB men retaliated leaving a rider injured with bullets and the other one fled. He said that the injured rider was speedily taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. Later, said the RAB commander, the dead rider was identified as drug peddler, Ibrahim. Ibrahim’s elder brother Md Sumon who identified the body at the DMCH morgue, said that his brother was missing since early June when some plainclothes men identifying them as law enforcement personnel picked him up at Chapainawabganj.

data.name: Mohammad Nadim Hossain
data.description: At Rupganj, Narayanganj, Mohammad Nadim Hossain alias Nadim alias Pochish, 35, died allegedly in a ‘gunfight’ with the RAB at 2. 30 AM on July 10. According to the police and the RAB Nadim from the Mohammadpur camp of Stranded Pakistanis, also known as Mohammadpur Geneva Camp, in the capital, did not live in the camp. Senior Assistant Police Superintendent Rabiul Islam of RAB-2 said that on a tip off that drug peddlers would deliver yaba tablets to fellow peddlers at Purbachal, the rendezvous was raided at about 2:30am when the gunfight ensued with the peddlers. The gunfight over, he said, RAB found bullet hit body of Nadim was recovered from the spot.

data.name: Belal Hossain
data.description: Belal was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police around 4:00am at Hazirhat area, on the outskirts of the city. Kotowali police officer-in-charge Babul Miah said that the gunfight took place as suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: RAB-8 officials claimed that the unidentified deceased was a member of a forest robber gang. RAB-8 Deputy Assistant Director Md Nuruddin said the 26-year old forest robber was killed on July 10 morning in a gunfight with the RAB at Ambaria under Sarankhola range of the Sunderban east division. Sarankhola police station officer-in-charge Md Kabirul Islam said that RAB-8 DAD Kabirul Islam lodged a case in this connection and they sent the body to Bagerhat General Hospital morgue for post-mortem examinations.

data.name: Bablur Rahman Babla
data.description: The victim was identified by relatives as Bablur Rahman Babla, 26, of Hashimpur in Jessore Sadar upazila. Babla went missing immediately after being released on bail from Jessore Central Jail on July 10. Mokarram Hossain, Officer in-Charge of Monirampur Police Station, said police recovered Babla’s body from Jessore- Rajgonj Road at Gangulia under Monirampur upazila at about 6:00am. ‘He might have died in gunfight between two groups of miscreants, ’ he added. Shaukat Hossain, nephew of the victim identified him at Jessore General Hospital later. Shaukat told reporters that Babla, accused in several cases, was missing since he was released from the Jessore Central Jail on bail on July 10.

data.name: Md Sohel Rana
data.description: In Lakshmipur, the man killed in a "gun battle" was identified as Sohel Rana aged about 37. He was from the district's Raipur upazila. Police said they picked up Sohel, an accused in 22 cases, from near Jhumur Cinema in the town on July 10 afternoon and conducted a raid in Raipur area around 3:00am July 11 taking the detainee along with them. The police team was attacked by Sohel's cohorts, forcing the cops to retaliate with shots. Bullets hit Sohel as he tried to escape, said Azizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Raipur Police Station. He was rushed to Raipur Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Nur Hossain Nuru
data.description: In Dhaka's Keraniganj upazila, alleged drug trader Nur Hossain Nuru, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" between criminals and Detective Branch of police. Monirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of DB, said the gunfight took place near Diamond Melamine Factory in Deushur area, reports UNB.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: Alleged drug peddler Abdul Malek died of his bullet wounds at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital on July 11. Malek passed away at 2:00am, said a staff member of the hospital, adding that he had been admitted to the hospital with bullet injuries to his left leg. The 48-year-old man was injured when a team of detectives opened fire on a group of drug peddlers in Charghat upazila on July 6, said Ataur Rahman, OC of Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police. He claimed police opened fire after they had come under attack from criminals.

data.name: Phutu Monna
data.description: At Kushita, suspected drug peddlers, Phutu alias Monna, 35, son of Ahmed Ali, and his nephew Russel Ahmed, 30, son of Rabiul Islam, of Rajarhat, were killed in ‘gunfight’ with the RAB at Katdah Char under Mirpur in the district on July 11, RAB-12 Commanding Officer Md Mohaiminul said. He said that the duo was top drug dealers according to the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry.

data.name: Russel Ahmed
data.description: At Kushita, suspected drug peddlers, Phutu alias Monna, 35, son of Ahmed Ali, and his nephew Russel Ahmed, 30, son of Rabiul Islam, of Rajarhat, were killed in ‘gunfight’ with the RAB at Katdah Char under Mirpur in the district on July 11, RAB-12 Commanding Officer Md Mohaiminul said. He said that the duo was top drug dealers according to the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry.

data.name: Osman Gani
data.description: In Natore's Boraigram upazila, alleged drug peddler Osman Gani died of his bullet wounds at a local hospital on July 11, around half hour after he was injured in a "gun battle" between RAB and suspected criminals. Major Shibli Mostafa, Company Commander of RAB-5, said a RAB team conducted a raid in Bahimali village around 11:40pm on July 10, on information that a group of people were carrying out suspicious activities there. At one stage, Osman and his cohorts opened fire at RAB members. The RAB men retaliated with gunshots, trigging the "gunfight" that left Osman injured. He was rushed to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Nurul, was killed in a gunfight with police at Purundapur village on July 12. Being tipped-off that a gang of robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive there around 1:45am, said Mohammad Salauddin, Additional Superintendent of Kotchandpur (circle) Police. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire to law enforcers prompting them to fire back in self-defence. At one stage, Nur caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Afzal
data.description: RAB-12 Crimes Prevention Company-3 Commander Robiul Islam said that peddler Md Afzal, of village Beguntol under Tangail Sadar, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the RAB in his village on July 13.

data.name: Ratan Hossain Mridha
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Chaugacha Police Officer-in-charge Khandaker Shamim Uddin, reported that Ratan Hossain Mridha, son of Abu Bakr Mridha of Dighalsingha under Chaugacha in the district, was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Kayarpara under the upazila on July 13 at 2:30am. Victim’s mother Farida Begum told journalists at Jessore General Hospital on July 13 morning that her son went missing from Magura on July 12 noon.

data.name: Putu Sarkar
data.description: In Bogra, suspected drug peddler Putu Sarkar, of Charsutrapur under Bogra Sadar upazila, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Bhatkandi Bridge under Shajahanpur upazila in the district around 3:00am, said Additional Superintendent of Bogra police Sanatan Chakraborty.

data.name: Murad Siddique
data.description: Murad Siddique, suspected robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police on July 15. Bhaluka Police Station Officer-in-Charge Firoz Talukdar said that a team of cops on secret information conducted a drive near Hijack Mor at about 2:15am to catch some suspected robbers. He claimed that the robbers, sensing presence of police, hurled stones and opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate by opening fire. After the gunfight, they found bullet-hit Murad and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors at emergency department declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Two alleged drug dealers including a former Jubo League leader were killed in a "gunfight" between police and criminals in Satkhira Sadar upazila on July 15. Faruk Ahmed, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station, said police picked up both men around 5:45pm on July 14. The shootout took place at Koker Beel area around 2:30am when a police team took the two men along to recover a consignment of drug that was supposed to have come from India. Sensing presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the police forcing them to retaliate and triggered a "gunfight", leaving the duo injured. They were rushed to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.description: Two alleged drug dealers including a former Jubo League leader were killed in a "gunfight" between police and criminals in Satkhira Sadar upazila on July 15. Faruk Ahmed, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station, said police picked up both men around 5:45pm on July 14. The shootout took place at Koker Beel area around 2:30am when a police team took the two men along to recover a consignment of drug that was supposed to have come from India. Sensing presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the police forcing them to retaliate and triggered a "gunfight", leaving the duo injured. They were rushed to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shahar Ali
data.description: In Kushtia, Shahar was killed in a gunfight between police and suspected drug peddlers during an anti-drug drive near a bridge at village Haripur under Sadar upazila about 3:30am, said Nasir Uddin, officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station.

data.name: Noman Khan
data.description: In Mymensingh, Noman was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between suspected drug peddlers and police at Raghurampur under Sadar upazila around 1:45am when Kotwali police raided the area to arrest suspected peddlers and seize drugs, said Mahmudul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

data.name: Amirul Islam Pancha
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Bhaturia. RAB-6 Company Commander at Jhenaidah Golam Morshed said that on July 17 night set a check post at Bhaturia village where a group of robbers, sensing the presence of RAB, opened fire on them at about 11:45pm. He said that RAB also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight between the RAB and suspected robbers. As the gunfight ended and suspected robbers fled away, he said they searched the area and found bullet-hit Amirul in a critical condition and took him to Harinakundu Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Enamul Haque
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with a joint forces team of RAB and BGB at Himchari on July 19. Major Iqbal Ahmed, Second-in-Command of 34 BGB Battalion, Cox's Bazar, said that Enamul and Farhad were killed in a gunfight around 4:00am on the Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road.

data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with a joint forces team of RAB and BGB at Himchari on July 19. RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of Chittagong Police Mintanur Rahman said they found the bodies of the two suspected drug peddlers after a brief gunfight at the place.

data.name: Unidentified

RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of Chittagong Police Mintanur Rahman said they found the bodies of the two suspected drug peddlers after a brief gunfight at the place.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.description: Khorshed Alam, a suspected drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with police on Dhaka-Chittagong highway in Daudkandi. Alamgir Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Daudkandi Police Station, said acting on a tip-off, police stopped a car on the highway near Hasanpur Government College. The men on board the car opened fire on the officers, leading to the gunfights. Khorshed's body was found at the scene later while the others fled.

data.name: Khairul Islam
data.description: RAB-5 Deputy Company Commander in the district Abu Khayer said that suspected drug peddler Khairul Islam, 42, of Char Islampur village under Sadar upazila was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB in a mango orchard at village Mollan under Sadar upazila in the district at about 1:30am on July 21.

data.name: Shamsuddin
data.description: In Kushtia, Shamsuddin alias Sham, 38, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bheramara upazila. The incident occurred around 3:30am when a police team raided Bankapul area after a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers were having a meeting there, said Aminul Islam, officer-in-charge of Bheramara Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rahim
data.description: In Dinajpur, Md Abdur Rahim, 45, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Parbatipur upazila. Two narcotics gangs were meeting in Bannirghat village and they opened fire when police raided the area around 3:00am, said Habibiul Haq Prodhan, the OC of Parbatipur Police Station. Later, police found bullet-hit Rahim and took him to Parbatipur Upazila Health Complex where he died of injuries.

data.name: Mohammad Ismail
data.description: In Cox's Bazar, Md Ismail, 42, an alleged drug criminal, was killed in a "gunfight". Ismail's wife Senu Ara said that her husband was picked up by some plainclothes men on Friday evening.

data.name: Ahadul Islam
data.description: In Natore, Ahadul Islam, 38, a suspected drug peddler was killed in Lalpur upazila at around 2:30am after a gang of criminals opened fire at RAB men, forcing them to retaliate, said Major Shibli Mostafa, a Company Commander of RAB-5 in Natore.

data.name: Faruk Hossain
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, a suspected robber was killed in "gun battle" with RAB in Shibganj upazila was identified as Faruk Hossain, 35, a resident of the upazila. Abul Khayer, Deputy Commander of Chapainawabganj Camp of RAB-5, said a patrol team was passing Mohammadpur area around 1:30am when a gang of robbers barricaded Paikortala-Mobarokpur road. Noticing the arrival of RAB, the robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB officials to fire back, leaving Faruk injured. He was rushed to Shibganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jakir Shikder
data.description: In Narail, a suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Kachubaria village in Lohagara upazila. The deceased was identified as Jakir Shikder, 35. During the time.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Monirampur Police Station Officer in-Charge Mokarram Hossain said that two unidentified suspected robbers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ at Pulerhat - Rajganj road in Gangulia Jamtala area under Monirampur upazila in the district . The identities of the dead could not yet be known.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Monirampur Police Station Officer in-Charge Mokarram Hossain said that two unidentified suspected robbers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ at Pulerhat - Rajganj road in Gangulia Jamtala area under Monirampur upazila in the district . The identities of the dead could not yet be known.

data.name: Alamgir Badsha
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: RAB-11 Assistant Director Md Alep Uddin said that Alamgir, son of Manik Bepari, was killed in a gunfight with a RAB team during an anti-drug drive at Changrakandi under Sonargaon on July 24. Major Ashik Billah, acting Commanding Officer of RAB 11, said Alamgir was a top drug peddler in the district. Alamgir's family and district BNP's General Secretary, however, claimed that he was killed because he was a BNP activist. Alamgir's wife Suraiya Akter, however said that on Monday three to four persons forced her husband into a microbus and took off after he left for work. His family could not trace him the whole day and came to know about his death on July 24 morning, she said. She claimed that Alamgir was never involved in the drug business and supported his family with the rent of some of their shops and house in Kanchpur area.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Sub-Inspector Quyyum Munshi of Jessore Kotwali police said that the police recovered the bullet-ridden bodies of two men after being informed of a robbery attempt at the spot around 2:55am. He said that they sent the bodies to Jessore General Hospital for post-mortem examinations. The police officer said that they recovered three sharp weapons, pieces of ropes and sandals from the spot. Jessore General Hospital medical officer Kajal Mallick said that the duo was brought dead to hospital.

data.name: Unidentified

He said that they sent the bodies to Jessore General Hospital for post-mortem examinations. The police officer said that they recovered three sharp weapons, pieces of ropes and sandals from the spot. Jessore General Hospital medical officer Kajal Mallick said that the duo was brought dead to hospital.

data.name: Imran Hossain Rocky
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of police Md Bazlur Rashid of RAB-6 said suspected drug peddler Rocky was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB members at a RAB check-post set up at Maheshwarpasha Paschimpara about 1:30am. The victim’s father Sheikh Mizanur Rahman claimed that his son was an employee of Rampal power plant, not a drug peddler. He said that plainclothes men picked Rocky up in a RAB car from the gate of the power plant and many workers had even witnessed it on July 7 about 5:00pm but RAB denied his detention.

data.name: Sazzad Ali
data.description: Sazzad Ali, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Paba upazila in Rajshahi. Major Ashraful Islam of RAB-5 in Rajshahi alleged that the gunfight began when a RAB team ordered a group of suspected drugs peddlers to surrender in Kosba area at around 1:00am. The criminals opened fire on the RAB officials who retaliated. Ali was left injured as the others managed to flee. He was declared dead after he was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital. RAB claimed that 50 bottles of phensedyl, a pistol and a bullet were recovered from the spot. li had at least seven cases for drug peddling filed against him, Maj Ashraful said.

data.name: Jakir Hossain
data.description: Jakir Hossain, an alleged drug dealer, was killed along with two others in a reported gunfight with RAB in Chattogram. Among the other dead, one was identified as Md Dalim Sheikh while another remained unidentified. Both Jakir and Dalim hailed from Morrelganj of Bagerhat district. According to Rab, Jakir was accused in one case involving drugs while Dalim in two. Mimtanur Rahman, an assistant director of RAB-7's media wing, said the "gunfight" took place at Ambagan Railway Canteen Gate area after a Rab team signalled a private car coming from Comilla to stop. "Seeing the Rab men, the passengers of the car opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate, " he said. Afterwards, Rab found the three bullet-hit bodies inside the car.

data.name: Mohammad Dalim Sheikh
data.description: Md Dalim Sheikh, an alleged drug dealer, was killed along with two others in a reported gunfight with RAB in Chattogram. Among the other dead, one was identified as Jakir Hossain while another remained unidentified. Both Jakir and Dalim hailed from Morrelganj of Bagerhat district. According to Rab, Jakir was accused in one case involving drugs while Dalim in two. Mimtanur Rahman, an assistant director of RAB-7's media wing, said the "gunfight" took place at Ambagan Railway Canteen Gate area after a Rab team signalled a private car coming from Comilla to stop. "Seeing the Rab men, the passengers of the car opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate, " he said. Afterwards, Rab found the three bullet-hit bodies inside the car.

The other two dead were identified as Jakir Hossain and Md Dalim Sheikh- both of whom hailed from Morrelganj of Bagerhat district. According to Rab, Jakir was accused in one case involving drugs while Dalim in two. Mimtanur Rahman, an assistant director of RAB-7's media wing, said the "gunfight" took place at Ambagan Railway Canteen Gate area after a Rab team signalled a private car coming from Comilla to stop. "Seeing the Rab men, the passengers of the car opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate, " he said. Afterwards, Rab found the three bullet-hit bodies inside the car.

data.name: Nazmul Hossain
data.description: In Tangail, an alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Mirzapur upazila on July 26. Mizanul Haque, officer-in-charge (OC) of Mirzapur Police Station said that a police team arrested Nazmul from his house at around 3:00am. When the police were on the Dhaka-Tangail highway, a "gunfight" ensued as a group of criminals attacked the police van. As the criminals sprayed bullets at police, Nazmul attempted to flee. When the police fired back, Nazmul was left with bullet wounds while the other criminals fled the scene. After he was rushed to a local hospital, they sent him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital upon referral. As his condition deteriorated on the way there, he was admitted to the Sheikh Fazilatunnesa Mujib Memorial Hospital in Gazipur where doctors declared him dead at 11:00am, OC Mizanul said

data.name: Masud Rana Farid
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: In Tangail, police recovered the bullet-hit body of former Aronkhola Union Parishad member Masud Rana Farid from Naira Baid area in Madhupur upazila on July 27 morning. On information, police took the body to the police station around 8:00am. Farid's brother-in-law Rubel Miah said he along with Farid's wife and children went to a relative's marriage ceremony at Roktipara on July 26 and Farid was scheduled to join them on July 27 morning. Family members talked to him over mobile phone at 8:00pm on July 26, but Farid had been unreachable by phone since July 27 morning. Meanwhile Modhupur Upazali unit BNP President Zakir Hossain Sarkar said that Farid was a Jubo Dal leader. His killing could have been a drama of'crossfire'.

data.name: Hazrat Ali
data.description: RAB-12 Additional Superintendent of Police Sakibul Islam Khan said suspected robber Hazrat Ali, 35, of village Udhuniya Pankhuriya under Ullapara in the district was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the RAB members at Paikpara under Ullapara at about 3:00am on July 27.

data.name: Al Amin Kawser
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers — Al Amin alias Kausar of village Maniknagar under Titash upazila and Ershad Mia of village Kongshanagar under Burichang upazila in the district were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Detective Branch of police on the Batakandi-Asmania Road under Titash on July 27, said the District Additional Superintendent of police Shakhawat Hossain.

data.name: Ershad Mia
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers — Al Amin alias Kausar of village Maniknagar under Titash upazila and Ershad Mia of village Kongshanagar under Burichang upazila in the district were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Detective Branch of police on the Batakandi-Asmania Road under Titash on July 27, said the District Additional Superintendent of police Shakhawat Hossain.

data.name: Lalon Hawladar
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Rajbari, Lalon Hawladar, 42, of Sujanagar upazila in Pabna and also a local leadr of Lal Pataka faction Purba Banglar Communist Party, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Sluice Gate area under Pangsha upazila in the district at about 4:00am on July 27, said Fazlul Karim, Senior Assistant Superintendent of Rajbari police. .

data.name: Shahidul Islam Sabur
data.description: In Comilla, Shahidul Islam Sabur, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Sadar upazila. Maj Ataur Rahman, a company commander of Rab-11, alleged that the shootout took place when a RAB team conducted a drive at Gomti river dam area in Kaptanbazar around 4:00am to arrest Sabur, who was accused in 27 drug related cases. Sensing Rab's presence, Sabur and his cohorts opened fire. When RAB officials retaliated, Sabur was left with bullet wounds while the others fled. Sabur was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rezaul Islam
data.description: In Satkhira, suspected mugger Rezaul Islam, 42, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Shyamnagar upazila, two days after he was arrested from Dhaka. Ziaur Rahman, Inspector (Investigation) of Shyamnagar Police Station, said a team from Dhaka's Pallabi Police Station arrested Rezaul on July 26 night from the Dhaka and handed him over to Shyamnagar police on July 27 afternoon. The gunfight took place at around 2:00am when Shyamnagar police took Rezaul along to Khanpur area to arrest the other members of his gang, Inspector Ziaur said. His cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering the "gunfight" that left Rezaul injured. The others managed to flee. Rezaul was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kajol
data.description: In Barguna, Kajol, a suspected member of robber gang ‘Jahangir Bahini’, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the RAB-8 at a char of the River Baleshwar of Patharghata upazila around 5:30am. . RAB-8 members were locked in the ‘gunfight’ when the law enforcers challenged a trawler in the river from where the suspected robbers opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate by firing.

data.name: Sohrab Hossain
data.description: In Munshiganj's Srinagar upazila, Sohrab Hossain, a resident of the upazila and an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Mohitul Islam, a Company Commander of RAB-11, said that the "shootout" took place when a RABteam raided Chhatrabhog area at around 4:30am, after receiving information on a drug consignment handover. Sensing RAB's presence, the criminals opened fire at them. As they retaliated, Sohrab was left dead on the spot as the others fled, claimed Mohitul, also an Assistant Superintendent of police.

data.name: Mukul
data.description: In Rajshahi, an alleged criminal was killed in a reported "gunfight" with police in Nobogonga area. Kashia Danga Police officials claimed that the dead was identified as Mukul, 45. He was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, RAB said.

data.name: Rajon
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of RAB at Basila under Mohammadpur. The deceased, Rajon, 25, son of Shahabuddin of Ekhlaspur under Begumganj in Noakhali used to live in a rented residence at Nabinagar housing area under Mohammadpur in the capital. The family members claimed that Rajon, who was a human-hauler driver, remained missing since May 29 when he was picked up by unidentified plain-clothed men. Dhaka Medical College Hospital officials said that bullet-hit Rajon was brought dead to the hospital around 3:30am. Rajon’s wife Surama Akhter, who along with her father-in-law came to DMCH around noon, said that her husband was picked up by a group of plain-clothed men on May 29 evening and he remained missing since then. She said that they later went to different law enforcement agencies, who denied her husband’s detention. ‘My husband was a human hauler driver and often used to take hemp but was not a drug peddler. He was accused in five cases but he was free on bail in all the cases, ’ she claimed. She said that they came to DMCH seeing television news of the death of one man namely Rajon in ‘gunfight’ at Basila.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: RAB-5 Deputy Commander Major AM Ashraful Islam said that suspected drug peddler Abdur Rashid was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with a team of RAB at Tarash village under Puthia upazila in the district at about 10:15pm on 31 July.

data.name: Kabil Hossain
data.description: In Natore, suspected drug peddler Kabil was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of RAB at Mahishbhanga under Baraigram in the district on 31 July about 11:40pm, said a message by RAB’s legal and media wing.

data.name: Monir
data.description: Monir, an alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Aat Bhawal area in Keraniganj under Dhaka on August 1. Mohammad Robiul Islam, Senior ASP, RAB-2 said, hearing an information, RAB personnel drive there. Sensing RAB's presence, criminals opened fire. When RAB retaliated left Monir with bullet wounds while the others fled. Later they took him to DMCH where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Nagolkot upazila. Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Nagolkot Police Station, said the shootout took place as a team of law enforcers raided Olipur area on information that two drug dealers went there to sell drugs. Sensing the presence of police, drug dealers attacked them with machete and started shooting at the police. The law enforcers also returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". At one stage, the police found Mehedi with bullet injuries and rushed him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: An alleged drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Satgiri Jamal village in Sundaganj upazila. Assistant Commander of Gaibandha's RAB-13, Habibur Rahman Habib said that after receiving a tip off, one of their teams was on their way to raid Abdus Salam's house at around 3:00am. When they were close by, criminals sensed their presence and around five to six of them opened fire on the law enforcers. As RAB officials retaliated, the criminals fled but Abdus Salam, the "ring leader" of the group, was found with bullet wounds. He was taken to Sundarganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Faruk
data.description: A wanted drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Chauddagram upazila in Comilla. Major Ataur Rahman, a Company Commander of RAB-11 in Comilla said a RAB team raided Komalla Munshirhat College Road area to arrest drug dealers. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the drug dealers opened fire prompting the RAB team to retaliate. At one stage, Faruk was shot. Faruk passed away when he was being taken to Comilla Medical College hospital. Family sources said Faruk was a tea stall owner.

data.name: Barek Majhi
data.description: In Chandpur, Barek Majhi was killed in gunfihgt with police. Mizanur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Shahrasti Model Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, a team of police were patrolling Shorshak area in Suchipara union of the upazila at around 2:30am. When the "drug dealers" attacked them, the police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight" that left one of the criminals dead. The body of the "drug dealer" was kept at Chandpur Sadar Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Manik
data.description: In Rajshahi, Manik, 30, of Natun Para in Charghat upazila, was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Muktarpur village. After receiving a tip-off about a group of drug traders gathered in the area, a team of police conducted a drive there at around 2:45am, said Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Charghat Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Manik was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. He was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Makbul Hossain
data.description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Lohajang upazila of Munshiganj. The dead was Makbul Hossain, 36, of Uttar Medenimondal area of the upazila. Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Mahitul Islam of RAB-11 said acting on a tip-off, one of their teams carried out a raid in Purbakumarbhog area around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, a group of drug peddlers opened fire on them. The RAB members retaliated by firing back, triggering a "gunfight". After the "gunfight", the RAB team found Makbul's body on the scene.

data.name: Mohammed Nasir
data.description: He was arrested in Anwara following a tip off on 10 August afternoon. The gunfight took place in Dut Kumra area of Barasat union 11 August, " said Dulal Mahmud, Officer-in-Sharge of Anwara Police Station. He claimed that the "gunfight" took place after police had gone to the area along with the arrestee to recover firearms based on his confession. "Sensing the presence of police, his accomplices opened fire on police. The police retaliated, " said the OC, adding that the bullet-riddled body of Nasir was recovered from the spot later.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: In Cox’s Bazar, the deceased, Abdul Malek, 37, son of Bashir Ahmed of Hoanak Panir Chhara under the upazila. Maheshkhali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that Malek’s name was on the list of suspected criminals prepared by police. OC Pradip said that a team of police raided the area when suspected drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate by firing about 11:30am. After the gunfight, he said they rescued Malek from the spot and sent him to Maheshkhali Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Altaf Hossain
data.description: In Chittagong, police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mariamnagar union unit Awami League vice-president Altaf Hossain of village Mariamnagar under Rangunia along Chittagong-Kaptai road under Rangunia upazila about 10:00am. Rangunia Police Station Officer-in-Charge Imtiaz Mohammad Ehsanul Quader said that the name of Altaf, wanted in 11 cases, was on the list of drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry.

data.name: Mohammad Nizam Uddin
data.description: Two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with law enforcers in Cox's Bazar. According to RAB sources, the RAB-7 set up a check post on Cox's Bazar-Chittagong Highway in Ramu upazila's Paner Chhara Bazar area. Maj Md Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said when the RAB team signalled for a fuel truck to pull over, its passengers opened fire on law enforcers around 7:00am. The elite force fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight". When the shooting stopped after a while, the RAB men found two bullet-hit men in the vehicle. The duo was rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ratan Rudra
data.description: Two alleged drug traders were killed in a "gunfight" with law enforcers in Cox's Bazar. According to RAB sources, the RAB-7 set up a check post on Cox's Bazar-Chittagong Highway in Ramu upazila's Paner Chhara Bazar area. Maj Md Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said when the RAB team signalled for a fuel truck to pull over, its passengers opened fire on law enforcers around 7:00am. The elite force fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight". When the shooting stopped after a while, the RAB men found two bullet-hit men in the vehicle. The duo was rushed to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mazharul Islam Swapan
data.description: Swapan, a suspected criminal, was killed in gunfight with the DB police at Khilgaon in Dhaka. The victim's brother Liton said that his brother went missing after coming back from abroad on July 27. Dhaka Metropolitan Police's Detective Branch (East) Deputy Commissioner Khandoker Nurunnabi said that a team of DB police, during special drive in Nagdarpar area around 4:30am, were locked in a gunfight with a group of seven or eight miscreants as they opened fire on the law enforcers. Later, the DB men rescued Swapon with bullet injuries and sent him to DMCH where on duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A robber was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Koyra upazila of Khulna range of the Sundarbans. Twenty three kidnapped fishermen were rescued and seven boats recovered during the drive on Marcory Bawan canal of Shibsha river, said Wing Commander Hasan Emon Al-Razib, Commanding Officer of RAB-6. On information, a team of RAB-6 launched a drive in the early hours of August 15 and rescued the kidnapped fishermen. As the robbers opened fire, the law enforcers retaliated in self-defence, leaving the robber dead on the spot. The identity of the deceased could not be known.

data.name: Mohammad Khairul Islam
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a'gunfight' with police near Kochamari Bridge in Gabtoli upazila. He was accused in four robbery cases, said Md Khairul Bashar, officer-in-charge of Gabtoli Police Station. A gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery by felling trees on Pirgachha road in the area around 2:30am. At the time, a patrol team of police went to the area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing police to fire back that triggered a gunfight, said the OC. Police later rescued bullet-hit Khairul from the spot and sent him to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where he died around 6:30am. Khairul sustained bullet injuries in his right leg. Meanwhile, the cohorts of Khairul managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Mostaque Ahmed
data.description: A suspected robber was killed at Meherghona Reserved Forest of Cox’s Bazar on August 17. Cox’s Bazar Divisional Forest Officer(North) Hoque Mahabob Morsed said a group of local forest robber had been cutting timber from Meherghona forest. Forest officials, being informed, raided the area to detain the timber robbers, he said, adding that the timber robbers opened fire on forest officials, prompting them to retaliate by firing for their own safety. The gunfight continued for about half an hour and later, the timber robbers attacked forest officials with knives and locally made cleavers. During the gunfight, one timber robber was killed by receiving bullet.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun Morshed
data.description: RAB-7 Crimes Prevention Company-1 Commander Safayet Fahim Jamil said that following tip off a temporary check post was set up by the RAB at Mahipal and the BSCIC area at Feni on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. At about 4AM, a speeding motorcycle crossed the Mahipal check post when RAB chased the riders who opened fire while crossing the check post at BSCIC area. RAB retaliated and chased them. As the firing stopped, Safayet claimed, RAB rescued two bullet hit men and took them to Feni District Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Md Al-Amin
data.description: RAB-7 Crimes Prevention Company-1 Commander Safayet Fahim Jamil said that following tip off a temporary check post was set up by the RAB at Mahipal and the BSCIC area at Feni on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway. At about 4AM, a speeding motorcycle crossed the Mahipal check post when RAB chased the riders who opened fire while crossing the check post at BSCIC area. RAB retaliated and chased them. As the firing stopped, Safayet claimed, RAB rescued two bullet hit men and took them to Feni District Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Azizur Rahman Azad
data.description: Teknaf-1 RAB camp in-charge Mehedi Hasan, reported that RAB personnel on secret information set two temporary check posts on Teknaf-Cox’s Bazar road - one near Palli Bidyut office and the other near upazila parishad. He said that the gunfight occurred when a microbus carrying five or six people speedily crossed the Palli Bidyut office check post, violating RAB signal and opened fire while the RAB personnel retaliated by firing. The microbus caught fire during the gunfight. RAB also found bullet-hit Azizur and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zakir Hossain
data.description: A man arrested over robbery charges was killed in what police had claimed to be a gunfight between cops and the man’s accomplices at village Pattashi of Indurkani upazila in Pirojpur. Indurkani Police Station officer-in-charge Nasir Uddin said that they arrested Zakir in Khulna on August 24 in connection with a case filed over a robbery incident took place at five houses of village Ramchandrapur at Indurkani in January. Cops, on information extracted from him, conducted a drive at village Pattashi to recover arms and to catch his accomplices. The OC said as they reached the village at about 2:20am, Zakir’s cohorts opened fire on police, prompting the police to retaliate by firing. ‘At one stage, Zakir tried to escape and was caught in an "encounter". He said that they immediately took Zakir to Indurkani Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Bhadu Sheikh
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police on the bank of river Garai at village Alankarpur under Baliakandi upazila in Rajbari. Hasina Begum, Officer-in-Charge of Baliakandi Police Station, said on information that a group of robbers gathered on the bank of river Garai to commit robbery, a police team conducted a drive in the area. Sensing the presence of police, she claimed, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate triggering the gunfight at about 2:30am. As the ‘gunfight’ ended, she said, they found bullet-hit Bhadu Sheikh in a critical condition on the spot and took him to Baliakandi Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Meher Ali
data.description: In Natore, Meher Ali, was killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Lalpur upazila. The "shootout" took place around 2:15am as RAB members challenged a group of people in Chamtia area and came under fire. The RAB men retaliated, triggering a gunfight, leaving Meher injured, said Maj Shiblee Mostofa, a Company Commander of RAB in Natore. He was rushed to Lalpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sharif Hossain Khan
data.description: In Gazipur, Sharif was killed in a reported gunfight with members of RAB in Protyasha Math area of Tongi. The elite force gave an identical narrative of the "shootout" -- they opened fire on ground of self-defence after coming under attack by a group of suspected drug dealers, said Ishtiaque Ahmed, a Deputy Director of RAB-1.

data.name: Mohammad Rafiqul Islam
data.description: A suspected robber was killed allegedly in a ‘gunfight’ with the Rapid Action Battalion at Majher Char in the Baleshwar River under Patharghata upazila. According to Patharghata Police Station Officer-in-Charge Molla Mohammad Khabir Hossain, Rafiq was member of ‘Noa Bahini’, a gang that committed robbery and illegally collected tolls from fishermen in Baleshwar River and the adjacent areas. RAB officials said the ‘gunfight’ occurred at Majher Char, also under Sarankhola range of the Sunderbans, when members of Noa Bahini opened fire on the RAB men while they were on regular patrol.

data.name: Abdul Matin Mondal
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: Fazlul Karim, Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police at Pangsha circle of Rajbari said, "After receiving secret information, a team of police conducted a drive at Alokdanga village where a group of outlaws were holding a secret meeting around 2:30am on September 2. Sensing the presence of law enforces, the gang opened fire and policemen retaliated triggering a gunfight. Abdul Matin was caught up in the firing, his body was recoved after his cohorts fled the scene. Police rushed him to Pangsha Upazila Health Complex where an on-duty doctor declared him dead around 3:30am.

data.name: Suman Pahar
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with DB police at Chhoygaon village. Based on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers had gathered for a meeting at an orchard in the village, a DB team conducted an anti-drug drive there around 2:30am, said OC of the DB branch of Shariatpur Police Mohammad Azhar Ali. When the DB team arrived at the spot, the alleged drug peddlers hurled crude bombs and opened fire on them, forcing the police to retaliate. When the peddlers fled the scene after the gunfight that followed, the officer claimed that they found Suman injured on the scene with bullet wounds. Suman was taken to Shariatpur Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead. Suman's brother Rajon Pahar alleged that some plainclothes men picked up Suman along with two other villagers in front of a shop of their village on 31 August evening. Although the two others were sent to jail, they did not get any information about Suman.

data.name: Lal Suman
data.description: A team of RAB-7 conducted the drive in Sultanpur Kabiraj pond area around 10:00pm, acting on information that some drug traders gathered there to sell drugs. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fired, prompting them to retaliate, RABofficials claimed. Lal Suman was injured during the gunfight while the others managed to flee. RAB took him to Feni Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Kabir Hossain
data.description: Squadron leader Shafayat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 said that Kabir was killed in a gunfight with the RAB members at Lemua area on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway in Feni on 5 September at about 4:00am.

data.name: Mobarak Hossain
data.description: In Narayanganj, Mobarak Hossain, 35, allegedly a member of an inter-district robbery gang, was killed in a "gunfight" with police around 4:30am at Songargaon upazila. Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station Morshed Alam said acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was about to rob vehicles on the highway, the police conducted a raid at the spot. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfight, police arrested six robbers, including a bullet-hit Mobarak. Later, Mobarak was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Apan Ceasar
data.description: Ceasar, was killed in a'gunfight' with police around 2:30am at Matidali area. Sonaton Chakroborty, Additional Superintendent of Police of Bogra sadar circle, based on information that a gang was preparing to commit a robbery, a police team raided Matidali area of the town. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered the gunfight. Ceasar, the leader of the gang, was hit by a bullet during the gunfight. Afterwards, police took him to the Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital around 3:00am, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.description: Two members of banned extremist outfit Jama’atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, also suspected killers of secular writer and publisher Shahzahan Bachchu, were killed in a ‘gunfight’ at a police check post at KC Road in Satgaon area of Srinagar upazila in Munshiganj. Munshiganj Superintendent of police Zayedul Alam claimed that some members of the old faction of JMB came to the area for committing robbery to collect money for their organisation. The police claimed that including the duo, three suspected JMB operatives, who were wanted in Shahzahan Bachchu murder case, were killed in ‘gunfights’. SP Zayedul claimed that at around 1:00am on 7 September, the police tried to intercept two motorcycles carrying four people at a temporary check-post set on KC Das Road of Srinagar. The motorcyclists, violating the police signal, hurled crude bombs at the police and also opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, he said. He said that the two were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to escape.

data.name: Ekhlasur Rahman
data.description: Two members of banned extremist outfit Jama’atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, also suspected killers of secular writer and publisher Shahzahan Bachchu, were killed in a ‘gunfight’ at a police check post at KC Road in Satgaon area of Srinagar upazila in Munshiganj. Munshiganj Superintendent of police Zayedul Alam claimed that some members of the old faction of JMB came to the area for committing robbery to collect money for their organisation. The police claimed that including the duo, three suspected JMB operatives, who were wanted in Shahzahan Bachchu murder case, were killed in ‘gunfights’. SP Zayedul claimed that at around 1:00am on 7 September, the police tried to intercept two motorcycles carrying four people at a temporary check-post set on KC Das Road of Srinagar. The motorcyclists, violating the police signal, hurled crude bombs at the police and also opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, he said. He said that the two were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to escape.

data.name: Mohammad Abul Hossain
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Namotomla in Gomostapur upazila of Chapainawabganj. The victim’s father, Alam Sheikh, however, alleged that his son had been picked up by unidentified people in plainclothes on 6 September afternoon at Rahanpur bus stand while he was returning home from Chapainawabganj after appearing before a court in a case. Acting on a tip-off that a group of ‘drug peddlers’ had gathered at a mango orchard in village Namotomla to trade drugs, a RAB team conducted a drive there around 12:30am. Sensing the presence of the RAB team, the'drug peddlers' opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight ended, the RAB rescued Babu who had been shot and rushed him to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jasim Uddin Iqbal
data.description: Abu Bakar Siddique, Officer-in-Charge of Kapasia Police Station, said a patrol team led by SI Sumon heard gunshots while on duty in Bhulesshor Netartek forest area on 7. 9. 18 and found the bullet-hit body. The area is around 60 km away from Jasim's house. The OC said they did not know Jasim and therefore could not identify the body immediately. "We're suspecting that he was killed during a clash between two criminal groups, " the OC said, adding that they sent the body to Kapasia Upazila Health Complex where the duty doctor declared him dead. Kapasia Union Parishad member Abdul Motaleb said police called him over the phone around 3:30am and asked him to go to the spot where he found a blood-stained body and a pistol. Jasim's wife Happy Akhtar Chhaya claimed a sub-inspector (SI) of Mouchak police outpost in Kaliakoir called her husband out on 7 September afternoon. SI Saiful Islam, who was acquainted with her husband, called Jasim to show his new car, Chhaya claimed. SI Rezaul Karim of Detective Branch (DB) of Police was with Saiful at that time. She further said that she spoke to SI Saiful over the phone twice that night, and offered "whatever they want" to speak to her husband. Contacted, SI Saiful denied the allegation of calling Jasim out of the home.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.description: In Narayanganj, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Bandar upazila. Police claimed that he was accused in several cases filed with different police stations in Narayanganj and other districts. Bandar police OC Shaheen Mondal said 15-16 robbers were taking preparations to commit robbery in Sonachara Ramnagar area around 3:30am. On information, the police raided the area and came under fire. The police also retaliated. At one stage, the robbers fled leaving behind bullet-hit Ibrahim. He was declared dead at Bandar Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mohammad Dulal Mia
data.description: Aleged drug peddler Mohammad Dulal Mia was killed in a reported shootout between Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) and drug peddlers in Rajshahi's Mohonpur upazila. Abul Kashem, Officer-in-Charge of Mohonpur police, said. Dulal was well-known as a wholesaler of different kinds of drugs and was absconding since the drive against drugs began. The RAB-5 in a press release said the "shootout" took place at Dhuroil intersection in the upazila around 1:00am when around six suspected people opened fire on the elite force chasing them. The RAB returned fire and after a shootout of five minutes found Dulal injured. He was declared dead at Mohonpur Health Complex.

data.name: Shawkat Ali
data.description: Shawkat was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Rangpur city. On information, a team of RAB-13 of Rangpur raided the area around 3:00am, said Moktarul Alam, Officer-in-Charge (acting) of Rangpur Sadar Police Station. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". During the "gun battle", Shawkat was hit by bullets and died on the spot and others managed to flee.

data.name: Azizul Haque
data.description: Police found the bullet-hit bodies of two siblings, who went missing after going to village market, from two places of two upazilas in Jessore on 16 September, according to police and their family members. Azizul’s bullet hit body was found at a garden of their native village, Samta, while Faruk’s body was found at village Dharmapur under Keshabpur upazila in Jessore. Shahidul Islam, youngest brother of the victims said that his two elder brothers went to their village market, Samta Bazar, on 15 September at about 7:00pm, and they did not come back. He said, ‘We searched them every possible place on 15 September night but did not find them, later on 16 September morning I came to the hospital in search of them whether they faced any accident and found their bodies brought by police. ’ ‘Though there were allegations of petty crimes against my brothers "many years" ago, they were now leading normal life and used to earn their livelihood by farming croplands, ’ he claimed. Sharsha police station officer-in-charge Moshiur Rahman said that police recovered the bullet hit body of Azizul Haque from a garden at Samta village under the upazila around 9:00am on 16 September. Sub-inspector Abdur Rahim Hawlader, in-charge of Bagabchra police outpost, termed Azizul a drug peddler and said that he might have been killed in a ‘gunfight’ between two groups of drug peddlers at night. He claimed that Azizul was wanted by the police in at least seven cases.
