data.name: Tofazzal Hossain
data.description: In Joypurhat, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with RABin Khetlal upazila. "Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 raided in Tausara village to arrest a group of drug peddlers around 1:45am, " said ASP Azmal Hossain, Commanding Officer of Joypurhat RAB. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a "gunfight", the RAB official added. Tofazzal sustained a bullet injury during the "shootout" while the rest escaped. RAB members took him to Joypurhat Modern Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Emdad Khandokar
data.description: In Kushtia, an alleged drug dealer, Emdad Khandokar, was killed in a "shootout" with police Adabaria village of Kumarkhali upazila. AKM Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Kumarkhali Police Station, said a team of law enforcers raided Chechua Beel area on information that some drug traders were holding a secret meeting there around 3:30am. Sensing their presence, the drug traders opened fire, triggering a "gunfight" when police retaliated, the OC claimed. When the criminals fled, police found the body of Emdad, who stood accused in two narcotics cases filed with Islamic University Police Station, on the spot.

data.name: Mamun Sarker
data.description: In Barisal, Mamun Sarker, was killed in a gunfight with police. Abdul Khalek, OC (investigation) of Kazirhat Police Station in Mehendiganj upazila, said Mamun was a robber and accused in at least 26 cases, including murder, rape and robbery, with different police stations. Police arrested Mamun on 25 February night in Muladi Bailey Bridge area and went to a brick kiln in Kazirhut lake area to recover firearms around 2:00am, he added. Mamun's associates opened fire on the police team, triggering a "gunfight". The OC said Mamun was injured during the "gunfight" and taken to the local upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Kamal Hossain, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Paltan area. He has several drug related cases against him with Paltan and Ramna police stations, claimed police. Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers raided the area around 2:00am to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Kamal and his cohorts opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to retaliate, claimed Syed Ali, sub-inspector of Paltan Police Station. At one stage of the "gunfight", Kamal's bullet-ridden body was found on the spot. When rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, doctors declared him dead. Victim's sister Johura Begum who identified her brother at DMCH claimed that her brother was a local activist of BNP, went missing on 25 February evening.'' My brother had a rent-a-car business and he was never been a drug peddler,'' she claimed .

data.name: Shaheb Ali
data.description: According to Lt Commander AMM Zahidul Kabir of RAB-6, on information, they conducted a drive in Kolagachhia area of Satkhira's Shyamnagar upazila around 9:30am to detain the members of Shaheb Bahini, an infamous forest bandits' gang in the area. Sensing presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Although other members of the forest bandits managed to flee, two members -- Shaheb Ali, 35, chief of the gang, and Habibur Rahman, 28, second-in-command of the gang -- sustained bullet injuries during the hour-long "gunfight", the RAB official claimed. Later, on duty doctors of Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: According to Lt Commander AMM Zahidul Kabir of RAB-6, on information, they conducted a drive in Kolagachhia area of Satkhira's Shyamnagar upazila around 9:30am to detain the members of Shaheb Bahini, an infamous forest bandits' gang in the area. Sensing presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Although other members of the forest bandits managed to flee, two members -- Shaheb Ali, 35, chief of the gang, and Habibur Rahman, 28, second-in-command of the gang -- sustained bullet injuries during the hour-long "gunfight", the RAB official claimed. Later, on duty doctors of Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal Hossain, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar. Lt Col Asadud Zaman, captain of BGB battalion in Teknaf, claimed that the members of the paramilitary force raided sluice gate-3 area in Hoaikong union of Teknaf on information that a huge number of yaba pills were about to be smuggled. As the BGB men reached the area, smugglers attacked them with sharp weapons and guns, forcing them to retaliate, Asadud claimed, adding that Billal sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, doctors declared Billal dead when he was taken to Teknaf Health Complex.

data.name: Abdul Shukkur
data.description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt Col Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias, engaged in a "gunfight" with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30am after BGB men took position in the area on information that a large consignment of yaba pills were about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, the Lt Col added. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt Col Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias, engaged in a "gunfight" with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30am after BGB men took position in the area on information that a large consignment of yaba pills were about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, the Lt Col added. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Nazir Ahmed
data.description: Two suspected robbers Nazir Ahmed, and Gias Uddin, were killed in a gunfight with Teknaf police. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a drive in Howaikang area of the upazila on information that a group of robbers was attempting to carry out the robbery in Nayapara Battali area. Sensing police presence, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. On the other hand, family members of Gias alleged that police arrested him a few days ago. Asked, the OC denied the allegation.

data.name: Gias Uddin
data.description: Two suspected robbers Nazir Ahmed, and Gias Uddin, were killed in a gunfight with Teknaf police. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a drive in Howaikang area of the upazila on information that a group of robbers was attempting to carry out the robbery in Nayapara Battali area. Sensing police presence, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. On the other hand, family members of Gias alleged that police arrested him a few days ago. Asked, the OC denied the allegation.

data.name: Selim
data.description: In Munshiganj's Sirajdikhan upazila, a suspected robber -- Selim, 42, of Sonakanda in Dhaka's Keraniganj -- was killed in a gunfight with police. Asaduzzaman, additional superintendent of Munshiganj police, claimed the incident happened around 11:00am on 1 March 2019 when police and a group of robber engaged in a "gunfight".

data.name: Lalu Mia
data.description: Lalu Mia, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Kalibari area. "On information that a group of narcos was trading drugs in Kalibari Puratan Godaragaht area, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30am, " said Shah Kamal Akanda, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Police in Mymensingh, who also led the team. Sensing police presence, the drug traders opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight", he added. Lalu sustained bullet wounds during the "shootout" and was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Shamim
data.description: Shihabur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Puraton Kasba Police Outpost, claimed that they raided the Kholadanga area around 3:00am on information that two groups of drug dealers would meet there. When the law enforcers reached the spot, the drug dealers were already engaged in a "gunfight", the OC said, adding that sensing police presence, the criminals escaped the scene, leaving Shamim behind with bullet injuries. Doctors declared Shamim dead after he was taken to Jessore General Hospital.

data.name: Mirazul Islam Miraz
data.description: Sheikh Moniruzzaman Mithu, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Khulna Metropolitan Police, said they had detained Miraz on 8 March. During primary interrogation, Miraz provided police with information that he and his cohorts stored robbed items in the city's Agriculture College area, he claimed. When police took him to the spot for recovering those items, his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one point of the "gunfight", Miraz sustained bullet injuries. Doctors declared him dead after he was rushed to Khulna Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: Abdur Rahman was killed in gunfight with police

data.name: Md. Nurul Islam
data.description: Commandar in charge Teknaf 2 BGB, Major Shariful Islam Jomaddar told that BGB got information that a Yaba shipment can enter Bangladesh through Khankar Deil village of Teknaf municipalty. Then, a team of BGB reached there. The traffickers started firing at the BGB. In reply BGB also fired and the traffickers flew that place. BGB rescued Nurul Islam as wounded and sent him to Upazela Health Complex. Nurul Islam died on the way to hospital. Officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das said that there was no case filed against Nurul Islam.

data.name: Mustaq Ahmed
data.description: Police claimed that two drug peddler brothers were killed in a gunfight with the two groups of drug dealers at Palongkhali in Ukhia under Cox's Bazar. However, locals said that the deceased two brothers and another youth were picked up by men claiming to be members of law enforcement agency on 12 March. The bodies of two bothers were found on 15 March.

data.name: Mokter Ahmed
data.description: Police claimed that two drug peddler brothers were killed in a gunfight with the two groups of drug dealers at Palongkhali in Ukhia under Cox's Bazar. However, locals said that the deceased two brothers and another youth were picked up by men claiming to be members of law enforcement agency on 12 March. The bodies of two bothers were found on 15 March.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: GG Biswas, officer-in-charge of Mohammadpur Police Station, claimed a police team set up a checkpoint in the area around 2:30am on information that a mugging gang was supposed to gather there. Sensing police presence, the muggers who were riding a car sped up their vehicle in front of the police checkpoint. At one stage of chasing and counter chasing, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he added. The duo was injured in the "gunfight". Of the two, one was taken to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yasin Arafat
data.description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar, hours after he was picked up by the law enforcers. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained Yasin from Teknaf town on 18 March evening over his alleged involvement with various crimes, including yaba trade and attack on police. "Based on his information, police conducted a drive in Mitha Panirchhara area around 2:00am to arrest his cohorts, " the OC added. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire, prompting police to retaliate that triggered a "shootout", he said. At one point, Yasin came in the line of fire and was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Jamal Haq
data.description: Mamun-or-Rashid, officer-in-charge of Comilla Sadar Dakkhin police station, said that a team of police raided Dhanpur on information that a group of suspected drug peddlers gathered in the area. Sensing the police, suspected pedlars opened fire on the law enforcers who also fired back, he said. Within a few minutes, the ‘gunfight’ ended as the pedlars fled away, said the OC. Police found Jamal shot and wounded and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nur Mohammad
data.description: Acting on information, police first arrested Nur Mohammad from Zero Point area of Teknaf town around 7:00pm on 21 March and detained Nurul Amin from the same area after gleaning information from Nur Mohammad, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The two were interrogated at the police station. Based on their information, police along with them were going to Rajarchhara area to recover firearms and yaba pills around 3:00am, said the OC. Sensing law enforcers' presence, some drug peddlers opened fire to snatch the arrestees, forcing them to fire back in self-defence, the police official added. During the "gunfight", Nur Mohammad and Nuru Aminl were hit by bullets when they were trying to flee from police custody, he said. The injured were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nurul Amin
data.description: Acting on information, police first arrested Nur Mohammad from Zero Point area of Teknaf town around 7:00pm on 21 March and detained Nurul Amin from the same area after gleaning information from Nur Mohammad, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The two were interrogated at the police station. Based on their information, police along with them were going to Rajarchhara area to recover firearms and yaba pills around 3:00am, said the OC. Sensing law enforcers' presence, some drug peddlers opened fire to snatch the arrestees, forcing them to fire back in self-defence, the police official added. During the "gunfight", Nur Mohammad and Nuru Aminl were hit by bullets when they were trying to flee from police custody, he said. The injured were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Korban
data.description: Korban, the main accused in Abu Taher Sagor murder case, was killed in a "shootout" with the Detective Branch of police in Khurushkul area of Cox's Bazar Sadar upazila around 3:00am, said Farid Uddin Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Sadar Model Police Station. Police claimed to have recovered a firearm and three bullets from the spot.

data.description: Budu, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with poli

data.name: Abu Taleb
data.description: Abu Taleb, a suspected robber, was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB in Banshkhali upazila of Chattogram. He was a resident of Chakaria upazila in Cox's Bazar. Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director of Rab-7 told The Daily Star that the gunfight took place at Chhoto Chonua area of Banshkhali upazila at around 4:00am. He said acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of Rab raided the area where the robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the sea-bound fishing trawlers. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight. Later, RAB members recovered Taleb's body and handed it over to Banshkhali Police Station.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: Shariful Islam Jamaddar, acting commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, said a "gunfight" broke out between BGB and a group of drug traders in Teknaf's Kharangkhali area around 4:30am when a BGB team was conducting an anti-narcotic drive there. At one stage, the drug traders, who were entering Bangladesh crossing the Naf River, retreated, Shariful added. The BGB men found two bullet-hit men lying injured on the spot later. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead. Police later identified the two as Mohammad Ilias, 18, of Kutupalong Rohingya camp and Faruk Mia of Balukhali camp.

data.name: Faruk Mia
data.description: Shariful Islam Jamaddar, acting commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, said a "gunfight" broke out between BGB and a group of drug traders in Teknaf's Kharangkhali area around 4:30am when a BGB team was conducting an anti-narcotic drive there. At one stage, the drug traders, who were entering Bangladesh crossing the Naf River, retreated, Shariful added. The BGB men found two bullet-hit men lying injured on the spot later. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead. Police later identified the two as Mohammad Ilias, 18, of Kutupalong Rohingya camp and Faruk Mia of Balukhali camp.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in "gunfight" with RAB in Magnama coastal area around 4:00am. The identities of the two could not be confirmed. Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said they were members of a robbery gang operating in the Bay of Bengal.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in "gunfight" with RAB in Magnama coastal area around 4:00am. The identities of the two could not be confirmed. Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said they were members of a robbery gang operating in the Bay of Bengal.

data.name: Shafik
data.description: An alleged top criminal from Narsingdi was killed in a "shootout" with RAB in Bhasantek area. Lt Col Kazi Shamsher Uddin, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said a RAB team raided a house in Bhasantek around midnight on 26 March to arrest Shafik. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the Rab men. The law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, triggering the "gunfight", the RAB official added. Shafik, accused in at least 12 cases, was injured by bullets. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 1:30am.

data.name: Kawsar Mia
data.description: In Gazipur, Kawsar Mia, was injured in a "shootout" with police in Tongi around 4:00am, hours after he was picked up by law enforcers from Gazipura area. Police took injured Kawsar Mia to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. OC Kamal Hossain of Tongi East Police Station said they picked up Kawsar, accused in several criminal cases, on 26 March afternoon when he was preparing to commit mugging. Later, a police team took him to Tongi's Banshpatti area and conducted a drive to recover illegal arms. At one stage, Kawsar's associates fired bullets at police to snatch him away. Law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, forcing them to retreat. The OC claimed the arrestee was hit with bullets fired by his cohorts. Kawsar's family members said he was not facing any murder or robbery case. Police picked him up from near his home around 3:00pm on 26 March. They heard the news of his death 27 March morning.

data.name: Tarzan Manir
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, Detective Branch (DB) of Police intercepted a microbus around 4:30am in Aftabnagar area, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB, . "The miscreants opened fire on the policemen from inside the microbus, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, " the official said. The two were injured during the "shootout" and declared dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, he said.

data.name: Shah Ali
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, Detective Branch (DB) of Police intercepted a microbus around 4:30am in Aftabnagar area, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB, . "The miscreants opened fire on the policemen from inside the microbus, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, " the official said. The two were injured during the "shootout" and declared dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Hossain
data.description: Mohammad Hossain, was killed in a "gunfight" between a drug gang and law enforcers near Habirchara union of Teknaf upazila. On information that a gang of robbers was preparing for robbery in the hilly area near Habirchara, police raided the scene around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police. The law enforcers returned fire in self-defence, he added. At one stage, the criminals retreated and the police recovered bullet-hit body of Mohammad Hossain. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead, said the police officer.

data.name: Mahmudur Rahman
data.description: Three alleged drug peddlers, including a Rohingya woman, were killed in "gunfights" with police and Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf. Police and BGB officials claimed that the three were involved in yaba trading. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team went to Moulvibazar Bridge area around 4:00am on information that two groups of yaba peddlers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire in self-defence, triggering the "gun battle", the OC said. At one stage, the criminals escaped and the law enforcers found the bullet-hit bodies of Mahmudur and Absar on the spot. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. They died there around 8:00am, the OC said. In another similar incident a female' drug peddler' Rumana was killed by BGB.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with DB police at Bhabanipur intersection under Kashimpur police station in Gazipur city. Gazipur Metropolitan Police detective branch Additional Deputy Commissioner Manzur Rahman said that, a team of DB police, on secret information that a group of drug peddlers were staying at an abandoned house near Bhabanipur intersection, raided the area. ‘Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, ’ the police official said. After the gunfight, the DB team rescued Jahangir with bullet injuries and took him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ghano Shankor Chakma
data.description: Ghano Shankor Chakma, a suspect in the Rangamati seven-murder was killed in a "gunfight" with members of joint forces. He was a regional political party member, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of RAB-7. He stood accused in the murder case, the RAB official said. On the other hand, MA Manzur, officer-in-charge of Rangamati's Baghaichhari Police Station, said a case was filed against 40-50 unnamed assailants. Shankor's name was not mentioned in the case. But police were keeping watch on him, the OC said. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of army and RAB raided remote Dochhari area in Naikhongchhari around 10:00am. Shankor was shot dead during the "gunfight" and nine to 10 others managed to flee, said the RAB official.

data.name: Jamal
data.description: Two alleged robbers-- Jamal and Nayem-- were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members in the Tejgaon area. Mohiuddin Faruque, Company Commander of RAB-2 said that the RAB team set up a check-point in Tejgaon on information that the alleged robbers would make off with a stolen lorry through that area. When the RAB members signalled the vehicle to stop around 4:00am, the "robbers" opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, Mohiuddin claimed. The two sustained bullet injuries during the "shootout" and were pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH).

data.name: Nayeem
data.description: Two alleged robbers-- Jamal and Nayem-- were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB members in the Tejgaon area. Mohiuddin Faruque, Company Commander of RAB-2 said that the RAB team set up a check-point in Tejgaon on information that the alleged robbers would make off with a stolen lorry through that area. When the RAB members signalled the vehicle to stop around 4:00am, the "robbers" opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, Mohiuddin claimed. The two sustained bullet injuries during the "shootout" and were pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH).

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: Nur Alam, Mohammad Jubayer and Hamid Ullah-- three Rohingya men, suspected to be robbers, were killed in a "gunfight" with police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near "H-block" of the camp on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing police presence, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the "gunfight", the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Heath Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

data.name: Shariful Islam Sharif
data.description: Sharif, a suspected robber was killed in a police firing during a robbery attempt at Soydabad-Belkuchi regional road. Being tipped-off that an organised group of robbers put up a tree on the road in a bid to commit robbery, a team of police conducted a drive in the area, said Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sirajganj Sadar police station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers tried to attack them, forcing them to open fire, the police said. Shariful sustained bullets while his accomplices managed to flee the scene, said the OC. Later, he was taken to Sheikh Fazilatunnesa Mujib Memorial Hospital where he died from his injuries .

data.name: Saiful
data.description: Saiful, prime accused in local Juba League activist Lokman Rahman Rony murder case, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Pranab Chowhdhury, officer-in-charge of Bakalia Police Station, said they arrested Saiful along with Zia, 25, another accused in the case, in Jafarnagar area of the district's Fatikchhari upazila on 9 April 2019. During primary interrogation Saiful informed police of the whereabouts of the murder weapon. Following the information, police conducted a raid in Bakalia area, with Saiful, to recover the murder weapon, he claimed. Sensing police presence, Saiful's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. The "gunfight" left Saiful dead on the spot.

data.name: Morom Ali
data.description: Mukhlesur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Bhairab Police Station, said police raided Chandpur Bridge area around 1:30am on information that some robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals started throwing brick chunks at them and they opened fire at one stage. Police then retaliated, triggering the "gun battle", claimed the OC, who led the drive. Morom was hit by bullets during the "gun battle", while the others fled. He was rushed to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nabi Hossain
data.description: Mohiuddin Faruque, company commander of RAB-2, claimed that Nabi used to sell yaba in the city. A team of RAB took position near Dhaka Udyan on information that Nabi was carrying yaba from Teknaf, Mohiuddin claimed. Nabi opened fire on the RAB men when they intercepted a CNG-run auto-rickshaw in the area that was carrying him, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. During the "gunfight", Nabi sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Delwar Hossain, a suspected robber, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with RAB at Chhoto Sanua in Bashkhali upazila of Chattogram. Tipped-off that a group of pirates were taking position in the area, a team of the elite force raided the area, said Mashkur Rahman, assistant director of RAB 7. Later, the robbers fired gunshots targeting RAB members, prompting them to fire back, leaving Delwar dead on the spot, he said. Four firearms and 22 bullets were seized from the spot.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: In Teknaf, Abul Kashem, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police in Khoaikong Satgariapara. Police arrested Abul Kashem on 10 April and raided the area at around 3:00am on 11 April taking him with them to recover arms, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf model police station, adding that Kashem’s associates opened fire on them when they reached the spot. ‘The police team then returned fire, triggering a gunfight in which Kashem was killed on the spot.

data.name: Ruhul Amin
data.description: Abu Jihad Md Fakrul Alam, officer-in-charge of Chuadanga Sadar police, said a team raided Ukta village on information that drug traders were holding a secret meeting there around 2:00am. "Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, " the OC said, adding, "A gunfight ensued when the team retaliated. " As the criminals retreated, the police found the body of Ruhul Amin.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: Habibur Rahman, an alleged criminal, was killed in a gunfight with RAB in the Salna area of Gazipur town. He was accused in 13 cases filed with different police station, according to RAB. RAB-1 Company Commander Lt Abdullah Al-Mamun said the gunfight occurred around 2:30am when RAB conducted an operation in the area acting on a tip-off that arms were being smuggled there. Sensing their presence, the arms dealers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, the elite force claimed. Rahman’s body was sent to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College morgue for autopsy

data.name: Mostafa Kamal
data.description: Kamal was killed in a gunfight with police at Ullapara. Ullapara police station Inspector (investigation) Mohammad Golam Mostafa said they, on a tip off that a group of drug peddlers had been dealing drugs, raided Ghosgati area at about 2:00am. Sensing presence of police, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering the gunfight, leaving Kamal dead on the spot.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: In Cox’s Bazar’s Ukhia upazila, two Rohingyas, allegedly involved in drug trade, were killed during a "gunfight" with BGB in Keruntoli area, said BGB Battalion 34 Commander Ali Haidar Azad Ahmad. On information that a gang of peddlers was at Keruntoli, the BGB sent a team to raid the area. Sensing their presence, the criminals fired at the BGB men, who then retaliated, said Commander Ali, adding that BGB then informed police about the incident. Police later recovered the two bodies, along with 20, 000 yaba pills and four sharp weapons from their possessions, from the spot, said Sub-Inspector (SI) Dipankar Roy of Whykong Police Outpost in Teknaf upazila.

Injured Mohiuddin was rescued while 10,000 yaba pills, a firearm and ammunition were recovered from the spot. Mohiuddin died of his injuries in Cox’s Bazar General Hospital around 11:00am.

data.name: Rafiq Uddin

data.name: Mujibur Rahman Jitu

Alamgir Hossen, OC of Moulvibazar Police Station said that tipped off that a consignment of yaba pills would be smuggled through the village, a patrol team of Detective Branch (DB) of Police took position in the area, said Rashedul Islam, additional superintendent of police in Moulvibazar. When a gang of alleged drug traders was crossing the area with sacks full of yaba around noon, the DB team intercepted them. The gang members opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight". After an hour-long battle, when the drug traders fled the scene, police recovered injured Jitu and took him to Moulvibazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Later, police, along with Bagha, conducted a drive to arrest his other accomplices in Pulpara area. At that time, Bagha’s accomplices attacked police with sharp weapons and also opened fire. Police then returned fire. Bagha was trying to flee police custody and was hit by bullets, while others fled, the OC said. Bagha was taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital. As his condition deteriorated, he was referred to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he died .

He was rushed to Madaripur Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead .

The suspected drug peddlers, sensing the presence of cops, opened fire on the police and they also retaliated with gunshots, triggering a gunfight in which Hazrat died.

The robbers, sensing the presence of RAB, opened fire on them and the RAB members also retaliated, triggering a gunfight, he said, adding that the RAB personnel rescued the bullet-hit unidentified robber from the house and took him to Dumuria upazila health complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

His cohorts managed to flee on motorcycles. "Sumon died while being taken to the Rangpur Medical College Hospital. His body was sent to the morgue for autopsy, " said SP Saifur.

data.name: Ashraf Ali

A team of RAB 2 had asked a group of people to stop at a check-post in Agargaon but they opened fire at them, triggering a skirmish, said RAB sources. The suspected drug dealer was killed during the gunfight, the sources added.

Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "shootout", he added. data.name: Ziarul Islam
data.description: Md Shahidullah, Rajshahi superintendent of police said that that being tipped off that two groups of ‘drug trader’ were exchanging gunshots over establishing supremacy, a team of police rushed to the spot around 2:30am. As the police chased them, the drug peddlers started firing targeting at the police, forcing them to retaliate which triggered a ‘gunfight’. At one stage of the ‘gunfight’, the drug smuggling members fled the spot while Kalu sustained bullet injuries. Later, Kalu was rushed to Bagha Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. Meanwhile, the deceased’s wife, Isma Begum, claimed that four plainclothes men picked up her husband, Kalu, from Kishorpur area of Bagha while he along with his business partner were returning home by motorcycle on 8 May night.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Shah Alam, accused of killing a woman, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police in Bakalia area. Chittagong South Metropolitan Police Additional Deputy Commissioner Shah Md Abdur Rouf said that Shah Alam had been at loggerhead with local ‘criminal’ Hasan. He went to the residence of Hasan’s aunt in Bojroghona Madina Mosque area around 10:00pm on Saturday in search of Hasan. As he was not there, Shah Alam got furious and attempted to shoot Hasan’s cousin Rubel. Being obstructed by Rubel’s elder sister Bubli, Alam shot her, leaving her critically injured, ’ he said adding that the injured was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared her dead. Later, a team of police raided Bolirhat area, adjacent to the River Karnaphuli, around 3:30am to arrest Shah Alam. When the police team reached there, Alam’s associates opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight that left Alam dead on the spot.

data.name: Yaqub Ali Kajal
data.description: Kajal, was accused of raping a schoolgirl and committing acid attack on a housewife, Gangni police officer-in-charge Harendranath Sarkar said. Kajal threw acid on a housewife on 10 May and on information, police arrested him raiding village Dhola in Kathuli union on the same day. He confessed to the police about his involvement in the acid attack. Kajal also informed police of owning several weapons, the OC added. Later, police along with Kajal went to a bamboo orchard of Garadhob to recover the weapons at about 2:30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Kajal’s accomplices opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, added Harendranath. After the gunfight, police found Kajal with bullet injuries but his associates managed to flee. The police took him to Gangni Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dudu Mia
data.description: Dudu Mia, was a named in a list of narcos prepared by the home ministry, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Tipped off, a police team arrested Dudu from a location nearby his house on 10 May night and conducted a raid in Moheshkhalipara area to recover a haul of hidden yaba pills and firearms taking him along with them, said the OC. As soon as the police team reached the spot, cohorts of Dudu opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which triggered a "shootout", the OC added. Dudu was caught in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody, he added. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Drug peddlers hurled brick chips and opened fire aiming at the team as soon as it reached the spot, triggering the gunfight, he claimed. After the gunfight, police found Mostafa at the spot with gunshot wounds. He was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Azim Ullah
data.description: Azim Ullah, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 23 in Shamlapur area and Abdus Salam, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. Tipped off that a gang of human traffickers had gathered some people in Shamlapur Marine Drive Road area in an attempt to smuggle them into different districts in the country, a police team conducted a raid around 4:00am, the OC said. Sensing their presence, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight". Later, police recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced them dead.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Azim Ullah was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 23 in Shamlapur area and Abdus Salam was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. data.name: Sayedul Mostafa
data.description: Bhulu, was killed in a "shootout" with police in Katapahar area. Police was about to conduct a drive to recover illegal firearms taking Mostafa along with them, said Farid Uddin Khandaker, OC of Cox’s Bazar Sadar Model Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, cohorts of Mostafa opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, the OC said. Injured Mostafa was shot during the incident and taken to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman Titas
data.description: Acting on a tip off, a police team raided a sugarcane field around 3:00am where the miscreants taking preparation for a robbery, said Bahauddin Faruki, OC of Ishwardi Police Station. Sensing police’s presence, robbers opened fire on the cops, forcing them to fire back in retaliation which triggered a "gunfight", said the OC. Later, police recovered Titas with a bullet injury and took him to Ishwardi Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: In Jessore, Abul Kashem, an alleged robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: Mohammad Abu Salam Miah, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station, said that they raided Shahidul’s house early in the morning. Shahidul and his associates opened fire as soon as police reached the place, triggering a gunfight. After the skirmish, police arrested Shahidul with gunshot wounds from the spot. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) or its sister organizations
data.description: Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodip Kumar Das said that the associates of Ibrahim opened fire at the law enforcers during a drive to arrest him from the area. Police fired back in retaliation, injuring Ibrahim and his associates. While his associates fled the scene, Ibrahim was left behind, according to the OC. Ibrahim was declared dead after he was taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Munir
data.description: Two suspected ‘hijackers’ were killed in an alleged ‘gunfight’ with the Rapid Action Battalion in Hazaribagh Beribadh area. According to RAB officials, a gang of hijackers hijacked a covered van carrying nine tonnes of tea of Ishpahani Tea Ltd from Srimangal five to six days ago. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB-2 set up a check-post in front of Madhu City under Hazaribagh police station in Old Dhaka and intercepted a van while it was crossing the check-post around 2:45am. Sensing the impending danger, the hijackers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a brief gunfight, the RAB recovered the bodies of van driver Munir and his assistant Gias from the spot, said RAB-2superintendent Mohiuddin Faruqi.

data.name: Giasuddin
data.description: Two suspected ‘hijackers’ were killed in an alleged ‘gunfight’ with the Rapid Action Battalion in Hazaribagh Beribadh area. data.name: Mohammad Monsur
data.description: Monsur, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police. Mohammad Mohsin, Officer-in-Charge of the Kotwali police, said that a patrol team of police chased a gang of muggers when they snatched a bag from a woman in Tigerpass area at night. When, the auto-rickshaw carrying the hijackers reached Pologround area, they opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. After the gunfight, police rescued bullet-hit Monsur from the spot and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Selim Miah
data.description: In Comilla, a suspected ‘drug peddler’, Selim Miah, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Golabari. Lieutenant Colonel Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, Commanding Officer of BGB 10-Battalion, said that a special team of BGB raided the border area. Sensing presence of the BGB, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. Selim sustained bullet wound during the gunfight and doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Nazmul Hossain
data.description: Nazmul Hossain, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch of police in Meherpur. Obaidur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Meherpur DB, said one of their teams raided Gangni upazila’s Karamdi village around 3:30am on information that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the DB personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, he claimed. At one stage, the attackers fled but Nazmul's body was found on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Hanif
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said Hanif was arrested in Teknaf town on 22 May evening. Around 4:00am, police, along with him, raided Lombori Para along Marine Drive Road to recover firearms and yaba pills. Hanif’s cohorts opened fire as soon as police reached the area, triggering a "gunfight". Hanif was hit while trying to flee from police custody, the OC claimed. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jakir Hossain
data.description: Kala Jakir, a suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with police. He was killed in Palpara Bridge area of the city. Abu Salam Mia, officer-in-charge of Kotwali Model Police station said that a team from the police station raided the area after being tipped off about the presence of drug dealers. During the drive, the suspected drug dealers started shooting at policemen, who retaliated with gunfire. After the suspects fled the scene, the bullet-hit body of Jakir was found at the scene, the OC said.

data.name: Abdul Hakim
data.description: In the incident day, Halim along with some others playing cards at Jhaoil Technical college field. During the time, SI Abu Taher, ASI Ashraful Alam and some other policemen drive that field with a microbus by wearing plainclothes and detained four persons. They were Suruzzaman, Haradhon Chandra, Gourango Chandra and Ripon. At that time, they beat up Halim, leaving him sick. However, local people took him to Gopalpur Upazila Health COmplex, where duty doctor declared him dead. Abu Taher, Ashraful Alam and six other constabes were closed from their duty

data.name: Mohammad Siraj
data.description: Mohammad Siraj, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a'gunfight' with police after being arrested by police. The incident took place at 8:30 pm on 15 May 2019 in a salt field near Naf river in Teknaf.

data.name: Hasan
data.description: Alleged robbers Hasan, Mustain, Mainul, and Haider were killed in a gunfight with RAB at Jongrakhal in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat. According to RAB, Hasan was the alleged ringleader of a robber gang called Hasan Bahini. The other three were members of the gang. Acting on a tip-off, a Rab team raided the Sundarbans area under Chandpai range at night, said Mufti Mahmud Khan, Rab’s legal and media wing director. Sensing the Rab members’ presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. The Four robbers were hit and died on the spot.

Sensing the BGB men’s presence, the criminals opened fire. The BGB members returned fire, triggering the "gun battle". The "drug dealers" were hit and they were taken to a local hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nannu
data.description: Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said police were looking for the two "notorious youths" - Nannu and Babu - as they have been committing crimes like extortion and mugging since long. A patrol team of RAB-1 raided the Tongi Bridge area on information that a gang of criminals were mugging people there. Sensing RAB's presence, the muggers tried to hide below the bridge. As RAB members approached them, they opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, Kamruzzaman claimed. At one point, the duo sustained bullet injures. RAB rushed them to Ahsanullah Master General Hospital where doctors declared them dead,

data.name: Saiful Karim
data.description: Saiful Karim, a listed yaba kingpin, was shot and killed when police exchanged fire with his associates in Cox’s Bazar. Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-charge Pradip Kumar Das said they arrested him from the Marine Drive in the tourist town around 10:00pm on 30 May. Saiful was picked up by law enforcers from Dhaka airport on May 25 on his arrival from Myanmar. He had fled there after the government declared a war on drug in May last year. Pradip said that during interrogation Saiful revealed a big consignment of yaba was being smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar through the Naf river. Police then took Saiful along to raid the area around 4:00am to seize the pills. "Sensing police presence, the yaba kingpin’s associates opened fire, prompting police to fire back, triggering a gunfight, " said Pradip. Caught in the line of fire, Saiful as well as four policemen were injured, and were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, said the OC. Saiful was later shifted to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Delwar Hossain
data.description: Delwar Hossain was killed in a gunfight with BGB members at Hakimpur border under Dinajpur district. During time, three BGB members were injured. They recovered 958 pieces yaba tablets and a mobile set

data.name: Abdul Gafur
data.description: Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf-2, said being tipped off over smuggling of a consignment of Yaba, a team of BGB conducted a drive in Kayukhkhali area. Sensing their presence, the yaba traders opened fire on the BGB men, prompting them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, he added. Later, the BGB men recovered the two with bullet injuries from the spot and sent them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mufizur Rahman
data.description: Following information given by Mufizur, a police team raided a secret place to recover arms and drugs around 4:00am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station. When the team reached the spot Mufizur’s cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered the gunfight. Pradip Kumar said that when the gunfight was over they rescued Mufizur with bullet injuries and took him to Sadar hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ismail
data.description: In Gazipur, an alleged drug peddler Ismail, was killed in a shootout with the RAB. ‘A RAB team was conducting an anti-narcotics raid in the river port area when drug peddlers opened fire on them, ’ said Kamal Hossain, officer-in-charge of Tongi East Police Station. ‘Ismail was killed during the gunfight, ’ he said, adding that a fire arm, bullets and several thousands of Yaba pills were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Md Arafat Bin Akhter Khan
data.description: In Chittagong, two suspected ‘robbers’ were killed in Sitakunda upazila. RAB-7 Assistant Director (Media) Masuqur Rahman said one of their teams went to the area to foil a robbery bid on the highway. ‘The robbers opened fire as soon as our team reached Chhoto Kumira around 2:00am. After the skirmish, bodies of two robbers, firearms and bullets were recovered, ’ he claimed.

data.name: Md Al-Amin
data.description: In Chittagong, two suspected ‘robbers’ were killed in Sitakunda upazila. RAB-7 Assistant Director (Media) Masuqur Rahman said one of their teams went to the area to foil a robbery bid on the highway. ‘The robbers opened fire as soon as our team reached Chhoto Kumira around 2:00am. After the skirmish, bodies of two robbers, firearms and bullets were recovered, ’ he claimed.

data.name: Helel Uddin
data.description: In Comilla, quoting BGB officials, reported that a team of Border Guard Bangladesh 10 Battalion, on secret information, conducted an anti-drug drive near Gilatali bordering area under Sadar upazila and the suspected drug peddlers opened fire at BGB personnel. The BGB men fired back that triggered a ‘gunfight’. The officials said that as the ‘gunfight’ ended, they found the body of Helal from the spot.

data.name: Monirul Islam Babul
data.description: In Thakurgaon, quoting Border Guard Bangladesh 42 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Gazi Nahid Uz Zaman, reported that suspected drug peddler Monirul was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with BGB members at Fakirganj under Pirganj in Thakurgaon. He said that a BGB team arrested Babul on 5 June night. Later, the team along with Babul raided Fakirganj area to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Babul’s associates opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, he claimed, adding that, at one stage, Babul was caught in the line of fire and died while his accomplices managed to escape.

data.name: Shamsul Alam
data.description: Teknaf Police arrested Shamsul, Noor and Habib from Leda area under Teknaf for their alleged involvement in abduction of a Rohingya child demanding Tk 5 lakh in ransom. Police rescued the child. Then the police raided Leda area at about 11:45 pm on 6 June along with the three accused to recover illegal firearms and arrest their accomplices. Sensing the presence of police, the accomplices opened fire and the police also fired back triggering a ‘gunfight’. The trio became critically injured falling in line of fire, the OC said. The injured were immediately rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

RAB officials also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight, Shafayat claimed. Later, RAB personnel found two critically injured ‘drug peddlers’ and rushed them to Feni General Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Ripon
data.description: Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid in the area on information that a group of criminals were preparing for robbery. Sensing the law enforcers’ presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding Ripon’s body was recovered after the skirmish.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Based on the information that a group of smugglers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar with a big consignment of yaba, a BGB team conducted a drive in Hnila area on the bank of Naf River, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the "drug traders" opened fire on the BGB team forcing them to retaliate, triggering a "gunfight", claimed the BGB official. Later, police recovered a bullet-hit body from the spot, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station.

data.name: Bappy Rajib
data.description: Police said a team of Sadar south model police station conducted a drive at Bijoypur around 2:30am to recover drugs. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Bappy and his associates opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate which triggered a gun battle, said inspector (Investigation) of the police station Kamal Krishna Dhar. Bullet-hit Bappy was found lying on the ground after the gunfight and he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Russel Mahmud
data.description: Russel Mahmud, of Narayanganj, was shot during a police raid in Hoaikong area around 1:30am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. He was on his way to buy a haul of yaba pills from suspected local drug dealer Amir Hamaja when police were conducting a drive in the area, the OC added. Sensing police presence, the drug peddlers opened fire and the officers retaliated, he said. At one point, the drug peddlers fled the scene and the bullet-riddled body of Russel was found, he added. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: Lt Mirza Shahed Mahtab, camp commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf, said a RAB team conducted an anti-drug drive in Paharidhala area around 3:00am, acting on a tip-off that some drug peddlers would smuggle yaba pills there. Sensing the RAB members’ presence, the drug peddlers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", the RAB official said. After the "gun battle", the RAB team found three drug peddlers bullet-hit. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the official added. However, family members of Shahidul said Shahidul was a trader. They alleged that around 11:00 am on15 June four plainclothes men in a microbus came to his shop on IBP road in Cox’s Bazar town and picked him up. Shahidul’s father Abul Kashem was present there at that time. He said the plainclothes men had firearms with them. "My son had been abroad for many years. He returned home six or seven months ago and started to run a grocery shop. He was not accused in any case, " he said. Kashem said the plainclothes men came to the shop again after two hours and gave them a mobile number for contact. But he could not communicate with anybody as no one received his calls. After Shahidul was picked up, traders of Cox’s Bazar town’s Boro Bazar gave a memorandum to Cox’s Bazar police superintendent, seeking trace of Shahidul. They also informed RAB of the matter. But all denied picking up Shahidul.

After the "gunfight", the BGB team found Hashem bullet-wounded and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Tanvir Ahmed Anik
data.description: Tanvir Ahmed Anik, so-called ringleader of criminal gang "Seven-Star Group", was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Tipped off that Tanvir and his associates would gather somewhere in Basila, a team of RAB conducted a drive to arrest them. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "shootout". Later, RAB members recovered Tanvir and rushed him to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Tofayel
data.description: Abdullah Al Mamun, officer-in-charge of Comilla Sadar South Model Police Station, said based on information, a team of police conducted an anti-drug drive in Rajapara Chowmohoni area around 2:15 am. Sensing police presence, the drug peddlers opened fired on them, the OC said, adding that the "gunfight" ensued when police fired back in retaliation. Later, police recovered Tofayel with bullet injuries and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Lipu
data.description: DB police arrested Lipu on 19 June evening and went on a drive to recover firearms in the city’s Dapa Balur Math area. When they reached the scene around 3:00am, Lipu’s associates opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate, said Kamrul Hasan, Sub-Inspector of DB police. Lipu came in line of the fire during the "gunfight" and was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Zafar Member
data.description: Zafar Member and his younger brother Khalil Ahmed- both alleged robbers- were killed in a gunfight with RAB. The gunfight took place around 12:30pm when a team from Rab-7 raided Banshkhali upazila’s Saral area in Chattogram. They went there to arrest the two robber brothers. Mashkur Rahman, assistant director of Rab-7 (media wing), said as Rab members reached there, the robbers and their cohorts sensed their presence and opened fire on them. The Rab members retaliated by firing back. After a brief "gun-battle", the law enforcers found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot.

data.name: Babul Mia
data.description: According to RAB's Assistant Police Superintendent Kamruzzaman, Babul Mia was killed in a "gunfight" when some RAB members were carrying out a raid in Dombari area of the upazila around 3:15am. After the "gunfight", RAB personnel found the body. However, Babul’s father Afaz Uddin said his son had been arrested by RAB from a hospital in the capital’s Khilkhet area on 20 June noon. Asked, Kamruzzaman rejected the allegation. "This is not true, " he said.

data.name: Abdullah Al Zunaid
data.description: Additional Superintendent of Police Sanatan Chakravarty said that two groups of criminals were getting ready for committing mugging, therefore a police team rushed to the spot . Sensing the presence of police the criminals opened fire forcing police to retaliate. After the gunfight police found bullet injured Abdullah Al Zunaid and sent him to Bogra Shaheed Zia Medical College Hospital. However his situation was deteriorated and sent to Dhaka's Orthaeopaedic Hospital where he died on 18. 6. 19

data.name: Omar Faruk

Sensing their presence, the criminals and their cohorts opened fire on policemen, forcing them to retaliate, the OC claimed. The duo was injured during the "gunfight". They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Proshanto Kumar Das
data.description: Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer (CO) of Rangpur BGB Battalion-10, said that Proshanto was detained from Mogoltuli area. Based on the information, during primary interrogation, a team of BGB men, along with Proshanto, conducted a raid in Bibirbazar area around 1:00am. Sensing their presence, criminals opened fire on the BGB team prompting a retaliation that triggered the "gunfight", the BGB CO claimed. Proshanto was sustained bullet wounds and rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain Rana
data.description: Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director (DD) of RAB-7, claimed that a patrol team of RAB-7 went to Amirabad area of Sitakunda on information that some criminals were gathering there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. After the "gunfight", RAB men found a bullet-riddled body of Iqbal Hossain Rana on the spot. They rushed him to Sitakunda Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Nur
data.description: Mohammad Nur, a suspected drug dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB.

data.name: Ramzan Mia
data.description: Ramzan Mia, suspected key planner of Badda Awami League leader Farhad Hossain murder, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Badda area. On information of Ramzan’s return to home, a team of Detective Branch of police conducted a drive in the capital’s Satarkul area to arrest him. Sensing their presence, Ramzan and his cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", Ramzan was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the Deputy Commissioner (DB North) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police Mashiur Rahman said.

data.name: Salim Ullah
data.description: Salim Ullah, suspected drug trader, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB members by the Cox’s Bazar-Teknaf marine drive at North Silkhali point in Cox’s Bazar. RAB-15 media wing officials said a team of RAB personnel, acting on a tip-off that a group of drug dealers were staying in the area, raided North Silkhali point at about 4:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB personnel, the suspected drug dealers opened fire, forcing the RAB members to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight ended, RAB members found Salim shot and killed on the spot and later handed it over to the Teknaf police

data.name: Leon Siddique
data.description: Leon, an accused in at least 17 cases including murder, narcotic and extortion, was arrested by police in Konabari upazila of Gazipur on 1 July night, said Alamgir Hossain Majumdar, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kailakair Police Station. The police official claimed that a team of policemen, along with Leon, conducted a raid in Shafipur area of Gazipur’s Kaliakair upazila around 1:00am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence, Leon’s cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Leon was caught on the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds, the OC added. Later, policemen rushed Leon to Kaliakair Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hamid Prakash
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station said police arrested "a top listed drug dealer" Hamid around 4:00pm on 1 July in Moheshkhalipara bazar area of Teknaf. Based on his information, a team of policemen, along with Hamid, went to Moheshkhalipara area around 2:00am to recover firearms, the OC claimed. Sensing police presence, Hamid’s cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Hamid was caught on the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries, he added. Police rushed Hamid to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the OC further said.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain Nayan
data.description: The prime accused in the Rifat murder case was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and police in Barguna. A team of Barguna police rushed towards Purbo Burirchar area around 4:15am on information that Sabbir Hossain Nayan alias Nayan Bond who, along with another, hacked Barguna youth Rifat Sharif to death in broad daylight on June 26, was staying there. As the team reached near Purkata ferry ghat, around 10 kilometres from the district town, it came under fire from Nayan’s cohorts. Police returned fire in self-defence, Maruf Hossain, superintendent of police in Barguna, said at a press conference at his office.

data.name: Mohammad Waliullah
data.description: Shahed Mahamud, Officer-in-Charge of Bera Police Station said that acting on a tip-off, police arrested Waliullah from Bera municipality area on 3 July night, the OC said. Later, they conducted a raid in Jorda area to recover a batch of hidden drugs and firearms taking the arrestee along with them, he added. When they reached the spot, Waliullah’s accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight". Waliullah was hit by a bullet during the incident and was taken to Bera Upazila Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries.

data.name: Anwar Hosen
data.description: Anwar was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Dhaka’s Uttarkhan area around 2:00am. Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said that a team of RAB-1 raided Uttarkhan area on information that a group of drug peddlers gathered there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Anwar sustained bullet injuries. RAB rushed Anwar to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Saiful Islam, was killed in a gunfight with law enforcers in Mymensingh’s Bhaluka upazila around 1:15am. The police official claimed that they raided Hatiber area of Bhaluka on information that Saiful and his cohorts gathered there. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point, as the "gunfight" ended, police found bullet-hit body of Saiful. They rushed Saiful to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Saiful Islam Geda
data.description: Saiful Islam Geda was killed in a "gunfight" with police. He was arrested a day before he was killed. Arbinda Sarkar, Officer-in-Charge of Sujanagar Police Station, claimed a police team, along with Saiful Islam Geda, conducted a raid in Hasampur field area around 2:30am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence Saiful's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Saiful sustained bullet injuries. Police rushed him to Sujanagar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Malek
data.description: Abdul Malek, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Abdul Malek, was the son of Mokbul Hossain from the district’s Natun Pallanpara area, said Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Police arrested him. A team of police conducted a raid in Lengurbeel Mathchara area around 12:15am. Sensing their presence, a group of yaba traders opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight", the OC added. Later, police recovered bullet-injured Malek from the spot and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Sumon
data.description: Manik, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Additional Superintendent of Police (Addl SP) in Natore Harun-or-Rashid told press that police had arrested Manik from Ishwardi on 12 July. He was held in another case filed on charge of shooting a college student before snatching his motorcycle on July 5 in Natore’s Baraigram upazila. Addl SP in Natore Akramul Islam said that a team of police was conducting drives to arrest Manik’s accomplices taking him along with them. When they were crossing Gopalpur area around 2:00am, Manik’s cohorts opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back. . Manik was caught in the line of fire when he tried to escape the prison van, he added. Later, police took him to Lalpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Gleaning information from him, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30am in Nayapara area along with Mufid. Sensing their presence, Mufid’s cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Mufid sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Biplob
data.description: Biplob was killed during a raid led by the Detective Branch (DB) of police in Chandmari of Narayanganj around 3:00am, said Kamrul Hassan, a sub-inspector of Narayanganj DB. "DB personnel led the anti-drug raid on a tip-off. Sensing their presence, the miscreants opened fire. The gunfight ensued as police retaliated". . "Biplob was found lying on the ground with gunshot wounds after his accomplices managed to flee. He was taken to the Naryanganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead

data.name: Amin
data.description: Amin, drowned in the Padma River during a gunfight between police and his cohorts at Kashiadanga, told local police. "On a tip-off that a drug consignment was being carried, a police team raided Kashiadanga around 3:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire triggering a gunfight, " said Monsur Ali Arif, Officer-in-Charge of Kashiadanga Police Station. Amin’s body was found floating in the river after other peddlers fled the scene, said the official, adding, police took Amin to the Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Asmaul Saudagar
data.description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in an alleged gunfight with Border Guard Bangladesh officials. Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion, said one of their teams conducted a drive in Jajimura Shikolpara area around 12:30am on information of drugs being smuggled through the Naf river. The criminals opened fire just as the border guards reached the spot. The BGB men retaliated for self-defence, leaving two with bullet wounds. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they were both declared dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam

As soon as the police team reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage of the "gunfight", police found the body of Rafiqul lying on the spot. data.name: Mohammad Hossain
data.description: Mohammad Hossain, was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Teknaf. He was arrested two hours before the "gunfight", said police. Prodip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that on information that a large consignment of yaba was stored in Whaikhyang, a police team, along with Mohammad, raided the area. As soon as they reached there, a group of drug peddlers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, the OC claimed. During the "gunfight", Mohammad sustained bullet injuries. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, on duty doctors referred him to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital where he died around 3:00am.

data.name: Khalek

Major Shajibul Islam, deputy commander of RAB-8, claimed a team was patrolling the area when Khalek Bahini opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", the duo sustained bullet injuries. Around 7:00am, RAB members rushed the two to Khulna’s Dacope Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead. .

data.name: Maharaj Khalifa
data.description: Maharaj Khalifa, accused in at least 29 drug related cases, died while under treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital after sustaining a bullet injury in Satarkul area of Dhaka’s Badda, claimed Senior ASP Kamruzzaman of Rab-1. A RAB team conducted a raid in the area on information that Khalifa and his cohorts gathered there for drug dealing. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing Rab members to retaliate, claimed RAB. Khalifa was caught in the line of fire during the "gunfight", he claimed, adding Rab members then rushed him to DMCH where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Najmul Hasan
data.description: Najmul Hasan alias Byanga Babu was killed in Mirpur’s Beribadh area around 3:15am, said Senior ASP Sajedul Islam of Rab-4. He was accused in at least 20 cases, including eight over murders, said Rab.He had fled to India a few years ago and returned to Dhaka to take part in a killing mission, reported UNB quoting Major Kazi Saifuddin Ahmed, second-in-command of Rab-4.

data.name: Jaker
data.description: Jaker, a suspected robber, was killed in a "gunfight" with Rab in Chattogram’s Banshkhali. According to Major Mahedi Hasan, deputy director of RAB-7 (Chandgaon camp), a team of the elite force conducted a raid in Purba Chambal’s hilly areas on information that a robber gang was positioned there. As soon as they located the criminals and approached them, Jaker and his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he claimed. RAB later found Jaker’s bullet-hit body on the spot, adding Jaker’s cohorts managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Mohammad Suman

He said when the team reached near Shikder Medical College around 4:30am, Sumon opened fired. The RAB members retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Sumon was hit and died on the spot.

data.name: Omar Faruk
data.description: Omar Faruk, a suspected drug peddler, were killed in "shootout" with members of RAB 2 in Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of drug will be smuggled into the country through Marine Drive road, a RAB team took position at Baharchhara Uttar Shilkhani around 3:00am, said Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2. The team signalled a car to stop, but the drug peddlers in the vehicle opened fire, forcing the RAB members to return fire. After the "gun battle", the team found Abdur Rahman and Omar Faruk injured with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Arman

He was accused in a case filed over the rape of a grade-VIII student in the area earlier this month, said Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director (AD) of RAB-7 (media wing). According to the RAB official, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the upazila’s Kusumpur union around 4:00am on information that the suspected criminal was hiding there. As soon as the RAB team reached the area, Arman and his cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.description: Ibrahim, was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB members in Teknaf. Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf, said a BGB team signalled a Cox’s Bazar-bound auto-rickshaw to stop around 4:00am in Kurearmukh area near Marine Drive road. "But the criminals ignored the signal and opened fire on the BGB team, triggering the gunfight, " he said. The "criminals" then got down from the vehicle and continued firing. After the "gun battle", the BGB members found the body of Ibrahim lying on the spot.
