data.name: Nurul Islam
data.description: Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, captain of Teknaf BGB, said they launched a drive at Kharangkhali of Hoikang area near the Naf river around 3:30am. "Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire at BGB, triggering a gunfight, " the BGB official said. Injured Nurul and Delwar were admitted to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, they were shifted to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official added. The BGB said they seized 20, 000 yaba pills, two arms, two sharp weapons and four bullets from the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Aiyub
data.description: Aiyub was killed in a "gunfight" with the BGB in Ruppati area. Anwar Hossain, Additional Director of 34 BGB Battalion in Cox’s Bazar, said a BGB team was conducting a drive in the area around 4:00am. The team signaled a motorbike to pull over, but the bikers didn’t comply and opened fire at the BGB men. The BGB personnel fired retaliatory shots. The "gunfight" lasted for about 10 minutes. Later, the BGB men informed the Inani Police Outpost about the incident. Police rushed to the spot and found Aiyub lying there with bullet wounds. Aiyub was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead, said the BGB official.

data.name: Soleman
data.description: Soleman was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Chunarughat upazila’s Dewatali Kalinagar area. Nazmul Haque, OC of Chunarughat Police Station, said a team of police conducted a drive in Dewatali Kalinagar area around 3:00am on information that a gang of robbers was taking preparations to commit a robbery. Sensing police action, the robbers opened fired at the law enforcers, sparking the "gun battle", the OC said. The incident left Soleman injured. He died on way to a hospital.

data.name: Ashraful Islam
data.description: Muhammed Mohiuddin Faruqe, superintendent of RAB-2, said they set up a check-post on Dhaka-Tangail highway in Kaliakoir upazila on information that a consignment of drugs was scheduled to pass by from Dhaka to Chuadanga. In the noon, a car tried to escape the check-post. Following the car, RAB officials reached an isolated area. At one point, the car got into a roadside Tamarisk bush. Finding no way out, Ashraful, who was driving the car, pointed a gun at the RAB officials, the superintendent claimed. In self defence, the RAB official shot a gunfire that injured Ashraful. In response, Ashraful fired back, forcing the RAB officials to retaliate with more gunshots. The man died on the spot, the RAB official claimed.

data.name: Shishir Ghosh
data.description: Shishir Ghosh, an accused in multiple cases was killed in a "shootout" with police. Shishir’s family, however, have alleged that police picked up Shishir from in front of his house and killed him just hours later. Sunil Ghosh, Shishir’s uncle and a local journalist, said a team of the Detective Branch (DB) of police picked Shishir up from on 6 August around 8:30pm. "In the name of recovering arms, they took him near a brick kiln in Mahidia area and shot him dead. They then left his body at the hospital, " Sunil said. "I had called the DB’s officer-in-charge [OC] over phone [after Shishir was taken] and he said nothing would happen to Shishir and that they just took him for questioning. But I later found his dead body at the hospital,

data.name: Malek Fakir
data.description: Malek Fakir, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rab. Raisuddin, Additional Superintendent of RAB-8, claimed a team of the elite force challenged a group of drug peddlers around 4:00am in Jagua-Choupashar Pole area of the city. At one point, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Fakir sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight". Later, RAB members rushed him to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Chinu Mia
data.description: Chinu Mia, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. AKM Mehdi Hasan, officer-in-charge of Gobindaganj Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid on the banks of the Karatoa on information of Chinu and his gang’s whereabouts. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the "gunfight", Chinu sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Chan Mia Hawlader
data.description: Chan Mia Hawlader, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Mostafizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station, said Chan was awarded with 10 years’ imprisonment in a robbery case but managed to stay in hiding. The OC claimed they conducted a raid in Karomjatala area of the upazila around 2:00am on information that a group of criminals gathered there for robbery. Sensing the police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he further claimed. At one point, Chan sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Kamal Hossain Prokash
data.description: Kamal Hossain Prokash, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB at Pekua. RAB conducted a drive in Mognama Ghat area of Pekua on information that a group of robbers, led by Badsha, was preparing for robbery there, claimed Major Mehedi Hasan, Cox’s Bazar Company Commander of RAB-7. Sensing RAB’s presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage of the "gunfight", the criminals fled the scene leaving bullet-hit Prokash behind. RAB rescued Prokash and rushed to Pekua Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: Nur Alam and another alleged Rohingya drug peddler Sarker were killed in gunfights with members of Border Guard Bangladesh. A BGB-2 team conducted a raid at the Hoaikong Urubunia Katakhal area after a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled from there, said BGB-2 Deputy Commander Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar. The BGB members signalled a boat to stop on the Naf River. But the smugglers ignored the signal and opened fire, triggering a gunfight. "Alam and Sarker were killed during the shootout, " Maj Shariful said, adding that BGB members recovered the bodies and sent them to a local hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Sarker
data.description: Nur Alam and another alleged Rohingya drug peddler Sarker were killed in gunfights with members of Border Guard Bangladesh. A BGB-2 team conducted a raid at the Hoaikong Urubunia Katakhal area after a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled from there, said BGB-2 Deputy Commander Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar. The BGB members signalled a boat to stop on the Naf River. But the smugglers ignored the signal and opened fire, triggering a gunfight. "Alam and Sarker were killed during the shootout, " Maj Shariful said, adding that BGB members recovered the bodies and sent them to a local hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Ekhlas Uddin
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Ekhlas Uddin, was killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB) of police at the Chakua Daria intersection in Mymensingh. The incident took place nearly two days after he was allegedly picked up by plainclothes men. Ekhlas’s father Nurul Islam, said Ekhlas was a ruling party activist and three young men, who he was familiar with, came to their house and asked him to go out with them. Ekhlas then went to Sadua Marker Bazar on his motorbike around 3:00pm on 20 August. "Around 4:00pm, we were informed that plainclothes men picked him up. His mobile phone was switched off since then, " said Nurul. "I also asked the young men who took Ekhlas out about where he is but they could not say. Even the motorbike is yet to be recovered, " he added. Police also denied picking him up. The family then decided to lodge a general diary with local police station yesterday but around 4:00am, they heard the news of Ekhlas’s death on television.

data.name: Abdus Shukkur
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf police station, said a "gunfight" took place around 1:30am as one of their teams carried out a raid in Jadimura hill area, on information that some accused in the murder case had gathered there. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in the "gunfight". After the criminals fled away, police found bulet-hit Abdus Shukkur, along with Muhammad Shah, lying there. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Muhammad Shah
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf police station, said a "gunfight" took place around 1:30am as one of their teams carried out a raid in Jadimura hill area, on information that some accused in the murder case had gathered there. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in the "gunfight". After the criminals fled away, police found bulet-hit Muhammad Shah, along with Abdus Shukkur, lying there. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Abdus Sahid
data.description: On information that a group of robbers would rob a house of a Bangladeshi expatriate, police raided Maricha area around 1. 15am, said Meer Md Abdul Naser, Officer-in-Charge of Zakiganj Police Station. Sensing police presence, the criminals at first hurled bricks and then opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he claimed. "As we chased them, they fled. While searching the area after the gunfight, we found Shahid on the ground shot and injured. We rushed him to the upazila health complex where duty doctors declared him dead, " the OC said. Police also claimed to have recovered one locally made firearm, five empty bullet shells and some sharp local weapons from the spot.

data.name: Hasan
data.description: Acting on information that Rohingya criminals were gathering beside Jadimura Hill, police led a drive around 1:30am, said Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station Pradip Kumar Das. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the policemen to respond, he said, adding that police fired 10 bullets in self-defence. After the end of the gunfight, police rescued the injured Rohingya youth from the spot and admitted him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. He was later shifted to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

data.name: Al-Amin
data.description: Bhola sadar police station Officer-in-Charge Md Sagir Mia said that a team of police was on raids in Rajapur area to arrest robbers. Hearing gunshots nearby, they advanced towards place of occurrence at Rajapur flood protection embankment at about 2:30am. He said that two groups of pirates were trading gunshots over sharing their booty. The OC said that when police reached near the place, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing the police personnel to retaliate with firing that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers fled away by trawlers and police searched the area and found two bullet-hit ‘unidentified’ suspected robbers and rushed them to Bhola General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

data.description: Bhola sadar police station Officer-in-Charge Md Sagir Mia said that a team of police was on raids in Rajapur area to arrest robbers. data.name: Mohammad Babul
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said that a police team raided West Sikderpara village on 16 August to seize yaba tablets and arrest suspected drug peddlers. At that time, members of drug peddlers’ gang opened fire at the police who also retaliated with gunshots that triggered a ‘gunfight’. He said that police rescued a bullet-hit injured person and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex from where doctors sent him to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital where he died.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Chattogram, a patrol team of RAB encountered with a group of armed criminals around 3:00am, said Mashukur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7 (media wing). Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on RAB members, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", the criminals fled the scene. Later, RAB members recovered the body.

data.name: Rasel Mia
data.description: Rasel was killed in a "gunfight" with Detective Branch of police in Comilla Sadar upazila. Mainuddin Khan, Officer-in-Charge of DB police in Comilla said that a team of DB police conducted a raid in Sreepur area on information that a group of drug peddlers gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, OC Mainuddin added. During the "gunfight", Rasel sustained bullets injuries. Later, policemen rushed him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sujon Mia
data.description: Sujon Mia, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB-1. A RAB team conducted a raid in Salna area on information that some youths were selling firearms and illegal drugs there, said Quamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Sujon sustained bullet injuries. RAB members then rushed him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Iran
data.description: Iran, accused in at least 10 cases filed with Banshkhali Police Station, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of RAB around 8:00am. Major Mehedi Hasan, deputy director of RAB-7 said a patrol team of RABraided East Chambal area of the district on information that a group of robbers gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. Iran sustained bullet injuries during the "gunfight" and died on the spot.

data.name: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq
data.description: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Police Station, said a police team raided Joyrampur village of the upazila around 2:30am on information that two groups of drug peddlers were distributing narcotics. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfight", Rokonuzzaman sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Awlad Hossain Mithun
data.description: Mithun, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Narsingdi’s Madhabdi area few hours after he was arrested. . Abdul Gaffar, Sub-Inspector of Narsingdi DB police, said that Mithun and his accomplice Sohel, 25, were held on 30 August afternoon. Based on their information, a police team, along with Mithun, conducted a raid in the area to recover firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. . At one point of the "gunfight", Mithun was caught in the line of fire. He was then rushed to Narsingdi Genral Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ruhul Amin Ripon
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Ripon was killed in a gunfight with DB Police.

data.name: Sumon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Sumon Chakma was killed during a gunfight with army at Baghaihat under Baghaichari upazila in Rangamati. Sumon was an activist of Prachit Jyoti Khisha-led faction of UPDF and also a suspect in the murder of Nannerchar upazila chairman Shaktiman Chakma, police said. An army team conducted a drive at Dopata to arrest some hooligans. As they turned up at the spot a group of miscreants opened fire on them at about 10:30am and the soldiers retaliated by firing. The gunfight lasted for about five minutes until the attackers retreated. Sumon Chakma, however, was shot and killed during the gunfight.

data.name: Abdullah Al Mamun
data.description: A young man died under custody at Kishoreganj police station at Nilphamari on 10 August 2019. Law enforcers arrested Abdullah from his residence early 10 August on charge of stealing cattle and kept him in custody at the police station. Victim’s cousin Mohammad Rashid alleged that Abdullah was tortured to death in the custody.

data.name: Nabin Jyoti Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: In a press release, Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) said the gunfight broke out after the team reached Boradam on information that seven to eight armed criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the army personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the patrol team to fire back. The gunfight continued for 10 to 15 minutes. At one point, the criminals were forced to step back, it said, adding that the gunfight left three criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) dead.

data.name: Misbah Uddin
data.description: Bianibazar police Sub-Inspector Mizanur Rahman said that they arrested Misbah from Jaflong at Goainghat on 31 August night as he was wanted in a robbery case filed with the police station. As per information extracted from Misbah during interrogation, a team of police along with Misbah went to Shewla Bridge area of Bianibazar at around 3:15am to arrest his accomplices and seize arms from them. The police said that sensing their presence in the area, the associates of Misbah started to open fire on them and that forced them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a gunfight. Misbah sustained of bullet injuries as he tried to fled the scene during the gunfight

data.name: Noor Mohammad
data.description: Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Pradeep Kumar Das said that they arrested Noor Mohammad at Ulochamari hill of Hnila in Teknaf on 31 August afternoon. Later, on early in the incident day, a police team, along with Noor, went to Jadimura hilly area in search of his accomplices. When the police reached the area, Noor’s accomplices opened fire on them to snatch their leader, prompting police to retaliate with gunshots that triggered the gunfight, the OC said. After the hour-long gunfight was over, the police rescued Noor Mohammad with bullet injures and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurul Kader Rana
data.description: Nurul Kader Rana, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. RAB 7 media officer Masokur Rahman said Rana was a member of Bay of Bengal based robber gang and was prime accused of MV Ma-Babar Dowa and MV Mahin robbery case on Bay of Bengal near Hatiya of Noakhali on August 26.

data.name: Fazar Ali
data.description: Fazar Ali, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between RAB and a group of suspected drugs smugglers. RAB-9 media officer Md Moniruzzaman said that acting on a tip-off, they conducted a raid at Mitrimahal area at Goainghat upazila in the district at around 3:00am to arrest some drugs smugglers. He said that sensing presence of the battalion members in the area, the suspected smugglers opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. At one stage of shootout, the attackers retreated and then Fazar Ali was found dead on the spot.

data.name: Kahlilur Rahman
data.description: Kahlilur Rahman was killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police. DB officer-in-charge Shah Kamal Hossain said that a police team raided Kalpa area on information that a group of auto-rickshaw lifter were gathered in the area. As the cops turned up in the area, the suspects opened fire on them who retaliated by firing. Cops caught injured Khalil when the attackers were retreating from the spot. He died on his way to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Joynal Abedin
data.description: Joynal Abedin was killed in a gunfight with police at Amin Colony area. Police arrested him on 1 September at 8:00pm from his house. A team of police along with Joynal went to raid that sensing their presence in the area, the associates of Joynal started to open fire on them and that forced them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a gunfight. Joynal sustained of bullet injuries during the gunfight and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Belal
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Belal, was killed in a reported gunfight with police. Khulshi police station Officer-in-Charge Pranab Chowdhury said that during his surrender, Belal promised to give up criminal activities and informed that he had illegal firearms. According to his information, a police team went to Jalalbad Hill of Khulshi with Belal to retrieve the arms at about 1:00am on next day. As they turned up at the spot, a group of unidentified gunman attacked them to snatch Belal away, the OC said. Cops retaliated by firing which prompted a gunfight, . The police officer said that they, after the shootout, found Belal injured and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sajal Mia
data.description: Sajal Mia, killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of Detective Branch of police at Nizam Nagar. Shah Kamal Akand, Officer-in-Charge of DB, said one of their teams raided the area around 1:30am after being tipped off that drug peddlers were selling drugs in the area. The drug peddlers opened fire as soon as the DB team reached the area, triggering a gunfight, the OC said. Sajal, who was shot during the gunfight, was arrested and taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Later, police searched the area, found three critically injured people, took them to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Hridoy
data.description: Hridoy, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of RAB. Additional Superintendent Jasim Uddin of RAB 11, said that a team of RAB, while routine patrol setting up a check post on Dhaka-Chittagong highway at Mridhakandi challenged a car for its suspicious movement. But, the driver of the car, without stopping tried to flee by opening fire targeting the RAB personnel. He said that the RAB personnel retaliated with gunshots that ensued a gunfight at about 4:00am while Hridoy left bullet injured. Later, he was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Abdul Karim
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge, Teknaf police station said police raided Jadimura area on information that some killers of Omar Farook had gathered there at midnight, said the Rohingyas opened fire on police when they reached the spot, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that triggered a ‘gunfight’ minutes after midnight. After the ‘gunfight’, police searched the area and found two critically injured people on the spot. Pradip said they rescued the duo with the help of locals, rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex but physicians there referred them to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital and they died on the way.

data.name: Sujon Malitha
data.description: Sujon Malitha, was killed in a gunfight with police. Kushtia Model Police Station's Officer-in-Charge Nasir Uddin said that on information that a "gunfight" between two groups of drug peddlers was going on, a team, led by Sub-inspector Mustafizur Rahman, went to the banks of GK (Ganges-Kabodak) canal in Mollateghoria village around 2:30am. Sensing the police presence, the criminals started firing at the law enforcers, compelling them to return fire. Then a tripartite "gunfight" took place, the OC claimed. During the "gun battle", Sujon was hit and he died on the spot.

data.name: Rubel Mia
data.description: Rubel was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with Detective Branch of police at Habirbari in Bhaluka of Mymensingh. Mymensingh DB officer-in-charge Shah Kamal Akand said during an anti-drug drive by two teams of DB police, they came to know that a group was peddling drugs in Habirbari area. DB police then rushed to the spot at 2:30am when the suspected peddlers opened fire on them while fleeing the spot. Police also retaliated with gunshots that led to Rubel’s death. .

data.name: Tutul
data.description: Tutul was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Moharajpur under the upazila, said Inspector (operations) of sadar police station Md Idris Ali.

data.name: Habib Ullah
data.description: Habib Ullah, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Muchani in Teknaf. Teknaf police station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that they arrested Habib at hilly area of Jadimura Salbagan Rohingya camp when a gang of Rohingya robbers were preparing for committing robbery on 14 September afternoon. Later, as per information extracted from him, Pradip said, a team of police raided hilly area of Nayapara Muchani Rohingya Camp for seizing illegal firearms at about 12:30am.

data.name: Abdur Rahim
data.description: Abdur Rahim, was killed in what police claimed was a gunfight between police and armed cohorts of suspected robber. said Swapan Kumar, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station. "A team of police arrested Rahim from Indronarayanpur village in the upazila on 15 September, the OC said. During primary interrogation, Rahim told them the location of some hidden firearms. According to his information, a team of police raided Kalibari area around 2:00am, taking Rahim with them. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, cohorts of Rahim, who had taken position near the spot, opened fire on police. Polive in retaliation fired back, triggering a gunfight which resulted Abdur rahim dead on the spot.

data.name: Masud Parvez
data.description: Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1 in Gazipur, said a team of Rapid Action Battalion raided Saatkhamair Bazar area in Gazipur’s Sreepur upazila around 2:30 am on information that a group of robbers was taking preparations for a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, they fired shots at the RAB men. The RAB returned shots. The criminals escaped after sometime. The Rab found Masud lying on the ground injured. He was sent to Sreepur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. Masud’s mother Rani Begum said "Around 4:00pm on Monday, one of Masud’s friends went to his in-law’s house and got him into a microbus saying that they would go to Gopalganj. But at night, Masud called me and said his friend handed him over to some unidentified people who blindfolded him. " "I may not return home. Please look after my daughter, " Rani said, quoting her son.

data.name: Tuhin Hossain
data.description: Maj Talukdar Nazmus Sakib, Deputy Commander of RAB-11 in Narayanganj, said a RAB team picked up Tuhin Hossain from Comilla’s Rasulpur area around 1:00am on 18 September. Gleaning information from him, the RAB team raided Syedpur area of Naryanganj around 4:00am to recover arms and arrest Tuhin’s associates. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire at the RAB men, forcing them to return shots, said Talukdar. At one stage, Tuhin along with his associates tried to flee. He was hit by bullets, but his cohorts managed to escape, said the RAB official. Tuhin was declared dead by doctors after being taken to Narayanganj General Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Russell
data.description: Abdur Rahim, Inspector (investigation) of Chandgaon Police Station, said, "Russell was the prime accused of a murder case filed with the station over stabbing and killing 22-year-old Jiad Hossain. " On information, a police team conducted a drive at Jele Para field in Chandgaon around 1:45am to arrest the criminals. "Sensing our presence, the miscreants attacked police with firearms and locally made weapons. Police also opened fire in retaliation. At one point, the criminals fled the scene leaving Russell dead on the spot, " Inspector Rahim claimed.

data.name: Arif Hossain
data.description: Arif Hossain, was killed in a "shootout" with police for his alleged involvement with a robbery gang. However, Arif’s relatives said he was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been "missing" for the last four to five days. AKM Azizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Laxmipur Sadar Police Station, said they had information that an armed gang was preparing for a robbery. "When a team of patrol police went to the spot, the robbers opened fire. Police retaliated, which forced the robbers to flee, " the OC said. Police recovered Arif’s bullet-hit body from the spot and took him to Laxmipur Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: A Rohingya couple was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Cox’s Bazar, hours after they were detained by the law enforcers. The incident that claimed the duo happened at a refugee camp in Hnila union. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained the duo with a gun. On their information, a police team, along with the duo, conducted a raid in the camp to recover firearms, the OC claimed. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight" the duo caught in the line of fire, he added. Police rushed them to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shoshan Mitra
data.description: Superintendent Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2, said three muggers coming in a motorbike snatched a bag from a man in front of Lab Aid Hospital around 12:45am. On information, a patrol team of RAB chased the motorbike. When the motorbike reached Hatirpool area, the elite force members asked them to surrender but the muggers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back. Two muggers- Hasan and Shoshan- sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight while another managed to flee the scene. Later, they were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Shoshan dead.

data.name: Bikash Kumar Dey
data.description: Samir Sarkar, superintendent of Police and Assistant Director of Rab-6, said after a tip-off about drug peddlers gathered at Dhanibunia village, a team of RAB conducted a drive there around 12:30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing RAB officials to retaliate, he said, adding that at one stage, the criminals managed to flee the scene, leaving behind Bikash with bullet wounds. He was taken to Dumuria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Touhid
data.description: Touhid, 35, hailed from Chittagong, was hit by a bullet during a "gunfight" with Detective Branch (DB) of police in Nagdarpara area of Khilgaon, said Mashiur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Khilgaon Police Station. Touhid was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Dosto Mohammad
data.description: Two Rohingya yaba smugglers were killed in a "shootout" with BGB members in Hnila union of Teknaf upazila around 4:00am, said Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf. They were from Maungdaw in Myanmar, said BGB. A BGB team on patrol in Jaliapara village found that some four to five drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh territory after crossing the Naf river by a boat, the BGB official said. When the criminals were asked to stop, they started firing, prompting them to retaliate. During the "gun battle", two yaba peddlers were hurt, while others fled. . The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official said.

data.name: Mohammad Yunus
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug traders were killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB in Jaliapara area. BGB Battalion commanding officer Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan in Teknaf said that on information that a group of drug pedlars was trespassing on Bangladesh with a big consignment of yaba tablets, a BGB team cordoned off Hinllha Union’s Jaliapara area of Teknaf and asked the drug traders to surrender. After the gunfight, the BGB soldiers recovered two bullet-hit people from the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital in critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ayub
data.description: Ayub, was killed in a shootout with police. Abul Kalam Azad, OC of Chandgaon Police Station. said that tipped off Ayub and his associates had gathered in Annanya Residential area of Quiash Road, a police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:30am, the OC said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the muggers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that eventually triggered a gunfight. Police rescued bullet-injured Ayub from the spot and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Sher Khan Mia
data.description: Family members of an arrested suspect in Palash upazila of Narsingdi claimed that their relative was beaten in police custody and died in hospital undergoing treatment. The deceased was Sher Khan Mia (23). According to Palash police station OC Sheikh Md Nasir Uddin on 22 September 2019 evening, police arrested Sher Khan from Borab market in the upazila. On the way to the police station, Sher Khan tried to jump off the police motorbike he was riding and injured himself. Following the accident, he was given first aid at the Upazila Health Complex and was brought to the police station. Soon after his condition deteriorated, he was taken to Narsingdi Sadar Hospital and later was transferred to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH). On 25 September morning, the duty-doctor of DMCH declared Sher Khan dead. However, Faruk Miya, older brother of Sher Khan, alleged that a six member police team, including Sub-Inspector Iftekhar, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Monjur, ASI Rubel, Constable Delwar, and Constable Manik, arrested his brother. Police beat him mercilessly when he tried to escape from the motorbike. When the familymembers visited the police station 22 September night, they found Sher Khan lying on the floor in lock up. The on-duty constable said a sedative injection was given to him as he was feeling unwell. When Sher Khan did not regain consciousness next morning, his family members started crying at the police station and only then did he receive medical attention, added Faruk Mia. Faruk Mia further said that Sher Khan was a fish trader and there is no case against him. Faruk Miya claimed that his brother died because he was beaten by the police.

data.name: Faruk Mia
data.description: An accused, Faruk Mia, was allegedly tortured to death while in police custody in Habiganj Sadar. Mashuk Ali, the Officer-in-Charge at the Habiganj police station, denied the allegation, saying, "No one tortured Faruk Mia at the station. He had a heart attack shortly after he was brought to the station. "We, immediately, took him to the hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. " Dr Mithun Roy, a doctor of the emergency unit at the Habiganj Sadar Hospital said that Faruk Mia had been unwell when he was brought here. He died early in the morning on 30 September 2019. The deceased's son, Masuk Mia, claimed that police tortured his father at the police station. They did not even let him to see his father. His father was tortured to death by the police. Masuk further said that his father borrowed Tk15 thousand a few months ago from Hannan Mia of their area. His father was returning the money in instalments through checks; recently Hannan filed a check dishonour case of Tk45 thousand with the court. The court, subsequently, issued an arrest warrant against Faruk Mia. Faruk paid Tk5000 each to Hannan and the police to avoid the arrest. Nevertheless, the police came and arrested him later that night. Faruk's brother, Matin Mia, said that a while after Faruk was taken to the station, police called and informed us that he was sick and taken to hospital.

Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they conducted a drive along with the duo at Baharchora Shilkhali Hill area to recover yaba pills and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", Amin and Helaluddin sustained bullet injuries, the OC claimed. Police then rushed the duo to a hospital in Cox’s Bazar where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Saddam Hossain

Sensing police presence, the criminals began firing at the law enforcers, who retaliated, triggering a "gunfight" around 1:15am. data.name: Zaynul Islam
data.description: Zaynul Islam, a suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB personnel at Srimangal. RAB Srimangal camp commander AK Kamruzaman said they detained some people in Sylhet on suspicion of their involvement in robbery two days ago. On information from the arrested, a drive was conducted at Cha-Kanya area at Satgaon under the Shrimangal at about 4:00am to catch some other suspects. As the RAB members showed up, robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated with firing back. Zaynul died on the spot after being shot during the gunfight while his associates fled the scene.

RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of police Kazi Md Tarek Aziz said that they conducted the raid on information that a group of hooligans and extortionists gathered near World Trade Centre of Agrabad.

data.name: Kudrat Ali
data.description: Kudrat Ali, an alleged robber was killed during a "gunfight" with DB police in Shayestaganj upazila around 3:00am. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Shayestaganj Police Station Mozammel Haque said that after receiving information that some 10 to 12 criminals were preparing for committing a robbery in Purashudha area on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway, a team of DB police raided the area. At one stage, the "robbers" opened fire on law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a "gunfight". Kudrat Ali was caught in the gunfight while his associates managed to flee.

data.name: Aung Chaimung Tongchoyonga
data.description: Followers of two member candidates Ajmot Ali and Babul Kanti Chakma locked a clash over fake vote casting at Fatrajhiri Polling Centre of 8 no. Ward of Ghumdhum union. During the time, BGB personnel fired bullets to bring the situation under control. Aung Chaimung died on the spot and Shwechcha Aung died later at Cox's Bazar Hospital.

data.name: Aminur Rahman
data.description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in the Sunderbans. Tipped-off that some forest robbers took position in the Sunderbans, a team of RAB raided the deep forest in between 3:00am and 5:00am, said Lieutenant Colonel Syed Mohammad Nurus Salehin Yusuf, Commander of RAB 6. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, Salehin said. Later, the RAB members recovered three bullet-hit bodies and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he added.

data.name: Iqbal Hossain
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police. Moin Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Sonagazi police station, said that Iqbal was a leader of an inter-district robber gang . Acting on a tip-off, a team of Feni DB police and Sonagazi police jointly raided the area around 3:00am, said Ranjit Barua, Officer-in-Charge of DB police. Robbers opened fire on the law enforcers as soon as the team reached the spot, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight. Iqbal was injured during the skirmish. His accomplices fled the scene leaving him, the OC said. He was taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them while conducting a drive to recover firearms around 4:00am. As soon as police reached the spot, Babul’s associates opened fire and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers, the OC said. Babul and Azim sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish. They were taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Mymensingh Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal Akond said they raided the area to nab suspected robbers when they opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that triggered the ‘gunfight’, leaving Motaleb injured. Later, he was taken to local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Aminul Islam

Tipped off, a team of police raided the area where a kidnappers’ gang gathered and, sensing presence of police, they opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Aminul was caught in the line of fire. Later, he was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Abul Hashem
data.description: Hashem and Kamal, were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the BGBat Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf about 11:30pm. Commanding Officer of BGB 2 Battalion at Teknaf Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said acting on a tip off that a group of drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar crossing Naf river by a boat with a big consignment of Yaba tablets, a BGB team raided Lambabil area and asked the drug peddlers to surrender when their boat anchored on the river bank. `Ignoring BGB’s call, two peddlers began to run and managed to flee but other peddlers opened fire on BGB personnel who also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight’, he said. After the ‘gunfight’, the BGB personnel found two bullet-hit people on the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital as critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Aziz
data.description: Aziz, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Moheskhaliapara. Pradeep Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said police arrested Mohammad Aziz at Teknaf as he was absconding in many criminal cases. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them to conduct a drive to recover firearms and drugs around 4:00 am at Moheskhaliapara, the OC said. As soon as police reached the spot, Aziz’s associates opened fire on them and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers. Police also took bullet-hit Aziz to a Teknaf hospital but the duty doctor the sent him to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital as he was in critical condition. Doctor at Cox’s Bazar General Hospital declared that he died before reaching the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Rahim Uddin
data.description: Rafique, a drug trader, was killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB at Nayapara. Commanding Officer of BGB Battalion 2 at Teknaf Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, said on a tip off that a group of drug pedlars entered Bangladesh from Myanmar with a locally made wooden boat carrying a big consignment of Yaba pills, a BGB team cordoned off Madinar Jora on cyclone control embankment of Teknaf at about 1:30am and asked the suspects to surrender when they reached on bank of the river. Later they opened fire on the soldiers, who retaliated with firing back. After the gunfight, the BGB men found a man shot and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later he was shifted to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital as his condition was critical. Doctors in the hospital, however, declared him dead.

data.name: Mahfuzur Rahman
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as supporters of the Hefazat-e-Islami clashed with police in Bhola’s Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who since 18 October had been demanding punishment of a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account, said police.
