data.description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as supporters of the Hefazat-e-Islami clashed with police in Bhola’s Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who since 18 October had been demanding punishment of a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account, said police.

data.name: Najir Ahmed Sumon
data.description: Sumon, a the leader of a notorious robber gang and the prime suspect in Chittagong child specialist Dr Shah Alam murder case, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director, (media) of RAB 7, said they arrested human hauler driver Omar Faruk, 19, in connection with Shah Alam’s murder on 22 October. He confessed to his role in the killing before the court and revealed names of several men, including that of Kalu, involved in it. A RAB 7 team raided Bashbaria around 4:30am to arrest Kalu. But criminals opened fire as soon as they reached the area. Kalu was killed on the spot in the ensuing skirmish, RAB sources said.

data.name: Mehedi Hasan
data.description: Mehedi was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police at Lodipur Khari Bridge area. Naogon Superintendent of Police Abdul Mannan said a team of law enforcement agencies conducted a drive in the area after being tipped off. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug dealers opened fire on law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate by firing. After the gunfight, Mehedi was found shot and killed, but others managed to flee, he added.

data.name: Prakash Selim
data.description: Prakash Selim was killed in crossfire with police. The gunfight began when police detained and took him to recover drug and illegal arms after arresting him in the early hours of 22 October in Chamarkul area. Pradip Kumar Das, Office-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, claimed that they were acting on a tip-off when they arrested Prakash on 21 October. Later, he was taken to Keruntoli Primary School area to recover arms and drugs as per his confession. But his cohorts, who were waiting in the area, opened fire on the police and the law enforcers retaliated. Selim was hit and taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abu Sayed
data.description: Abu Sayed, was killed in a "gunfight" between law enforcers and his cohorts in Araihazar. Araihazar police arrested Abu Sayed on 26 October evening. Officer-in-Charge Nazrul Islam of Araihazar Police Station said that as per the information given by him, police took him on a drive in Ilumadi area around 3:00 am to arrest his accomplices. As soon as they reached the spot, cohorts of Sayed started firing on the team, forcing the police to retaliate. After the gunfight, Sayed was found shot and lying on the ground. He was taken to Araihazar Health Complex where doctors declared him dead on arrival.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Shahapur in Faridganj. Tipped-off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery, a team of police went to Cherag Alir Bagan area around 2:00am, said Abdur Rakib, Officer-in-Charge of Faridganj Police Station. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire towards police prompting them to fire back in self-defense, Rakib claimed. After the gunfight, police took a bullet-hit person and and took him to Faridganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Samsul Alam
data.description: Shamsul’s daughter Satana said her father was a cattle trader and never peddled liquor. She also said after detaining her father, the police personnel demanded Tk one lakh and he refused to pay it. ‘They tortured him whole the night to death at the investigation centre, ’ she alleged. Local people said police detained Samsul Alam, 55, of Shantipur in Mithapukur from Baradaroga Bazar in Pirganj. His body was found hanging from the grill of a window at Bhendamari police investigation centre. Pirganj police station Officer-in- Charge Saresh Chandra said police detained a drug peddler Samsul Alam with 25 litres of locally made liquor on 15 October night and he committed suicide on 16 October morning at the police investigation centre.

data.name: Lavlu
data.description: Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB (north), said that police arrested some people posing as RAB and DB members at different parts of the city. During interrogation, they told police that some robbers would gather in the area. Later, a team of DB raided the area around 1:00am and stopped a microbus. Four people on the vehicle opened fire while trying to escape. During the skirmish, three were injured but another managed to flee the scene. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where Lavlu, 50, died from injuries around 4:00am. Bullet wounded Kamal Hossain succumbed to his injuries at National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitaion (NITOR), Shyamoli, Dhaka on 12 November 2019.

data.name: Kamal Hossain
data.description: Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB (north), said that police arrested some people posing as RAB and DB members at different parts of the city. During interrogation, they told police that some robbers would gather in the area. Later, a team of DB raided the area around 1:00am and stopped a microbus. Four people on the vehicle opened fire while trying to escape. During the skirmish, three were injured but another managed to flee the scene. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where Lavlu, 50, died from injuries around 4:00am. Bullet wounded Kamal Hossain succumbed to his injuries at National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitaion (NITOR), Shyamoli, Dhaka on 12 November 2019.

data.name: Saddam Hossain
data.description: Jabed Mahmud, Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj police station, said that they raided the area around 1:15am acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was there. The miscreants opened fire on the police team as soon as they reached the spot, triggering a skirmish. At one stage, Saddam was caught in the line of fire while trying to flee the scene and died on the spot.

data.name: Mahmudul Hasan
data.description: A Rohingya man, accused in several criminal cases, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Mahmudul on 13 Novembernoon over possessing firearms. After interrogation, a team of police, led by Additional Superintendent Redwan Ahmed, conducted a drive near the Rohingya camp around 1:00am to recover firearms. As police reached the area, Mahmudul’s associates opened fire at them, triggering a "gunfight". At one stage, Mahmudul was shot while others managed to flee. He died of his injuries while being taken to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Noor Kabir
data.description: In Hnila union of Cox’s Bazar, Noor Kabir, of Leda Rohingya camp in Teknaf, was killed in a "gunfight" between "drug dealers" and a patrolling team of BGB. While patrolling in Chhurikhal area, a BGB team approached four people who were digging out a plastic bag from the ground, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, Commander of BGB Battalion-2. The men started shooting at the team, forcing the BGB personnel to retaliate, said Faisal, adding that the men fled the scene after about 10 minutes. Later, the team found bullet riddled body of Noor on the ground. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Razzaq Mia
data.description: In Narsingdi’s Shibpur upazila, Razzaq Mia, was killed during a "gunfight" with police. Police arrested Razzaq, an accused in 16 criminal cases, at his home on 14 November midnight and took him on a drive to Telia Shashan Ghat area, said Inspector (Investigation) Mominul Haque of Shibpur Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, the associates of Razzaq started shooting at them, said Mominul, adding that, the law enforcers were forced to fire back to defend themselves. After the "gunfight", police found that Razzaq was lying dead on the ground.

data.name: Yasin
data.description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1 were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, said BGB officials. Following information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of 34 Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that the bullet-hit body of Yasin and Hossain were found on the ground after the "gunfight". They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex where doctors declared them dead on arrival.

data.name: Hossain
data.description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1 were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, said BGB officials. Following information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of 34 Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that the bullet-hit body of Yasin and Hossain were found on the ground after the "gunfight". They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex where doctors declared them dead on arrival.

data.name: Badsha Sheikh
data.identity: Allegedly tied with one of the armed leftist extremist groups operating in the Southern region
data.description: In Jhenidah, the dead Badsha Sheikh, was an accused in seven murder and two arms cases, said police. On information that some activists of the faction gathered at a Mahogany orchard in Jorapukuria village, police raided the area around 2:00am, said Ashaduzzaman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Harinakunda Police Station. As soon as the law enforcers reached there, the PBCP men started firing. on them forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that they found Badsha dead on the ground after the "gunfight".

data.name: Abdul Aziz
data.description: In Chittagong city’s Khulshi area, Abdul Aziz, an alleged robber, was killed by police during a "gunfight". Police said Aziz came out of prison about three months ago after serving a 12-year sentence in a case filed under the Public Safety Act. OC Pranab Chowdhury of Khulshi Police Station said Aziz’s name came up in the primary investigation of a robbery incident at Garibullah Shah Housing Society in the city on November 15. A team of law enforcers conducted a drive at his home at Nasirabad area in the city to arrest him, said the OC, adding that sensing their presence, Aziz and his cohorts opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate. At one point, the criminals fled the scene and police spotted injured Aziz on the ground. . He was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival.

data.name: Nadim
data.description: Tipped-off, a team of RAB-2 conducted a drive in the area to find drugs around 4:00am, said Dhaka Medical College Hospital police outpost in-charge Bachchu Mia. A group of people opened fire as soon as the elite force reached the area, triggering a skirmish. Nadim was caught in the line of fire and suffered gunshot wounds. Later, he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman Mintu
data.description: Mizanur Rahman Mintu was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Md Kamruzzaman, an Assistant Director of RAB-1 said that on information that some drug dealers gathered in Swadesh Property area of the capital’s Khilkhet, a RAB patrol team rushed to the area around 1:15am. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then retaliated. After the "gun battle", RAB found Mintu bullet-hit. He was rushed to Kurmitola General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Laxmindar Ali
data.description: Laxmindar Ali, was killed in a "shootout" with police in Bokarbhanga area. Mostafa Kamal, Officer-in-Charge of Chhatak Police Station, said police arrested Laxmindar on 22 November. Police took him to Bokarbhanga area one next dayto recover firearms, but he tried to flee. A "gunfight" ensued when his associates opened fire, the OC said. Later, police found the body of Laxmindar.

data.name: Ibrahim Khalil Rubel
data.description: Rubel, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of Detective Branch of Police. He was named in at least 16 criminal cases. Noakhali Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Kamruzzaman Shikdar said that they arrested Ibrahim in a raid at Purba Mahduri on 27 November evening with 60 yaba tablets and later, as per information extracted from him, they took him with them during a raid at Paschim Mahduri for recovering firearms. He claimed that Ibrahim’s associates opened fire on the raiding police personnel as soon as they reached the spot at about 4:00am and police also retaliated by firing that triggered a ‘gunfight’. During the gunfight, the OC claimed, Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire but his associates fled the scene. He said they took Ibrahim to Noakhali General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mamunur Islam
data.description: Mohammad Mostafizur Rahman, Superintendent of Police, said they arrested Dwip and Saiful on 29 November over snatching of Tk 26 lakh from a Bkash company agent in Kaliganj upazila. Police took them to recover the money. When they reached Kamalnagar area around 3:00am, associates of the miscreants open fired on police to snatch them, leading to a gunfight, the SP added. They were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Mohammad Mostafizur Rahman, Superintendent of Police, said they arrested Dwip and Saiful on 29 November over snatching of Tk 26 lakh from a Bkash company agent in Kaliganj upazila. Police took them to recover the money. When they reached Kamalnagar area around 3:00am, associates of the miscreants open fired on police to snatch them, leading to a gunfight, the SP added. They were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Delu
data.description: Delwar Hossain Delu was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Acting on a secret information that a gang of robbers were meeting in Karaitola area in a bid to commit robbery, police raided Tulatoli village, said SI Gias. Sensing their presence, the robbers started firing at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a "gunfight", the police official added. At one stage, Delwar was shot while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. Delwar was rushed to Comilla Medial College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ali
data.description: Mohammad Ali was killed in a "gunfight" with police. Mohammad Basiruddin, Additional Superintendent of Jamalpur police, said one of their teams conducted raid in Prajapati Char and arrested Ali from a boat on 2 December. Police, along with Ali, conducted a raid at Kutilarchar to recover arms around 3:00am on 3 December. Sensing police presence, Ali’s cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Ali was caught in the line of fire and suffered bullet wounds while others managed to flee, he added. Later Ali was taken to Islampur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: Imam Hossain, a suspected yaba peddler was killed in a gunfight with BGB. The gunfight took place in Keora Bagan area near Zadimura border with Myanmar.

data.name: Abdur Rashid
data.description: Abdur Rashid, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between Detectives branch of police and suspected drug peddlers during an anti-drug drive, Mymensingh police’s Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal Hossain said.

data.name: Noor Alam
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered huge quantity of illegal fire arms and yaba raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion held four people, including the Nur and Sohel, on 13 December. Later, the RAB handed the arrested people over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team of the department went to Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police triggering the gunfight, adding that, when the gunfight was over, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

data.name: Mohammad Sohel
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered huge quantity of illegal fire arms and yaba raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion held four people, including the Nur and Sohel, on 13 December. Later, the RAB handed the arrested people over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team of the department went to Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police triggering the gunfight, adding that, when the gunfight was over, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

data.name: Shahrul Islam
data.description: Maheshpur police station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Rashedul Alam said the robbers, who were preparing for robbery on the Kaliganj-Jibannagar route, opened fire on a patrolling police team. The police fired several rounds in retaliation, triggering the gunfight. Police found the injured Khokon while other robbers managed to flee the scene at one point of the gunfight. Police took Khokon to Maheshpur Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Nurunnabi
data.description: Nurunnabi, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Catapahar area. . Mohammad Iqbal Hossen, one of the Additional Superintendents at the Cox’s Bazar police, said Sub-Inspector Mohammad Taimur Islam and Sub-Inspector Abul Kalam caught Nurunnabi with illegal fire arms at Kalordokan area of the Cox’s Bazar town. Later, they took him to Katapahar area, but the team came under the attack of an armed gang that opened fire on cops, who retaliated with firing back. The attackers managed to ran away, but Nurunnabi was shot. They took him to Cox’s Bazar general hospital but doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Yasin Mia
data.description: Yasin Mia, an accused of rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl, was killed in a "shootout" with police. Police arrested Yasin Mia, in Wireless-para area of the town on 15 December, on charges of raping and murdering Fatema Begum, mentally challenged daughter of Elahi Sharif of Rajendrapur College area, on December 12. Zamal Pasha, Additional Superintendent of police in Faridpur, said they recovered the girl’s body with stab wounds in several parts of her body, from the boundaries of BTCL office around 6:00pm on December 13, a day after she had gone missing. Following a case filed by the victim’s father with Kotwali Police Station, police identified Yasin upon analyzing the CCTV camera footage in the area. As soon as they had reached Double Bridge Rahakhola Launch Ghat area around 2:30am, Yasin snatched a gun from a policeman and tried to flee forcing the law enforcers to open fire, he claimed. Yasin suffered bullet injuries in the "shootout". He was taken to Faridpur Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival. Meanwhile, his sister Rahima Begum said that he came out of jail on December 4 on a bail and went to Dhaka the same day. Upon his return on 15 December, police arrested him.

data.name: Joynal
data.description: Joynal, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with members of RAB. Tipped off, a team of RAB 15 raided the area and challenged some robbers, said Deputy Commander of RAB 15 Major Rabiul Islam. At one stage, they opened fire on the RAB team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. After a brief gunfight, they recovered the bullet-hit body of Joynal. One gun and three bullets were recovered from the spot.

data.name: Abdul Karim
data.description: Abdul Karim, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB on the bank of the river Naff near Teknaf land port. RAB-15 crimes prevention Company-1 Commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab said that a team of RAB raided on hilly area near Teknaf land port after getting information that some robbers gathered there for committing robbery. Sensing presence of RAB personnel, he claimed, the robbers open fire on RAB members who retaliated by firing that triggered a gunfight at about 2:30am. Later, RAB members caught one wounded in gunshots from the spot and took him to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Siddiq
data.description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of BGB in Ukhia. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad, Commanding Officer of 34th BGB Battalion, said one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then sent to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official claimed.

data.name: Shahjahan
data.description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of BGB in Ukhia. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad, Commanding Officer of 34th BGB Battalion, said one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. At one point of the "gunfight", the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then sent to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official claimed.

data.name: Monir Hossain
data.description: Monir Hossain, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police in Goni Miar Doroja area. Anwarul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Chatkhil Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, they arrested Monir. A police team later raided the area along with Monir to recover firearms and Yaba. When the team reached the area, his cohorts opened fire and tried to snatch him. In the ensuing skirmish, Monir sustained gunshot injuries. He was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mokhlesur Rahman
data.description: Mokhlesur, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Nateswar of Sonaimuri. Sonaimuri Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abdus Samad said when a patrol team of police challenged a gang of robbers around 12:45am they opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered the gunfight. After the robbers fled the scene, the law enforcers took bullet-wounded Mokhlesur from the spot. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Noakhali General Hospital.

data.name: Rony Miah
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Kamruzzaman, Company Commander of RAB-1, said the drug trader was killed in the gunfight between members of RAB-1 and a gang of drug traders.

data.name: Shahadat Hossain Swapan
data.description: Swapan, was killed in a reported gunfight with police. Companyganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Arifur Rahman said that a team of police led by inspector (investigation) Mostafizur Rahman arrested Shahadat from Chowmuhani in Begumganj on 29 December evening. During interrogation, he revealed that his gang members would wait at the village to commit robbery at night. When a police team reached the spot around 3:00am to arrest other members of the gang, the alleged robbers opened fire on police, triggering a gunfight. Shahadat sustained gunshot wounds during the gunfight. Later, he was taken to Companiganj Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Rubel
data.description: Mirza Shahed Mahtab, Company Commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf talked to journalists after the "gunfights". According to the officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts on information. In both the cases, "criminals" opened fire on RAB members first, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfights", both the "criminals" sustained bullet injuries and died. In Cox’s bazar, RAB members rushed Rubel to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Amin Sheikh
data.description: Aminul Kabir Tarafder, Commanding Officer of RAB-12 in Pabna, talked to journalists after the "gunfight". According to the officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts on information. "Criminals" opened fire on RAB members first, forcing them to retaliate. During the "gunfights", both the "criminals" sustained bullet injuries and died. In Cox’s bazar, RAB members rushed Rubel to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. In Pabna, Amin died on the spot of the "gunfight".

data.name: Alamgir Hossain
data.description: Alamgir died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on 19 December. Alamgir, a father of two children, who lived in Phulbaria area under Uttara- 10 sector with his family members. Relatives of Alamgir said that Alamgir was returning home after finished his duty on 13 December night. When he reached near at his home Uttara West Police picked him up. Hearing this news Alamgir's wife Alo Begum rushed to the police station. But police didn't allow to meet with her husband. On next day police took him to the court but Alamgir was sick. Abdur Razzak, brother of Alamgir alleged that police tortured his brother after took him to police station. His brother died due to police torture. Tapan Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of the police station said that they they didn't torture Alamgair in thier custody.

data.name: Ratan
data.description: Ratan, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police at Amishapara union in Noakhali. Police arrested him from his residence on 21 December 2019. Later, police drive an operation with Ratan to rescue arms. Sensing their presence Ratan's cohorts fired to them. Retaliated police fired. At one stage Ratan bullet wounded. Police took him to Noakhali General Hospital, where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Anwar Sadek
data.description: Anwar Sadek, was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion at a Rohingya camp in Teknaf upazila. Shaha Alam, Company Commander of RAB-15 (Whykong camp), claimed that they raided Nayapara Mochoni Rohingya camp to recover drugs. A gang of robbers opened fire on RAB members while they were conducting the anti-narcotics drive, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Sadek sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Zakir Hossain Gazi
data.description: Zakir Hossain Gazi, was killed in a "gunfight" with police. He was an accused in 13 cases with different police stations, said Mirza Salahuddin Ahmed, additional superintendent of Satkhira (Sadar circle) police. He was found dead after a "gunfight" between police and "robbers" at Damarpota area, he said, adding that they seized a firearm and two bullets from the spot.

data.name: Emdad
data.description: Emdad, was an accused in hawkers’ leader Ripon murder case, said police. Officer-in-Charge Pritom Sarker of Bayejid Bostami Police Station said the law enforcers conducted a drive at Majhir Ghona area around 2:30am to arrest Emdad. As soon as had the police reached there, Emdad’s cohorts opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate, said the OC, adding that the miscreants fled at one point. After the "gunfight", police found the bullet-hit body of Emdad on the ground. He was declared dead on arrival by doctors at Chittagong Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Samuda Begum
data.description: Samuda Begum, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with police. On information that some drug peddlers had gathered in Laboner Math area in Whykong union, a Teknaf police team conducted a drive there around 4:00am. Sensing their presence, the criminals at the spot opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. After the gunfight, police found the bullet-hit body of Samuda lying on the ground. She was taken to the upazila health complex and was later moved to Cox’s Bazar Medical College Hospital where on duty doctors declared her dead on arrival, said the OC. Police claimed to have recovered 10, 000 yaba pills from the spot.

data.name: Mohamamd Ismail
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of 34th BGB battalion, claimed they conducted a raid in Palongkhali area of the district’s Ukhiya upazila around 5:00am on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing BGB members’ presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the "gunfight", two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20, 000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm and two cartridges from the spot.

data.name: Helal Uddin
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a "gunfight" with members of BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of 34th BGB battalion, claimed they conducted a raid in Palongkhali area of the district’s Ukhiya upazila around 5:00am on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing BGB members’ presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the "gunfight", two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20, 000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm and two cartridges from the spot.

data.name: Hafizur Rahman
data.description: Hafizur Rahman, a suspected drug peddler, was killed along with an associate in a "gunfight" with RAB at Teknaf. The "gunfight" took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing the Rab members to retaliate. The "gunfight" left the duo dead on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets and 40, 000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered and the lorry was seized from the spot, the law enforcer claimed.

data.name: Sabbir Hossain
data.description: Sabbir Hossain, a suspected drug peddler, was killed along with an associate in a "gunfight" with RAB at Teknaf. The "gunfight" took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing the Rab members to retaliate. The "gunfight" left the duo dead on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets and 40, 000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered and the lorry was seized from the spot, the law enforcer claimed.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal Hossain, who allegedly abducted and killed a fourth grader, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Monirampur. Police picked up Billal from Keshabpur upazila on 7. 1. 2020. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Billal's associates opened fire at police. Cops fired retaliatory shots in self-defense. At one stage, Billal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, accoring to police.

data.name: Iqbal Ahmed
data.description: Syed Iqbal Ahmed, an alleged drug dealer, was killed in a shootout with RAB in the capital’s Malibagh area. He used to bring yaba pills to the city from Cox’s Bazar, claimed Rab-2 Company Commander Mohammed Mohiuddin Faruqe. The incident happened around 7:00am near the ticket sales centre of an intercity bus operator. The area is covered by CCTV cameras of different nearby shops and businesses. Employees of these shops told this correspondent yesterday afternoon that Rab officials had deleted the footage and didn’t let anyone see what had been recorded. According to Mohiuddin, RAB officers were waiting there after being tipped off about a man arriving from Cox’s Bazar with a yaba haul. After the bus arrived and the other passengers had left, Iqbal was waiting there with at least 12 bags, Mohiuddin said. At one point, sensing their presence, Iqbal started to shoot at the RAB members who then retaliated. He was killed during the shootout. Iqbal was accused in at least six drugs cases, Rab claimed.

data.name: Abul Kashem Kaisha
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with DB Police in Ramsagar Tajpur area. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, said ATM Golam Rasul, officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. A police team took position near a road in the area around 1:30am to intercept a gang of drug peddlers. When the DB team stopped a gang passing through the area, the criminals opened fire on them,

data.name: Laskar Ali
data.description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with DB Police in Ramsagar Tajpur area. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, said ATM Golam Rasul, officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. A police team took position near a road in the area around 1:30am to intercept a gang of drug peddlers. When the DB team stopped a gang passing through the area, the criminals opened fire on them,

data.name: Abul Hasim
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Cox’s Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, assistant superintendent of police (ASP), also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said a RAB team conducted a drive in Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after a tip-off that a large amount of yaba was being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, which led to a gunfight, he claimed. "Hasim and Ayub suffered bullet wounds in the gunfight, " he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ayub
data.description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Cox’s Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, assistant superintendent of police (ASP), also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said a RAB team conducted a drive in Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after a tip-off that a large amount of yaba was being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, which led to a gunfight, he claimed. "Hasim and Ayub suffered bullet wounds in the gunfight, " he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Aiyas
data.description: A Rohingya man, Aiyas, who was allegedly involved in drug smuggling, was killed in "gunfight" with the BGB. Being informed that a big consignment of yaba would smuggle into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took position in Jadimora- Shikholghera area under Teknaf’sHnila union, said Lt Colonel Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB Battalion-2. Around 3:00am, the team noticed that a boat carrying a group of people entering Bangladesh. Sensing presence of the BGB men, the alleged smugglers started firing on the BGB team members when they came closer to the shore, BGB official said adding that they also retaliated with gunshots in self-defence triggering a "gun-battle" that lasted for 5/6 minutes. At one stage, the three drug traders jumped into the river and swam away toward the Myanmar border, CO Foysal said. Later, the BGB men found a bullet-hit "yaba smuggler" on the boat, he said. After providing primary treatment at TeknafUpazila Health Complex, he was sent to Cox’s Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the BGB official added.

data.name: Anwar Hossain
data.description: Anowar Hossain, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB. RAB-1 officials claimed that he was a notorious drug peddler.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Cox’s Bazar, a "suspected drug smuggler" was killed in a "gunfight" with BGB, said Lt Col Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB 2 Battalion. He could not confirm the identity of the victim. The incident took place near Jadimura mosque in the union on the bank of Naf River when a BGB special patrol team noticed some people carrying sacks on their head, . As the BGB team challenged them, they opened fire on the law enforcers in response, triggering the gun battle, the CO said. BGB later found the victim caught a bullet and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Abu Hanif Bepari
data.description: In Natore, a "murder accused" was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Gurudaspur. Deceased Abu Hanif Bepari was accused of murder and several other cases, including robbery, said Akramul Hossain, additional superintendent of police in Natore. Police detained Hanif from Dhaka’s Badda area on 22. 1. 2020 SP Akramul said. The "gunfight" took place when a team of police, along with Hanif, went to Pargurudaspur area and raided a banana orchard to detain his associates.

data.name: Nasir Uddin Munna
data.description: In Cox’s Bazar, a suspected drug pedlar was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hoykong union near the river Naf in Teknaf. Police detained him on 25. 1. 2020

data.name: Jumar Uddin
data.description: Jumar Uddin, was shot to death by police firing. In the incident day, stone workers and traders blocked the highway demanding illegal lifting of the underground stone. Police went there to normalize the situation. At one stage police and blockaders locked in a clash. During the time, blockaders vandalised four police cars. Police fired tear shell gas and rubber bullets to bring the situation under control. Bullet wounded Jumar Uddin died on the way to the hospital.

data.name: Anwar Hossain Yusuf
data.description: Anwar HossainYusuf, was killed and three police personnel were injured in a reported gunfight with police at Bircourt in Senbagh. He was a member of an inter-district robber gang and wanted in 12 criminal cases, said the police sources. Tipped off, a team of police raided at Jamidarhat in Begumganj uapzila on 27. 1. 2020 night and arrested Yusuf around 9:30pm, said assistant superintendent of Noakhali police Alamgir Hossain. Later, police along with Yusuf conducted another drive to recover arms around 2:45am in Bircourt area of Senbagh upazila. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the associates of Yusuf opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense. Yusuf was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Jewel Hossain
data.description: Jewel Hossain, detained from Cox’s Bazar was killed in "gunfight" with DB police. He was one of the main accused of Ansar member Hossain Ali murder case, said Tauhidul Islam, additional superintendent police (ASP) in Jessore. A team of Jessore Detective Branch (DB) arrested Jewel from Cox’s Bazar on 28. 1. 2020, the ASP said. Following his statement, DB members along with Jewel conducted a raid at Hasimpur village around 4am to detain Munna, he said. Munna, main accused and his cohorts opened fire on the DB team forcing the law enforcers to retaliate triggering a gunfight. During the gunfight, Jewel sustained bullet wounds and was rushed to Jessore General Hospital, where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abu Bakar Siddique Babu
data.description: According to the police, Babu was detained on 18. 1. 2020 evening after a case was filed against him under the Digital Security Act. Inspector Iftekhar Islam took Babu to Dhaka Medical College Hospital in an unconscious state after he tried to commit suicide. Later, the duty doctor declared him dead. One of his relatives said AC Moinul and Inspector Iftekhar are responsible for this mysterious death.

data.name: Abdul Nasir
data.description: Abdul Nasir, was killed in a gunfight on Marine Drive Road at Montalia Puranpara after 1:15am, with Rab said Company Commander Sha Alam of RAB-15. Responding to a tip-off about drug trafficking, a RAB team set up a check-post there, he said. The officers stopped several men who were carrying some sacks. But the men started shooting at officers, forcing the latter to retaliate, Alam added. At one stage, Nasir got shot while the others managed to flee the scene, he said, adding that Nasir was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mozaffar Hossain
data.description: Abdul Wahab, father of Mozaffar, quoting eye witnesses said that a drug smuggler hired Mozaffar's auto rickhaw. At one stage police chased that smuggler but he managed to flee. Police later detained Mozaffar with smuggler's shawl, three and half kilogram ganja and his auto rickshaw and took him to police station. Abdul Wahab alleged that his son died due to police torture in their custody.

data.name: Mohammad Ilias
data.description: Mohammad Ilias, a Rohingya refugee and suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Jadimura refugee camp under Hinllah union of Teknaf police station. RAB claimed that 12 other people were injured in this gunfight. RAB 15 company commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab said a group of RAB raided Jadimura Rohingya Refugees camp at midnight to arrest suspected Rohingya robbers and to seize illegal firearms. When they turned up at the camp, suspected robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing back. Later, RAB members found a Rohingya shot and wounded and seized some illegal firearms from him. The injured man, however, died on the way to Teknaf upazila health complex.

data.name: Shahid Hossain
data.description: Shahid, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the Rapid Action Battalion in Beribadh area. A team of RAB 1 conducted a drive in the area at night, said sources at the RAB headquarters. The robbers opened fire as soon as the team approached the area, triggering a skirmish. At one stage, Shahid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene, RAB sources said.

data.name: Kashidul Islam
data.description: On information that some robbers were preparing to rob a house in Kashidanga village in the upazila, a police team, led by Akhiul Islam, additional SP of (Hakimpur circle), went to the spot around 2:00am, said AbdurRazzak, officer-in-charge of Hakimpur Police Station. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle". At one stage, Kashidul, leader of the robber gang, was shot dead. Others fled the spot, the OC said.

data.name: Nurul Amin
data.description: Nurul Amin, an alleged Rohingya robber, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ in Teknaf, Cox’s Bazar with RAB. RAB said Nurul was the chief of a ‘robbery’ group. He came to Bangladesh from Myanmar around 25 years ago and was named in multiple cases. They said a team of RAB conducted a drive, leading to a gunfight with the gang. At one point, Nurul Amin was found shot at the scene. He was taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the doctor on duty declared him dead. Two RAB members were injured in the incident.

data.name: Mazarul Islam
data.description: Mazarul Islam, an alleged robber, was killed during a shootout with police. He was accused of was accused of killing two traders while robbing them on the Cumilla highway. According to police, a team of police raided a neighbourhood in Burichang to arrest Mazhar. A group of robbers opened fire on the police when they arrived. Police retaliated in self-defence. A man was found shot after the robbers fled the scene.

data.name: Aurangajeb Jebu
data.description: Jebu was killed in a reported gunfight with the members of Detective Branch at Bankapur of Manda upazila. Mozaffar Hossain, officer-in-charge of Manda police station, said Jebu was a listed ‘drug trader’ in the area and wanted in 20 criminal cases. Superintendent of Naogaon police Abdul Mannan said that a team of DB police arrested Jebu from Deluabari Bazar on 10 February night. After getting information from Jebu, a team of DB police conducted a drive in the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected drug dealers opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Jebu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene.

data.name: Mong Kiyu Tong Chonga
data.description: Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad Ahmad of 34 Battalion captain said that on information they took position in the early morning in the incident day. At one stage they have seen some five to six suspected persons were coming from Myanmar side. The BGB members instructed them to stop. The suspects opened fire to BGB members. BGB members also opened fire in self-defense. The suspected Yaba smugglers then fled to Myanmar. He said, "the BGB members rescued bullet wounded Tong Chonga and brought him to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex. The duty doctor of the hospital declared him dead.

data.name: Rafiqul Islam
data.description: Police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on 19. 2. 2020. Gleaning information from the two, a police team took the duo with them and raided ChhotoMagura village to recover firearms around 3:00am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, other members of the gang opened fire. Police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead when they were trying to escape from police custody. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, said police.

data.name: Wazed Ali
data.description: Police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on 19. 2. 2020. Gleaning information from the two, a police team took the duo with them and raided ChhotoMagura village to recover firearms around 3:00am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, other members of the gang opened fire. Police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead when they were trying to escape from police custody. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, said police.

data.name: Habban Ali Sheikh
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a police team conducted a drive in Char Shibrampur area of Pabna Sadar upazila around 2:00am, said Rafiqul Islam, superintendent of Pabna police. When police reached the spot, the criminals fired on police. The law enforcers returned fire. After the "gun battle", police found bullet-hit Habban lying on the spot, he said. Habban was declared dead after being taken to Pabna Sadar Hospital, the SP said.

data.name: Torikul Islam
data.description: In Chapainawabganj, the key suspect in a seven-year-old girl murder was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Horishpur in Sadar upazila. Torikul Islam alias Saddam, 32, of Manik Hajir Tola village under the same upazila, was accused of killing the girl after rape.

data.name: Jahangir
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area. Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team sensing their presence. For self-defence, the police retaliated, said police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured at the time. They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared two robbers dead.

data.name: Arifuzzaman Emon
data.description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police at Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area. Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team sensing their presence. For self-defence, the police retaliated, said police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured at the time. They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared two robbers dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Narayanganj, a RAB team installed a check-post on the Asian Highway in Kalni area after learning that a private car carrying a drug consignment was heading towards Gazipur, said Major Abdullah Al Mehdi, camp commander of RAB-1 in Gazipur. "As we signalled to stop the car, its passengers started firing on us that forced us fire back in self-defence, " he said. Later, the RAB personnel found a person with bullet-injury inside the car as the three others fled the scene. Later, they took him to a nearby hospital where doctors pronounced him dead

data.name: Yasmin Begum
data.description: Yasmin Begum, died several hours after she was picked up from home by Detective Branch of police in Gazipur. Her 17-year-old-son Yasin Arafat Jisan said about 4-5 men in plain clothes, who introduced themselves as DB officers, showed up at their home in Bhawal in the evening and said they were looking for his father Abdul Hai over allegations of drug dealing . When he and his mother told the men that Abdul was not at home, they started beating her up and took her into custody. Around 11:00pm, Jisan received a phone call from someone who told him that his mother had fallen ill and had been taken to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital. Due to difficulties in finding transport, he reached the hospital around 1:00am and saw that her mother had died. There were injury marks on her legs, arms and some other parts of the body, Jisan said. Meanwhile, Deputy Commissioner Manjur Rahman of DB in Gazipur told that Yasmin was arrested with 120 yaba pills and taken to the DB office in the city. She later fell sick and was taken to hospital. Jisan said his father was a drug addict and only came home once or twice a week, but he was not accused in any case. He added that the officers did not find yaba pills in his mother's possession. .

data.name: Mojaher
data.description: Mojaher was killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf upazila. Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station Pradip Kumar Das told that on information a police team drive an operation that area. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle". At one stage, police recovered Mojaher's bullet wounded body. Police took him to upazila health complex. Later, they took him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the duty doctor declared him to dead.

data.name: Ali Hossain
data.description: Ali Hossain, 40, from Kodupur village was killed in what RAB said was a "gunfight" with them. Samiul Alam, media officer of RAB-9 said, "During a drive to arrest Ali, he and his associates open fire to RAB members which eventually led to a gunfight. Five others were arrested from the spot.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: In Narayanganj, an unidentified youth was found dead in a car with drugs after a ‘gunfight’ with Rapid Action Battalion near a checkpoint at Colony area of Rupganj in Narayanganj.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: Abdus Salam, an accused in three human trafficking cases was killed in an alleged gunfight with police. He was one of the main accused in a human trafficking case filed after a trawler capsized near St Martin's Island. The "gunfight" took place at the foot of a hill near Salam's house around 4:00am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Acting on a tip off, a team of police went to the area to arrest Salam and his cohorts, who were holding a meeting there, the OC said. Sensing police presence, Salam's men opened fire on the law enforcers and injured three cops, he said. In self-defence, police retaliated with gunshots. Salam's men fled at one point, the official said, adding that police found bullet-hit Salam and rushed him to the upazila health complex. Later, he was shifted to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the OC added.

data.name: Shahidul Islam
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a ‘gunfight’ between two gangs of drug peddlers and a joint team of police at Bagowan village. Acting on tip-off a joint team of Daulatpur police and Detective Branch of police conducted a drive at about 3:00am while two gangs of drug peddlers were selling and buying drugs in a betel leaf orchard, Daulatpur police station officer-in-charge SM Arifur Rahman said. Sensing the presence of the law enforces, Shahid’s associate opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, police recovered Shahid’s bullet injured body while his associates managed to flee. They took Shahid to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Arpon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Arpon Chakma was killed in a gunfight with Army at Mohishbhanga Banaschhari. An Army petrol team of Shuvolong camp going by boat. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire to them. In self-defence, Army retaliated with gunshots. After 15 to 20 minutes, the armed criminals were forced to fall back and the Army members took control of the area At one point, they found Arpon Chakma's dead body.

data.name: Nurul Haque Keru
data.description: A suspected robber was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with the police in Begaritala area. Jasim Uddin, officer in-charge of Monirampur police station, said that police raided the area along with Nurul Haque, arrested on charge of lifting an easy bike, to recover arms. He died during the gunfight between the police and his cohorts that took place around 3:00am.

data.name: Shariful Islam
data.description: In Feni reported that Nishan and Shariful appeared before a Feni court over a robbery case on 27 February. The families said they were accused in the case filed in 2019 over enmity with a local political leader. They were in bail and appeared in the court hearing. After hearing, Shamsul went to Feni Bara Bazar for shopping for his sister’s weeding, said his uncle Delowar Hossain. Shamsul was called in to some place by one Sujon, who also appeared the court hearing in the case, over phone. The family failed to trace him since 1:00pm of 27 February. He said that Shamsul was never involved with robbery but he was made accused in the ‘imaginary case’ last year over enmity with local political leaders. Shariful Islam’s father Obaidul Haque said that his son earned living by driving human hauler but was accused in the case over enmity with the local political leaders. On 27 February he appeared before the court and did not return home. Later on 28 February they identified his body at the hospital. ‘My son was killed after being picked up by police, ’ Obaidul alleged, ‘He was never involved in robbery. ’ Sonagazi police officer-in-charge Moin Uddin Ahmed denied the allegations. He said that Shamsul and Shariful were robbers and were killed in internal fight near Bismillah Brickfield in Mangalkandi village on 27 February night. Two locally made guns and eight cartridges were found at the spot, he said, as evidence of firing among the robbers.

data.name: Bulu Mia
data.description: A gang of 10-12 robbers was fleeing the area after committing robbery at a house in the area, said Alamgir Hossain, officer-in-charge of Sadar police station. The robbers opened fire when a patrol team of police signaled the auto-rickshaw carrying the robbers to stop, forcing police to fire back that triggered the gunfight. At one stage, Bulu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Shahin Bishwas
data.description: Shahin Bishwas was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB members in the capital's Shyamoli area. The incident took place when a RAB team signalled a CNG-run autorickshaw to stop at a checkpoint in front of the National Institute of Kidney Diseases and Urology around 12:15am, said Mohammad Mohiuddin Faruqui, company commander of RAB-2. As the RAB men asked the three passengers and the driver to get off the vehicle, all but Shahin followed the instruction, the RAB official said. When the RAB men were forcing Shahin to come out, the others suddenly fired blank shots and tried to escape by crossing the adjacent boundary walls of National Institute of Mental Health and Hospital. RAB members were forced to fire back when Shahin also started firing on them from inside the autorickshaw, triggering a "gunfight", Faruqui said. Hanif caught a bullet injury during the incident and was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Seven suspected Rohingya robbers were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, Commanding Officer of RAB-15, said acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was hiding in Shalbagan Lalporirjum Hill, adjacent to Jadimura-Nayapara 26 and 27 Rohingya Refugee Camps, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00am. First, the RAB members cordoned off the area and then using a megaphone asked the robbers to surrender. But at this, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire retaliatory shots, he claimed at a press briefing at his office in Cox's Bazar . The "gunfight" continued for nearly four hours. After it ended, the RAB members searched the area and recovered seven bullet-hit bodies.

data.name: Nur Alam
data.description: Nur Alam, was killed in a gunfight with BGB said Lt Col Md Faysal Hasan Khan, commander of BGB's Teknaf-2 unit.

data.name: Hafez Nazrul Islam
data.description: Nazrul Islam, was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with police in Amanullahpur village in Begumganj. He was an accussed of student wing of AL leader Rakib Hossain murder case. He was the second-in-command of student wing of Jamaat’s Pias Bahini, police said. Harun-ur-Rashid Chowdhury, officer-in-charge of Begumganj police station, said that the thana and Detective Branch of police jointly raided Jonokollyan High School field around 3:45am. Members of Pias Bahini locked in a gunfight with them. Nazrul sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish at the spot. Police took him to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors pronounced him dead, said the OC.

data.name: Mohon Ali
data.description: Mohon Ali was killed in a gunfight with police at Golapnagar Moni park of Bheramara upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Bheramara police conducted a drive in the area near Kushtia-Ishwardi Highway while a gang of robbers were taking position there to commit robbery, Bheramara police officer-in-charge Mohammad Shahjalal said. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers open fired on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight.

data.name: Musa Miah
data.description: Four persons were shot dead and a few others injured after a BGB team opened fire on villagers in Matiranga upazila during an altercation over the seizure of tree logs. The BGB headquarters in a press statement titled ‘unwanted incident created during smuggling of wood log’. Dulu Mia, one of the witnesses to the shooting, told that BGB commander Ishaque, along with his team, was trying to seize four jackfruit tree logs from Amir Hamza, triggering an altercation near Gazinagar Bazar. He said that they came to know that Amir Hamza cut his trees on instruction from the local power supply authorities. The BGB team wanted to take way the logs in a pickup van, but there was a commotion as villagers tried to resist the team, he affirmed. Ahammad Ali was filming the scene with his mobile phone but BGB members took away it and got into a scuffle. At one stage of the scuffle, soldier Shaon and villager Ali Akbar fell on the ground, said Dulu Mia said that Ishaque opened fire targeting them. The DC formed a three-member committee, headed by additional district magistrate Khandker Muhammad Rizaul Karim, to carry out an inquiry into the killings.

data.name: Oziullah
data.description: Oziullah, was killed in a gunfight with police at Matichhira Pahar area. During that time, three policemen were injured. Police told that he was an associate of robber Joki group.

data.name: Jubair Mia
data.description: Jubair Mia, was killed in a gunfight with BGB members.

data.name: Altaf Hossain
data.description: Altaf Hossain's family members said he was picked up from Jaamgara village in Muktagacha on February 28, 2020. A Mymensingh court sent him to jail on March 1. He was released on bail on March 7. His 12-year-old son Arif Hossain said he was home on February 28. "I came home from my madrasa around 2:00pm and heard from neighbours that police chased my father, caught him and then beat him up with tree branches, " said Arif. "Later, police demanded Tk 85, 000 from us. Since we didn't have the money, they took my father to Muktagacha Police Station where he was tortured mercilessly. " After Altaf was released on bail on March 7, he lost his appetite and couldn't sleep. But the family couldn't afford to take him to a hospital, said Sirajul Islam, brother-in-law of Altaf. "As his condition deteriorated, we were taking him to Muktagacha Upazila Health Complex but he died on the way, " said Sirajul. Refuting the allegations of torture, the Officer-in-charge (Investigation) of Muktagacha Police Station Jahangir Alam said the court or the jail authorities wouldn't have accepted him if he was sick or injured and added that the allegation was baseless.

data.name: Nur Kamal
data.description: Saiful Islam and Nur Kamal, both alleged members of Jokhi Robbers Gang, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on Shaplapur Marine Drive road in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. Company Commander of Rab-15 in Teknaf Shahed Mahtab said acting on a tip off, a team of Rab-15 conducted a drive in the area around 1:00am where a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing RAB men to fire back. Saiful and Nur were caught in the line of fire and their bullet-ridden bodies were recovered later.

data.name: Saiful Islam
data.description: Saiful Islam and Nur Kamal, both alleged members of Jokhi Robbers Gang, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on Shaplapur Marine Drive road in Cox's Bazar's Teknaf upazila. Company Commander of Rab-15 in Teknaf Shahed Mahtab said acting on a tip off, a team of Rab-15 conducted a drive in the area around 1:00am where a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing RAB men to fire back. Saiful and Nur were caught in the line of fire and their bullet-ridden bodies were recovered later.

data.name: Mohammad Khokon
data.description: Being tipped off that a gang was preparing for a robbery, two teams of police and DB raided the spot around 1:50am, said Porimal Das, sub-inspector of detective branch (DB) of police in Comilla.  Sensing police presence, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight", he continued. Police recovered a firearm, two bullets and several sharp weapons from the spot.

data.name: Johurul Islam
data.description: Johurul Islam, accussed in 10 cases, was killed in a gunfight with police at Gabtola area. ‘Drug peddlers opened fire on the police during a drive near Ballabpur School at night, ’ said Rifat Khan Rajib, officer-in-charge of Chougachha police station. ‘Jahirul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

data.name: Jahidul Islam
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Liti Khatun, wife of Jahidul Islam told that on 14 March 2020 at around 5:00pm suddenly some poliicemen came to their house. They picked and beating up Jahidul. At around 7:00pm they got information that Jahidul was passed away. She claimed that police beaten to kill her husband.

data.name: Abdul Mannan
data.description: Asaduzzaman, Deputy Commissioner (east division) of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said that the dead -- Abdul Mannan alias Mona, 35, -- was the allege leader of the mugging gang that was responsible for the death of a woman who fell from a rickshaw after muggers snatched her bag. Earlier, police arrested four muggers from the Mugda Stadium area and told media that they were looking for their gang leader Mona. Later, based on the arrestees' information, police raided Khilgaon's Nagdarpar area around 3:00am to arrest other members of the gang, the DC said. "Sensing the presence of police, the muggers opened fire. This prompted the law enforcers to fire back, triggering the gunfight during which Mona was shot, " the DB official claimed.

data.name: Abdul Alim
data.description: Abdul Alim, was killed in a "shootout" with police in Pabna's Santhia upazila, said Goutam Kumar, additional superintendent of police in Pabna. Acting on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers had taken shelter somewhere in Khoyerbagan area, a police team raided the area around 2:00am, he said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate that eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, police found Alim with a bullet injury and took him to Pabna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Moniruzzaman Monir
data.description: Monir, was allegedly beaten to death by the police. Monir’s family members complained that several cops some in plainclothes raided the building at Chamarkhan of Uttarkhan. The victim’s brother Zakir Hawlader told that cops from Uttarkhan police station raided their building at about 5. 30am and dragged his brother onto the rooftop. Police locked the door and beaten his brother. Police then rushed Monir to a local hospital at about 9:30am claiming that he had a stroke and doctors there declared him dead.

data.name: Sohel Hawlader
data.description: Sohel Hawlader was killed in an alleged gunfight with police at Khilgaon area, hours after he was arrested from Airport Road area. Mashiure Rahman, officer-in-charge of Khilgaon Police Station, said a police team, in association with Airport Armed Police Battalion, arrested Sohel from the Airport area on 22 March 2020 evening after he reached Dhaka from Cox's Bazar. Later, based on his information, police took him to Nagdarpar area in Khilgaon around 3:00am to recover hidden firearms and drugs, the OC said. Sensing their presence, Sohel's associates opened fire, prompting law enforcers to fire back in "self-defence". . At one stage, Sohel fell in the line of fire, while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead, the OC added. Sohel's elder brother Jamal Hawlader alleged that they went to Khilgaon Police Station on Saturday night hearing that police picked up Sohel who was returning form Cox's Bazar. Police then told them to go to the court, he would be produced before it. "But they killed my brother, " he claimed.

data.name: Parvez Khan
data.description: Golam Mostafa, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kushtia Model Police Station, said they arrested Parvez on 24 March 2020 afternoon and got information on his firearm storage. On information, police along with Parvez went to Shalda village in the upazila to recover the firearms. On their way, Parvez's cohorts opened fire on police around 3:30am, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the "gunfight", Parvez sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot, .

data.name: Shanu Hawlader
data.description: Shanu Hawlader, died three days after he was arrested. A doctor said there were multiple injury marks on his body. Police arrested Shanu on 23 March 2020 from his home in Kalagachia village of Amtali upazila on suspicion of being involved with a murder last year. He was not an accused in the murder case, family members and locals said. His wife Jhahanara Begum and son Shakib Hossain alleged that police demanded tk three lakh in return for releasing him. As they could not arrange the money on such short notice, officer-in-charge Abul Bashar and Manoranjan Mistry tortured Shanu to death. . Shakib said he offered tk 10000 to the Abul Bashar on 24 March 2020, but he refused to take the money and asked for the full amount. On 25 March 2020 Shakib and his mother Jhahanara went to the police station to meet Shanu but they were refused by the police officials. Jhahanara's brother Rakibul Islam said I heard Shanu's scream in agony while I was waiting at the police station to meet him in the same day. Shanu was found hanging from the ceiling fan in Inspector Manoranjan's room on 26 March 2020 morning, according to Bashar. He added that Shanu was taken to the bathroom by a constable around 6:30am. But he sneaked out of the bathroom moments later and hung himself. Manoranjan and Arifur were suspended for the allegations of Shanu's death. A three member committee headed by Additional SP also formed and asked to submit report in three days.

data.name: Surat Ali
data.description: Surat Ali was killed and five others were injured in a clash between jute mill workers and police in Biral. Amir Ali, a workers' leader of Rupali Bangla Jute Mills, said the mill authorities announced to shut down the mills without any prior notice amid corona virus outbreak. The workers demonstrated in and around the mill demanding their three weeks arrears, he added. At one point, the director of the mill tried to pacify the workers with police, resulting in the clash, he added. Sheikh Mohammad Nasim Habib, officer-in-charge of Biral Police Station, said they had to fire rubber bullets, tear shells and charge baton to take the situation under control. Surat suffered injuries during the clash and later died. Meanwhile, Abdul Kader, sub inspector of that police station, filed a case accusing 1100 unnamed people in connection with the incident.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: BGB-2 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that acting on a tip-off, a BGB team raided the flood control embankment in the River Naf. They challenged a small boat coming from Myanmar. The gunfight took place as the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers while trying to escape the scene. When the gunfight was over, three bullet-hit drug peddlers were seen lying on the ground, the BGB official said. They were sent to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared them dead. The bodies were handed over to the Teknaf police.
