data.name: Musa Akbar
data.description: Musa, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with the Teknaf police. Teknaf police officer in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that acting on a tip-off, a police team raided village Tolatoli under Hoykong union at about 4:00am. Sensing presence of the police, miscreants opened fire them that triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight was over, the police recovered bullet hit body of Musa from the spot.

data.name: Sarwar Salo
data.description: Goutam Kumar Biswas, additional superintendent of police, said acting on a tip-off, police and Detective Branch members jointly raided Shamukjani Bazar in Santhia upazila at about 2:00am. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the robbers opened fire, triggering a skirmish, the ASP added. Sarwar, injured in the gunfight, was arrested from the spot and taken to Pabna General Hospital where the doctor pronounced him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Ferdous Fahim
data.description: Moniruzzaman Monir, officer-in-charge of Birampur Police Station, said tipped-off that drug traders were bringing drugs from bordering area, police took position beside Mirpur field. The drug traders fired at police and Fahim was killed in the gunfight.

data.name: Faruk Moral
data.description: Lieutenant Colonel Rawshanul Firoz of RAB-6 said they conducted a drive in the area at about 7:00am. As soon as they reached the area, robbers fired at them triggering a skirmish that lasted for about 40 minutes. Later, RAB arrested Faruk from the spot and took him to Mongla Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he said.

data.name: Rofiqul Islam
data.description: It is alleged that police and Rofiqul were locked into tussling about drug and then police beaten him greviously so that he died at one point.

data.name: Minhajul Islam
data.description: Police arrested Minhajul from his residence on 1 April 2020 . Later, police took him with them to recover firearms at Tilabaduri village . As soon as police reached the spot, Minhajul’s cohorts opened fire. Minhajul was killed during the skirmish.

data.name: Zahidul Islam
data.description: Parimal Kumar Chakrabarty, Officer-in-Charge of Patnitala Police Station said that Zahidul was arrested on 1 April 2020 . . Police took him to Bakrail village to recover drugs. When police reached the spot, Zahidul’s associates opened fire. ‘He was killed in the ensuing gunfight.

data.name: Mohammad Mizan
data.description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Cox's Bazar's Taknaf upazila. Searching a microbus, police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver Mahmudullah on 5 April 2020 around 9:00am, Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, said. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid at Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, OC Prodip said. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mahmud Ullah
data.description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Cox's Bazar's Taknaf upazila. Searching a microbus, police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver Mahmudullah on 5 April 2020 around 9:00am, Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, said. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid at Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, OC Prodip said. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Hassan
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were going to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching Rab team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

data.name: Masud Hawlader
data.description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were going to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching Rab team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

data.name: Ali Hossain Titu
data.description: The metropolitan police’s west zone Additional Deputy Commissioner Anis Uddin said that they arrested five people at different places of the city for their suspected involvement in robberies on the nights following April 1 and April 5 and the arrestees informed them that Ali Hossain led their gang. He said that they detected Ali Hossain’s location at Mohammadpur on 13 April night and a team, on secret information, went to Bochhila area to nab him and Ali Hossain was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with DB police.

data.name: Jafar Alam
data.description: Jafar Alam, was killed in a gunfight with members of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) at Golarchar in Teknaf. BGB said that Jafar Alam was a drug peddler and they seized 2 lakh Yaba tablets from him. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of 2 BGB Battalion at Teknaf, said that BGB members were patrolling along shore at about 1:30am. At one stage, they saw a small wooden fishing boat coming towards Bangladesh from Myanmar side crossing the river Naf at about 2:00am. . The boat anchored at Golarchar near Shahparidwip. As the BGB members challenged the boat, the people aboard it opened fire on them. The BGB members also retaliated with gunshots, said Faisal Hasan. After the ‘gunfight’ the BGB members found one bullet-hit person and 2 lakh pieces Yaba tablets on the boat. The bullet-hit man was immediately taken Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Jashim Mondol
data.description: Jashim Mondol, was killed in a reported gunfight between the members of Border Guard Bangladesh and a gang of pedlars at Natunpara border area. Quoting BGB-58, Jibannagar police station officer-in-charge Saiful Islam said that BGB arrested Jashim with phensedyl from border area in the upazila around 3:00am. Later, Jashim was killed in a gunfight during a drive conducted to recover more drugs as per the information of Jashim, BGB claimed.

data.name: Ekramul Hossain
data.description: Shot in an altercation with RAB at Shoshanghat. Victim and his crew started firing as soon as RAB entered the area acting on a tip off. The gunfight between the two sides lasted almost 10 minutes. Victim was declared dead by the doctor at Joypurhat Modern Hospital after being found lying at the scene of raid at the end of gunfight and being taken to the hospital by RAB.

data.name: Robiul Islam Robu
data.description: ASP Kamruzzaman confirmed that a group of drug peddlers were dealing drugs around 1:00am. Acting on a tip-off they went to raid the place. Robu was shot in the altercation with RAB and died on his way to the hospital.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Khorshed
data.description: Police started chasing the bike and the rider when it didn’t stop after the police signaled it to stop while they were at Coxsbazar-Chittagong Highway. A group started actively firing at the police when they reached Jowariyanala, Ramu to which DB police backfired for self defence. Police claimed that they found a dead body (victim), 20k Yaba pills, a motorcycle and an LG from the spot.

data.name: Mannan
data.description: Milon, younger brother of Mannan alleged that Mannan was driving his CNG back to Kaliganj when 2 police officers stopped his vehicle and started beating him as he was driving during lockdown and picked him up. Police replied that the CNG driver had heart attack when he was questioned and died in the hospital as he had a severe heart attack. Victim's brother said they saw their brother's dead body lying at Police Lines.

data.name: Giridhari Chowdhury
data.description: CMP Deputy Commissioner (DC, South) Md Mehedi Hasan said Giridhari and a colleague of his were loading clothes from their shop onto a rickshaw after iftar, despite the market being closed. A security guard of Teri Bazar confronted them and asked why they were there amid the lockdown. The two staffers acted suspiciously during questioning, and the guard informed a police patrol team that was passing by. Police then took the duo to the outpost, the DC said. DC Mehedi said that at the outpost, officers asked Giridhari to call his shop owner, but he suddenly fell sick. Police rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH), where on-duty doctors declared him dead. Colleagues of the victim alleged that police beat him up and that lead to his death. Police denied the allegation. ASI Kamrul Islam and his two constables were closed for alleged involved in this incident.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rashid
data.description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Ronhingya dacoit gang were preparing for a raid at the west side of the mountain, particularly at the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them to which RAB fired back. After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the victims.

data.name: Mohammad Abdul Hakim
data.description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Ronhingya dacoit gang were preparing for a raid at the west side of the mountain, particularly at the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them to which RAB fired back. After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the victims.

data.name: Mohammad Sayem Firoz
data.description: Offier-in-Charge Anwarul Islam confirmed that they raided Khilpara Bazar on a tip-off and the drug peddler gang started firing at the police when they reached the place to which the police fired back in self defence. The doctors announced him dead when he was taken to Upazilla Health Complex after the gunfight. Dead body was sent to Noakhali General Hospital for post mortem.

data.name: Juwel Ahmed Shobuj
data.description: Wing Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that Shobuj kidnapped a 5year old kid named Alif on 29th April. Earlier RAB arrested Sagor who confessed that Shobuj was the mastermind behind the killing. RAB recovered a decomposed body of Alif wrapped in a plastic bag. Based on this information a team of RAB went to the spot to arrest Shobuj. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang started firing and in self defence, RAB started firing back and saw a dead body lying which was later confirmed as Shobuj's.

data.name: Syed Alam
data.description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55, 000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the ‘gunfight’. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

data.name: Abdul Monaf
data.description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55, 000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the ‘gunfight’. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

data.name: Nurul Alam
data.description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55, 000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the ‘gunfight’. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

data.name: Mohammad Sadek
data.description: Suspected Rohingya drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with BGB. Tipped off, a team of BGB conducted a drive at Rahmetorbill border area around 4am confirmed by Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed. Sensing presence of the guards, criminals opened fire on BGB men, forcing them to fire back in self defence that triggered the gunfight. Later BGB men recovered the body of the drug peddler from the spot. They also seized 30, 000 Yaba Pils, a firearm and three round bullets from the spot.

data.name: Maruf Mollah
data.description: Lt Col Rowshanul Firoz, Commanding Officer of RAB-6 said that Maruf died in a gunfight where two RAB personnel were also wounded. OC Tazul Islam confirmed that a team of the RAB raided the area while 7-8 drug peddlers were dealing with drug at a field at the place around 5. 55pm. Gunfight ensued as the suspected drug dealers opened fire at the RAB personel and youth was killed. The youth was brought dead to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Rafique
data.description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off poice raided and detained the victims. Police took them to look for more consigment of drug. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Noor Mohammad
data.description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off poice raided and detained the victims. Police took them to look for more consigment of drug. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight.

data.name: Shawkat Ali
data.description: A police team raided Moragachtola area around 2am to reover a consignment of Yaba. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the drug peddlers opened fire to which police fired back in self defence. At one stage Shawkat was hit, but his cohorts managed to flee. Three policemen including ASP Nihad were hurt. He was taken to Ukhia Upazilla Health Complex where he was declared dead by the doctos.

data.name: Sazzad Hossain
data.description: Villagers caught Sazzad as his name surfaced as rapist and killer of a teenage housewife in a moving auto rickshaw on May 6 following RAB's arrest of the auto rickshaw driver who was another alleged rapist of the housewife. Villagers handed Sazzad to the police and along with Sazzad, police went to Moaranghona area to seize firearms when his cohorts started firing at police who retaliated by firing triggered gunfight where Sazzad was shot and killed on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Babu
data.description: Sheikh Tasmim Alam, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station reported that Babu, a suspected drug dealer and wanted in at least one dozen of cases, was declared dead at Jessore General Hospital following a ‘gunfight’ between police and suspected criminals at Sarapole area under the upazila at about 1:15am. Jessore General Hospital’s doctor Mohammad Swapan said that Babu, who was shot in his head, was taken dead at the hospital.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.description: Billal, who had more than 16 cases filed against him, was picked up by Police from Goran area and the "gunfight" took place when they took him in Shekher Jaiga area to arrest his accomplices around 11:30pm on Thursday.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.description: Jalil was killed at Banani, who had 16 cases filed against him previously. According to RAB, the gunfight lasted for 10 minutes when the members seized firing and backed off leaving Jalil behind who was taken to DMCH and declared dead.

data.name: Ariful islam
data.description: Police raided the local Fishmarket on a tip-off that Ariful and his crew are gathering. Upon sensing police's presence a gunfight was triggered and Ariful was shot. OC Pradip Kumar Das confirmed that Ariful was taken to CoxsBazar Sadar hospital where he was declared dead. He had 6 cases filed against him previously.

data.name: Nurul Ansar
data.description: Police confirmed that they received a tip that a few armed local terrorists were in the local brickfield. Gunfight was triggered when the police went to retreive the arms. A dead body was recovered after the gunfight and was taken to Health Complex where he was decalared dead.

data.name: Mohammad Saker
data.description: Commanding officer Muhammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that a team of BGB patrol team challenged a group of Rohingyas crossing Naff carrying bags from Myanmar at about 3:00am, the suspects opened fire at BGB members, who retaliated by shooting back, which ensued a gunfight.  After the attackers pulled out, BGB members found Saker shot and wounded. They took him to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, Faisal Hasan added.

data.name: Sawkat Hossain
data.description: Sawkat died within 24 hours of the murder of Nasir, where he was the main accused. OC Abdul Karim confirmed Sawkat was arrested by the police because of the murder case. He was taken on an expedition by the police to recover arms where his confidants started firing at the police to which police retaliated and back fired. Shot and injured Sakwar was taken to health complex where he was declared dead while being treated.

data.name: Mohammad Sujan Miah
data.description: Suspected criminal, Sujan is accused of murdering his cousin, was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police. A team of police raided Bhelangar area to arrest Sujan and his accomplices around 2. 30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, criminals opened fire on police prompting them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Sujan caught in line of fire while other managed to flee. Sujan was declared dead at the health complex after being taken rescued by the police. His body was sent to Brahmanbaria Sadar hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Kabir
data.description: Kabir was from Gazipur, confirmed by Commander Mohiuddin Faruqe. Kabir was accused in atleast 13 cases including drug cases. RAB signalled Kabir to stop his motorcycle at a checkpoint set up in Agargaon Link Road area around 5. 30am. Kabir opened fire on them from the moving bike forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Kabir caught multiple gunshots during the incident and was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abu Sufian
data.description: On information that a gorup of terrorists were staying infront of Modhumita rail track, RAB conducted a drive around 12. 30am to arrest them. Sensing presence of RAB, terrorists opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate. Officer claimed Abu died on the spot. Abu's associates managed to escape. It is to be reported that Abu and Niloy took a 7 year old girl behind a brick heap luring her with chocolate and raped her on May 15. When the child lost sense, they strangled her to death.

data.name: Hassan
data.description: RAB-1 captain Shafi Ullah Bulbul confirmed that they went on a raid acting on a tip-off at Majabosti area. Hassan and his associates started firing at RAB to which they retaliated by firing back. They later recovered the dead body of Hassan who is also accused in 14 cases.

data.name: Mohammad Helal Uddin
data.description: Helal was a resident of Pashchim Bhujpur and wanted in several cases. OC Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah confirmed that a group of miscreats led by Helal, picked up two girls while the victims were returning their houses from Kazirhat Bazaar and raped them taking them to a nearby forest of Galachiopartek. A case was lodged in this connection with police and subsecuently arrested. Along with Helal, police went to arrest others but as soon as they reached the spot, Helal's accomplices opened fire on the police promting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight where he died.

data.name: Mohammad Ishaq
data.description: Assistant Director (Media) Abdullah Mohammad Sheikh Sadi confirmed that they went to arrest Ishaq after they received a tip-off. Reaching the spot, perpetrators started firing shots at RAB which they retaliated with firing back. Dead body of Ishaqwas recovered from the spot. Body was later sent for autopsy at Coxsbazar zilla sadar Hospital. He had several cases filed against him.

data.name: Rubel Hossain Shaon
data.description: RAB-6 commanding officer Lt Col Rowshanul Firoj said that a RAB team went to the spot as part of its anti-drug drive and was attacked by miscreants which triggered the gunfight at about 3. 30pm. He claimed RAB rescued Shaon with bullet injuries and took him Health Complex where the doctos declared him dead.

data.name: Kanak Chowhdhury
data.description: Kanak's aunt Rokeya Begum alleged that Kanak died in Rajpara Police custody after being taken two days remands in a murder case. She also alleged that it was preplanned murder due to take possession of property. Sub-Inspector Jamal Uddin of Rajpara Police Station refuted that allegation.

data.name: Noresh Chandra Dash
data.description: Diceased's son Poresh confirmed that SI Masud called his father 3 times but Noresh did not answer. Then around evening, 2-3 persons came in the house and took his father. Screams were coming from the place of incident. So someone torched a light at the scream and saw Noresh lying on the floor and SI Masud and others were running towards the police station. He was a previous heart patient and declared dead at the Sadar Hospital. Police confirmed the calls but denied torturing. He had several drug cases filed against him.

data.name: Abdur Rahman
data.description: The victim was killed in a gunfight with BGB when they went on a raid. As soon as they reached the spot, drug peddlers started firing shots at them when they retaliated by firing back. While others managed to flee, Abdur was shot dead at the spot confirmed by Captain Lt Col Ali Haider Azad. Dead body was recovered confirmed by local OC Anwar Hossain.

data.name: Nurul Haque
data.description: Company Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that a checkpost was installed to catch a shipment of Yaba Pills from teknaf to Dhaka. As soon as the truck was going to be checked, they fired shots at RAB member to which they fired back that hit Nurul.

data.name: Rubel Islam Shaon
data.description: Police station confirmed that victim was accused of several cases filed against him previously. Patrolling team was on patrol in the morning when they were tipped off about a drug peddling. As soon as they reached the spot, they were being fired shots at to which they fired back and retalited to which Rubel was shot. Police rescued Rubel and took him to hospital where he was announced dead.

data.name: Nikhil Talukder
data.description: Victim and his friends were playing cards at the spot when source along with his van driver came along the path. Everyone managed to flee except Nikhil who got severly beaten by the police especially at his knee and head. They broke his spine. He was taken to Barisal Medical College by his relatives after this but had to transfer him to Dhaka Pangu Hospital when his health got worse and died while being treated.

data.name: Mohammad Sharif
data.description: OC Pradip Kumar confirmed that on information a police team conducted a drive in the area to arrest robbers of Zakir group around 9. 30pm, Sensing Police presence, robbers opened fire, forcing police to retaliate. Police found the body of Sharif lying on the ground while rest of the group managed to flee. Victim was rushed to local health complex and then to Coxsbazar Sadar Hospital where the doctors decalred him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Shafiqul Islam Shofi
data.description: OC Enayet said, two group were involved in a gunfight near East Meghna area. Reaching the spot, pirates started firing at the police and the police fired back. They could not arrest anyone except finding Shafiquls dead body on the floor. Victim's wife claimed that police took Shafiqul from his residence and shot him dead which ASP Sharker Mohammad Kaysar denied. Victim had several cases filed against him at the local police station.

data.name: Delwar Hossain Dukhu
data.description: When arrested, Victim informed the police about a drug trade taking place that very night around 12am. Police went on a raid taking him with them. Sensing presence, drug traders started firing at the police for which a gunfight was ensued. Delwar was a victim of this gunfight. He was declared dead by the doctos of local health complex after being taken there.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: RAB Media Wing Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said the incident took place at Boro Takia on Dhaka-Chittagong highway. Gunfight took place between a group of robbers who gathered to commit robbery. Victim was hit by bullet while other criminals managed to escape. He was declared dead after being rushed to Upazilla Health Complex.

data.name: Mizanur Rahman
data.description: Mizan was killed by an alleged gunfight. Police arrested himbecause of alleged rape. Police took him to Sonakandi to recover illegal arms that Mizan confessed of having in his possession. When law enforcers arrived the area, Mizan's cohorts opened fire on police and wounded Mizan. He was rushed to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Abdul Mazid
data.description: ASP of RAB-7 Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said that the gunfight took place at midnight after a patroling team went there to arrest the accused. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, cohorts of the accused opened fire to which RAB retaliated. Mazid was found bullet hit while his cohorts fled the scene. He was rushed to upazilla health complex where he was declared dead.

data.name: Abu Hanif
data.description: Hanif had at least 8 cases filed against him previously with different charges including drug peddling and robbing. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area along with Hanif for seizing drugs and arms. During the raid, associates of Abu Hanif opened fire at the law enforcers. When the police retaliated, assailants fled the spot and the police rescued Abu Hanif who sustained gunshot wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to a nearby hospital where attending doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hedayet Ullah Badsha
data.description: Senior Assistant Director Sohel Mahmud confirmed that their team went to the area on information that a consignment of yaba was being smuggled there. They spotted five youths getting up from the sea and asked them to stop. Sensing RAB presence, youths opened fire, forcing law enforcers to retaliate. A body was found lying around after the gunfight. Body and evidences were later handed over to the police.

data.name: Abdus Subhan
data.description: SP Sheikh Rafiqul Islam confirmed that their team went to near a graveyard as a part of their anti-drug drive at about 2. 30am and was attacked by a group of miscreants which triggered the gunfight. Police rescued Subhan with bullet injuries and took him to Bera Upazilla Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries at about 4. 15am.

data.name: Rayhan Sarker
data.description: Acting on a tip-off RAB went to a rented flat as Rayhan was present there at the moment. They raided the house and went inside Rayhan's room when Rayhan fired 3 shots at the law enforcers. RAB retaliated by firing shots to which victim died.

data.name: Jahangir Hossain Pinku
data.description: Senior Assistant Police Super Mohammad Kamruzzaman confirmed that they received a tip-off that suspects were present at TNT Bazar area. RAB raided the area and suspects opened fire at RAB sensing their presence to which RAB retaliated. Pinku was shot while other managed to flee. He was declared dead after he was taken to AhsanUllah Master General Hospital.

data.name: Imam Hossain
data.description: Police received a tip-off that a Yaba trade-off was going to get smuffled in a vehicle. Police signalled the autorickshaw to stop and seeing this Imran and his friends started firing at the police to which police retaliated back by firing shots. Rest of them (5 persons) managed to flee from the scene while Imam was left lying beside the vehicle. He was later taken to local health complex and then to Cox's Bazar sadar hospital where he was announced dead by the doctor.

data.name: Robiul Islam
data.description: ASP AM Mohaiminur Rashid confirmed that they went on an anti-drug raid to arrest the drug peddlers in the scene. Sensing the presence of RAB members, armed drug peddlers started shooting at RAB to which they retaliated which hit Robiul where he died on the spot. Robiull's mother claimed that her other son was killed by law enforcement agencies by the same way.

data.name: Mohammad Rasel
data.description: When police went on a raid to arrest Rasel, he and his accomplices started firing at police to which police fired back and the gunfight lasted around 20minutes. Police recovered Rasel's dead body from the spot.

data.name: Babul Molla
data.description: The team of robbers killed the night guard Abdul Mannan by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they reached, they broke the shop's lock and started to loot on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime law enforcers reached the spot and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight one of the robbers died on the spot while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upaziila health complex while another died on way to Feni 250 bed general hospital. However, no information from the victims' families was reported.

data.description: The team of robbers killed the night guard Abdul Mannan by strangling him. data.name: Hamid Hossain
data.description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed a joint team conducted a drive to nab the robbers on information that the members of Hakim robber's gang had taken shelter at Chakmapara of Hoyakong Hilly area at the bordering area. SP said that as they reached the spot robbers began to flee by opening fire at the police to which they retaliated by firing and chasing the robbers. After the gunfight police found the four critically injured ones and took them to a hospital where the on duty doctos declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Somrat Sohel
data.description: OC Safiul Kabir said that after arresting Sohel they conducted a drive along with him in Kutub Dighir par area at about 2. 30am to seize the knife which was used to kill Mosaddekur. When the police approached the area, a gang of drug peddlers opened fire on police from their hideout, forcing them to fire back that triggered the skirmish. Sohel received bullet injuries and died on the spot.

data.name: Habibur Rahman
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight. .

data.name: Shariful islam
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight. .

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight. .

data.name: Abul Kashem
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station said that a police team raided the area around 12. 30am on secret information. A group of suspected drug peddlers opened fire on the team that triggered the gunfight. Abul Kashem sustained bullet injuries while his cohorts managed to escape from the spot. Later, he was taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex where on-duty doctor declared him dead. The police also seized 10, 000 pieces of Yaba Pills, a locally made gun and six cartridges from Kashem's possesion, said Pradip.

data.name: Billal Hossain
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Awami League or its sister organizations
data.description: Due to an ongoing feud for a long time in the locality, a confrontation between the two groups emerged. Police fired rubber bullets to stop the conflict in which Billal died. Billal had rubber bullet marks on his body.

data.name: Mosharrof
data.description: Deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation Aminul Islam said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2. 30 am early in the morning at 300ft area. On information that a ring in auto rickshaw was mugging in the Khilkhet area, police team signalled a speeding auto-rickshaw to stop near Shewra bus stand area, but it refused to slow down. Police team chased the auto-rickshaw and informed another team ahead who put a barricade on the road. Suddenly, two men jumped out of the rickshaw and opened fire at the chasing police, trying to make their way to a nearby waterbody, claimed Mashiur. police also retaliated with firing, leaving two hit with bullets. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Nannu
data.description: Deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation Aminul Islam said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2. 30 am early in the morning at 300ft area. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Yasin
data.description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2. 30 am that three people were swimming. Suspecting them as Yaba smuggler, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation . But they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back resulting in a gunfight. Gunfight lasted for four to five minutes and BGB members recovered two bullet-hit youths. Rushed to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Mohammad Alam
data.description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2. 30 am that three people were swimming. Suspecting them as Yaba smuggler, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation . But they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back resulting in a gunfight. Gunfight lasted for four to five minutes and BGB members recovered two bullet-hit youths. Rushed to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Abdul Jalil
data.description: SubInspector Moinuddin said that both of them were shot and killed during a gunfight with the cops. The gunfight ensued when the suspects opened fire on police who went there to conduct an anti-drug drive. When the attackers retreated and the gunfight ended, they were taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex, but the doctos reffered them to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for better treatement but upon arrival the doctors decalared them dead. The bodies were sent to the morgue of CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Saddam's father Sultan ahmed was also killed in a gunfight with law enforcement agencies two years back.

data.name: Jashim Uddin Raju
data.description: The gunfight ensued when police went on a raid to arrest him but his cohorts started firing and the police to which the police retaliated by firing back. Jashim was found lying on the ground after the gunfight ended. He was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where he was declared dead.

data.name: Hamid
data.description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped-off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

data.description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped-off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

data.name: Tanjib Hossain
data.description: Tanjib was arrested from Library Bazar and later on after extracting information, police took him to Banglabazar to recover weapon at around 2. 30am. When the police reached the Shibarampur Embankment's Battala area, his accomplices started firing at the police to snatch him and police also retaliated by firing back. At one stage Tanjib sustained bullet injuries and his associates fled from the scene, the SP said adding that they took him to Pabna General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Afsor Ali
data.description: The victim was taken into remand by police. Victim's wife said police murdered her husband. She added that he was beaten infront of his wife being handcuffed. Addtional Police Super Mahbub Alam Khan said he committed suicide inside the police station while Ward coucillor vouched for Afsor saying he was an honest and hardworking man.

data.name: Akram
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area to arrest Akram. Sensing their presence, Akram and his accomplices opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight was over, police found bullet-hit Akram while other manged to escape, confirmed by the Officer in Charge. Akram was sent to Noakhali General Hospital where on-duty doctors pronounced him dead.

data.name: Syed Alam
data.description: In information that a large consignment of yaba pills would be smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took position around the area. Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan confirmed that the team noticed two men roaming the area and another crossing the Naf river into Bangladesh from Myanmar. Seeing this, the troops asked the three to stop but they opened fire, defying the instruction, injuring two of the BGB members. In self defence, the BGB men retaliated triggered the gunfight. After the gun battle the BGB team found a man with bullet wounds. The injured was taken to Teknaf Upazilla health Complex that referred him to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital. He was declared dead after being taken to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Bahar Uddin
data.description: Deceased was a resident of Burichar Union under Hatia. Additional Superintendent of Police Jashim Uddin Chowdhury of RAB said that they also arrested four associates of Bahar from the spot after the gunfight, namely Mohammad Yusuf (35), Alauddin (40), Mohammad Murad (30) and Mohammad Sheikh (20). Tipped off that Bahar and his gang were preparing for a robbery at Shurjamukhi Ghat area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, members of the Bahar gang opened fire, promting RAB to fire back in self defence. Bahar was killed at one point during the gunfight.

data.name: Azidul Haque
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, police conducted a raid around the area at 2am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. Police then rescued the two brothers who sustained bullet injuries and rushed them to Teknaf Health Complex, where doctors decelared them dead, the law enforcer claimed. Teknaf police sent those bodies to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

data.name: Aminul Islam
data.description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, police conducted a raid around the area at 2am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The gunfight took place around 3am when a team of Mohammadpur Police went to apprehend a criminal, said the police station sub-inspector Sajedul Islam. Sensing police presence, the criminal gang opened fire at police who were forced to retaliate in self-defence. SI Sajedul prepared the FIR of the incident where he said a man sustained bullet injuries and other criminal fled the scene leaving him. He was later rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mizan
data.description: Officer in charge of CoxsBazar Model Police Station Abu Mohammad Shahjahan Kabir said that a case was filed in connection with Yaba looting. Mizan was the prime accused and was in hiding. Benapole immigration police arrested Mizan on 17/07/2020 and handed him over to CoxsBazar police. Following Mizan's information, a team of police conducted a drive in the bridge area in the morning and as soon as the team approached the area, Mizan's associates attacked the the police and opened fire forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Police rescued Mizan's bullet hit body and took him to the hospital but the the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mamun Mia
data.description: Mamun had four cases filed against him for murder, robbery and arms carrying. Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-14, said the, on secret informationa team of RAB raided the area to arrest Mamun but Mamun opened fire on RAB members who fired back that triggered a gunfight. Mamun was shot dead on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Rajib
data.description: Adittional Deputy Commissioner Shahidur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a raid at 2. 35am. As the DB team reached the area, suspected drug peddlers oepned fire on them who retaliated by shooting back. As the attackers retreated, DB police found Rajib shot and wounded. He was taken to DMCH where the doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Ekhlas Uddin
data.description: RAB officials said the the deceesead was involved in drug dealing and died during a gunfight but victim's relative however claim that Ekhlas was picked up from Narayanganj on 04/07/2020 and killed in a staged gunfight. RAB officials refuted the allegation.

data.name: Ripon Howlader
data.description: Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police MD Salauddin said on a tip-off about drug dealings, a team of RAB conducted a drive and as soon as they reached the spot, the drug traders opened fire forcing RAB members to retaliate intitiating a gunfight. Ripon succumbed to his injuries after he was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: Inspector (Investigation) of Bagura Sadar Police Station said that they went to the spot after receiving information of gunfight between two armed gangs. Sensing police presence, the gang fled the scene and police rescued Rabbi's bullet-ridedled body and took him to Bagura Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College and Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rasid Ullah
data.description: Biman Chandra Karmakar, Assistant police super and operation commander of RAB that a team of Battalion was waiting about 2. 30am that a robber gang was preparing for robbery. RAB officials said that robber group opened fire at RAB members once they surroounded the gang. RAB members opened fire in counter for their safety. Robbers stopped firing a few minutes later and rescued one bullet hit person from the spot. He was sent to Teknaf Hospital for treatment but duty doctors declared hat the person died earlier. .

data.name: Mohammad Belal Hossain Dofadar
data.description: Deputy Police Commission (North) Ashikur Rahman said that the deceased was acused in 10 cases filed over rape and molestation. He added that the gunfight took place at Shanti Nagar Samabay Resident area when police went there to arrest the culprit. Sensing the presence of police his cohorts oepned fire and police retaliated, triggering a gunfight. Police found his bullet-hit body on the spot after the gunfight and recovered a gun and 500 yaba pills.

data.name: Ibrahim Khalil
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of police Kamruzzaman said that the incident took place at about 2. 30am when a team of RAB made a check-post on a tip-off suspecting a huge drug trade. In the meantime about 2. 15am a motorbike came and RAB signalled it to stop, but the rider did not. The rider oepned fire at the officials and RAB also fired back in self defence, resulting in a gunfight. After the gunfight Ibrahim Khalil found dead.

data.name: Mohammad Taher

Based on his statement they later arrested Boktear and Taher from their respective houses on the same night. At one point, the cohorts started firing at the police and the law enforcers retaliated triggering a gunfight. Their bullet riddled body was later taken to Teknaf Hospital where duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Sher Ali

Tipped off, RAB conducted a drive while a group of pirates were preparing for robbery. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire forcing the RAB to retaliate which triggered the gunfight. RAB recovered the bullet hit dead body of Ali, along with three arms from the spot.

Duo were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and then to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire to flee the spot while the police fired back in self defence and found four of them lying on the spot. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Shah Alam

As soon as they reached the spot, other drug peddlers were waiting for the police to come and fired as soon as they did. Police fired back in self defence which led to the killing of Alam. He died while being taken to the hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Badrul Mia
data.description: A press release issued by BGB public relations officer Md Shariful Islam said that a team of BGB personnel of Alinagar border outpost seized eight sacks of ‘Nasir’ brand of Indian bidi, smuggled into Bangladesh, at about 4:15am. It said that a group of 30 to 40 suspected smugglers, armed with sharp weapons and sticks, attacked the BGB personnel on way to BOP, and snatched two sacks of the seized bidi. Though the BGB personnel warned the attackers, the attackers went violent and tried to snatch the remaining bidi forcing the BGB men to open fire in the air, the release said. It claimed that the suspected smugglers then tried to snatch the BGB personnel’s firearms when the BGB personnel, to save their lives and government properties, opened a fire that killed Badrul.

data.name: Mohammad Mohsin
data.description: Operation Officer Ziaur Rahman said that a team of RAB, on secret information, raided Eastern Housing area and sensing the presence of law enforcers, Mohsin opened fire on them forcing RAB to retaliate by firing that triggered a gunfight at about 2. 45am. He added that they found critically injured Mohsin and took him to a hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Mohammad Hasan
data.description: Police conducted a drive in the incident area around 2:30am. But sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", police found the three bullet-hit bodies of Mohammad Hasan, Mohammad Zafar and Jahir Ahmed lying on the spot, he added. On the other hand Zafar's family claims Zafor was picked from his resident at Vaiyar Dighir Par, Kochua when police officer-in-charge Habibur Rahman and SI Aminul Islam. After taking Zafor, the police officers called Zafor's wife and asked for a ransom of 50 Lakh bdt saying that Zafar is a drug dealer and he will be put under the list of crossfire if the family does not comply. This incident took place on 29/07/2020 and 2 days after this incident, a police officer called the UP chairman and confirmed the death of Zafar by crossfire. The family of the victim found the dead body at CoxsBazar Medical College Morgue.

data.name: Mostofa Kamal
data.description: Lt Col Raushanul Firoz, a commander, said they went to Babu Bari area near Rampal Thermal Power Plant on information that a secret meeting of drug dealers was going on there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, criminals opened fire and RAB members retaliated, triggering the'gun battle', adding that at one stage, Mostofa was caught in line of fire while others fled. He was taken to Jhanjhania Hospital in Rampal where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Rashed Mohammad Sinha
data.description: Killed in police firing at a check post, said the sources at Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where he was declared dead. Cox's Bazar Superintendent of Police ABM Masud Hossain told New Age that police personnel at the checkpoint stopped a private car and a man locked in an altercation with them. At one stage, the man showed his firearm and attempted to open fire at the police personnel at about 10. 30pm. The police personnel in self defence, retaliated and later took the injured man to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared the victim dead. The SP claimed that they later had come to know that the man was a retired army official. He said that they also arrested two other people but declined to give their identity. Cox'sBazar Deputy Commissioner Kamal Hossain said that an inquiry committee was formed with a Deputy Secretary as its head and one each representative from the Bangladesh Army and the Police to probe the incident.

data.name: Abdul Mannan Munna
data.description: Officer in Charge of Jakiganj Police Station, Mir Mohammad Abdun Naser said that they arrested Mannan and extracted information that he had yaba pills and firearms at his home. The OC claimed that they started for his home from the police station and on the way his accomplices opened fire on the police team prompting them to fire back in retaliation. Police said they later rescued Mannan and took him to Jokiganj Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Anowar Hossain
data.description: Victim was picked up from his residence on 02/08/2020 and the next day he was killed by police. Police later on held a press conference saying that Anowar was arrested and taken on a anti-drug drive to revive the drugs where upon reaching the spot, his confidants started firing shots which hit Anowar and to which he died as well.

data.name: Mohammad Akram
data.description: Family of the victim has accused RAB members of torturing him to death in custody. RAB however, refuted the allegation and claimed that the man was a mugger and he had been beaten up by a mod during a mugging attempt. But witnesses say that he was not beaten up by a mob. The documents of the unnatural death case, filed by RAB, also doesn't mention anything about mob beating. Seeking anonimity, a top official of the Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) said they have no information on any incident of mob beating in Muradpur area. Akram's family said he was never involved in any criminal activities. After Akram's arrest and on Akram's information, RAB took him with them and conducted drives in different areas of the city. At one stage in Shershah Area, Akram fell sick and complained of chest pain. He was admitted to CMCH's medicine Ward where he died. Police declined to disclose contents of the inquest report.

data.name: Raja Fakir
data.description: Raja's family alleged that police tortured him to death while PBI turned down the allegation. PBI said Raja has been on the run since he was accused of murder and was arrested at one of his relative's house in Patuakhali, brought to Bagerhat. Raja's father Babu Fakir said that PBI officer tortured his son to death. After death, police took the body to the hospital and did not allow family members to have a look at the body. However PBI turned down the allegations.

data.name: Masud Rana
data.description: Victim's wife complains that her husband died in custody due to torture. Dead body has been sent to DMCH for autopsy. Masud went to work at 8 am as usual and had a conversation over the phone with his wife at 10am but no contact has been made between them after that time. At 10 pm, Masud's younger brother Saiful confirmed that his brother has been picked up by the police. After 1am, a call from the police station confirmed that Masud is feeling sick in the police station. The wife went to the police station and confirmed that Masud died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Rehana, the wife also confirmed that there is a video footage available that police and Masud were scuffling and hurt his head on the wall. Police tried to influence and threaten Rehana not to file a case in this matter as she has two daughters to feed.

data.name: Rayhan Ahmed
data.description: Rayhan's family members sad that he died in police custody and further alleged that the law enforcers had demanded Tk 10, 000 for his release. Jyotirmoy Sarkar, Additional Deputy Commissioner (media) of Sylhet Metropolitan Police said that the matter is complicated and they are investigating into it. Rayhan had left his home around 10:00pm and after a while his mobile was found switched off, said his his cousin Tanvir Ahmed. It is to be reported "Around 4:23am, Rayhan called his mother from an unknown number and told her that police had picked him up and were holding him at Bandarbazar Police Outpost. He asked to send someone with Tk 4, 000 so that police will free him, " his cousin said. "Hearing that, Rayhan's stepfather went to the police outpost with the money. There a policeman in civil uniform told him that Rayhan was injured in an accident and was sleeping at the time, and asked him to come again around 10:00am with Tk 10, 000, " Tanvir said. "Uncle then went to the police outpost around 10:00am when policemen at the outpost told him to go to Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital, as Rayhan was admitted there since his condition had deteriorated, " he also said. "Reaching the hospital, he came to know that Rayhan died and the police members on duty there told him that Rayhan was beaten by a mob. " Rayhan's stepfather Habib Ullah echoed the same and said, "We believe that Rayhan was tortured to death at the police outpost.

data.name: Hazrat Matubbar
data.description: Matubbar was beaten inside the prison and died while being treated at the Zilla sadar Hospital. He was accused in two cases and on 27. 09. 2020 he was ordered to be sent to prison by the court. Wife of Matubbar complained that the police killed him.

data.name: Syed Alam

Tipped off, a team of BGB-2 challenged a boat carrying three people along suice gate- 1 of Naf river. Sensing danger, the criminals opened fire on BGB men, forcing them to fire back that trigerred a gunfight. At one stage all the criminals jumped into the river to flee. BGB members found a man with bullet injuries and took him to a local hospital where doctors decalred him dead.

data.name: Noyon Chakma
data.connotation: The conflict in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) or its sister organization(s)
data.description: Police confirmed that UPDF attacked on a patrol team of Army and they retaliated to which Sajek was shot dead on the spot. Officer in Charge of the local police station confirmed that the gunfight took place between UPDF members and Army. Dead body has been sent to General Hospital for autopsy. UPDF claimed that the killing was premeditated.

data.name: Liton Kha
data.description: According to Liton's family, Liton had a longstanding land-related dispute with the authorities of a local madrasa. Following the dispute, Madrasa authority recently filed a complaint with the police and upazilla nirbahi officer (UNO) mentioning Liton killed their fishes and constructed house on the Madrasa Land. Liton's brother in law Mofizur Rahman Gazi said the police held Liton around 4pm on the basis of that complaint. Hearing the news he rushed to local police station and saw Liton was sick. Some policemen were taking him to a local health complex. After providing primary treatment, on-duty doctors there sent Liton to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital in Barisal where he died around 1:00am. . Contacted. Liton's wife Mazeda Begum said Liton was completely well when police held him. He fell sick being tortured by police. "I want justice, " she said. The victim's father-in-law Matlab Gazi said, "Liton was tortured to death.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Shah Alam of RAB-15, said a team found some people running away while patrolling Baharchhara area. The team chased them. The criminals opened fire. RAB members also fired back, forcing the criminals to flee the scene, he said. After the "gunfight", the RAB members found the bullet-hit body of a man, the official said, adding that he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. The body was kept at Teknaf Police Station.

data.name: Nazmul
data.description: Police Constable Hasan Ali used to own 8 autorickshaw of which 1 was run by Nazmul. After that rickshaw were stolen, Hasan Ali thought it was stolen by Nazmul so he went to Nazmul's house and tortured him with scissors and hammer. Nazmul was sick after this incident and died.

data.name: Khorshed Alam
data.description: A man was killed and three police injured in a shoot-out at Teknaf. Officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station Hafizur Rahman said, ‘Police arrested one fugitive Samsul Alam around 10:30pm. Suddenly, his associates attacked police in Habirchara area and tried to snatch him. ’ At one stage, the criminals opened fire targeting the police, which prompted to retaliate, triggering a gunfight that left some people with bullet injuries, the OC added. ‘Later, we came to know that a youth named Khorshed Alam, brother of Samsul Alam, died on way to hospital, ’ Hafizur Rahman continued. The body was kept at the mortuary of Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Mohammad Abdur Rahim
data.description: 34 BGB Captain Lt Col Ali Haider confirmed that a group of men challenged a BGB team and started firing at them. BGB retaliated and fired shots back at them to which Abdur was shot. Rest of them fled away. Abdur was taken to Ukhiya Health complex where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Rezaul Karim Reza
data.description: A probationary lawyer in Barisal district court, arrested by police on December 29, 2020, died at Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital prison cell Saturday night due to excessive bleeding. The deceased was identified as Rezaul Karim Reza, 30, of Abdul Karim Khan Road in Barisal city. The victim’s family members alleged that Reza died due to torture by police after his arrest on false allegation. Hearing the news of the death, locals staged demonstration in the area and threw brick bats on the house of a cop in the area who allegedly picked up Reza on December 29 night. Reza’s father Md Yunus Mia alleged that Detective Branch sub-inspector Mohiuddin, also their neighbour, picked up his son alleging that he was a drug addict and tortured him at DB office. On January 1, he said, they received a phone call from the hospital and the caller told them that his son was admitted to the prison cell as there was excessive bleeding through his urinary system. Barisal Central Jail superintendent Prashanta Kumar Banik said that they received Reza with wounds in his groin and he was sent to SBMCH.

data.name: Dil Mohammad
data.description: Acting on a tip off, a team of BGB-34 Battalion conducted a drive at Garjanbania Chakmapara in Naikkhangchhari upazila, said Yar Hossain, Assistant Director of the Battalion. The BGB personnel confronted a group of "yaba dealers" who opened fire on the border guards, forcing them to retaliate in self-defence, he said. Later, the BGB men found two persons lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead. The accomplices of the two, however, escaped.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with Border Guard Bangladesh members at Shah Parir Dwip in Teknaf upazila of Cox’s Bazar. BGB 2 commander Lieutenant Colonel Md Faisal Khan said that a BGB team challenged two people in the Naf River at Golarchar point of Shahporir Dwip. They opened fire on the guards forcing them to retaliate in self-defence, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, one of them fell into the river after sustaining bullet wounds while another managed to flee, he said. The body was sent to hospital morgue.

data.name: Shafiq Sheikh
data.description: A man, who was killed in an alleged gunfight with Rab-10 in Dhaka's Keraniganj was a truck driver that ran over and killed a RAB member in Mymensingh's Bhaluka on February 14. Four days after the so-called gunfight, family members of the deceased identified the body at the Dhaka Medical College morgue. Shafiq's brother-in-law Manik said Shafiq worked as a technician at the Tongi truck stand and was behind the wheels of the truck that killed the RAB man in Bhaluka. Manik claimed that Shafiq had been missing since the accident on February 14. "Shafiq was not a drug peddler. He had been traceless since the accident. " Throughout the rest of the day, RAB officials did not disclose how the man died or who he was. In the evening, they finally spoke and claimed that the deceased was a drug dealer, who was killed in a gunfight with RAB-10 earlier in the day in Keraniganj's Swapnadhara area. The officials did not give any further details of the deceased.

data.name: Abdul Hamid
data.description: Three Rohingya youths- Abdul Hamid, Johir Ahmed and Jokir Ahmed- were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion personnel at Teknaf in Cox’s Bazar. RAB said the youths were involved in robbery, abduction, ransom, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling. RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan said Jokir was the leader of Jokir Group and he had at least 17 cases filed against him with Teknaf Police Station for robbery, kidnapping, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling in past one and half a year. RAB had information that the group was planning to kidnap a Bangladeshi NGO worker. Based on that information, RAB raided a hill, where Jokir and his accomplices had allegedly took position, near Rohingya camp number 26 in the afternoon. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB team to retaliate, claimed RAB-15 deputy director Mehedi Hasan. After over an hour of gunfight, the group fled the scene and the RAB team found three people shot and killed in the hill, said Mehedi. Earlier this month, at least two Rohingyas were killed in reported gunfights with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Naikhyangchari upazila in Bandarban.

data.name: Delowar Hossain
data.description: RAB said it seized four lakh pieces of contraband Yaba, one pistol, four bullets and a bullet shell from his possession. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-7 raided the garden in Ramu upazila, said Lieutenant Colonel Mahbubur Rahman, commanding officer of Rapid Action Battalion-RAB, Cox’s Bazar. As soon as Delwar and his men spotted RAB near Valley of Hill, they opened fire, forcing RAB to retaliate in self-defence. While Delwar died on the spot, others managed to flee, ’ Mahbubur said. KM Amiruzzaman, officer-in-charge of Ramu police station said, the dead body was sent to Cox’s Bazar Sadar hospital morgue for autopsy. No information has been found from the family in this connection.

data.name: Kamal Miah
data.description: BGB claimed that a group of cattle tradders were coming near 1215 Pillar of Bongao when the BGB patrol team tried to arrest them but the 30-35 people team of cattle traders attacked on BGB and hit Lans Nayek Tui Hola Mong who was greviously injured and fired back to self defence which hit Kamal. Kamal was then taken to Sunamganj Sadar Hospital and then he died on his way being transferred to Sylhet. .

data.name: Mohammad Rubel
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Teknaf. BGB commander Lieutenant Colonel Faisal Hasan Khan said they had recovered 360, 000 Yaba pills and a locally-made firearm from the site. The deceased were later identified as Mohammad Rubel and Younus Alam. Khan said one of their teams took position at Nazirpara point. ‘The Yaba traders fired at the BGB team, triggering a skirmish, ’ he said. ‘The bodies were recovered from the site after the gunfight and had been sent to Cox’s Bazar Sadar Hospital for an autopsy. ’

data.name: Younus Alam
data.description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Teknaf. BGB commander Lieutenant Colonel Faisal Hasan Khan said they had recovered 360, 000 Yaba pills and a locally-made firearm from the site. data.name: Masud
data.description: A man, who sustained bullet wounds when police opened fire during a clash with a group of fishermen in the Meghna river in Matlab North upazila, died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. The clash took place when a team of River Police was conducting a regular drive against jatka netting. Mohammad Kamruzzaman, a member of Chandpur River Police, said while patrolling in the Meghna river they chased a group of fishermen, who were catching jatka. Being chased by the law enforcers, the fishermen threw brick chips on them, prompting the police team to fire shotguns in self-defence, adding that Masud was hit by a bullet in his left thigh. After the clash, police detained bullet-hit Masud and two other fishermen from the spot. Later, Masud was taken to Matlab North Upazila Health Complex, from where he was shifted to DMCH as his condition deteriorated.

data.identity: Reportedly affiliated with the Hefazat-e-Islam Bangladesh, an Islamist pressure group
data.description: Mohammad Ashik, along with 18 other supporters of Hefazat-e-Islami Bangladesh, was killed and over 500 were injured during protests against the recent Bangladesh visit of Narendra Modi, the prime minister of India.

data.name: Rubel Shah
data.description: When the police went to arrest him at his residence, it is alleged that he came with sharp weapons to attack the police. Police shot him in self defence. He was greviously injured and taken to a private hospital in Shyamoli where he died while being treated.

data.name: Mohammad Jubayer Hossain
data.description: Jubayer was shot dead by police during an altercation between the people and police. The altercation started previously in a incident where the police was enforcing around imposition of lockdown.

data.name: Rony
data.description: Workers of the S Alam group owned coal-based power plant SS Power Plant alleged that police opened fire on them, killing Rony and four others, while they were peacefully demonstrating for their five-point demand, including payment of their overdue salary. Police and workers said the incident took place inside the power plant project area. Seven vehicles -- six cement mixers and a microbus -- were set ablaze during the incident. Besides, a cement godown was torched. Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Chittagong Range Anwar Hossain said that workers of the coal-based power plant of Gandamara at Banshkhali had been demonstrating over several points of demands. However, a meeting had been held between them and the authority but the agitating workers in the morning started demonstrations and at one point they attacked the plant and on-duty police personnel of the project area.

data.name: Mohammad Ibrahim
data.description: A Rohingya man suspected to be a yaba dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with Border Guard Bangladesh in Bandarban's Naikhongchhari upazila. Mohammad Ibrahim was from Kutupalong Lambashia Rohingya camp in Cox's Bazar Ukhia upazila. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of BGB-34 Battalion said that the "gunfight" took place in Aambagan area near Baishfari border around 12:30am. A BGB patrol team took position in Aambagan area on information that a consignment of yaba tablets would be smuggled to Bangladesh through the border. When the BGB men challenged a group of five-six people, they opened fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, the criminals fled. Later, the BGB team found a body lying on the spot which was sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

data.name: Hamidur Rahman
data.description: Hamidur's family had an internal clash between husband and wife where the both of the son took their mother's side and beaten their father to which Hamidur filed a written complaint to the police. Police wanted to fix the family issue but Hamidur denied taking his wife back in the family again. Police being agitated, kicked Hamidur in the gut and punched him in the chest. He was kept detained for a certain period of time but later freed. This incident took place on 25. 04. 2021. Hamidur's mother claimed that the police took bribe from his wife and beaten Hamidur to death.

data.name: Sanaul Haque Biswas
data.description: Sanauls' younger brother Masud Rana Biswas said that police arrested Sanaul from in front of Sadar hospital when he went out to buy eggs. Masud said his brother was tortured by police and died due to torture. His brother left behind his wife and four daughters, he said. Masud added that his brother was a drug addict, but was not involved in any drug trading. AHM Abdur Rakib, superintendent of police of the district, said Sanaul was wanted in a narcotics case. The SP denied allegations of torture and said they primarily suspect Sanaul died of a heart attack. After the case, he fled the area. Later, on information, a team of Detective Branch (DB) of police conducted a drive in Chanshikari village. Sensing the presence of DB officials, Sanaul tried to run away but police managed to arrest him. After the arrest, the accused complained of chest pain. Police then took him to Bholahat Upazila Health Complex.

data.name: Abul Hossain Molla
data.description: Abul was arrested when his name came up in the investigation by the Detective Branch of Police. He was not named in the Ejahar. He was still arrested and remanded for 5 days. He had his pre-fast dinner and went to the toilet. After a while since no sound came out, the door was opened and the guards saw him lying on the floor. He was taken to Faridpur General Hospital quickly where he was announced dead. His family claimed that their loved one died due to police torture at the police station.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Police said that the gunfight took place between the police and a gang of dacoits when a youth was hit by bullet and taken for treatment where the doctors declared him dead. The incident took place near Ratan Khamar, Korergao, Dokkhin Keraniganj. Police sent the dead body to Solimullah Medical College Hospital for autopsy.

data.name: Mohammad Rasel
data.description: Two alleged muggers- Mohammad Rasel and Enamul- were killed in a "gunfight" with Detective Branch of Police in Dhaka's Khilkhet area. The shootout took place when a team of the Detective Branch of Police, along with local police, chased a group of muggers who were on an auto-rickshaw, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of (DB-Gulshan) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said around 2:15 am, as law enforcers signalled an auto-rickshaw at a check post to stop, its driver refused and tried to speed his way towards Purbachal area. The DB team then informed another one of their teams ahead who intercepted the auto-rickshaw, he said. Then, two of the muggers came out of the auto-rickshaw and started firing at the law enforcers, who fired back in self-defence, leaving the men bullet hit, claimed the DC. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Enamul
data.description: Two alleged muggers- Mohammad Rasel and Enamul- were killed in a "gunfight" with Detective Branch of Police in Dhaka's Khilkhet area.
