data.name: Manik
data.description: Manik, a suspect in Shahin Uddin murder case, was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Eastern Housing area of Mirpur in Dhaka. RAB-4 director Mozammel Haque said they raided the Eastern Housing area on a tip-off about a group of thugs. Sensing RAB’s presence, the thug opened fire and RAB personnel retaliated. After the gunfight the personnel found Manik shot and killed.

data.name: Mohammad Monir Uddin
data.description: Monir was killed in the gunfight with the zonal branch of Detective Branch of Police who was first greviously hurt in the gunfight and later the doctors declared him dead at the Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital.

data.name: Rokon Mia
data.description: Rokon Mia, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with RAB on Dhaka-Mymensingh Highway near Tongi bridge. Assistant police superintendent of RAB Emran Khan said a patrol team of RAB went to the spot, on a tip-off that a group of youths were peddling drugs there. Sensing the presence of the RAB members, the drug peddlers opened fire, prompting RAB to retaliate. Rokon died on the spot.

data.name: Mohammad Shamim
data.description: Iftekhayer Alam, spokesperson of Rajshahi district police said that a group of assailants opened fire on police while a team of law enforcers from Kakonhat police outpost was patrolling at Lalitanagar, forcing the later to retaliate which resulted in a gunfight. After the gunfight, they found Shamim injured while the others managed to flee the spot. Later, he was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Lutfur Rahman
data.description: Lt. Col Ali Haider, Commander of BGB said that thery went to Nalbania Shrimp farm to petrol the area. During this time they gave signal to some suspected persons. However, they fired towards them which caused them to fire back. Then the suspected persons fled away. After that they found bullet wound Lutfor who was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Hashimullah
data.description: According to RAB Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, when a group of RAB from Teknaf camp reached in number 14 bridge of Teknaf Cox's Bazar regional road area, a group of robbers fired towards them, so they fired back, During this time Hashimullah was killed.

data.name: Ashraf Ali
data.description: Ashraf Ali was an accused of a double-murder case at Rumaliyarchhara area in Cox’s Bazar, was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB. RAB-15 deputy commander Tanvir Hasan said in the predawn hours, RAB carried out an operation based on their information but the criminals sensing their presence opened fire on them and RAB personnel retaliated in self-defence. They later found Ashraf shot and killed.

data.name: Karimullah
data.description: Karim alias Kalimullah, a suspected robber and a resident of Lambashia Rohingya camp under the Ukhiya police station, was killed in a gunfight with the RAB in Cox’s Bazar. According to RAB, he was the leader of robber gang Kalimullah group and was accused in five robbery and murder cases. Squadron Leader Tanvir Hasan, deputy commander of RAB-15, said RAB members launched a drive in the area on a tip-off that a group of robbers were staying there. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight was over, RAB recovered the body of Karim and two firearms from the spot.

data.name: Asadul
data.description: A Rab team raided Bharoil area acting on information that some robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the area, said Lt Col Abu Nayeem Md Talat, commanding officer of Rab-14. Sensing the presence of Rab members, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said the Rab official. After the "gun battle", the RAB members found two bullet-hit persons- Asadul and Sumon Mia - on the spot and they were taken to Gafargaon Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Sumon Mia
data.description: A RAB team raided Bharoil area acting on information that some robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the area, said Lt Col Abu Nayeem Md Talat, commanding officer of Rab-14. Sensing the presence of Rab members, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said the Rab official. After the "gun battle", the RAB members found two bullet-hit persons- Asadul and Sumon Mia - on the spot and they were taken to Gafargaon Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Parvez Ahmed
data.description: The deceased is Parvez Ahmed, ringleader of inter-district robber gang. Tipped off, a team of RAB-1 conducted an anti-narcotics drive in the area at about 1:00am. Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, Parvez and his two associates opened fire on the RAB men, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Pervez was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the two others managed to flee the scene. However, information from family or other source is unknown.

data.name: Mohammad Liton
data.description: Truck workers obstructed roads in Bogra and demanded justice of Liton's death. They said under police remand Liton was tortured and died. However police claimed he committed suicide.

data.name: Nurul Alam Nuru
data.description: Nurul Alam Nuru, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Teknaf upzila in Cox's Bazar . The gunfight took place beside a hill near the makeshift Rohingya camp in Damdamia Nature Park around 1:00am when a RAB team rushed there on information of robbery and abduction, according to Lt Commander Mahbub Hasan, a company commander of Rab-15. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at them, who retaliated -- leaving Nuru critically injured. RAB later took Nuru to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Md Kajol
data.description: Md Kajol, an alleged robber, was killed in a gunfight between a group of robbers and members of the Rapid Action Battalion (Rab-7) in Chattogram's Bayezid-Foujderhat link road area of Sitakunda upazila. He was charged with the murder of truck driver Abdur Rahman, killed during a robbery attempt. Sitakunda Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Abul Kalam Azad said a RAB team raided the spot on a tip-off that the robbers were preparing for a robbery there. "Rab later got into a gunfight with a gang of robbers," said the OC, adding that "after the brief gunfight, Kajol's body was discovered at the spot.

data.name: Tajul Hossain
data.description: Tajul Hossain, along with Sajeeb Hossain, sustained bullet injuries in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj and later died while undergoing treatment at the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH). Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said two youths were admitted to the hospital on 16/08/2021 with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on 17/08/2021. According to RAB-10, they launched a raid in Jhilmil area on a tip-off that a group of robbers were preparing for a crime. Sensing RAB’s presence, the alleged robbers opened fire and the law enforcers retaliated. Tajul and Sajeeb was injured in the incident and sent to DMCH

data.name: Sajeeb Hosaain
data.description: Sajeeb Hossain, along with Tajul Hossain, sustained bullet injuries in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj and later died while undergoing treatment at the Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH). Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said two youths were admitted to the hospital on 16/08/2021 with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on 17/08/2021. According to RAB-10, they launched a raid in Jhilmil area on a tip-off that a group of robbers were preparing for a crime. Sensing RAB’s presence, the alleged robbers opened fire and the law enforcers retaliated. Tajul and Sajeeb was injured in the incident and sent to DMCH

data.name: Mohammad Shahjahan
data.description: BGB men took position on information that a big consignment of yaba tablets from Myanmar will enter Bangladesh, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commander of BGB Battalion-34 in Cox's Bazar. When a gang of four to five was entering Bangladesh through the border around 4:00am, the BGB men signalled them to stop. But they opened fire, forcing BGB personnel to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight". Shahjahan was hit, he claimed. Doctors declared him dead after being taken to Ukhiya Upazila Health Complex. However, no other information is reported from family/ locals.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: The BGB official said three drug peddlers were crossing the Naf river. Following the "shootout", one of them was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex with bullet wounds, while two others fled to Myanmar.

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: Jahangir, a suspected drug dealer, was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Captain Azim Ahmed, wing commander of Rab-15 said the incident took place behind Jaliapalong Forest Beat Office at around 8:30pm. According to Azim, a group of drug dealers started firing at RAB personnel when they were on a drug recovery operation there. RAB fired back in retaliation and later they found the body of Jahangir on the ground.

data.name: Sujan Howlader
data.description: On 20 September, ASI of the River police on the leadership of ASI Mamunur Rashid, four River Police went to Dhosh and chased traller of Sujan Howlader. At one point police caught Sujan and beat & kicked him up caused him to death

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Cox's Bazar BGB-34 Battalion Commander stated"A BGB team took position in Karibunia area after receiving information that a consignment of yaba tablets was being transported to Bangladesh from Myanmar via Ukhia area. " "At the time, BGB members saw a group of 4-5 people approaching from Myanmar and ordered them to stop, " he said. "Sensing the presence of BGB, the group split up and started firing at BGB members. In self-defense, BGB members also fired back. At one point, the attackers retreated and fled through the hills towards Myanmar, " he said. Later, BGB members searched the spot and found an unidentified person lying on the ground with a bullet wound. When he was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex, the doctor on-duty declared him dead.

data.name: Md Alamgir
data.description: Md Alamgir, a suspected robber, was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion (Rab-7) in Banshkhali upazila of Chattogram. According to RAB, he stood accused in nine cases filed over different charges. Nurul Absar, media officer of Rab-7 said RAB had information that a group of 10-12 people gathered on 13th October at Gondamara union of the upazila to prepare for a robbery. When RAB members went to the spot, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing Rab to retaliate. After a brief gunfight, RAB members found a bullet-hit body on the spot, later identified as Alamgir.

data.name: Al Amin
data.description: Al Amin, along with three other people, was shot dead by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla. Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

data.description: Shamim, along with three other people, was shot dead by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla. Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

data.name: Sagar
data.description: Sagar was shot when he was in Hajiganj bazar. Later he died in hospital on 19th October. The police fired bullet centering unrest about disrespecting Quaran in Comilla.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An unidentified youth, aged around 30-32, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-1 in Rupganj upazila of Naraynganj. RAB-1 Captain Abdullah Al Momen told the media that a group of robbers was preparing for a robbery when a petrol team of RAB was nearby. Sensing the petrol team’s presence the alleged robbers opened fire and RAB members retaliated in self-defence. After the gunfight, the body of a bullet-ridden youth was found lying at the spot. RAB took him to Upazila Health Complex, where the doctors declared him dead. Inspector Fazlul Haque, in-charge of Bholab investigation centre under Rupganj Police Station, said the youth’s body had 3 bullet wounds in the front and four in the back.

data.name: Tofayel Mia
data.description: Tofayel Mia, along with Shaid Mia, was killed in a gunfight between RAB members and a group of unidentified people in Moulvibazar's Sreemangal upazila. Both were accused in a case filed over the murder of a local business association leader. Basu Dutta Chakma, Commander of RAB-9 (Sreemangal Battalion), said, "A group of people started shooting on a RAB vehicle in the morning inside the Mirtinga tea garden area and RAB retaliated in self-defense. After the gunfight, the bullet-riddled bodies of Tofayel and Shahid were recovered from the spot, he said.

data.name: Shahid Mia
data.description: Shaid Mia, along with Tofayel Mia, was killed in a gunfight between RAB members and a group of unidentified people in Moulvibazar's Sreemangal upazila. Both were accused in a case filed over the murder of a local business association leader. Basu Dutta Chakma, Commander of RAB-9 (Sreemangal Battalion), said, "A group of people started shooting on a RAB vehicle in the morning inside the Mirtinga tea garden area and RAB retaliated in self-defense. After the gunfight, the bullet-riddled bodies of Tofayel and Shahid were recovered from the spot, he said.

data.name: Mohammad Mamun
data.description: After the gunfight, BGB team found Mamun with bullet wounds and sent him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the BGB official BGB Battalion-2 Commander Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan. said.

data.name: Hamidul Haque
data.description: 11 November, Hamidul Haque received bullet shots from police when police fired rubber bullets to disperse supporters of defeated member candidate when they were tried to stop the election officials with ballot boxes and other election equipments. On 13 November bullet wounded Hamidul was succumbed to his injuries at Rangpur Medical College Hospital

data.name: Jahangir Alam
data.description: Jahangir Alam, 35, a resident of Jamidarpara village under Balukhali union, was killed was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Balokhali union under Ukhiya upazila in Cox’s Bazar. RAB 7 personnel claimed that they had seized 70,000 pieces of Yaba tablets and a gun from the spot. Flight Lieutenant Niaz Mohammad Chapal, senior assistant director (media), RAB 7, said RAB members raided Kakra bridge of Balukhali area on a tip off. At that time, a group of Yaba peddling suspects opened fire on RAB members who retaliated instantly. Later they recovered the body of the suspected drug peddler on the spot.

data.name: Kefayet Ullah
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya robbers-- Kefayet Ullah and Korban Ali alias Shafiq, residents of Nhilla Rohingya camp-- were killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion near a Rohingya camp in Teknaf of Cox's Bazar. RAB-15 Senior Assistant Director, Additional Superintendent of Police Abu Salam Chowdhury said the "gunfight" took place in the hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union. A RAB team raided the hills after receiving information that a group of Rohingya robbers and drug traffickers were positioning there. Sensing RAB presence, drug traffickers and the criminals started firing. Rab retaliated in defence. After the firing stopped, RAB officials searched spot and rescued the Rohingya duo. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared them dead. Information from other sources was known.

data.name: Korban Ali
data.description: Two suspected Rohingya robbers-- Kefayet Ullah and Korban Ali alias Shafiq, residents of Nhilla Rohingya camp-- were killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion near a Rohingya camp in Teknaf of Cox's Bazar. RAB-15 Senior Assistant Director, Additional Superintendent of Police Abu Salam Chowdhury said the "gunfight" took place in the hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union. A RAB team raided the hills after receiving information that a group of Rohingya robbers and drug traffickers were positioning there. Sensing RAB presence, drug traffickers and the criminals started firing. Rab retaliated in defence. After the firing stopped, RAB officials searched spot and rescued the Rohingya duo. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared them dead. Information from other sources was known.

data.name: Farid Mia
data.description: At least 50 supporters of a defeated member UP election candidate attacked on police cars with lethal weapons after the result was announced. That time police fired 16 rounds blank shot to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the time, chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanges between them, leaving Arif, an autorickshaw driver shot and dead. The incident also killed Farid Mia.

data.name: Arif
data.description: At least 50 supporters of a defeated member UP election candidate attacked on police cars with lethal weapons after the result was announced. That time police fired 16 rounds blank shot to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the time, chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanges between them, leaving Arif, an autorickshaw driver shot and dead. The incident also killed Farid Mia.

data.name: Aditya Kumar Roy
data.description: Village Police Sagendranath Roy who was on duty at the centre said when announcement of Khangaon UP election result was made, supporters of Nuruzzaman rushed to the centre, besieged law enforcers and polling officials, and demanded the result sheets of the UP election. After half an hour, a team of BGB members led by Pirganj Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) Rezaul Islam rushed to the spot to control the situation. Nuruzzaman's supporters started vandalising of the polling station and attacked the law enforcers, said Sagendranath. Then, the BGB members opened fire, leaving three people, including Aditya Kumar Roy, dead.

data.name: Md Sabbir Hossain
data.description: Md Sabbir Hossain, 28, accused of the murder of Comilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide, was killed in a reported gunfight in the city with law enforcers on 30th November 2021. Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (Investigation) of Comilla's Kotwali Police Station, said that several teams of Detective Branch and Kotwali Model Police Station conducted a raid in Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am based on a tip-off. "The accused started firing at the law enforcers as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area, forcing retaliation, " the police official claimed adding that once the firing stopped, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of Sabbir and Sajon from the spot.

data.name: Sajon
data.description: Sajon, 32, accused of the murder of Comilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide, was killed in a reported gunfight in the city with law enforcers on 30th November 2021. Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (Investigation) of Comilla's Kotwali Police Station, said that several teams of Detective Branch and Kotwali Model Police Station conducted a raid in Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am based on a tip-off. "The accused started firing at the law enforcers as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area, forcing retaliation, " the police official claimed adding that once the firing stopped, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of Sabbir and Sajon from the spot.

data.name: Tajul Islam
data.description: Tajul was allegedly tortured to death. After the news spread that a man was tortured to death by police, a mob reportedly threw brickbats at Haragach Police Station and vandalised a few police vehicles on 01 November 2021. The High Court on November 03 sought a probe report on the alleged custodial death of Tajul Islam in Rangpur, as a four-member committee has been formed by the police administration in order to conduct an inquiry into the incident.

data.name: Sujan Saha
data.description: His family alleged that he was beaten to death and thrown into the river. The body of a youth in handcuffs was found floating in the Haridoa river of Narsingdi Sadar upazila on 09 November, hours after his arrest. Sujan's sister Pinky Saha said police arrested her brother from Brahmandi area of the district town and took him to Hajipur area. There, police asked the workers of a factory to beat him and then police threw him into the river.

data.name: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain
data.description: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain, 28, and Sajon, 32, both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel. Sabbir and Sujon had been on the run ever since the slain councillor's brother filed the case. . On information, police conducted a raid in Comilla city's Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am, he further added. Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (investigation) of the police station, claimed, "A group of criminals opened fire on police as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area around 12:45am, forcing the policemen to retaliate. "Once the firing stopped, police found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot. The law enforcers also recovered guns and ammunition from the spot.

data.name: Sajon
data.description: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain, 28, and Sajon, 32, were both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel. Sabbir and Sujon had been on the run ever since the slain councillor's brother filed the case. On information, police conducted a raid in Comilla city's Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am. Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (investigation) of the police station, claimed, "A group of criminals opened fire on police as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area around 12:45am, forcing the policemen to retaliate. "Once the firing stopped, police found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot. The law enforcers also recovered guns and ammunition from the spot.

data.name: Shah Alam
data.description: Acting on a tip-off, a local police team along with some detectives conducted a raid in Chanpur Ratnabati Gumti Beribadh area of Sadar upazila at about 1:30am, said Anwarul Azim, officer-in-charge of Kotwali model police station. Spotting the cops, Alam and his accomplices opened fire, forcing the cops to retaliate. Alam sustained bullet wounds during the exchange of fire, while his cohorts managed to escape. The injured man was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead on arrival, police said.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Two unidentified suspected pirates were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Char Kukri Mukri of Charfashion upazila in Bhola. Dakkhin Aicha Police Station inspector (investigation) Milon Kumar Gosh said a team of RAB conducted a drive at Jalia canal in the morning on information that a group of pirates had taken position there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, pirates opened fire forcing RAB personnel to retaliate by shooting back. When the suspects retreated, two of them were found dead on the spot.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: Babul Das and another unidentified alleged robber were killed in a shootout with RAB in Chakaria upazila in Cox's Bazar. The gunfight took place around 4:00am when a team of Rab carried out a raid after a tip-off that a group of robbers gathered at Purba Boro Bhewla area, said Maj Sheikh Yusuf Ahmed, a company commander of RAB-15. He said the robbers opened fire at the RAB men, who retaliated, leaving two of them with bullet wounds. The injured were taken to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Babul Das

The gunfight took place around 4:00am when a team of Rab carried out a raid after a tip-off that a group of robbers gathered at Purba Boro Bhewla area, said Maj Sheikh Yusuf Ahmed, a company commander of RAB-15. He said the robbers opened fire at the RAB men, who retaliated, leaving two of them with bullet wounds. The injured were taken to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

data.name: Unidentified
data.description: An alleged robber was killed in a reported gunfight with the members of Rapid Action Battalion in Patharghata upazila of Barguna early Friday. According to RAB-8, a team of RAB-8 took position on the bank of the Bishkhali River in Badurtola area at about 2:00am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at the RAB members forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. After the gunfight, RAB found a robber lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Later, police went to the spot and sent the injured robber to Patharghata Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, said Abul Bashar, officer-in-charge of the Patharghata police station.

data.name: Babul Sarder
data.description: Police said Babul committed suicide while in DB custody, but his family claimed he was tortured to death. Babul's daughter Munni said he was completely healthy and police beat him.

data.name: Porag Ali
data.description: Porag Ali (22), was shot after BGB opned fire on 28 November during an election violence. He later succumbed to his injuries on 1 December while under treatment at Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital.

data.name: Hamidul Islam
data.description: Hamidul Islam was shot down by police after two groups clashed during the UP election vote counting. Police opened fire instead of using non-leathal weapons.

data.name: Abdul Khalek
data.description: Abdul Khalek wad shot dead when police fire during a clash at Char Montaj Union during the 4th stage of UP election.

data.name: Abdus Salam
data.description: According to local people, the supporters of independent chairman candidate Emran Hossain blocked Sylhet-Zakiganj road in Boitikar Bazar over the poll results of two centers in wards 8 and 9 in Fulbari Union at 8:00pm. A clash ensued between the villagers and police when police tried to disperse the supporters of Emran Hossain, forcing police to open fire, they said. Abdus Salam, who suffered bullet injures during the clash, was taken to MAG Osmani Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

data.name: Kulsum Begum
data.description: Kulsum was killed by BGB firing during vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) interfering with vote counting resulted in a clash between police and BGB. Then BGB opened fire killing four people including her..

data.name: Khorshed Ali
data.description: Khorshed was killed by BGB firing during vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) interfering with vote counting resulted in a clash with police and BGB. Then BGB opened fire, killing four people.

data.name: Abdur Rashid Pramanik
data.description: Abdur was killed by BGB firing during vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) interfering with vote counting resulted in a clash with police and BGB. Then BGB opened fire, killing four people.

data.name: Alamgir
data.description: Alamgir was killed by BGB firing during vote counting at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) interfering with vote counting resulted in a clash with police and BGB. Then BGB opened fire killing four people including Alamgir.

data.name: Asad Sheikh
data.description: Asad's family alleged that RAB members tortured him to death in custody. He was arrested by RAB from his house on 01 January on charges of drug dealing and taken to custody in the afternoon. According to RAB’s FIR, Asad was a drug dealer and was detained by RAB acting on a tip-off. RAB also claimed they seized 603 Yaba pills from Asad. But police later said they could not find any criminal cases filed against him. Asad’s brother-in-law Alam said that he was a mechanic and worked in a vehicle repair shop. According to RAB, a scuffle broke out among Asad and RAB members as he tried to flee. He was critically injured and was taken to Tongi’s Shaheed Ahsan Ullah Master General Hospital in the evening. There the doctors declared him dead. An inqust report by Tongi East Police Station sub-inspector Sajal said there were marks of wounds at Asad’s right knee and left part of his chest.

data.name: Himangshu Chandra
data.description: Himangshur’s father Biswasar Roy alleged that the police tortured his son to death in custody. Hatibandha police officer-in-charge Ershadul Alam said Himangshu tried to commit suicide when he was kept in a room after interrogation. When he was taken to the hospital, the doctor declared him dead.

data.name: Wazir Mia
data.description: Family members said Wazir died because police tortured him at Shantiganj Police Station after arresting him in the early hours of February 10. His brother Dalim Mia said, "He was severely tortured. He was released on bail the next day, but fell ill. We took him to the hospital in critical condition. Villagers later blocked Sunamganj-Sylhet road at Pagla Bazar for three hours demanding justice for Wazir. Superintendent of Police in Sunamganj Mizanur Rahman said there will be an autopsy and actions will be taken if evidence of torture is found. He was arrested allegledly for stealing. SI of police, Debasish Sutradhar has been transferred due to this incidence.

data.name: Jahirul Hawlader
data.description: Jahirul's family claimed that he was tortured to death by police. His elder brother Ali Akbar said his brother was not involved in murder, however PBI arrested him and beaten him up severely. 4/5 days before his death, he was forcefully sent to jail. HIs family beleived he was tortured to death

data.name: Mohammad Sahed Hossain
data.description: Shahed, an undertrial prisoner was arrested from Raipur of Laxmipur on 6 March 2022. His family claimed, police demanded Tk2 lakh as bribe to release him, or they would produce him to court in a drug case. But his family said they can’t pay more than Tk45,000. As the family could not pay as per demand by police, Shahed was severely beaten in police custody. Later he was sent in Laxmipur District jail, where he died.

data.name: Amir Hossain
data.description: Amir Hossain, a fisherman of Bandarpur Prokash-Kutubpur in Bhola Sadar upazila, was killed when police opened fire during a clash with fishermen in the Meghna River at Sadar upazila of Lakshmipur. Shotgun pellets were found in his head and back, said DMC morgue source.

data.name: Rabiul Islam
data.description: Rabiul Islam was picked up by the police from a Pahela Baishakh fair at Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar under Sadar upazila in Lalmonirhat district. Allegedly died due to torture while in police custody. Robiul and another man were arrested by the police on charges of gambling at a fair in the Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar area on the occasion of Pahela Boishakh, according to his family members. Robiul had an altercation with some cops while being dragged into a police van as he insisted that he was innocent, they claimed. He was badly beaten up by the cops for refusing to enter the police van. He had sustained injuries, which eventually led to his death, ’ said a family member of the deceased. The two people were arrested by a police team from the fair on tip-off. But Robiul fell sick on the way to the local police station and he was soon rushed to Sadar Hospital. He died while being shifted to Rangpur Medical College and Hospital, ’ he said. As the news of the death spread, the agitated locals blocked the Lalmonirhat-Rangpur highway in the early hours of 15 April and demanded the punishment of a sub-Inspector of Sadar police station. Sub-inspector Halimur Rahman of Lalmonirhat Sadar Police Station was closed following allegations of Rabiul's death due to torture in custody.

data.name: Mohammad Raju
data.description: Raju was killed in a ‘gunfight’ with Rapid Action Battalion in the Golabari area of Burichang upazila in Comilla. Local police claimed that he was involved in drug peddling and smuggling and was the prime accused in the murder case of journalist Mohiuddin Sarkar Naeem. This is the first death in a reported gunfight with RAB since the United States slapped sanctions on the force and seven of its current and former officials on December 10, 2021

data.name: Kawsar
data.description: He was killed in "gunfight" with RAB. Razu Ahmed, the only son of Kawser and a second year HSC student, said his father visited them after seven months. "No matter what, nobody wants such death of their dear ones. My mother broke down heavily as it's hard to accept such a demise.

data.name: Najir Ahmed
data.description: Najir Ahmed was allegedly tortured to death in police custody in Brahmanbaria, his family complained. . Police denied the allegation and claimed that he died of a heart attack. Victim’s brother Hossain Ahmed Tafsir said that his younger brother Najir bought a house in the area.
